All parking as valet, great couple of guys working outside with water for you. There is a restaurant on the second floor with free coffee/tea in the morning and wine in the evening.

Welcomed warmly by the valet person (very unobservant of me, to not have got his name), then at the reception by Marci who informed us of all the inclusions provided to us during our stay here. At 7:30 morning there were either yoga/tai-chi/zumba (depending on the day) for the guests held at the park right across from the hotel - with mat, towels and a bottle of water provided. A bottle of water would be available for us everyday in our rooms with our consumed coffee capsules replaced. When we can took advantage of the complimentary happy hours for coffee between 6-10am and the wine between 4-6pm, at the newly opened restaurant. The coffee was even given in a large take-away cup, so it made it even easier for us to pick up a coffee and start on our trip for the day.Our room 523 gets a view of Diamond Head, the park, a bit of the ocean view between some buildings and the parking lot :) The only bad thing I have to say about the room was the quilt when the sheets peeled back was a little dirty. We enjoyed the free bike hires, riding to the main stretch of Waikiki and around the park - again they valet parking guys were awesome and attentive to our needs asking if we would like any bottled water. The best thing amongst all this was that everyone was very friendly ... even the bar-dude who put on a stern face to tell people that wine glasses are to stay within the restaurant ;) and then to top it off, as we were on our honeymoon (failed to mention it during our booking) we asked Marci if there were anything the hotel can do for us, she kindly congratulated us and delivered a bottle of champagne and a couple of delicate cupcakes to our room. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who's thinking to stay around Waikiki!

We stayed at this lovely and quiet boutique hotel to complete our Hawaii adventure after visiting several other islands. This quieter location near a beautiful park and away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk to Waikiki beach was perfect. The modern room and amenities (cocktail hour lovely, valet parking, shuttle to other hotels, complementary bikes) made the stay special and the staff at the front desk and bellman were friendly, helpful,and one even called my cell phone quickly after we left for the airport when I had left a bag behind. Thanks to all who made our stay fabulous! Shout out to the bellmen as well who manage the valet service.

Truly an exceptional hotel. Within easy walking distance of the busy section of Kalakua Avenue, but in a relatively quiet, uncrowded area. Staff all were very welcoming and friendly. Valet parking was quick and easy. A daily continental breakfast was better than expected. Beach chairs, towels were available from the front desk, as were loaner bicycles. Only minor downside is that there is no direct beach access, but it's only a very short walk around the adjacent hotel.Stayed in a corner room (821) which had a partial ocean view, plus a view of Diamond Head and Kapolani Park.

This is a fantastic boutique hotel! Away from the crowds of Waikiki, but still close enough to the best restaurants. We had a very nice room; spacious and well appointed. My only complaint was the ocean view. We did have a view of the ocean, but only what could be seen around another building. There is a difference between ocean view and ocean front -- just something to know going in. At this price not a deal-breaker for us, and the over the top service more than made up for it! Will definitely stay there again.

I'm at the Lotus now. My stay will be 3 nights. Tonight is my 3rd night. I'm here working (sales, so a flexible schedule and I do have a car). This has been a very pleasant experience. I'm so grateful to not be in the middle of the Waikiki craziness. I'm actually a very social person, and like a lot of action, but after working all day, it's so nice to go back to a quiet place. I've been told that the Lotus will have a restaurant starting next week and I think that will add a lot. In the meantime, 2 of my nights here, I've just walked next door to the New Otani Kaimana Hotel which has an open air bar/restaurant. I had a nice glass of wine and a couple appetizers which were delicious both nights. Back to the Lotus, the room is very clean, cute decor, bed and pillows very comfortable and the AC cranks! One of my favorite things is their fabulous in room coffee set up with Italian illy espresso! The staff is delightful. There is a $25 daily Resort fee (not sure if that's what they call it), but part of what it covers is valet parking which I appreciated. Every day from 4-6, they have a serve yourself wine and appetizer spread which was very nice with fairly high quality wine (which I didn't expect). I have had a great experience at the Lotus and would stay here again in a heartbeat for work or pleasure.

The team working this hotel make this the place to stay in Waikiki. Marcy, Russell, Clarissa, and Jules all made sure we were taken care of at all times. They really give 5 star service at a 3 star price. As for location this hotel is away from the nuttiness of the strip, but not too far. About a 10 minute walk. A few things that went a long way for us was bottled water available at all times, towels on demand, beach chairs, boogey boards, and Russell had our car waiting for us at all times. I don’t thin we wait more than 2 minutes all trip for our car. This was important to us. We once stayed at the Grand Wailea in Maui and would have to wait 10-15 minutes and that hotel was $500/night! Good job Lotus Hotel. Hope to be back soon, Jason and Cari.

My first time in Hawaii and i have to say i loved the place. If i were to ever visit Honolulu again, i would definitely go for this hotel again. It is in a nice quiet location within walking distance of Waikiki. I stayed in a room with a balcony facing Diamond Head and it was absolutely gorgeous. It was clean and tidy and you get a bathrobe and nice toiletries. It would be nice if they had a kettle in the room (they only had a coffee machine and i don't drink coffee). The staff were all really helpful. Tea and coffee was complimentary in the mornings; and free wine in the lobby 4-6pm. I believe there will be a restaurant in the near future but it was not open when i was there. No spas, pools etc but that was fine with me as there was plenty to do in the area. Free chairs and towels for the beach, which is quite small at the back of the hotel but more quiet compared to Waikiki. DVD rentals are included in the resort fee and i did watch a few films in the evening: the choice of films available were decent. Free shuttle rides to Ala Moana Shopping Centre which i visited twice during my visit: very handy service.

Visiting Oahu for the first time to attend a wedding, my girlfriend/bride arranged our accommodations at the Lotus. Because she is a local we received a very good room rate. However, Ward and his staff epitomize the Aloha spirit. My husband and and I were treated like VIPs. Our room was on the 10th floor with a great view of Diamond head, looming large and proud. Everything, EVERYTHING was perfect! The restaurant was not opened in time during our stay. While not complimentary, the breakfast offered great coffee and attentive service. Mahalo, we will be back soon!

Nice decor, we had a comfortable room with a nice view, all the staff were awesome,no pool .....who travels to an island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean to swim in a pool LOL walked down to the ocean, then down to the barefoot beach cafe for sum Ahi tuna and a sunset.They were filming an episode of Hawaii Five-O on the beach,.... this is a great property A+

I've been visiting Honolulu for years now and I can finally say that I have a new favorite, go to hotel. The Lotus. It's a boutique hotel that's off the strip in Diamondhead. If you're looking to get away from the mega crowds, hunt for local grinds and enjoy a more personal touch to your hotel stay, this is the perfect place. The Lotus is just the right amount of hotel. You get the know the staff and they'll attend to your every need. They provided us with a tandem bike to get to the strip and even helped us get rental surfboards delivered to the hotel. In my opinion, the Lotus is the perfect choice for me and I'm definitely staying here longer next time. The rooms are clean, quiet and moderately priced. Considering the resort fee includes valet parking, it's a great deal. I just moved to the Pink Palace for the second half of my trip and I totally regret it. Nothing against the hotel, but I feel like I'm staying in the middle of a shopping mall. I'll be back here next year.

We enjoyed our 8 day stay at this quaint boutique-ish hotel. The staff were very friendly -- we especially liked Russell, who helped us with restaurants and excursions.The location is indeed off centre -- exactly 15 mins walk through the park and takes you to the edge of Waikiki beach, so a total of 20-30 mins walk to most restaurants/shops in town, which we didn't mind, but not for everyone. They also have bicycles available for use, which is a nice touch as it cuts down the travel time. Renting 2 beach loungers and parasol on Waikiki beach will set you back a cool $50 per day, so you can save yourself a fortune by buying a $10 parasol from ABC stores/Walmart and borrowing the hotel's free beach chairs -- these also come in handy when visiting other beaches like Kailua, Lanakai, Sandy Beach, etc. (assuming you have a car rental).There are only 2 restaurants within 5 mins walk -- the Lau Tree Lanai, which is ok... a bit overpriced, and reservation required to get a table. The other restaurant is French, but we didn't try it. For snacks, there's also a convenience store. Btw, there's a restaurant in the Canoe club next door, but surprisingly only serve food to members. Our favourite restaurants in town were Duke's and Eggs & Things, which we preferred over higher end restaurants such as Orchids and Hy's steakhouse (service was excellent, but a bit snooty -- i.e. covered shoes mandatory).For excursions, we did the Holokai Catamaran, which was excellent and only $60 (booked directly on their website) for snorkelling with the turtles and Diamond Head sail. We also tried to do the Shark Adventures which looked fantastic (they put you in a cage surrounded by sharks) but our trip was cancelled at the last minute due to high winds, so try to get this trip in early if interested.

We had a really nice stay at the Lotus. The best feature of this hotel is the outstanding service from the staff - nothing was too much trouble, everyone did all they could to assist us, and we were allowed to check in very early which was appreciated. The location was perfect for us - out of the busy Waikiki area. It was a 2 minute walk down the road to a great beach, a 20 minute walk to Waikiki, and the hotel provides a shuttle service to Ala Moana. Unfortunately, while being in a quiet location, the rooms aren't soundproof, so guests or staff in the corridor woke us several times. The room was spacious, but due to the age a few of the soft furnishings were stained. The room was also let down slightly by having mould through the shower. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

I would return here - nice atmosphere - simple -view of diamond head- glimpse of the beach Clean room - free yoga in the park and happy hour nice wine - quaint -tucked away . . . . . Great service . .

We stayed at the Lotus for 5 nights. We had a corner room on the 7th floor. The view was ok overlooking a carpark and a ppep of the ocean on one side and a nice view of Diamond head from the other. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The location is in a relatively quite part of Waikiki an easy walk to the beach, the hotel has no pool, and about 20 minutes to the city centre. The staff with one exception were really great and couldn't do enough for us.The exception was the man who worked in the breakfast cafe who was borderline rude in his tone and attitude, also the food was poor. One enjoyable point of difference is the wine and cheese which is served free in the lobby everyday from 4 - 6 pm this encourages the guests to mingle and we met some really nice people this way.

We've stayed at the lotus a couple other times and we have always found it the same....Awesome!  Great Staff, Great Room, Great Views & Great Price! Don't let the chic appearance scare you away! The entire staff was courteous and friendly. They even had a bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived as the woman that booked are room noticed it was my birthday. Thank You Lotus!

Our plans to stay in Kona, HI changed due to hurricane Madaline. Instead stayed those days in Honolulu. Booked our room last minute. The view from the room was beautiful with views of both Diamond Head and the Ocean. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! We took advantage of the beach towels and chairs, the beach being just steps away. We loved that the hotel is located in a quieter section of Waikiki beach, just a short walk from the heart of the shopping area. The opening of the restaurant in October will be a big plus. I highly recommend this hotel!!

For the size, this hotel has full and professional service. It is in an ideal location for work and play. We have been partnering with the Lotus for years and would not want to be anywhere else. It feels like a home away from home. Best on Oahu for comfort and ease.

The Lotus hotel is small and a few miles from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. This gives it a quiet and restful feel. The rooms are large, airy and clean. Excellent bedsBathrooms even without a bath are generous.The rooms and hotel is quiet. Perfect for a holiday. Two minutes to the beach

The lotus at diamond head is a real jewel . Tucked under the shadow of diamond head a few steps to a sandy beach this is the perfect hotel for those not wanting to be in the hustle of downtown Waikiki . Fabulous large rooms with great views , very friendly staff , shuttle bus to town , next door to outrigger canoe club . Highly recommended.

We had the most amazing experience at this hotel. They were so nice and accommodating. And the hotel is located in a great location, next to the park, zoo, aquarium and a great little beach for the kids. We will definitely be back.

Nice staff. Nice room. We only stayed one night as we were checking into the condo next door for a month. A.C. was good. Bell man helped us take our luggage to the condo the next morning. He was kind to do this for us since we had a lot of bags for a month. Plan to stay at the Lotus again for a longer period of time. Wish they had a restaurant on site. We were not impressed with the limited amount of choices at the breakfast bar and we found the choices to be expensive for what was provided. We did not stay for the wine service in the evening.

We were only in Oahu for 1 1/2 days before heading out to other islands. We had a huge list of things we want to do on Oahu, so we knew we weren't going to be hanging by a pool. This hotel is really nice because it has free parking (within the $25 boutique fee- which is much cheaper than other hotels I looked at), free water bottles, free wine at happy hour (4-6), free bikes. It has no pool or gym but that didn't matter to us. My dad went to a 24 hour fitness down the road since he's a member. We didn't have a view of the beach, but a beautiful view of diamond head. For the price, this was exactly what we wanted. Downtown Wakiki is super overpriced for what you get, whereas the lotus is super close to everything, but in a nicer area and less expensive.

At first, the hotel did seem a bit dated from the outside compared to other hotels nearby. But the rooms were very modern compared to their other hotels and resorts which consisted of very dated rooms. The staff was nice. The hotel also offered amenities such as rental bikes, complimentary movies, a shuttle, an in-room massage, and beach chairs. Would definitely go back!

We stayed here for three nights. The room we stayed in had a lovely view of Diamond Head but the hotel is not on the beachfront, which was fine for us. It was a nice large room but I didn't find the mattress to be very comfortable and I think it could do with a bit of a remodel. What we really liked about the hotel was how quiet it was which suited us perfectly. One night we caught the free shuttle bus to the shops at Waikiki. It was awful and took ages. I highly recommend walking to the shops they really aren't that far. I did find the resort charge I bit cheeky as the hotel doesn't have a pool or any chairs on the beach. I really liked the valet parking though and made good use of it during our stay. The staff were very helpful.

I stayed here 1 week with my two teenage boys.The rooms were beautiful and welcoming.The valet service was amazingly helpful - one valet in particular, and I wish I remembered his name (on duty Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday during the day) was particularly helpful in giving tips about places we were going to visit.The coffee in the breakfast area was good, and the staff there was very friendly.I really enjoyed the wine and cheese in the early evening.Although I did not participate, I loved that there was a yoga session available in the morning. I anticipate participating on my next visit.I did not like paying by item for the continental breakfast. I chose instead to walk to the Barefoot Beach cafe where I could get a cooked breakfast at a slightly higher cost. To me, it was well worth it.I liked having access to a more private beach, with the option for the public beach.I liked that the hotel had beach towels available for our use.

The lotus was perfect for our anniversary trip. Close enough to Waikiki but out of the crowds and hassle. the staff at the hotel was amazing and the rooms were very nice. The beach access was very convenient. Great view of diamond head. The Hau tree restaurant next door was great too.

The Lotus Hotel was a perfect selection for our family. We wanted to be close to Diamond Head, have a great view both the ocean and Diamond Head, be near everything, but away from the bustle of the heart of Waikiki. The staff and accommodations at the Lotus were of the highest caliber. When we return to Oahu, we we be returning to the Lotus.Also, if you are interested is terrific cheap local food, the Diamond Head Market is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and is a short 3/4 mile walk along Kapiolani Park.

We've stayed 10 days and enjoyed the hotel right upon arrival ! The location was for us perfect, because we enjoyed the daily little walk along the beach street to busy Waikiki and the view from our corner room (8th floor) was just spectacular to the Diamond Head and between two front buildings even to the pacific!The hotel crew of this very small hotel was very polite, charming and relaxed - perfect for a Hawaiian spirit and feeling !Our room was big enough for a party of 4 (2 adults and two kids, 8 an 18 years old).The room was clean, nice furnished and the bathroom was big enough!The daily house keeping (full service in the morning and turn down late afternoon) was excellent!As I'm still on vacation (now in Los Angeles), I'm writing just a short report, but it was important for us to give a top feedback right after we have left the beautiful island !We will come back !!!Aloha and mahalo to the Lotus Team !!!!

We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon.The hotel has a very traditional feel to it- the rooms are very spacious and clean.We had the premium room which had a lovely balcony overlooking diamond head and part view of the ocean. The beds were a good size and were very comfortable and we had a good shower. They gave us a complimentary bottle of Champs as a congratulations and the staff were so friendly and helpful!The hotel offers dvds, complimentary drinks and snacks in the afternoon, beach chairs and towels as well as water. Also make use of the free bike hire just to explore the island more.The hotel has no pool which is a shame but has the sea about 1 minute away-not a private beach but plenty of room to go on. The walk to the main town is pleasant approx 10-15mins which means you are away from the noise and hussle and bussle.We did the Pearl Harbour tour and island tour which the hotel guided us on (including the best price).Thank you for a great stay!Aloha Mr and Mrs Townsend-Hall

From the first point of contact (valet parking) the hotel was detail and service orientated. It was my first time staying here and reception celebrated my stay with a complimentary bottle of wine. What a great touch. I enjoyed the bottle over my 4 night stay and appreciated their graciousness with each sip. The rooms are clean, modern and was everything I wanted (away from the Waikiki noise but close enough to accessing great stores and restaurants). I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

My husband and I enjoyed a 3-night stay and experienced great customer service! Having just left the Four Seasons in Wailea, we were trying to ensure our expectations were reasonable. The staff were helpful, friendly and accommodating. It's a small hotel, so you see many familiar faces (Marci , J.R. and Travis). The location is close enough to the main area of Wakiki but far from the noise and crowds of the beach. We hiked to the crater, just a few minutes away. I enjoyed yoga one morning which is included. We appreciated the upgrade and bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon!

The service and friendly atmosphere of the Lotus are incomparable. We love the amenities of the wine and cheese bare in the afternoons and the accessibility of all Waikiki and Diamond Head have to offer. Every staff member is very courteous and service oriented. We would not stay anywhere else when we are on Oahu.

Great hotel if you want to avoid major chains and want to be away from the craziness of Waikiki. Staff at the hotel is wonderful. Close to trigger canoe club. No pool, but 1minute walk to the beach. Free happy hour (red/white wine and snacks) beach towels provided. Valet parking. Recommend having a rental car. Free DVD movie rental. Yoga studio in hotel. Beach towels, boogie board, sand toys provided. Great views of diamond head.

We stayed there July 7-9, 2016. This was our first trip to Honolulu. We had to arrange shuttle service. We chose Speedy Shuttle, was nice, but took a long time to get there. Upon arrival we knew why. The Lotus is situated a little farther down Waikiki beach. It was still within walking distance, but not at the center, where it was very crowded. The hotel was clean, we had a partial ocean/view and it was beautiful. The staff was very kind and informative as to where to go, etc... We rented paddleboards from a place beside the hotel and they were happy to assist. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

This was my first visit to Honolulu and we came to the Lotus at the recommendation of a friend. Great choice! We loved the quiet location at the end of Waikiki and the hotel was perfect -- view of the ocean from the balcony, with free bikes and morning yoga! Complimentary wine in the afternoon and Illy coffee machine in the room! We didn't use the DVD library, but saw families that did. The only downside is the absence of a restaurant in the hotel -- there is a continental breakfast available, but the hotel is close to a number of fun breakfast spots and other really good food options. You can bike, walk or drive to Diamondhead for a wonderful hike. I can't wait to return.

My husband and I arrived mid June. We stayed at Lotus for a few weeks until we were able to find a home. We loved it there. The location is perfect. The service is top notch. Thanks for taking care of us.Timothy & Patrice B.

Excellent customer service. Beautiful location, clean well appointed bali style luxury rooms.This is my new favorite. Quiet location with gorgeous views of Diamond Head and the amazing flowering Rainbow shower trees. Sweet quiet are tucked away for the busyness but so close you can walk to anything you need.

Just spend 9 nights here...loved it. Check in easy, had a corner room that over looked diamond head and the beach (sorta- had to look between two buildings but still pretty)...Room was spotless on arrival and every day after that. Went to 2nd floor to get coffee every day and coffee was good (didnt care for coffee in room...but its there if you want it)...I just threw on a robe and went to 2nd floor every morning and got several cups. :) Loved sitting on balcony every morning to wake up. :) They have beach chairs, towels and umbrellas to take with you every day. There is a beach you can use a 3 min walk away that is ok...we preferred the 10 min walk towards waikiki at the park...loved the shade trees and grass and ocean just a few feet away. Restrooms there are kept pretty clean, too. :) Loved people watching and watching the surfers. Easy walk from there into the center of Waikiki for shopping and restaurants.. Ok- back to hotel. ;) Complimentary red and white wine served in lobby from 4-6 every day, which was a nice treat. Good wine, too! Parking is valet only and they were super friendly even when we didnt tip. We were coming and going constantly and couldnt tip that much! They were friendly just the same...we tipped at times and at times didnt...also left a pair of sunglasses there and didnt realize it. On checkout...one of the valet guys asked if we had lost any sunglasses....we said yes, we actually had...when my husband told them what kind (mau jim !!!! $$$$), the valet presented the found pair! What a nice surprise! Also, theres a convenience store just a 1 minute walk away that has sodas, snacks, wine, etc, so that was super convenient . And front desk has a corkscrew :) . Loved this hotel and their awesome staff. Every person was super friendly and we hope to be back one day!

This small hotel has few amenities but lots of heart. Sparkling clean and beautifully designed, the rooms have terraces with views of Diamond Head, only minutes away by bicycle or on foot. Rooms are well-appointed, beds are fantastically comfortable, and each has a great espresso maker and a useful mini-fridge (hotel has no restaurant so stocking up on snacks and drinks is convenient and economical in this overpriced city). Use of bicycles is complimentary (covered by mandatory boutique fee), as are unlimited beach towels, bottled water, and morning yoga, and the wine available each evening, on the house, is a nice extra touch. The staff are some of the nicest people you'll ever meet.

We happened upon the Lotus while searching for last minute accommodations. We were so lucky we did! After a long two days of travel, walking into the Lotus was like walking into heaven! The lobby area was beautiful, with lit candles, fresh flowers and even wine...we arrived during the complementary wine happy hour (4-6pm daily). The staff couldn't have been better, happy to do whatever possible to ensure a wonderful experience. Sorry, I don't remember any names! The valets were the stars of the Lotus, anticipating your needs before you do! We were given a corner room, so we had amazing views of the park, Diamond Head Crater and also the ocean! The Lotus is in a great location, away from the hustle and bustle yet close enough to all the sites. There is also a shuttle service to other locations in Waikiki. It was a perfect location to relax and unwind. I could go on and on about how much we enjoyed all the little touches that made our stay in paradise so wonderful. We were sad to leave, it was truly an Oasis in Oahu!

My family and I stayed here for Father's Day weekend for a nice little staycation. It really exceeded our expectations. Our room was beautiful with gorgeous views of both Diamond Head and the ocean. The staff is extremely friendly and goes above and beyond for you. We love this part of Waikiki, because it's quieter and away from the hustle and bustle of the heart of Waikiki, yet walking distance if you want to see/do things. As locals, we loved walking to Monsaratt Ave and ate at all of our favorite places... Bogart's Cafe (breakfast), Diamond Head Grill, Diamond Head Health bar(best acai bowls on the island) and even got gelato at a brand new little cafe called Ars Cafe! (Tourists- try the local spots we love! Stay away from the chain restaurants in Waikiki) on our last day, we walked to Barefoot beach Bar Cafe which is really close to the Lotus and had a casual breakfast with the outdoor seating. We loved the little wine happy hour they have in the lobby (Daily from 4-6pm) that we got to pour a nice glass and take it back to our room and sit on the lanai. Although this property doesn't have a pool, it has a great little beach that the locals go to and it's right next door to a private club. So nice that they even give you Tommy Bahama beach chairs, towels, umbrella and even beach toys. We are big coffee drinkers too and liked they had illy coffee in the rooms. For you beauty obsessed travelers, the toiletries are Paul Mitchell Awapuhi. A huge bonus, is that it's dog-friendly and our little furry baby got to come with us and enjoy it too! When we checked in, they had a basket for just her. It came with a bowl, blanket, dog bone and a full bag of bacon treats that she loved. Great that there is the park right across the street too that we could take her. We can't wait to come back. We highly recommend this hotel for travelers wanting a unique Waikiki experience. My only thing I would recommend is at night, I would dim the lights really low, adding tons of candles and play nice lounge music. It has the potential to be a sexy hotel. Ambiance goes a long way! Thank you so much!

We only stayed in Honolulu for 2 days prior to going on a cruise. We didn't want to be in the middle of town where it was very busy and noisy so we choose to stay on the outskirts at the Lotus. It was perfect! Our experience was nothing but perfect. Every staff member we encountered was so pleasant and helpful. The hotel is extremely clean. The rooms are comfortable and roomy with great views. They served wine daily for happy hour, that was a nice touch. When we return to Honolulu, we will definitely be staying at the Lotus again!

Lotus is a wonderful boutique hotel on the edge of Waikiki. It's out of the way, therefore, you can take a nice walk or short uber/taxi drive into the heart of Waikiki. Love everything from the staff to the modern look of the facility. Overall great stay!

We totally enjoyed our stay at the Lotus Honolulu. We stayed one night on our stop over to Kauai. Location was great...the room I reserved was a view of Diamond Head but as a bonus we also could see the ocean, close to beach, beds were very comfortable, and all of the staff were VERY friendly and helpful. There is valet parking which is very nice since not much parking space and the valets are very nice and gave us advice on places to eat and go! Also loved the fact that they gave us nice beach chairs and towels to take to the beach. Would definitely stay here again!

We had a great stay at the Lotus! The staff were all fantastic and made the stay very relaxing. The hotel is just the right distance away from all the action. We loved the way they had beach chairs and towels available for us everyday.

Really enjoyed this place. Location is walking distance to Waikiki, but well away from the bustle. Morning walks into Diamond Head, evening walks towards Waikiki. Super helpful and chill staff. The perfect set of extras - morning coffee, evening wine, water, beach towels, beach chairs.

After a 2.5 year absence from Hawaii, there was only one choice for us to stay - the Lotus Honolulu. Did I mention it was our 5th return to the hotel and again we were not disappointed. Since the last stay, the hotel has included many amenity items which may not be important to some folks but made all the difference to us. From twin bathrobes to quality toiletries and of course, the morning newspaper. The location of the property is definitely a plus as we stayed over the King Kamehameha festival timeframe and could easily walk into Waikiki to view the parade. But above all, I have to mention the friendly staff filled with their famous "Aloha Spirit" who made us feel like family returning to our second home. Much Mahalo (thank you) to Clarissa and her team of professionals. We will return again sooner than 2 years!

Last minute reservation so there was a little bit of a mixup with if it had even gone through, but they were very helpful and accommodating. Room was very nice and after being there for about an hour got a call to make sure the room was adequate and that we didn't need any additional services. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend it!

We were in a Premium room on the 7th floor. Nice, clean, spacious room with one "Juliet" type balcony facing the ocean, and another good sized balcony with seating, also with sea views. Comfortable bed offering a restful nights sleep with no outside noisy distractions. Bathroom had a generous size vanity unit with wall to wall mirrors, and plenty of room for personal items - very well appointed. Location was excellent; we hired a car, but still was close enough to take an easy stroll down to Waikiki. Very near to beach and great swimming. Staff were friendly and accommodating; we would happily stay at this hotel again and recommend to friends!

The Lotus hotel is a smallish, intimate hotel near beaches and beautiful parks at the far end of Waikiki Beach. The corner room we had gave us beautiful views of both the water and Diamondhead mountain. The service at the desk and the valet stand were excellent and accommodating. There are a couple of restaurants nearby and a small convenience store on the same block. They have bicycles available for guests and we took a 'long' walk from the hotel to the top of Diamondhead and back on our last day-- it took us about 3 hours in total and was an experience not to be missed.

Lovely rooms, great location near Diamond Head, away from the crowds, warm and helpful staff - this hotel is the perfect place to stay in Honolulu. It's also next to the main park in Honolulu, which is great for running and exercising.

I have stayed here for years it really is my second home because thats how this awesome staff makes you feel. I had the pleasure of spending my birthday here to my surprise they gave me a card and a box of yummy cookies thats how special this place& people are they truly shine the aloha spiriti told the gm i hate to tell anyone about them because im afraid if people start booking them full i wont have my slice of paradise. But they truly deserve a five star rating!Patty Sullivan

Nice, clean rooms, very friendly staff, nice beach close to the hotel. Bus stop next the hotel, so even without a car it was possible to go anywhere, to visit other beaches or wood areas. Highly recommend.

The most friendly and helpful staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in. Bright and clean rooms with everything we needed for our stay. The hotel is small enough to give you the feel of personal attention , yet large enough to offer great amenities. The "wine hour" every afternoon gave us the opportunity to interact with other guests and got to see where others had traveled from to come to Hawaii. We will return again and again.

Really warmly welcomed despite our late arrivalAll staff very helpful w exception of the breakfast crew. We were unable to sit because they were closing "soon". Food was not too worth it's presumed convenienceQuiet and really nice to give the bicycles and beach chairs with our package. Fabulous Japanese restaurant a block away and the hotel gave a coupon. Would recommend if you are looking for small and quiet with a friendly staff vs BIG Honolulu
user_location: Please do not publish my email or this will be my last review for Trip Advisor

review_body: Nicely decorated, clean boutique hotel. Comfortable bed, great view of Diamond Head, quiet location.Very nice and helpful staff. A 15 minute stroll to the shops and restaurants in Waikiki, but that is fine with us. Room was tastefully decorated. I would stay here again.

Enjoyed our stay, location is at the quiet end of Waikiki and staff were friendly and so helpful. Is is great that they have bikes to lend and have beach chairs and towels to borrow. Late afternoon they set out wine for guests, nice touch.

Room amenities were very comfortable and appreciated available beach equipment. Beach small but considering location, it was OK. Even though there was no restaurant for lunch or dinner, would have enjoyed a better breakfast facility. Very basic. The valet service employees were particularly helpful and welcoming. Nice that Lotus is away from Honolulu center but still convenient.

There is a personal touch that the Lotus offered that made my stay feel like home away from home. It was a relief to arrive back at the hotel after a long day of work. I will be back and will make this my Honolulu Hotel!

Everything at this hotel was perfect. Rooms are lovely, facilities are great. Amazing and friendly staff and fantastic beach location. Highly recommend staying here. Short walk to shopping. Beautiful park just opposite.

We stayed here on our honeymoon. I mentioned that in the comments section for every reservation I made. A couple places said "congratulations" at check in but here there was a chilled bottle of sparkling wine and glasses waiting in our room when we arrived. There was an issue of some old stains on the bedding which required a late night call to housekeeping but the linens were changed promptly and the staff were all apologetic. We noticed a very loud metallic clunking noise whenever the elevator opened in the lobby, and you needed to swipe your key to go any higher than the restaurant on the 2nd floor. This was inconvenient if you were trying to carry breakfast for two back to your room alone. There was a park nearby which was nice to walk through during the day. A lot of homeless stay there so I wouldn't go alone at night. We did walk through as a couple on our way home from the bars and restaurants along Waikiki and had no problem though. The view of Diamondhead was ok but we were on a middle floor (6th) so there were some trees in the way. I'd recommend a higher floor for a better view. The hotel is not beach front and we could not see the beach from our room.We did not try it but they said they had towels, chairs, bikes etc for a trip to the beach or around town. A really nice touch was they had complimentary cold bottled water available at the front desk.Looking back most of my comments are a little negative but really this was one of the nicer places we stayed. I'll definitely look this place up again if I ever go back to Honolulu.

This was the PERFECT choice for my wife and I. This beautiful property is perfectly located next Waikiki Beach, while avoiding the hectic mess of traffic and tourists. Secluded beach access directly behind the hotel, they have the chairs and towels ready for you. Less than 3/4 mile from shopping and food. After a long day, free wine in the lobby from 4-6! Don't drink? They've got cold bottled water for you all day. Free bike rental, free shuttle around Waikiki! Saves a ton parking, time , and gas. Free DVD and video games! Brand new movies too! The friendliest and most pleasant staff that make you feel welcome and at home when you walk in. They also were very helpful with recommendations everything. Gorgeous, big, and very clean room with excellent views from any side of either diamond head or partial ocean, we were lucky to have both! We absolutely loved our stay. It was everything we were looking for and more. Book here. Do not hesitate.

The Lotus as you've probablyt determined by now is in a quieter section of Honolulu just a short walk (or take advantage of complimentary bicycles) from the sights and sounds of Waikiki and a longer walk (mile or so) from the Kapahulu restaurant neighborhood. If you've got a car and I always do - to take jaunt to North Shore, Kailua, etc., the valet parking is included in the resort fee, and the valets are very nice and quick. The room was spacious and very nice. The corner diamond head room has two balconies and terrific cross breezes, and a decent view of Diamond Head. If you want a nicer view, get a higher floor (maybe want to do this when you book if you can). The staff are friendly and very helpful. All told - - pretty good value.

Fantastic, well located out of the frenzy of the Downtown, excellent shuttle arrangements. Minutes to beach, copse to Hanama Bay & the freeway to the North Coast. Great service & very helpful in every respect. Breakfast was a disappointment.

New televisions are needed. The cable and reception was not very good.A larger breakfast program is needed. Egg dishes, more hot products. Coffee quality and options could be better.Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful. As good as I've seen. Kudos to them.I would stay there again without a doubt.

Great location away from the noise of Waikiki but still within walking distance. Epic view of Diamond Head and still partial ocean views. Rooms face away from sunset so keep you cool in the evenings. Quaint beach just 1 minute away and hotel provides chairs and towels. I believe free bicycle rental which would be great for cruising around Kapiolani park. Very nice rooms with excellent bedding and updated furniture. We live in Oahu and have stayed here 3 times so far, usually when we have to be in the area early the next morning. It's a gem of a find.

This place is very zen like. I liked how this property is located a little bit away from the real touristy beaches. The staff here are very accommodating and I really like the valet parking. Beautiful place.

Hotel is right at the end of Waikiki beach, so if you look for a quiet spot or just a place to stay for a night it is fine. To get into the heart of Waikiki beach you need to walk 20 min or take a cab. There is a very small beach you can use next to the private clubs. Service is very good, rooms are super clean and spacious.

Recently stayed at this hotel for two nights and I must say we really enjoy our stay. The hotel had everything it said it did.Complementary wi fi, daily wine , shuttle etc etc. Our accommodation was pre paid with Webjet and included all taxes!But on checkout we were charged a daily boutique fee of $25 per person plus tax - we were told this covers all the complementary things wi fi, daily wine, shuttle etc etc. So in fact nothing was complementary! So the end of the trip was so the disappointment, the man on reception was really rude, while the rest of the staff had been very nice.Feel like we've been ripped off this fee was never mentioned at check in. But just proves old saying you get nothing for nothing.

If you are looking for a quality hotel to stay in Honolulu (whether it be for family or honeymoon), Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head is your best bet! My family with a 2 yr old toddler were meeting with me in Honolulu from Asia while I flew in from East Coast. We booked two Ocean View Premium rooms. The rooms are clean and nice. It is not too brand new, but it is very decent and up to par. The view is amazing - on the left we had a full view of Diamond Head and on the right we saw part of the ocean. It is not a wide open ocean view because the building in the front blocks partial of the view. However it does not affect the beauty of this room. At night, I was able to see the moon rising above Diamond Head. I left the balcony door shade open, so I slept under the moonlight shining into my room. I didn't want to sleep because I wanted to enjoy that beautiful moment!There are no breakfast included, but they have a simple restaurant on the 2nd floor that you can pay, or you can order from any restaurants in Honolulu to deliver to your door. I highly recommend the nearby "Bogart's Cafe" for breakfast or lunch. That is the BEST brunch spot - I visited 4 times during my 6 days stay in Lotus. You can ride a bike to the restaurant within 5 mins. The morning Yoga in the nearby park is a must try experience as well as riding the bike around Diamond Head. You will be able to see the beautiful coast line and some really cute local residence. The hotel also provides beach towels and chairs that you can enjoy. The free wine between 4 and 6pm is amazing too. What sets Lotus apart from other big chain hotels with hundreds of rooms is their service. Everyone in the hotel is very nice and warm. Sebastian at the valet service is outstanding by always greeting us with genuine smiles and always offered advice and help for guidance. Parking here is included in the $25 resort fee. It is totally worth it.There were a few glitches during my stay as well:- We booked two Ocean View Premium rooms but the front desk gave us one premium and one regular Ocean View, and realized later that it was a mistake after we already checked in. They gave us credit for the resort fee to waive the difference of prices, but I would wish we could have two premium rooms as requested. - Room 821's WIFI was not working during our entire stay. We had to do some work on laptop but the IT technician couldn't figure out how to fix the WIFI, and did not follow up with us either regarding this issue. We had to use cellphones to do our work. No credits were issued when we mentioned to the front desk upon our check-outs either. - Upon check-outs, one of the room's bill was billed incorrectly for in-room entertainment fee. This was the room which was supposed to be the premium room. The total amount of the bill comes out to be exact as my premium room (with the incorrect entertainment charge). My parents stayed in that room. They didn't watch TV at all but they were charged with this fee. The front desk was able to fix the bill, but I still find it bizarre how this charge occurred.I felt the front desk was not able to answer my questions when I had issue with WIFI and bill. They kind of just want to smooth it over instead of fixing the problem. I wish the management can look into this. Otherwise, all other staff members are doing a fantastic job! I will definitely come back to Lotus again when I visit Honolulu!

This is absolutely the gem of Honolulu. The rooms and bathrooms are beautiful. The Hawaiian breeze and views are beyond belief. I cried when I booked it, got misty when we checked out (we went to another more expensive hotel, that I didn't like half as much), and can cry when I look at the website still. The staff is so warm and friendly. The wine hour every night is wonderful. There is onsite pay laundry, which was fabulous and really made the trip more comfortable. They have bikes you can take and ride around on. We took ours to the Honolulu Zoo. Seriously I could cry writing this review. This is absolutely one of the best boutique hotels I've ever stayed at. It's perfect, we had such an amazing romantic time here.

Our second stay in a three week period, we were not overly impressed with our first stay due to room request being ignored however we all have an off day.Our second stay was perfect our room request was acknowledged at check in so we actually felt like valued guests rather than just another number etc.Room was nice with beautiful view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Check in staff were efficient, room was clean and nicely decorated giving it a holiday feel, housekeeping were friendly and polite, the use of washing machine & dryer were appreciated after a long trip, afternoon wine in lobby is a nice touch the only negative to mention is just one lift to guest floors.A special mention to JR on reception and the young guy who works Concierge during the day (sorry can't recall your name) - Thanks guys.

So this was the 5 year that we have spend time at the Lotus in Honolulu. This year we brought two new people with us, one from Miami and the other from Dublin. Needless to say, they both loved it. They were amazed at how nice everyone was....it just affirmed why we come back every year.

The property was very convenient for my purposes, a comfortable walking distance from Waikiki and access to the beach, great views, a wonderful lanai to catch the early morning sun. Room is well appointed and comfortable.

The stay was wonderful.The service at the hotel and welcome at the hotel was wonderful. The staff were always helpful and courteous. We had a room with a partial view of the ocean and lovely patio we could enjoy it from.

Enjoyed our stay very much. Convenient to attractions, but out of the craziness and traffic of Waikiki. Would love to return when the restaurant reopens as it would really add to the whole Lotus experience.

Wonderful hotel, everyone was so kind and helpful. When I called to book the room I spoke to JR he was knowledgeable and, informative. Upon arrival, Sebastian parked our car,and brought up our bags. He continued to be helpful throughput our entire stay, with driving directions, and tips for where to see the best sunsets. Perfect vacation!

I have family that lives in the Diamond Head area so I first picked this hotel due to its location. Now I would recommend this small boutique hotel to anyone interested in Waikiki. You are only steps away from all the action, but when your day is over you can return to tranquility. While the hotel rooms are very nice and the views from the lanais are pretty spectacular, I think the best feature is the staff. They are all so attentive and friendly and helpful. I have now stayed three times and each time I am very happy to return to a place that feels like home (or better).

Nice property! Away from the chaos of the main strip in Waikiki but close enough if you want to be near the action. About 15 min walk to main strip. The is also a free shuttle that runs between their different properties. Smaller hotel compared to other properties nearby. All of the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable of the area. Free parking(in resort fee), bikes, beach chairs, umbrellas, and wine in the evening.

The Lotus Hotel has very comfortable rooms with excellent views of Diamond Head and the ocean. The hotel is far enough away from all the noise of the downtown hustle but close enough to walk there. The beds are extremely comfortable. Hardwood floors along with a rug that makes the room very comfortable. There is a night time turn down service.

Having previously stayed in the main tourist part of Waikiki, on this trip we opted for the quiet Diamond Head end of the beach. The Lotus was a fabulous find and we were not disappointed. The small hotel feel was just what we were looking for after, being on a cruise with 2000 plus others. The wine each afternoon was of good standard, and we loved the coffee machine in the room and the fact that on request for more coffee pods, we were given more the next day. The free DVD's were an unexpected bonus and the ability to purchase continental style breakfast items meant we did not need to go back and forth to the ABC shop. The room itself was very roomy and comfortable and we enjoyed the breeze we picked up on the balcony where we had breakfast and enjoyed our wine. The small convenience shop outside the hotel next door was useful and while we did do the walk into the main tourist area for dinner twice, we mostly opted for the beach kiosk in Queen Kapiolani Park enjoying the casual outside seating and live music watching the sunset. Magic. We will definitely return and highly recommend for travellers who want a quiet environment and enjoy park surrounds and do not have to be in the overpopulated downtown area. Thank you Lotus for a memorable stay.

It was the staff actions that differentiated this hotel. The valet guys, for example, are way more than "car parkers". They help get you out the door, and in our case when they heard where we were going or what we had planned they would jump ahead and say things like "Oh, you're hiking on that trail today? It poured yesterday, let me throw some towels in the trunk for your likely muddy shoes/sandals." The towels were Key. One of the front desk staff heard me coming back downstairs after I left something in my room and they crossed the lobby to hand me my other stuff and save me the walk. ("I heard you coming..."). It wasn't just that the employees were cordial; it seemed like they were thinking ahead to get you things or info that you'd likely need.

Great gem. Used to be W-hotel. Great views, past the Aquarium and ZOO, away from noisy Waikiki. We got upgraded to a penthouse on the top floor. We could basically run around the whole floor, two bedrooms. Very outdated, super nice staff.

Nice and quite hotel away from the hustle of downtown Waikiki. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed on the 9th floor and had wonderful views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Great value too! The only downside is no restaurant in the hotel but there are a few within walking distance and shuttle service and uber/taxi rides are reasonable.

This is really cute boutique hotel at the end of the Diamond Head row of hotels. We had a corner room Oceanview 10th floor room. While not actually on the water, the views of the ocean and Diamond Head were beautiful. Comfortable beds, attractive room with patio, mini fridge, free bottled water, free wine and pretzels in the afternoon, free apples everyday at the lobby elevator, wonderful friendly helpful staff. They couldn't have been any nicer or more helpful. Free continental breakfast in the morning, but no protein except for lox and hard boiled eggs for sale, so one star off for that and no working restaurant on site (heard restaurant to reopen later this year), and no pool... They do have a free shuttle to other Aqua Hotels in Waikiki area for shopping, sightseeing, eateries- get a map of pick up spots so you can wander Waikiki and then back free to this quiet refuge. Taxi should be $35 or so from airpirt, about $10 back to hotel from Waikiki. Loved being down at this quiet end of Waikiki...2 miles away. A short walk through front parking area and you are at a gorgeous quiet beach with a beautiful park across the street and next door. They have beach chairs and bikes to borrow and beach towels at lobby for water fun. Closest restaurant is in the New Otani Hotel next door- heard it is the best breakfast in town, but make a reservation. The Outrigger Club and Elks Lodge are just down the street, but are private. Also a small market next door on the street at New Otani with good prices and everything you could possibly need. Catch the city beach bus a few steps down in front of Elks Lodge for the 20 minute ride to Hanauma Bay for amazing snorkeling. $2.50 each way...go early if driving...lot closes up when it is full in the morning...or go in the afternoon. $7.50 to get in. Crowded but worth it. Waikiki is not my idea of a Hawaii vacation. I accompanied a friend. It is very busy and crowded - like going to downtown LA for vaca, but millions of stores and eateries. For me The Lotus was a wonderful place at the quiet end. I highly recommend it. Photos are our view from balcony.

Awesome attention to detail from the lux Paul Mitchell toiletries in the room to the free yoga and water waiting for us in our car from the included valet parking. Breakfast was great and they helped us pack it to go so that we could meet our early morning reservations. Kind, considerate, clean and unique, we would definitely stay here again.

The room was lovely and very clean. The staff was great and gave us anything we needed, from extra room towels to beach chairs and towels! The only downside was the cost of food. You only get free tea and coffee, and have to pay for everything else!

We loved the location of the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Because it is at the quiet end of Waikiki Beach it was very peaceful. It was also super easy to get to Diamond Head where we wanted to hike.

I rarely write reviews. Only in the most extreme circumstances will I sit down to draft something (usually if my experience was quite poor or, as in this case, simply wonderful). The Lotus is a boutique hotel about a ten or fifteen minute walk outside of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. So, if you like to be in the center of it all, you may find this hotel a bit quiet (and it hasn't got a pool, if that's important to you). However, if you prefer a more tranquil setting across from Kapiolani Park (perhaps the nicest park in Honolulu), this is a lovely hotel. The best aspect of the hotel, beyond the tranquil setting, is actually the staff. To a person they were extraordinarily kind and thoughtful. From the people at the front desk, to the valet guys helping with the cars and bikes (yes, they offer mountain bikes for guest use, along with nice quality beach chairs and beach towels, and bottled water as you head out for the day), to the restaurant staff and the maid service, and let's not forget the really nice yoga instructors who offer yoga in the park every morning) everyone was professional, patient and attentive. I must say that the entire staff at this hotel may be the best that I've experienced in all of my years of travel, both domestic and international. It may sound strange to say this, but returning to the hotel each day almost felt like going home in the sense that everyone at the hotel made my wife and me feel so comfortable and welcome. I strongly urge the hotel ownership and management to take very good care of the hotel staff. Their professionalism and attentiveness is what sets this hotel apart from your competition.I used to live on Oahu for many years and now live in California (the Bay Area). However, I visit Oahu fairly often each year due to work (my company is headquartered on Oahu) and to visit friends who still live there; and when my wife and I are not actually staying with our friends, the Lotus hotel will be our hotel of choice whenever we are on Oahu. I cannot recommend the Lotus hotel more highly. An easy 5 stars.

Friendly and efficient front desk. A glass of wine at check in was very welcome after a long rushed day. A Great corner room with an awesome view. Clean and attractive room. We like that it's not in the center of Waikiki. For our next staycation, We will book here again!

I have stayed at this boutique property on several occasions. It is a tranquil setting within walking distance to the vibe of Waikiki Beach. Located next to a large urban park, and a short stroll to an beautiful beach, makes it ideal. Outstanding service and staff where everything has a personal touch.The premium ocean view befits the name, and worth the extra.

Our one night in Honolulu (after a week in Maui) was for an event at the Aquarium, which is a very quick walk from the hotel. It's a a good value, compared to other Waikiki hotels. It's quiet and pristine and has a bit of a zen-like feel. In fact, they offer regular yoga classes. It is off the beaten track, however, and restaurants are a bit of a hike. The breakfast was not very appealing and there is no dining room for other meals. I also couldn't quite figure out how one gets to the beach, but I'm sure that it's not an issue as the water is close-by, and they offer beach towels. I'm not sure we'll stay there again unless, once again, we have an event at the Aquarium. We had trouble with the wifi, but without asking, they refunded the charge for it.

Booked this hotel via Expedia based on the great reviews and location and I'm so glad I did! It was both our first trip to Oahu as we were celebrating our 10 yr. Anniversary. They gave us a room with a SPECTACULAR view of both Diamond head from our patio and upon opening the front door it was an amazing view of Waikiki. The customer service was FANTASTIC. From check-in to check-out and everything in between! Travis (valet) has excellent recommendations of where to eat, places to check out, activities to do he never disappointed! A nice surprise was the bottle of champagne they provided my husband and I upon arrival to our room. So thoughtful!They provide beach chairs, beach towels, cold waters whenever you leave the hotel and a private beach is literally steps away! They also have happy hour from 4-6pm every night near the check-in counter. There's even a complimentary shuttle to take your around Waikiki and to the main Ala Moana shopping mall. It's away from the crowds of Waikiki, but close enough you don't feel like you're missing out on anything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, don't think twice! A HUGE Mahalo to the staff at Lotus Hotel, you made our week unforgettable! We hope to see you again soon! :)

This was our second visit to the Lotus, and after a hiatus of three years it remains an excellent choice for those who want elegant accommodations but not the mobs of tour groups and screaming kids that overrun most Waikiki hotels. The hotel is small, only around 100 rooms, all beautifully furnished and equipped. Mini-fridges and Illy espresso/coffee machines, marble bathrooms, and nice lanais with views of Diamond Head and the Pacific. The Lotus is around ten minute or so walk south of the main Waikiki area, across from Queen Kapiolani Park. Seriously underpopulated Sans Souci Beach is just a few steps away, and the aquarium and zoo are easy walks. And the staff on both trips was warm, welcoming, and way beyond expectations in their helpfulness. The hotel does not have a full service restaurant, but it does offer continental breakfasts and complimentary beverages in its second floor dining room, as well as complimentary wine in the evening. There are several excellent restaurants an easy walk nearby, and of course myriads in central Waikiki. There is also a very nice open air cafe about five minutes up the beach, which is both excellent and very reasonably priced for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and affords a lovely al fresco setting by the ocean. The only potential drawback is that if you are too limited in mobility to get to and from central Waikiki (assuming you want to) on foot, you will need to either hop the hotel's periodic (free) shuttle or a city bus to get there and back, or rent a car. There is no charge for valet parking, by the way.

Third time I have stayed at the Lotus. The location is great. The rooms are nice a size and well decorated. I love the staff they are helpful and friendly. Great view of the water, mountain and park from the room.

We opted to stay at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki in the knowledge that it would be quieter and more peaceful than in the 'heart' of the resort. The Lotus Hotel proved ideal for us. We had a fantastic room on the 11th floor which had wonderful views towards Diamond Head and glimpses of the ocean too in other directions. The room was spacious, very clean and very quiet. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times. Great location, close to beaches for swimming and snorkelling. There was a small shop close by which sold just about everything! We enjoyed the 20 minute walk into the centre of Waikiki. The hotel is near a bus stop although the bus service was not that frequent. Enjoyed this hotel so much that we hope to return!

Loved it here. Staff is FABULOUS. I can't say enough about them. I have to give a little shout out to Sebastian. He was the best! Although as I said, everyone made you feel special. Accommodations were clean and comfortable and it's really nice to be outside of the bustle of Waikiki. Loved every minute. Thank you to everyone at the Lotus!

We came to Hawaii for a cruise April 2016. The cruise would take us to the other islands but we wanted a little extra time on Ohau because of its history and all there is to see. Ohau is the heart of Hawaii.I chose the Lotus from the reviews on Trip Advisor and they we're not wrong. For price, location and a really great staff, what a find it is. It's a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach but its away from the congestion of it. For us it was perfect fit.I would highly recommend it if you want a little slower pace than crowed Waikiki area but want to be close by it or in it when you want.It's in a smaller hotel and condo area, very quiet..Not directly on the ocean it shares a private beach with the access a 1/4 of a block walk across the back parking lot.

The Lotus is a gem of a hotel hidden away in a quiet part of W Honolulu near diamond head. It's two doors down from the Outrigger Canoe Club, close to the beach and across from Kapiolani park. The rooms are clean and modern (although it's an older building) and the staff was cheerful and helpful. There are free bike rentals and free beach chairs as well free wifi and a free DVD kiosk in the business center. Room service is provided by a kind of Honolulu Waiters-on-wheels that can get you food from 27 restaurants. A very pleasant place to stay if you're looking for more of the romantic/quiet get away with a run in the park rather than the hubbub of Waikiki.

My mom & I stayed here in February after several days on business downtown. We picked this hotel simply because they accentuated the relaxing environment we were looking for on their website. We got exactly what we were looking for & much more! Complimentary lemon water was always available. Beach chairs & fluffy towels right at the desk. Free wine in the evenings. GREAT GREAT GREAT staff!!! (Their names escape me, but the valets were nothing short of top notch!! One of them even gave me a soda so I didn't have to walk to the store!) Our room was spectacular & the view was even more so! We could see Diamond Head AND the ocean every day. We slept very well & even kept our lanai door open so we could wake up to the view! After our hectic work week, the Lotus met our need to relax 110%! If you are looking for a quiet place, away from the hustle & bustle of Waikiki, THIS IS IT!! Thank you to everyone at the Lotus for such a wonderful visit!!!

Have stayed there now 3 times in the span of 2 months. The location is good - off the beaten path from Waikiki. Value is very good for what you get. Very clean and nicely appointed rooms (modern decor). The staff is wonderful and were very attentive and polite. The hotel is not directly on the beach but very easy walking to it. We never ate at the hotel but its easy walking or biking to a number of restaurants near the hotel. We liked it for the fact that it was easy to get in and out of the Waikiki area and the proximity to the KCC farmers market which is wonderful. Our family only wishes it had a pool which would have make it perfect.

Loved the staff, room, attention to guests. The location is right near Kaimana beach...a place I hold very dear to my heart:) we will definitely be back for another trip soon. Don't miss out on this property!

I live on a neighbor island and stay here whenever we come to Oahu to visit friends or doctors. Has the best location in Honolulu, second to none. Rooms are nice, comfortable, and quiet and catch the beautiful easterly Trade Winds we get in Hawaii. Staff is courteous and highly competent. I just hope this hotel doesn't get so popular that I won't easily be able to book a room

My husband and I stayed at the Lotus Honolulu for 5 nights in March. We had a wonderful time. This hotel was perfect for our stay. Close proximity to the beach, park, zoo and aquarium. It is not near the main strip, but we didn't mind the short walk back to the hotel as there is a lot of activity going on in the area. I can't say enough about the staff as they were so friendly and helpful.. We travel often and this is the best hospitality we have ever received from hotel staff. Everyone from the front desk, to the valets and room attendants were awesome! The valets were so helpful with directions and local information. I would definitely stay here again if I had the chance. Loved the view of Diamond Head and the ocean. We also enjoyed the beach chairs, bicycles and evening wine service that was provided by the hotel. The only improvement that could be made is to open the restaurant that is on site, because you have to leave the property of you want a meal. However, I do think it was very nice of them to have pastry available for a quick bite. No complaints about this hotel, we were very pleased. Mahalo to the staff and if I'm lucky we will have the opportunity to visit again.

We were in Honolulu for 3 nights. Primarily for the Pearl Harbor memorial tours. Hotel is very clean, attentive staff and excellent location. Area is very quiet, good access to beaches and parks. The only drawback was the continental breakfast...disappointed in quality and variety of offering. Best to plan breakfast somewhere else!

Perfection! The Lotus Honolulu is just as advertised. Our room was beautifully decorated and had a million dollar view. The staff is very friendly. Eric and Devini served us breakfast in the second floor dining area. They are so friendly. Robert is the evening shift valet and is incredibly friendly and helpful, and pointed us to some great restaurants. We didn't catch the daytime valet's name but he is also super nice, as are the front desk staff. The Lotus is a short walk to the main Waikiki beach/dining/shopping area. It is an even shorter walk to the nearby beaches. It must have been off season as the the hotel seemed quiet, which was a plus for us. There is a nearby convenience store two doors down the block where we picked up snacks and water bottles for the day's outing. We will definitely return to this hotel, hopefully soon!

Loved the view from our room, Travis the vallet was so awesome at making us feel at home! They offer you water every time you leave or you can ask also. Room was perfect for us, only thing is they need to clean behind the beds. Other then that we were totally in love with this hotel. Newspaper every morning and super friendly staff!

A jewel of a boutique hotel-nestled in at the far end of Waikiki Beach. Wonderful service, easy parking(included in resort fee), well-appointed rooms. Easy access to beach and the activities of Waikiki. And one of the best dining experiences we've ever had right next door at Michel's!

Lovely small quiet hotel on East end of Waikiki. Hotel is not on the beach however, but set back a ways. Beautiful views of Diamond Head from room patio.Very clean. Wonderful staff. We would definitely return to this hotel.

We spent our honeymoon at the Lotus, it was wonderful! Everyone that worked there always had a smile on their faces and were very helpful in suggesting places to visit and eat. It was very quiet and peaceful, and had a great view of Diamondhead. We will definitely be suggesting the Lotus to friends and family that will be visiting Oahu but don't want to deal with the craziness of Waikiki.

It's off of the main drag in Waikiki over by Kapiolani Park, so it's a little bit further from some of the restaurants and shops, but I view this as a good thing. It's much less congested with tourists and therefore more relaxing. Rooms are clean and modern. We chose it based on the parking situation. Every other hotel in Waikiki charges upwards of $35 in addition to numerous other bogus fees, but the Lotus included parking in their "resort fee." Staff was helpful. You can get bottles of water from the valet when you're heading out, and they will also provide you with beach chairs and towels if you desire them. I would have sworn that I read breakfast was included, but when we went down in the morning, a tiny muffin was priced over $4, so we went elsewhere. Overall a good value for the area. It's smaller than its massive Waikiki neighbors, and it allows the place to feel more like home.

We wanted to visit relatives on Oahu during part of our honeymoon, but were NOT looking forward to staying nearby in busy, hot, hectic, pricey, loud, touristy, ugly (come on, be honest) Waikiki proper. But as the very kind, professional staff (and my relatives) pointed out, Lotus is not on Waikiki. Rather, it's a mile or more east at the foot of Diamond Head (Leahi), right across the street from the lovely, quiet greenery of Kapiolani Park (itself another 5 star entity). The difference between the Waikiki main drag and the Lotus/Kapiolani Park/Outrigger area is huge--don't mistake one for the other. Lotus, both as a hotel and a location, is like a lovely, green, quiet zen garden, an oasis, a retreat, a safe place with its own lovely little beaches out front. While there are several other tower blocks adjacent to Lotus, the group are all set clearly away from the skyscraper logjam of Waikiki (exception: late night ocean view dining is a Waikiki specialty, so don't miss out). The other reviews here did not mislead or disappoint: Lotus is very clean, quiet and has lovely Asian-Pacific decor in all rooms and lobbies; Room had a superb large bathroom, comfy lanai (balcony), decent free WiFi and perhaps the best hotel mattress I've ever encountered. Free afternoon wine in the lobby? Yup. Complimentary beach gear for all? Check. Warm, engaging staff, who were equally helpful to my family guests? Absolutely. We did not use the valet parking but my relatives did and were greeted with kindness and ice cold bottled water. I even want to put in a good word for that highly addictive in-room espresso machine with its cute little ceramic cups (why yes, Lotus expects adults to be able to use real glassware). Now, many hotels can match such amenities, but Lotus has something others lack: it actually felt warm, welcoming, like coming home, not just resort or chain hotel fakery--the staff are true locals, act like family and proud of their aloha oasis. If I had to say anything negative, Lotus does not have a pool (the beach is way better) and not really a kid-oriented hotel (unless your kids are zen masters), but to each his own. After this experience, I would not stay anywhere else on Oahu and hope Lotus keeps up to their high standards.

Nice, clean and good for the price. $25 is charged daily which included parking, WiFi etc . Some hotel charge up to $50/day ($35 parking, $15 resort fee). We got upgrade to a corner unit with two balcony. Free wine upon arrival. Daily supply of big bottles water in room and small bottles when you go out or pick up your car. Very quite surrounding. 10-15 minutes walk to all downtown shopping

Really surprised at quality of rooms and staff. This is obviously a class operation. Complimentary bikes are a great thought. Well located at the foot of Diamond Head. Pity my stay was so brief. I would definitely recommend this hotel.The only drawback was a leaf blower (?) outside very early in the morning

From reception to room service, every staff at the hotel was extreme friendly. The hotel room was spacious and modern. Hotel offers a range of complimentary services (free breakfast/free wine between 4-6pm/free bottled water on demand). The gave us a bottle of champagne for free for my mum's birthday. We will definitely go back.

Front Desk agent who checked us in was very friendly and made us feel at home. As soon as I walked into my room, the amenities and views were breathtaking. I love the fact it was quiet and away from the busy side of Waikiki beach.

The Lotus was great. Loved the bicycles, the cleaning staff, the good guys who worked the bell desk, and the little extras like fruit water. My internet didn't work well, but the manager was very responsive and apparently that is being addressed. I'd totally stay there again. One other tiny thing: don't block the view of the ocean with a TV or a big piece of furniture! Otherwise, great part of town, great hotel.

Just returned from our annual trip to Honolulu and stayed at the Lotus. It's been a year since last time (have stayed there 4 times) and it was still an excellent hotel. Loved the very end of the public beach right off the park near the Lotus. Very gentle waters for swimming. Lotus staff is a collection of wonderfully hard working people. It's a nice walk to Waikiki but you are far enough away from the crowds at Waikiki. We'll be back.

From start to finish, we were very happy with our experience at the Lotus Honolulu.We were greeted warmly at check-in by Jonysius, who gave us a good overview of the hotel. The entire staff was pleasant. The hotel was convenient to everything - not far off the interstate. Nice views of the park and Waikiki - and of course Diamond Head.Our room was comfortable and well appointed.While we were well aware that there was no breakfast provided, I was still a little disappointed by the limited continental breakfast offering there. For a few bucks extra they could have put out a nicer spread that would allow people to grab something before venturing out. That is my only dissatisfaction.

We loved staying outside of downtown. It was very quiet and relaxing. There is no pool but you have access to the ocean behind you. The rooms were very nice - hardwood floors and large sliding glass doors to a good size balcony.

Following a busy family visit, my husband and I spent our last night in Honolulu at Lotus Honolulu. Intrigued by the descriptions on the website, and having spent many hotel nights over the years in Waikiki, we were anxious to experience the "zen"-like ambiance suggested in reviews. We were not disappointed!! From the warm welcome by the concierge, to the alohas from the front desk at check out, we had a relaxing time to regroup and enjoy the beach before heading home.The hotel's location is superb! Only blocks from the crowds of Waikiki, the hotel is somewhat secluded and protected from traffic with the park on one side and the beach on the other. Our unobstructed Diamond Head view was spectacular. The proximity to an uncrowded, safe beach was beyond expectation. The beach was very safe and we were comfortable taking our 2 young grandchildren for some late in the day water time.Our room was spacious, exceptionally clean, modern yet tastefully Polynesian in decor. Upon first glance we automatically sighed in relaxation and appreciation.We loved our experience and the staff at Lotus Honolulu, especially the concierge. Had the breakfast service not run out of most items by 9:00 I would have given this property 5*. We will return!!!

This is our third stay here. The staff makes you feel like family and the views, private beach, complimentary happy hour, morning yoga, and bicycles and spotless and spacious rooms are what hotels should be. The neighborhood is old Hawaii yet a short walk from downtown. One of our favorite hotels!

i choose the Lotus because it is quiet, friendly, close but not too close to the madness of waikiki, and its nice well appointed rooms. the staff in many cases have been the same on all 4 of my visits and their consistent quality of service keep me coming back.my only complaint is that although the hotel doesn't have that many rooms, there is only one elevator and sometimes (not very often) there is a wait. also, there used to be a full service restaurant on the second level and it would be nice if that sort of service returned. currently only a limited menu light breakfast is offered - coffee, tea, cereal, muffins, fruit, etc.

This was the hubby and i s first time in Hawaii. We got a ocean facing room - great views of diamond head and the water. They have morning yoga on some days and daily wine hour. Which can't be beat! The staff is super nice, there's always a bottle of water for the room. There's morning coffee on the second floor. We highly recommend it.
