The only downside to this place is that it's far from Waikiki beach. A good 15/20 minute walk to all of the action, but it's super quiet. We didn't have any noise issues. It's one of the trade offs. Our week long trip there was awesome and the relaxing stay was worth it. We traveled with a 8 month old baby And there wasn't issues.

My sister and I flew to Hawaii to surprise our brother for his 50th birthday and we needed a place to stay for a few days before the big event. We stayed at this property in December 2015, and we had a great experience. The hotel is a small boutique hotel at the quiet end of Kalakaua Avenue, and only a short, 15 minute walk to the action, on the way to Waikiki Beach. Being at the base of Diamond Head, our room had a great view of the beautiful landmark to one side, and a view of the beach on the other side. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable, clean, and nicely decorated. There is a daily resort fee, which was $25 when we stayed, and it included valet parking and complimentary beach chairs. We were offered bottled water to take along each time we ventured out, and that was a nice touch. The property is not right on the beach, but just a short stroll away is a private beach for hotel guests to share with adjacent properties. Towels and beach chairs can be picked up at the front desk, and they are first-come-first-served. Ask for the beach chairs with backpack straps - they're easier to carry. The beach was very nice, and not crowded at all when we went.The Honolulu Marathon took place on Sunday December 13, and we were right by the Finish Line. We were able to see the runners and cheer them on as they came by the hotel. If you happen to be in town for the Marathon, this is an ideal place to stay!If you're Catholic, St. Augustine By The Sea Catholic Church is less than a mile away. It's a nice walk, and you can stop for breakfast or brunch afterwards.I would not recommend this hotel for children, as there isn't much to interest young kids. Maybe late teens would do ok, but I think this hotel caters more to adults. I would stay here again and again and again!

We stayed for one night. staycation deal. the rooms were big and clean. great view of diamond head. they had free wine in the lobby. good kamaina rates. on the outskirts of the hustle and bustle of waikiki means its very quiet, but still close enough to enjoy the wining and dining of waikiki. really enjoyed our stay.

Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head was conveniently located in between Waikiki beach and Diamond Head National Park. The hotel had bikes, beach towels, and beach umbrellas that you could use (part of the "boutique fee"), which was great since parking in Waikiki is a nightmare. They also had a great breakfast selection and the coffee was delicious!Overall, this was a very good property for the price, the amenities, and the location. I would definitely recommend this location.

We like the Lotus very muck. It is like coming home every time we visit there. The staff is veryfriendly and helpful. Also it is very clean. The extras are nice too like the beach chairs, beach towels and beach bikes. The wine reception in the evening is a nice touch.

We just returned from a stay at the Lotus Honolulu that combined business with pleasure. We stayed in an Ocean View room and enjoyed its spaciousness, cleanliness and beautiful views of both Diamond Head and the ocean. While it's true that the view also included the parking lot below and a couple of buildings in the foreground, you'd be hard-pressed to find accommodations in Honolulu that combine the spaciousness of the rooms, the amenities of the hotel, the helpfulness of the staff and the peaceful quiet so close to the craziness of Waikiki, especially for the price. We've stayed in other hotels in Waikiki that had a good view of the ocean, but our rooms were the size of postage stamps. However, we loved our room at the Lotus! Every day at 4:30 p.m. we sat on our lanai and watched whales breaching in the distance. We also enjoyed watching the activity in the park below Diamond Head: dog walkers, joggers, kids practicing soccer, etc. In the mornings, we were awakened by the sounds of birds chirping in the palm trees below, which turned out to be parrots (or maybe parakeets?). We took full advantage of the beach, accessed by a very short walk across the hotel lot, which was never very populated and excellent for swimming with no reef. (When you approach the beach, take the stairs to the left, not the right, for the best swimming.) Originally, we ate breakfast closer to Waikiki, but eventually we settled for the hotel breakfast which was reasonably priced and more to our light-breakfast tastes. I can't say enough about the front-desk, breakfast and valet staff who were very accessible and saw to our every need. I want to give a special call-out to JR at the front desk and to each of the valet staff, who made every aspect of our stay comfortable and EASY. FYI: We took advantage of the free Honolulu Art Museum tickets offered by the hotel and were favorably impressed. The museum definitely is worth seeing and the food in the cafe very good. All in all, a perfect stay in Oahu, thanks largely to the Lotus. My husband has frequent business in Honolulu and has decided to abandon his previous hotel for this one. Very much worth the visit. We will be back!

Great location. Off the beaten path and easy to access all of Waikiki. We walked everyday for all meals and even to the scuba shop for a dive or two. Wonderful and accommodating staff for the whole stay.

Staying near Dismond Head gives you the benefit of a quiet neighborhood adjacent to Queen Kapiolani Park and a spectacular view of Honolulu. Great waking opportunities just footsteps from an uncrowded beach.

This place is amazing! This hotel feels more like a resort away from the busy Waikiki area. Its located in between the end of the Waikiki strip and the famous Diamond Head volcano. We upgraded to the premium room (corner suite) with two balconies, one facing the diamond head and the other facing the beach, where you can enjoy the beautiful sun set! The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Each room has an Illy Coffee machine, which I found didn't work so well. But not to worry, the hotel offers free coffee service at the restaurant located on the second floor every morning until 10am. Plus everyday from 4-6pm the hotel offers free wine! The fact that this hotel has its own private beach area, you can even take the wine with you to the beach unlike other hotels. We rented a car, so with the $25/day resort fee ... it covers the valet parking! Pls note: you cannot park your own vehicle, the staff will park the car for you every time you return to the property. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating! If you don't have a car, staying at this resort might be a bit inconvenient - Unlike all the other hotels in the Waikiki area, where everything is walking distance! With that said, i think the best way to explore the island is to rent a car. That way you can visit all the other beaches and attractions, like north shore and dole plantation. The resort fee covers all the beach gears like towels and chairs. I'm definitely coming back here again, the next time I return to the island of Oahu!

Located 10-15 min walk from Waikiki and main drag. Far enough away to be quiet, but close enough to avoid taxis. Very friendly staff, especially the valets and beautiful views from our 10th floor room.

Very friendly staff, great room, great location.I slept very well Will stay there again Everything was just wonderful.I highly recommend thus lovely boutique hotel for business or vacation as wellMahalo

My wife and I recently stayed at the hotel.The experience was wonderful.The staff was very helpful and they went beyond the expected to help us. They were 5 star.The room was 5 star.We highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

A very clean, quiet and upscale Hotel. Also included is a very nice wine service late afternoon each day. Although there is no pool, they offer towels and beach chairs to use on a private and very cozy beach nearby.Excellent service, quiet and relaxing!Close proximity to Waikiki beach as well as Diamond head.

What a find!!! We loved this place. Quiet with only the birds to sing to you as you sit on the balcony resting your eyes on the luxurious green of Diamond Head & Kapiolani Park. A slight turn of your head and the view changes to the ocean with a surfer or sailBoat. The Lobby greets you with the calm beauty of an Asian oasis and the friendly & helpful staff. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. The bed and bedding were of ecxcellent quality - a delight to crawl into after a day of sightseeing. The bathroom was spotless and a beauty of travertine marble. Michel's, a long time Oahu fine dining favorite, is right next door and Waikiki & its eateries are a short walk down Kapiolani Park. A shuttle is also available. Loved our stay here and didn't want to leave.

If you are looking for an excellent, comfortable hotel near the heart of Waikiki then I heartily recommend Lotus. We love the Zen like atmosphere and Balinese furnishings. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. We have stayed multiple times and have never been disappointed. I would definitely recommend it.

My wife and I had booked a long weekend in a Diamond Head View Premium View room at the Lotus. The website promised incredible views and free breakfast with a 5-night stay. When we checked in to the room our view turned out to be a Parking Lot View Premium (see photos) and we were told that the breakfast was actually not included. Noise from the parking lot was loud, bothersome, and the view was frustrating considering the price of the room. The staff offered no options to upgrade or change rooms. The only option we had was to cancel the reservation and find another place to stay. The location of the Lotus is literally in a parking lot behind three other properties. Their room categories are based only on the height of the room, with "Diamond Head" view meaning up to the 7th floor and "ocean view" meaning 8th floor and higher. "Premium" describes rooms on the corner of the building that have 2 lanais, and not a more premium view. Judging by the layout, the "Ocean View" rooms are probably quite nice, but really offer views primarily of Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park. All rooms face the park.

Nice big room with a view to the mountain, beach snd parking lot, nice big balcony. Clean, modern room, with coffee maker. Complimentaty wine serving every night(?). Nice calm location with easy beach access, nice small beach. Service was great!10min walk thru the park, safe. Parking included. Small breakfast option not so tempting. Overall, good price for the quality!

We loved the location of the hotel. It was a quiet spot away from town but close enough to walk there. A free shuttle to town if a person isn't able to walk or chooses not to. Easy access to the beach and a nice park across the street. The employees were all friendly and accommodating. The rooms were kept up and cleaned every day. We would stay there again.

highly recommend to the ppl who loves nature of Hawaii.Beautiful half private beach, diamond head and kapiolani park are walking distance.Evening wine service is good for watching sunset at the beach!!

I have stayed at the Lotus for three visits to Waikiki and always find it to be a welcoming, relaxing place to stay. Rooms are spacious and attractive, only five to a floor. Staff is friendly and hard-working. Beach is very close, there are bikes, beach chairs and towels for guest use. There is a large park across the street for tennis, walking; hike around Diamond Head is about 6 miles. Downsides are elevator, which is frequently very slow, and lack of a restaurant except for a cold/microwaved breakfast.

Enjoyed my stay. Perfect for my needs! Staff was accomdating and personable! My new favorite on Wakiki! The hotel was easy access to all the locations I needed to get to. This hotel had all of my personal requirements... Safe, Easy access to the hotel , to the front desk, to my room, comfortable bed, the ability to open the window and breathe the air ,

I can't say enough about how much my wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Lotus at Diamond Head. It truly was outstanding in every aspect. Our room was kept spotless, the parking was definitely a bonus, as was the complimentary drinking water that was offered each time we left the hotel on our many trips off the property. There was also a nightly turn-down service. Also appreciated was the quick access to the beach along with beach towels and chairs. The hotel is located outside the busy strip of hotels and shops that make up the main part of Waikiki so it is a refuge from the chaos and tourist traffic that makes up so much of Waikiki.

Wonderful place to stay for walking just about anywhere in Waikiki; from Diamond Head to Chinatown. We loved its location and the peace and quiet though close to everything. The private beach is a plus as we sipped our happy hour wine watching the sunset. Will definitely be back.

We had a lovely stay here for 4 nights in October 2015. On arrival the staff were very helpful and polite. The room was a good size and was very fresh and clean. The bed was very comfortable and there was an espresso machine and fridge in the room too. There was a great view to diamond head from the balcony which was lovely. Although this hotel is about a 15 minute walk into the centre of Waikiki, it is in a nice quiet location and has a nice beach area only 2 mins walk away. There is also a small store very close by for any essentials. Buses also come regularly that go into the centre of town for those who don't fancy the walk. We had hired a car to travel round the island during our stay and the valet offered us complementary bottled water every day when we took the car out which was great. The complementary wine in the evening was really nice too. The hotel is really nicely decorated and is very clean. We really enjoyed our stay here and would go back again if we are ever in Honolulu.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and had a lovely stay. We were on the 7th floor in a corner room with a lovely view of Diamondhead, but we could easily see the ocean as well. We walked around the area and enjoyed seeing the historical homes close by. So nice to be close to Waikiki, but much quieter. The staff was super helpful, polite and very friendly! The room was so pleasant and perfectly clean and the bed was very comfortable! Nothing negative to say. So nice to have the 2 balconies and lanai! I would be happy to come back anytime!

Poor first impression: We booked with the hotel 6 months prior to our stay for a $600/night rate. At our 6PM check in , after 18 hours of travel, we went to a vacant checkin desk with no lights on.Somebody came to help us quickly and we were checked in by 6:15. We asked for, but couldn't get, a welcome glass of wine because that was available from 3-6 only. We had no offer of a bellman to take our bags to the room. Pros: The room was clean and neat. Bikes were available when we wanted them. Cons: We waited 40 minutes for the shuttle one night then gave up on it. No bar or food was available though the website showed photos of them. Movies and Play station didn't work and their technician was no help getting it working for us. We checked Trip Advisor for room rates during our stay and found them to be in the $300/night range. When I asked why our rate was twice that, they couldn't tell me. I think the stay was average for a $150-200/ night hotel. Adding $100/$200 for it being a holiday, December 27 and 28, and being in Hawaii would still make it average . We payed twice that for a poor to adequate hotel with minimal services and nothing to put it in the "boutique" category by our standards.

We booked a corner room with views of both Diamond Head and the beach. The room was clean and updated, perhaps with a bit too much furniture, but comfortable. The hotel is at the quieter, north end of Waikiki beach, which was a plus for us. While the hotel is not directly on the beach, you can walk to a beach area in under 2 minutes; there is one building between this hotel and the water. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and professional. We were able to easily walk to the beach, zoo, shopping, and restaurants all under 15 minutes.

The Lotus is a great example of the Good, the Bad and the Ugly. Lets start-off with the positive:Good:The staff! Friendliest hotel employees I've ever met in both Hawaii and elsewhere. Really went out of their way to be helpful and all, from the housekeepers to valet, truly personified the aloha spirit.Bad:The restaurant. Per the website, you get free breakfast if booking a certain level room but both the front desk and restaurant employee said you needed a coupon from a meal inclusive package. In addition, the tv in the room boasted of a full service restaurant/bar but the both have been closed to anything except breakfast grab n go tiuil 10am for almost 2 years.Ugly;Disrepair. The Lotus isn't being upkept and is looking rather tired. My shower sprayed everywhere, the elevator was broken 2 of our days (imagine going up/down 10 flights, not fun), the pergo floors worn in spots and the a/c unit very loud (needed a tune-up). In addition, bikes weren't available when we asked (they seemed to have 3 total for all rooms/guests) so we had to Uber everywhere, adding in an expense; we did ask if we could reserve bikes and were told it was "first come."Some Hope:Another traveller told me they spoke to a new GM there so hopefully these will be addressed as the location can't be beat!

Loved the quiet location. Room was clean and more homelike than most hotels. We had a corner room with a nice balcony where we could sit and enjoy the view of Diamond Head. It would be nice to have a shuttle directly to the restaurant/shopping area.

We booked this hotel at peak season and paid about $350/night from Dec. 26-30. Nice room, great service. We got a roll away bed which was quite comfortable not the cot type which gave you an achy back next morning.

We picked this hotel again because it is not in the Waikiki frenzy, yet a nice 20 minute walk there if you really have to go. Kapiolani Park separates it from Waikiki Beach. It's a boutique hotel near Diamond Head, with a truly versatile small staff, each of whom can pick up another's job if necessary. There's no restaurant, but the classic Hau Tree Lanai is the the right in the New Otani, and the equally venerable Michel's is to the left, both two minutes away. Nice Nespresso machines in the rooms, and delicious Hawaiian coffee available in the morning downstairs. There are beach chairs, towels, etc. available for the asking, for a small private beach by the Outrigger Club just across the parking lot. The view of Waikiki Beach lights is dreamy as night descends, and the Friday night fireworks are close. For a splurge, I might pick the spendy historic Royal Hawaiian, or the Moana with the giant banyan tree, but for peace I'd pick the Lotus any time. No tourist luau, few children, fair prices for Honolulu. What's not to love? Five stars!

Nice staff and location- rooms large and comfortable- beach access and chairs and bikes nice amenities. Lower floors not great views, otherwise super! Boutique hotel with good vibe, but not super luxurious, if that's what your looking for.

Very clean and nice boutique hotel. Thoughtfully laid out interior, California king sized bed, and attentive & personal staff made this a great place to escape. Close to the beach & the downtown area ( but not too close), and across the street from a lovely park.

The Lotus is a charming boutique hotel at the far end of Waikiki, a stone's throw from Diamond Head. What it lacks in amenities, it makes up via the pretty, recently renovated rooms and the friendly staff and great service. It's not a cheap place to stay but we don't feel our money was wasted. This hotel is a good choice for couples who prefer a quieter environment and access to lush, green areas close by.

o view of the ocean ). If you are looking for a low key vibe in a great location out of the hussle and bussle of Wikiki then this is a great budget friendly option. We would definitely stay here again!

We had a very pleasant stay at Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head. We liked that the hotel was removed from the main Waikiki drag -- it felt like a real refuge and a place to relax. We also loved that there was a happy hour from 4-6pm. Overall the service was excellent. We felt very well taken care of. There was some confusion about breakfast; we were told there would be a continental breakfast in the morning, but went down to find that it wasn't a part of our package and for-purchase only. There was at least free coffee, and we ended up finding a great local restaurant away from Waikiki, Bogart's Cafe, instead! Our room was also attached to the neighbors' by a thin door and at time it felt like they were in the room with us. Definitely not as private as we would have liked, but an overall pleasant experience.

The bed was too soft, the pillows too large and firm, the one and only elevator too slow, and the bar and restaurant never opened. There is no pool and no fitness facilities. And yet.......The full view of Diamond Head's iconic west side and the view between condos to the ocean, both as seen from the large balcony of our room on the southeast corner of the eighth floor, redeemed the shortcomings. Observing the sun rise above Diamond Head each morning through the wide sliding glass doors, while still in bed, sealed the deal.The lack of options for nearby restaurants would be a shortcoming, except the half mile walk along the ocean or through the parks to multiple other eating options is delightful, and helps to wear off the calories.This is a good choice for the Waikiki Beach area.

We liked this Hotel as the destination was very quiet but those looking for better facilities with regard to shopping and dining are advised to be closer to town.Our room was nicely furnished with a modern contemporary style, all important items provided including scales which while on holiday is not such a good idea.A very limited breakfast but light years better than the nasty little outdoor cafe 1/4 of a mile towards Waikiki which serves revolting breakfast.So good Hotel, a little remote distance wise, good service , in general you should not be disappointed

What a great boutique hotel located away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki yet 15 minute walk to the center of Waikiki. Beautiful and clean decor this is a true gem in Honolulu. If you want a great experience, I highly recommend this hotel.

I loved this hotel set away from all the crowds. But, not far from all the restaurants and stores to shop at. The rooms were large and clean. The lobby had a zen feel to it, and was very nice. If I ever come back to Honolulu , I will definitely stay here again.

I stayed at a room with ocean view, but the center view is partially blocked by some other hotel and apartments. You can only see the diamond head on the left and the ocean on the right. The room was spacious and cozy. The only problem is that there was no bathtub. Yeah, I like to relax in the tub when I'm exhausted. One more thing: WiFi was extremely slow.

Terrific hotel and room for the price .... rooms very large and super comfortable. Hidden gem in Waikiki ... Just steps away from lovely Kaimama Beach and easy walk to Waikiki, Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park.

The rooms are nice, I got a room with a balcony toward the beach. Although another building blocked a full view of the beach, I could still enjoy the sunset. The staff are extremely polite and helpful. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there is a very good one in the hotel next door. Room service from multiple other restaurants too. Also a convenience store next door. No other shopping is in the immediate vicinity, which is wonderful. The acquarium is at walking distance also the zoo. Perfect place for being close to the beach, to the Diamond Head crater, and for walking around without bumping into hoards of tourists. I enjoyed it, I would happily return to this place.

Had a wonderful stay. Great staff. Eager to please. great amenities and steps from the beach. There's is coffee and newspapers everyday and wine and snaxs after 4. bikes, beach chairs and towels...what more do you need.

We researched online for weeks looking for a place to stay on Oahu. We settled on The Lotus. We made the right choice! It is within easy walking distance of Waikiki, but since it is down close to Diamond Head, it is in a quiet area, with little traffic. It has a private beach, just the right size. The staff was the most friendly folks I have ever encountered at a hotel. Our room was excellent. You cannot go wrong at the Lotus.

Hotel is a bit overpriced for what it is. There isn't any room service from the hotel, only the Waikiki online room service service. They direct you to a nearby hotel for breakfast since there isn't anything more than a continental breakfast available on site. The wifi is absolutely terrible and when I asked about it, they knew about it and it's something they were struggling with. I mean, this is the United States and we're in the 21st century, there should be working wifi. Hotel staff is nice and accommodating but overall the hotel is not impressive and like I said, overpriced for what it is.

The rooms were really nice and the staff was very friendly. We were very pleased with everything the hotel had to offer. Although it's not really a business hotel, they' were very accommodating with making sure we had everything we needed for our meeting. The food was brought in from a local catering company and it was excellent and well priced. I like that it is right below Diamond head and across from the park .

Loved this hotel !!Awesome service .We arrived early to the hotel at 7:30 am due to our early flight so we thought we try our luck if we were allowed to check in early ... We were told our room was ready (sweet) I forgot what the name of the conceierge but he introduced himself gave us a map told us abit bout Waikiki and where and what places to check out .. He was sooooo awesome !!! There's a shuttle bus that gets you to alo Moana shopping centre and around Waikiki and it's free!!! The room is absolutely gorgeous and huge .!!!! We were in room 1025 one one side was the diamond view and the other side was ocean view .. Bathroom was clean . I think we got our room cleaned twice a day haha On our second day when we were waiting for the shuttle bus , the driver came out and told us it was full house in there .. So he went into the hotel spoke with the manager and organise a taxi for us to get to Alamoana shopping centre at the hotel costs.. ( thumbs up for awesome customer service . Walking distance to Waikiki is a good 10 minutes my partner and I walked most of the time didn't mind.There was free wine from 4-6 pm . Free beach towels beach chairs DVDs these were included in the boutique fee. Overall I'm happy with this hotel it's freaking awesome and I love the customer service everyone is so friendly !!!!!! Will come back for sure

We only had two nights at the end of our holiday. Was convenient and comfortable. Quiet location. Walking distance to main strip and buses. Breakfast service was alittle unfriendly and resort fee annoying when you don't have a car to park! Friendly efficient service.

We arrived very late and after 28 hours of traveling it was a delight to be welcomed so warmly! We got a room with both ocean view and a fabulous view of Diamond Head. The staff was very helpful during our four night stay. We got directions and tips when we asked. The rooms were big and clean. Everything was exactly as it should be expected for the price we paid. :)The hotel amenities are great as well: yoga class in the morning outside in the park (perfect way to start your day!), beach towels and chairs, bikes (perfect for going to Diamond Head), wine in the afternoon, free wifi. The big plus staying at the Lotus, is that you are at the end of Waikiki, away from all the tourists and noise (if that's what you'd like).We would definitively stay again if we are lucky enough to visit Honolulu again.

Hey, my girlfriend and me went there after spending a night at a really awful Hotel, located at the border of Waikiki Beach Area (which provided pictures of a new and modern interior, did not match though, however); the view of the Diamond Head aswell as at the sea is absolutely amazing (who wants to look at Hotel Skycrapers, which Waikiki Area is full of, believe me, when he is in such a wonderful environment?!); staff was very helpful and kind in every question, the location is in comparison I would say definitely one of the most quiet and peaceful. By foot you get back to Waikiki Area in maybe 10 minutes, by bike which you can lend it happens in no time. The comfort in the rooms equipped with fridge, Flat-TV, PS3, Safe, Espresso-Machine,.. is very neat, modern decorated and very clean, there are Yoga-Classes provided in the morning hours, and Wine during 4pm-6pm. Valet Parking Services with friendly and helpful staff-members are ensured. A very nice little not crowded beach is also not far away!

The Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head on Oahu was recommended by a friend. We had never been to Oahu but I have visited Maui & the Big Island/Hilo side more times than I can count over the last thirty years. (Two sisters live on Maui and Big Island.)We had the best time at the Lotus. First, Robert (valet) greeted us when we arrived. He parked our car, took our luggage to our room, and gave the most wonderful, detailed information about the island and the area. He directed us as to how to get around in spite of the crazy traffic in the Waikiki area. He suggested a great dinner spot in the hotel next door and showed us the private beach we could use while staying at the Lotus. Beach towels and beach chairs were provided too.Before going to our room, we met Jana and JR who checked us in and welcomed us to the hotel. We asked more questions that Jana happily answered. We then asked for a regular coffee maker in our room in addition to the pod coffee maker that was already there. She then invited us to have a glass of wine since it is available in the lobby each evening from 4:00 to 6:00pm. It was about 4:30. We then found out that Jana was the General Manager at the Lotus and knew we had chosen the right place to stay in Oahu. When we got to our room, we found a "welcome letter" signed by Jana that said "we are happy to make the necessary arrangements to satisfy your wishes" and she meant it. We then went out for dinner and when we got back, the coffee maker we requested was in our room along with the shades closed and lights turned on so we didn't have to enter into a dark room. Very nice and welcoming. Our room was fabulous with two balconies; one overlooking the ocean and the other one facing Diamond ahead. This hotel was peaceful, clean, comfortable, away from the Waikiki crowds and SMOKE-FREE. It was a 10 minute lovely walk to downtown Waikiki and we walked there for dinner one night. It was very crowded and people were smoking everywhere. I was so glad we get away from this and knew our hotel would be fresh, clean and smoke free!!!I also want to mention another valet named Travis. He was incredible and was there each morning as we headed out for the day. He gave us great direction to Pearl Harbor, the museums and the Queen's palace. He told us where to go, what to expect and explained little but important details like the lockers at Pearl Harbor since bags are not allowed at this military base. One of our days we wanted to drive to the North and East sides of the island. He again gave us great direction and made suggestions about what to do and see when we got there. Where the ladies like to shop and the local shrimp trucks too. He made the few days we had there very valuable and we got to see lots of what we wanted to see. We will return to Oahu and we will no doubt, stay at the Lotus again. Try it! You will love it too. Thanks Jana, Travis, Robert for making our trip fabulous. See you next time.

Pleasant hotel, staff friendly but could have had more info on area. Rather far from downtown = no restaurants within walking distance. Quiet neighbourhood near park welcome after Waikiki noise.Large, comfortable room with balcony. Glass of wine offered in lobby after hot day very welcome gesture - mahalo.

A great hotel with close attention to details. Only stayed one night and wished we would have stayed here our entire time in Honolulu. Close to Waikiki but yet a bit outside to get some peace and quiet.

Great Hotel away from the busy WaikikiWine in late afternoon such a special touch.Staff was friendly, aimed to please.Will be back but longer next time.As a travel agent,I will definitely book this property for my clients visiting Oahu and will be at ease because of the wonderful experience clients will have

Very quiet and great place to stay and just an 8 minute walk away from all the noise and traffic of Waikiki, or what I called Vegas Strip without the panhandlers, the trash and the guys giving away fliers in the middle of the sidewalk. The Lotus Hotel is not a big hotel it has 51 rooms only it's not a new property either however it's well maintain, you get very professional and friendly employees, the rooms are big the beds are very comfortable and from my room in the 12th floor I had great views of the Beach and Diamond Head. You also get complimentary Yoga classes in the Kapiolani park across the street, Beach Chairs and towels, DVD rentals, wine service (4 pm - 6 pm), Coffee and Tea (6 am - 10 am) Beach biker cruisers to take to the park or beach.Overall, a great little clean and friendly place to stay.

My visit to see my family and participate in Sean's wedding was made so much sweeter by the wonderful stay I had at the Lotus Hotel in Honolulu. I felt spoiled and very well taken care of. The staff was very friendly and made you at home. Thank you so much I can not wait until I return with some of my friends.

If you want to be out of Waikiki this is the place to stay. Friendly staff...clean & well maintained. Three negatives...can't get decaf at their 2nd floor mini breakfast bar, no Fox News on TV& wish washers & dryers free.

The Lotus Hotel provided us with top-notch friendly service from everyone we met and the view from the balcony of Diamond Head was eye-popping. We enjoyed walking to the park and to Waikiki Beach which was just far enough away to escape the throngs. Mahalo to the great staff of the hotel- you do a great job!

This is great mid-size boutique hotel just a 15 minute walk (toward Diamond Head) from the main strip of Waikiki hotels. If you want a relaxing stay but still easy access to all the tourist amenities, this is the place to be. I stayed for a business trip, so it was perfect. I could be ocean side without being surrounded by tourists reminding that I was working while they are on vacation! The room was spotless and comfortable. I had a corner room with two balconies and a view of Diamond Head. It was a low floor, so if you can get higher up, your view won't be obstructed by the trees. I had slow drain in the sink and a light bulb out in the bathroom. I forgot to mention it to the front desk on my way out in the morning, but it was all fixed when I got back! Its obvious the staff is attentive to detail. I highly recommend the Lotus if you want to be away from the crowds in Waikiki.

Beautiful property and room. I would definitely stay here again! The whole hotel was spotless from lobby to our suite and the staff was super friendly. A big plus is that it''s not in the very heart of Waikiki. Love it!

We recently stayed at the Lotus Honolulu for two nights and truly enjoyed our experience! The location of the hotel is secluded from the overpopulated Waikiki strip but within walking distance of the major attractions and restaurants that Waikiki has to offer. The entire Lotus staff were extremely warm, welcoming and displayed excellent hospitality from check in to check out. The beach access is a 2 minute walk which you can ask for beach chairs and towels to use, they offer bottled water anytime, and wine in the lobby 4-6pm daily! Other amenities we enjoyed was the free wifi and dvd rentals. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable. I definitely recommend this hotel, and will be back again for our next vacation!

I had high expectations of Lotus Honolulu after reading all the positive reviews here on TripAdvisor but was sadly disappointed. We had the unfortunate incident of having our rental broken into on the way hotel and ALL of our luggage was stolen. After switching out rental and arriving at the hotel we informed the guy at the front desk (forgot his name) and he really couldn't have cared less. Still shaken up from the robbery that had only happened a couple hours prior to getting to Lotus we were a bit surprised... A little bit of sympathy would've been appreciated at that point. After we arrived at our room we called down to the front desk and asked the same you to please let us know straight away if a police officer calls us at the hotel (out cell phones had been stolen) and he advises that all calls are put through a voicemail system so we would receive messages straight away. So we were very surprised and angry the next afternoon when we were told that a police officer had called twice in the past 12 hours - no voicemails, just someone at the front desk who decided to mention it when I called to ask about a late check out. Unacceptable!!! We had just been violated in a country that's not our own and we couldn't even count on the hotel to help us out with such a simple request. Will never stay here again.

Still part of the Aqua Group but under some kind of interim management, with restricted services, such as no bar or restaurant (for some months now apparently, seems it used to be franchised out...) All seemed very odd to us and very disappointing that this wasn't obvious when we booked, or that no one informed us afterwards. And they charge a $25 'boutique fee' on top of the room rate. Suggest this 'hotel' is avoided until it's fully reopened! (And even then it has no direct beach front). Luckily the meals at the hotel next door were very nice however (Hau Tree Lanai restaurant)

There is such a thing as being away from the crowds but the Lotus takes it too far. While the views are OK (ocean view is across the roofs of 2 parking garages and you cannot see the beach) access to meals etc is horrible. You have to go into downtown Honolulu...Since they do not believe in decaf coffee we had to go a half mile to get to a coffee shop. It took us less than 10 minutes to decide we would not stay the three days we had planned. So we stayed and paid for the one night we were forced to and then moved on to a lovely b&b within walking distance of beach and dining and at half the price. Also be aware that they require that you use their valet service which tacks another chunk on to the bill. Ah well, we all have those lessons to learn.

I come to Honolulu on business and I stay at the lotus because the hotel is so grounding. It is away from Waikiki, but you can still walk to the restaurants.The hotel is right across from the park which is wonderful to run or walk in.For both business and vacation travel I recommend it. The staff here is wonderful!!

Whilst room was fine the dining room, bar and lounge were all closed only option for these within reasonable distance was at hotel next door which was itself busy and didn't always have capacity for extra guests. On arrival after some difficulty with one-way system parked in car park only to be told not allowed to self park but had to drive out go kilometre around one-way system and re-enter (10 metres away) and pay $25 for valet parking. Couldn't recommend this hotel unless and until under new management which apparently is likely sometime in future.

We booked this hotel specifically for it's location, away from all the business and noise of Waikiki, and we got exactly what we hoped for. Quiet and laid back atmosphere. True there is not a restaurant here but we found a beachside cafe within a 5 minute walk that served wonderful food. Our room had a spectacular view of both the ocean and Diamond Head on the 4th floor and when we returned a week later from teh 8th floor. The front desk was very helpful anytime we had a question. As part of the nominal resort fee, they provided beach towels and beach chairs when we headed out to the beach and even directed us to a small less crowded part of the beach. They also give you bottled water each day in your room and small bottles every time you leave and enter the hotel. Valet service was included as well as parking. A safe was available in the room and the bed was comfortable. The room was very clean. Other services available were free movie rentals, happy hour wine and morning beverages. Washers and dryers are available for a fee. I could go on and on, but if we ever visit Honolulu again, we will definitely stay here!

We have stayed at the Lotus Honolulu At Diamond Head for the past 7 nights and we could not be more satisfied with our stay. We leave tomorrow and that makes me sad! I figured I should write this review while I am in their comfy bed. We have never been to Waikiki/Honolulu before, but I heard it can be very busy.. And it is! But, this hotel is a bit away from all the hustle and bustle of the busy strip and I LIKE that. I wanted a room that was modern, safe and close enough to the beach. There is a $20ish dollar boutique fee, but let me tell you some of the things that includes 1. Free daily valet service. The valet guys are so nice every single time and always help us load and unload our cars. And they make sure we have waters every morning before we leave2. Free wine in the lobby from 4-6 pm every night. This is SO NICE! They have a comfy lobby you can drink the wine in, or you can take it to the room and drink it on the balcony while overlooking the ocean. 3. Free use of beach towels. Big, new, thick neutral colored beach towels. 4. Free use of beach chairs that they let you take for the day (this was SO NICE)5. Access to small, private beach. Pretty shallow and family friendly. Short walk to Queen's Beach and Waikiki Beach. 6. Bike use (we did not use the bikes, but knew they were there) 7. Free yoga (mat included) in the big park across the street 8. Free movies! There is a Redbox type machine on the second floor. They give you a special card for getting the movies. 9. Bookshelf next to the movie machine for some last minute beach reads. The rooms:1. Dark hardwood floors with a clean, modern rug around the bed. Rooms are so modern and beautiful. It feels like home, not a hotel room.2. PS3 in the room with a flat screen TV3. Big closet with lots of room for organization. 4. Plantation style sliding doors then glass sliding doors for the lanai. 5. Hot water, good pressure. 6. BIG fluffy white towels. Not those small, little hotel towels. 7. Paul Mitchell toiletries 8. K-cup style espresso machine in the room that makes DELICIOUS coffee. 9. Small mini-fridge. 10. Very comfortable beds. 11. Ocean view! You are not Ocean Front, but we still had insane views of the ocean and surfers and sunsets. You also have an absoutley unobstructed view of Diamond Head which is a icon for Oahu, so its very special to see that too. We slept with our lanai open every night. 12. Waikiki view when you walk out of your room. Its breathtaking. Housekeeping was very trustworthy. We accidentally forgot to put away our laptop, DSLR, Go-Pro and my purse while we were out one day. They were on the bed and they stayed there-- they just serviced the rest of the room. Everyone is SO NICE. I did not come across one single rude or annoyed employee. They all smile and wave and are so helpful! That hospitality was so appreciated.Go to Barefoot Beach Cafe or LuLu's for breakfast. There is also a small convenience store at the hotel next door. Just book it! You won't regret it.

If you want your personal belongs stolen from your room then stay here. My husband and I left for a day of activities and returned to discover both my husband and my new tennis shoes, husbands cologne and our camera and been stolen from our room by housekeeping. Front desk did nothing but tell us to file a police report. Sure didn't think we needed to lock all our belongings in the safe. Very disappointed that our belongings were not sage. Would not recomend anyone to stay here.

It was really a nice experience to stay in the hotel....I had visited there 2 months ago and I am really pleased with the services offered. the food was amazing and the hospitality was mind blowing! In short, they made my business trip the most enjoyable one ..thanks to VacSaver for the cheap and best package...

I just recently visited the Lotus Hotel at Diamond Head and it was a very pleasant stay. The level of service was fabulous and the room was great. The bed was extremely comfortable and off the balcony we had a beautiful ocean view as well as a view of Diamond Head all from the fifth floor. There was easy beach access as well. There were a few things left to be desired. The hotel does not have a restaurant, so make sure you plan to walk to Waikiki or bring some snacks with you to your room. There is a convenient store next-door at the New Otani Hotel but the prices are pretty steep. The staff did offer a bottle of water each and every time we came in or left the hotel, which was awesome. The best part of the hotel was the service, specifically the valet attendants. They were all very nice, very helpful, and went out of their way to make sure everything was great.

All the staff was very welcoming. Very clean. Loved the complimentary "happy hour" of wine and coffee. Loved that the beach was a 2 minute walk, if that and they provide beach towels and chairs. Even the little things like a scale or wine cork, the customer service was very prompt and reliable!

I stayed at the Lotus March 19, 2015 and was very pleasantly surprised. The rooms: VERY nice. There nicely decorated, with nice dark floors. The bedding and decor are very current. We had room 725 and it was gorgeous. This is one of the few hotels I've stayed in where after looking at the rooms online, they were just as the picture advertised. THAT's what I appreciated most. It wasn't that they only had one updated room that looked this way and that's the one that they posted in their advertisement.We had a corner room with two balconies on the 7th floor. Very nice view of the ocean and diamond head.The Location: Great location away from the hustle and bustle. It's about an 8 minute stroll from the nearest Starbucks. It's at the beginning of the residential area. When I read this, I initially had some concerns. But once we arrived, I saw that it was the perfect area. Across from a park also.The Staff: We are a very friendly couple and will stop and engage ANYONE. And the staff indulged us. We'd stop and chitchat for a bit and they were quite indulging. They offered suggestions for dining and site-seeing. They were the best. The person assigned to cleaning our room was very pleasant and did a wonderful job.I have nothing bad to say about the Lotus. Not one negative. I thought I'd have an issue with them not having a pool. But while I was there, i didn't even miss it. Sitting on the balcony enough for me. No exercise room, you'll walk around the town anyway.OR ride one of the bikes available to the guests.No room service, no problem. You're just a short walk from eateries. While they do offer some breakfast items, I passed as they didn't really have the menu I could appreciate. Want to stay in, you can get free dvds on the second floor. Most of the hotels I looked at prior to booking this one had dated rooms which I just refuse to stay in. You can't go wrong with the Lotus.

This hotel is located on the 'far side' of the Honolulu downtown concrete canyons & madness. Having said that...you can walk to the Duke statue in 10 mins. So, it's not far at all.Very quiet & peaceful location. Rooms are spacious. Bedding very comfortable. Control your own AC or let the breezes come in through the big sliding doors. Housekeeping is excellent & friendly. Room was always very clean & cleaned promptly & quickly each day. Linens are above average in quality: plush.Usually plenty of street parking along the park but it is metered during the day. Free at night. Yes, they write plenty of parkign tickets in Honolulu.The check in process is smooth & fast. One elevator = sometimes a wait but not bad.The true stars of this hotel are the valet guys. Yes, I know, how can that be you're asking. Well, there's a mandatory 'boutique fee' of $25.00 per day. Which, let's face it, is a gouge - - but so many hotels are doing this now. So, it is what it is.Well, you have to valet your car if you park on the property. Not enough spaces in tight confines, that sort of thing. Yet, the valet guys really are the face of the hotel. The valet guys work very hard 24/7 to get you whatever you need. Cold bottle of water, beach towels with your ride? Keeping your car up front & readily available? Storing surfboards, kite gear, anything you don't want to trundle to your room?Done, done, done & done. These guys are the stars of the Lotus. Travis, Robert, and several others: all great. Tip them handsomely, they will certainly earn it.I'd say it's worth it to be in an upper floor room. The view of Diamond Head crater is pretty cool. You will also be able to see the ocean, although the view directly off to the right is obstructed by the big hotel between Lotus & the ocean. You can almost see the wind whipping around Diamond Head. Bring binocs & you can check out the surfers over at Tunggs.The free coffee is good. Mornings from 0600-1000. The people who are the stewards at the breakfast are also friendly & helpful folks.Would definitely stay at the Lotus again.

We like the location, Quiet and removed from the hub bub but just minutes from all the actions. We liked our room, which has a big balcony overlooking Diamond Head to the left and part of the ocean off Waikiki Beach on the right. Not much of culinary delights though.... the only food avaliable there was breakfast service operated by one person in the closed down restaurant on the second floor. But amazingly, it was good service nonee the less, and he offered enough for our wants, most items are ala carte to fit most needs, with a view that overlooks a park across the street. Many Indonesia artifacts for decor which made it interesting for us.

What a wonderful stay! The entire staff is all impeccably trained and are very friendly at every turn whether it is the bellman, the front desk clerk, or the housekeeping/engineering staff. Seriously, they are spectacularly friendly. From the time of check-in to check-out, everyone was very accommodating & welcoming. Always smiling. Our comfort and pleasant experience was of importance to them and a high priority. Kudos to all. As far as our room goes, it was BEAUTIFUL, didn't want to leave. Wish we stayed a little longer. Room was are super clean & very nice. Big thanks to Team Housekeeping & Cecilia (I believe that's her name) for servicing our room on the 4th floor. We will be back for sure, this time we will stay a little longer. Thank You all again for such a wonderful Hawaii hospitality. Best service we ever had, anywhere. \m/P.S. Kudos to the bellman/valet guy (sorry forgot his name) for always making sure we had water in our car every time we left for the day & always asking us if we needed directions to anywhere.

Loved this place. Yes, it has its quirks--the one elevator and no restaurant, but after being here twice within 4 weeks the place really grew on me. I didn't mind the 10 min. walk to restaurants (LuLu's for breakfast was great, and I ate dinner twice at the bar next door at Otani and once outside for lunch at their restaurant). Saw homeless people on the walks to Waikiki but was never bothered by them--I did take a taxi back if walking after 7:30 at night since I was alone. Lotus staff was very helpful. Booked Diamond Head Premium View Room which was lovely--great views of both DH and the water--yes, there are buildings in view but you can still see the water (I was on 7th and then 11th floor (Ocean View) when they upgraded me 2nd stay). Sat outside on lanai (it says there are two but you can actually only sit on one). Both corner rooms were very clean, sunny, and open. I swam at the beach outside the Otani since it is bigger (you can use any beach in Hawaii). If you want noise, crowds, hustle and bustle, fancy restaurant, and a pool, don't stay here. If you want peace and quiet, and to wake up to the sound of birds (not traffic)--a respite from the concrete jungle that Waikiki has become--Lotus is the place!

We chose this hotel because of price, location, and atmosphere, and we weren't disappointed. It's at the Diamond Head side of Waikiki beach, near some condominiums, across from the park and within walking distance of everything. The lobby has a Zen vibe, with sofas, cushions, fountains, mirrors, candles, etc. It's a comfortable place to hangout with the pre-dinner wine glass. The room was on a corner, with a balcony and windows overlooking the beach and Diamond Head. It was clean and roomy, with a safe and fridge. The staff was friendly and helpful, offering advice and water bottles. We borrowed chairs and towels for the beach. You can go to a quiet beach shared with a canoe club, or walk a little more to a bigger, Waikiki beach. This is located at the end of the bustling Waikiki strip and you have to walk a little to get to the action, but that was fine with us, because we wanted quiet at night. If you're not a "walker", you need a car or taxi. Taxis get expensive. We took one to Diamond Head and it came to $16 each way. The breakfast isn't included, but it was reasonably priced, with various options, the restaurant isn't in service right now, which is a shame, because it has great views of the park and Diamond Head. I took a Saturday morning yoga class in the park, which was included and the hotel provided the yoga mat. It was of moderate difficulty and a beautiful practice under the expansive trees. You get more for your boutique fee than we got at a higher priced North Shore resort: unlimited coffee, daily wine, beach towels, chairs, unlimited water bottles, free yoga classes. There is also a shuttle to the other hotels in the chain, that you can use to get around a bit. It stops at the big mall, Ala Moana, too. The staff called the driver to let us know when he'd be coming around, so we didn't have to wait. This little boutique hotel is a winner, as far as I'm concerned, and I would definitely stay here if I ever return to beautiful Hawaii.

If your looking for a place that has a relaxing pool with tasty food then look else where. I was a little dissapointed that it was the price it was and yet in terms of facilities it was barely one step up from a hostel. That said the room was excellent condition and clean and good service. My view was ok but part of it was a car park. You had plenty of towels and drink and other complementary items. I mentioned about the food earlier , in a morning there is something but it's little more than a nominal cofee and fruit. I feel this is poor value. Finally for non American customers I must mention that hotels like the Lotus insist on photo identification. This I have totally un heard of and left the hotel $250 out of cash pocket. I'm told this is normal state policy for any credit card transaction and yet later I managed to buy a mobile phone by a major telecommunications company using my card and was not asked for ID. This is similar to UK where the only time photo ID is required is once a year on vacation. (Except house buying) lol

We stayed here to be near Waikiki and Diamond Head. It was perfect. There is no pool, but who cares! You are in Hawaii and the beach in front is a dream. We took advantage of using their bicycles and beach equipment which are included in the $25 hotel boutique fee. Great valet parking. You can walk into the center of Waikiki in a few minutes without the extra hassle of having to maneuver through the traffic and find a place to park your vehicle, which can be a total night mare. This hotel is just the right size, easy to get in and out of, walking or driving. Beautiful furnishings and beautiful views. Just loved it.

Lotus at Diamond Head is an odd duck. It's clearly an older hotel that's been renovated to more modern standards. Location is a bit of a bust, views are pretty bad, beach access isn't great, and there's only one elevator for the entire building (used by both guests and staff and it kind of has a mind of it's own) but the staff is super friendly and helpful (we really appreciated the offers for bottles of water whenever we were leaving), and the rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable. Major cons: Location, it's not so far out of Waikiki that you feel like you're escaping the crowds/traffic and yet it's not close enough to Waikiki to be super convenient (shopping, restaurants, and access to the heart of Waikiki beach are about a 10-15 minute walk away). In fact, unless you're familiar with the roads in the area, you'll likely end up having to go all the way through Downtown Waikiki to get to the Lotus anyway (which kind of negates a lot of the benefit of staying outside of the busiest areas).The hotel is in between the street and a couple of other taller buildings so ocean views are practically non-existent (though the view of Diamond Head is nice even though you have to put up with street noise to get it). There's access to a beach one building over though it's not as nice as you'll get towards the heart of Waikiki.Major pros: The staff is excellent, very helpful and friendly and they remember your name. Rooms aren't terribly expensive given the proximity to the beach (cheaper hotels are more inland) and I'm pretty sure that the Lotus is one of the better values in the Waikiki area all things considered.Overall, I'm not sure we would stay here again. It's kind of stuck in a grey area. It's not cheap enough to be a bargain hotel and yet it doesn't have the location or facilities to be high end. It's kind of average overall despite the strength of it's staff. I definitely think you could do worse than stay here but I'm pretty sure you could do better (both in terms of price and/or location). You could make an argument that the hotel is very reasonably priced given that it's on the seaward side of Kalakaua Avenue but a counter argument could be made that it's location at the far southern end of Kalakaua actually makes it harder to get to than some of the more inland places.

My two 17 year old sons & I stayed at this perfect hotel for us for 8 days of their Spring Break. We loved it & had a terrific time! The room had two excellent double beds, flat screen TV, coffee maker, large safe, small fridge, free WiFi & wonderful lanei with gorgeous view of Diamond Head & partial view of ocean. No swimming pool but steps from a great beach that wasn't packed with people & seemed to be frequented primarily by locals. This hotel was perfectly located on a huge park with free, public tennis courts with great lighting to play after sunset. The hotel loans bikes & helmets for free as well as chairs to take to the beach! Well away from the crowded Waikiki area of Honolulu but we took several fabulous walks on the beach, promenade & through the park to Waikiki; not far at all (15 minute walk max which we enjoyed a lot). Park is perfect for jogging; lots of joggers especially in the mornings. Simple breakfasts available to purchase at hotel & they made breakfasts for us to take on the go on in the mornings when we had to leave in a hurry on day trips. Many activities on Oahu including some terrific hikes. I stayed at this hotel last year in 2014 with my husband & loves it so returned this year with my two teenage sons. We all had a fabulous time!

The rooms and service here is great. Lobby and rooms are very modern and ultra comfortable. A very peaceful place to stay away from the Waikiki noise. However, the rooms views are of other hotels and roads, even when you upgrade to ocean view. Everyone is so willing to help.The restaurant here is closed, but bakery goods and coffee are available in the morning. You can walk to waikiki in 15 minutes, but it is well over half an hour to get into the heart of Waikiki and even longer to get to the bigger malls. The bus service is great, but you are often waiting over 20 minutes for the bus that makes multiple stops. Parking is limited and the roadways in and out of the lotus are somewhat convoluted.

We stayed for one week during the beginning of July. The fact that the hotel does not have a restaurant didn't bother us, There are so many great breakfast spots throughout Honolulu. Try Bill's, Kokohead Cafe or Kaila's to name a few. The fact that the hotel does not have a pool also didn't bother us, Kaimana beach has a fraction of the crowds that Waikiki has and the water in our opinion is just as nice (3 minute walk away). The $25 boutique fee not only included parking but also several bottles of water throughout the day and complimentary wine in the evening. Most Waikiki hotels charge $30 or more for parking only. The room itself was very clean and spacious. We requested two double beds that could not be met at check-in so they gave us a King and a roll-away bed with a comfortable (roughly 6 inch mattress) instead at no additional cost. Worked out good for us and the room was easily big enough. Did I mention that this hotel is much quieter than all hotels in Waikiki, and for the people that complained about having a view of a parking lot..... it's better than sitting on your balcony and looking across at the people sitting on their balconies like we have had several times before in Waikiki. If you don't PAY for oceanfront, you are going to be looking at some structure of sorts. We will definitely return to this hotel, also the staff are exceptional. Ask Travis for directions to the great turtle beach on the North shore when he gets your car.

We just returned from a 5 night stay at Lotus and could not have been more pleased. The service was head and shoulders above the big chains. Employees knew us by name, provided bottled water when we left on foot or in our rental car, offered towels and chairs when we left for the beach, and were always helpful and friendly.  The location is great because you have both beach and Diamond Head views with easy walking access to Waikiki and Honolulu without all of the crowds and craziness. Rooms had been recently updated and were comfortable and clean with all the amenities.  Every night in the lobby, wine was provided and you could stay and visit with other guests or retreat to your lanai for a glass of wine before dinner. They also served a continental breakfast each morning on the second floor for a nominal charge, but the coffee was free. This is a perfect place for couples or families, although they do not have a pool. We didn't go to Hawaii to swim in a pool, however, so we will definitely stay here again.

Beautiful, spotless room, peacefully decorated, very zen and serene. The hotel has a calm welcoming atmosphere. Hotel is away from the hustle of Honolulu and feels like a private club. The hotel staff is caring and professional. The real Aloha experience, you feel like you are staying as their personal guests. Walk right over to the busy Honolulu/Waikiki in a few minutes or walk or run around the City park that is right across the street. I loved it. I'd stay there again. Diamond Head view if you look left and water view if you look right...we had a partial view and it was perfect in my opinion. Quiet all day and night. Small convenience shop next door and fridge and coffee maker in the room, it was great. Easy getaway to the freeway for day trips. We had a car and they park it for you every time in their lot right there...we felt like celebrities the way the hotel staff treated us. Thanks Lotus.

We had a one night stay here before moving in to a Condo. The hotel is absolutely great away from the bustle but just a dart to a secluded beach. Our corner room renovated to a high standard was spotless and had very good views too.Nice touch the free wine in foyer at 4pm and a chance to chat to other guests.Customer service attentive.Would definitely recommend as a top value for money hotel in Waikiki.

I typically stay right in Waikiki or Ala Moana, simply because it is easy in/out. All of the 'usual suspects' were booked or out of my business allowance. This hotel is nestled right around Queen's beach within a stone's throw of diamond head. In fact, if lucky enough, as I, you will have a room with a FABULOUS VIEW of the crater! Let me tell you why you 'simply must' try a stay here. First of all, it is 'boutique' so none of this 25 floors etc. It is small, rare to find in Waikiki. Second, staff (although most of the hotels, ALOHA is everywhere!) The amenities though are what separated this property from others. the 'in room' coffee is illy!!! espresso or brew machine, OMG! I love illy coffee!!!The towels are fluffy and generous size. The water is nice and HOT if you want it.I was 'upgraded' to a corner room with two lanai's. One had chairs, the other just for looking out. The plus to this was the cross breeze from the 'trades'!!! a great way to sleep and wake up to!!!

This is a little gem, only 15 minutes walk from central Waikiki. The rooms are a good size, and very modern and always clean.The guys on the ground floor who look after check in and the car park are very courteous and helpful. Always offering a bottle of water, or a towel for the beach, or chairs for the beach.they are very knowledgeable about the area, and great with recommendations for restaurants etc.There is no restaurant at this hotel, although they do offer a buffet breakfast. Wifi reception was terrible.

My family and I have come to Honolulu 7 times in the last 14 years, 7 different hotels & apartments (some very well known and big, some not so), but this place has been wonderful. Will certainly stay here again the next time we come to Honolulu. Doesn't have much in the way of breakfast, restaurants, pools, other facilities like the big hotels, but really really makes up in service, charm and character. Free illy coffee in the rooms, free wine in the lobby in the evenings, free & friendly valet parking, free wifi all over the place, free towels & beach chairs. AND this place is not so expensive. In-house coin laundry machines & dryers also available. Fabulous views of Diamond Head and the ocean from the balconies (depending on the room), in a very green and quiet part of the city. Walking distance from Waikiki. Great for couples or families with kids over 10 years old. Like I said, lovely place.

What a lovely little boutique hotel. It isn't beach front but you have access to the beach just a few minutes away. No amenities (pool, restaurant) but they make up for it with thoughtful little details, like illy coffee in the room, free dvd rentals, complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. The room is fantastic, so much bigger than the Westin and Royal Hawaiian Hotel, and there's a large lanai too. The bathroom is spacious and newly upgraded. The Lotus is located about 20 minutes walk from the heart of Waikiki. This was perfect for us since we love walking and we prefer a quieter location. This may not be ideal for people with small children or people who enjoy being in the heart of the action.

This was our second stay at this property, though the first time since ownership transferred from Starwood hotels. It's still an extremely nice property within easy walking distance to Waikiki without all the throngs of tourists at your front door. We were on the 12th floor with very nice views of Diamond Head and the ocean. The rooms were very nice, roomy by most Honolulu standards. The temperature was such that we were able to have our balcony doors slightly open at night to hear the ocean. The hotel does require cars to be valet parked, but the cost is reasonable. There are amenities offered such as bottled water (from valet) and cold water in the lobby. Bicycles are available for use for free. Also, there is a shuttle that runs to all the Aqua hotels and the Ala Moana Center (shopping center) which is nice if you need to run to the mall, or you want to ride to downtown Honolulu locations.The one downside for the hotel is the extremely limited breakfast. There are a few ala cart items available (cereal, muffins, fruit), but the selection is very limited. It would be best if you planned on eating elsewhere for breakfast if possible. We ended up going to "Barefoot Beach" which was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel.

This hotel is in a great location far enough from the heart of Waikiki to be quiet but still only a short walk away. Rooms are large and comfortable and wifi is decent. Staff were all very helpful and the pricing while not great is ok. They have bikes available for free, which is great, however they are desperately in need of a service as the chains are rather rusty and they tend to be be very creaky/noisy.

Wes at the front desk is fantastic. He was always polite and helpful. We traveled with a group, so I didn't select this hotel. Even so, it's really modern, the rooms are clean. However, it just lacked a few things. No pool or hot tub. No workout facilities and no direct beach access. Also, we were on the third floor and our view was of the roof.

This is my second time at this property. I was there when it first opened (different owner).Pros: Small, quiet property. Staff are very nice and attentive. It felt like we were the only ones there. There was a shuttle that went to all their other properties in addition to Ala Moana mall. It is across the street from as great park so you are surrounded by locals. Walking distance to a great breakfast place on the beach. The view of Diamond Head is spectacular. It is also easy to get in and out if you have a car.Cons: none for me. But if you like the craziness and being close to restaurants and stores this may not be the place for you. There is no on site breakfast or lunch (hotel next door). I don't think that there is an on site bar.I will be back.

The best choice of hotel that I could've make in Honolulu. Waikiki is great and I loved it, but after a while, you want to rest, to have some privacy, go to an almost privacy beach after a full day or early in the morning, this is the place. I had a nice view to the Diamond Head, the park in front is quiet. Lotus is modern, not so touristy and has the right distance to the main restaurants, shops, beaches and attractions. You can even walk. Great staff too. Only thing that could be better: the breakfast (not too many options, actually: bagel, juice and that's it).

We stayed here four nights before our cruise to rest up and get over the jet lag. Glad we decided to do that (for more than the original reasons), because the Lotus is not just a flower -- it's a jewel. The reception on our late arrival set the tone for what was an excellent stay. We had a corner room so we could easily see the ocean AND Diamond Head. We had rented a car to explore a different part of Oahu each day, so we were in and out with the valet parking often. EVERY time we left in the morning, the valet greeted us with our car and two bottles of cold water for our adventures. And when the front desk learned that we intended to try a different beach each day, they gave us beach chairs to keep in the car for the week -- and fresh beach towels daily. At the end of our stay, we decided to do a small load of laundry (they even have coin washers and dryers) before starting our cruise. The maid offered us extra hangers! I can't remember what else they did for us, but it seemed like they were offering help in some small way at every turn. The room was comfortable and roomy, but the service was incredible!

Not quite on the beach but we had a beautiful "Deluxe Diamond Head View" room that also had an ocean view. It was a corner room with views in 2 directions. The hotel and room design was very attractive. They have free valet parking, a little strange since the lot is right in front by the door, but probably not big enough for the number of rooms without the valet. The only real missing element is a restaurant. The "breakfast room" on the 2nd floor was clearly recently a full restaurant. Now they have a counter with some breakfast items for sale. But the hotel next door has the Hau Tree Restaurant, a really beautiful beach front restaurant, a good choice for meals.

This hotel was trendy and walking distance to Waikiki Beach and the shopping strip! Our room was a corner room with TWO balconies! One balcony looked over the city of Honolulu and the other balcony had a spectacular view of Diamondhead!

We had a corner premium room on the 8th floor. The website was accurate as you can see diamond head from the room. You just feel very relaxed when you enter the room. The bed was so comfy. The hotel is just located past Waikiki beach. Dining and shopping only 10 minute walk. Its quiet at night. The staff was very helpful with any questions we had. We would recommend this place to our friends.

We spent another few days at the Lotus and as always, upon arrival, realize why we keep coming back. Great location, friendly staff and nice rooms. What's not to love?Really like the Premium Ocean Rooms with two lanai.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We had a room on the 12th floor. The room was updated, spacious and comfortable. The view from the balcony over the ocean was gorgeous as was the view from the open walkway outside our room. It looked back at Waikiki, in all its glory. At night the view was even more stunning. Our room was quiet, came with an automatic espresso machine, a large shower with instant hot water. The staff members were all pleasant and helpful. We were charmed with this hotel and would stay here again. Great area for walking/running. Free bikes for use by guests. Free coffee in lobby. Free valet parking with boutique rate. Small beach with towels and chairs provided. Free wifi that works well. Breakfast is not included and is pretty sparse but a wonderful full-service restaurant right next door. Only one elevator slows things down at peak times.

We were very pleased with this hotel after trying to choose from an overwhelming selection of resorts/hotels in the Waikiki area. I am so glad we went with the Lotus. It was very modern, and very clean. It is situated at the far end of Waikiki so it is quiet and you face a park and Diamond Head. I recommend walking to the beachfront café for breakfast - it is just past the Aquarium along the beachfront sidewalk. There is also a small convenient store next door which has just about everything. We initially were given a room on the 3rd floor, but we ended up spending a bit more to upgrade to the 11th floor after seeing the view. The elevator is a bit noisy, so be sure and select a room that is away from it. The valet parking can seem a bit silly since you can see your car parked right there, but I suppose if it is very crowded they may have to shuffle cars around the lot (when we were there there did not appear to be many cars in the lot). I would recommend this place without a doubt unless you are looking for a more full service hotel with in house dining options, pool, etc. I would stay here again when visiting Honolulu/Waikiki.

my wife and I stayed here for 1 week in may 2015. really nice hotel with great views from our room ( room 1125) of both the ocean and diamond head. all the staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. this hotel is located about a 15 mins walk from the end of the main strip of hotels and bars etc. which to honest is a bonus after a busy day/ night on Waikiki beach its nice to go back to a bit of piece and sit out and enjoy the views with a couple to cold drinks.very good value hotel with great size rooms - thanks for such a great stay.

I went to grad school at UH and so my husband and I lived on Oahu in the late 90's for 3 years. Of course when we lived there we never went to Waikiki! But for a long weekend getaway with our two young teenagers we wanted somewhere they could go to the beach or get an ice cream within walking distance and have a little autonomy. This boutique hotel fit the bill perfectly for our 5 night stay. We rented a car and so we went all over the island to our favorite haunts and restaurants - we only ate one or two meals in Waikiki and the walk was doable. I loved the valet parking (they guys helped my husband get the surfboard on the car) and they always had water bottles for us to to take with us. We liked the quiet little beach close to the hotel. To me what made this hotel perfect was the staff - always friendly even when busy - coffee in the morning - wine every afternoon. Our kids felt comfortable checking out chairs and boogie boards. My husband and I borrowed bikes and took a ride to Diamond Head crater. This isn't a top notch resort but a nice small hotel with 'real' people working there who want to share aloha with you.

I had only 3 days here, will book more next time. The room was the entry level room but compared to most rooms in this chicken coup paradise, it is huge. And the lanai is twice the size of lanais at hotels twice the price. Negatives: no breakfast apart from hot tea and coffee and hot chocolate. They offered some overpriced pastries,but with a supermarket only 15 mins walk away, there is just no need. No dinner options: again, there are plenty of options either 15 mins walk or 10 mins bike ride away down Kapahulu, and everything is better than ripoff Waikiki burger joints. Pros: the rooms have Illy coffee. A proper coffee in a U.S. Hotel, shocking. Did I mention free wine hour(s)? And the friendly Aqua Shuttle that will take you to Alamoana and back again? Or the free snorkel and masks, thanks a lot, I no longer have to bring my own. And the bikes?Yes,I am impressed. And this place is so quiet. You know how in Waikiki you have to book a room at least 20 floors above street level to get away from those noisy Zombies and garbage trucks? Here all you can hear is those noisy runners. I'll join them next time. And ill climb Diamond Head for a third time.

I booked my hotel for our trip to Honolulu after having read a few reviews about it on TripAdvisor. The actual experience, however, was better than we had expected. Aqua Lotus Honolulu is tucked away in a very quaint part of Waikiki, right at the foot of Diamond Head. It's far away enough that you can get away from the crowds of Waikiki, but still close enough to access all the shops and restaurants that it has to offer within a 10/15 min walk. The hotel facilities are excellent, and we were especially pleased with our room. It was very sizeable, with a balcony and the view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The room comes with all the basic amenities, plus a espresso machine for that early morning coffee. Our check-in service was swift as well.
