If you are renting a car in Honolulu, which most visitors tend to do, the hotel has a $25/day boutique fee, which includes valet service. The hotel also offers complementary wine service at the lobby during happy hour, among other things.Most importantly, the staff at the hotel were extremely courteous and friendly. They were always eager to assist with anything and happy to do it with a smile. The valet staff were excellent and were extremely efficient and courteous, as were the reception staff. We couldn't be happier with the service. Honolulu is one of our favourite holiday destinations, and we have found our home whenever we visit the island again!

We were there with our daughter and her husband. Perfect view of the beach without being right on it and a great view od Diamond Head. Rooms were very clean, amenities were great, worth the cost of the room. Valet parking. Would return to this hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful.

I stayed at Lotus Honolulu at Diamond Head only for 3nights. I really think it's too short... it was so nice hotel for me. Because friendly staffs,private room,amenity,location and kind survice for guest. It is far from the center of waikiki,but it's not bad for me. If the resterant in hotel was opend at night time,it must be much better than now. But I could enjoy to stay there.

This hotel couldn't be more perfect for me.Quiet yet luxurious in a perfect location only a five minute walk to the craziness of Waikiki yet peaceful and serenely located across from a park and a stones throw from the beach.Complimentary wine hours in the afternoon and coffee in the morning are the perfect touch .A warm staff along with a beautifully appointed room with wonderful beds add to the experience.Love it!

My husband and I came to honululu for our 5th anniversary - booked at lotus based on reviews. We booked directly on hotel site, a premium diamond head view room (higher floor, upgraded amenities, robes, slippers,etc) . Granted it's midnight, our flight arrived three hours late - we've just checked in. I must say I am disappointed. Our room is on the 5th floor, "view" is of a parking deck. The room itself is very clean and lovely - no robes, etc. The bathroom is nice, shower doesn't drain, so if you're in shower more than 5 min, you're in a bath. I am very disappointed. The front desk gentleman is kind and courteous - but they can't move us until tomorrow. I feel deceived and that we overpaid for a less than stellar "premium" room.

Fantastic stay and amazing views. Felt spoiled! The staff made us feel very welcome. Would suggest that the bikes be stored indoors to prevent further rusting. The location was perfect, not too busy or far from shops and beaches.

The hotel near to beach and walking distance to Waikiki center. Accommodation bikes, beach towel, snorkeling equipment. Family use bikes to diamond head for hike and great site. Beware the $25 dollars charge for boutique fee per day which charge when you check out. I did not aware what boutique fee mean so the receptor said you pay for complimentary fee then it is confuse. If it complimentary then it is free and if charge then should not call complimentary. So discuss with the assistance manager to.waive the fee. This should not be any hiding fee.

We are frequent visitors to Oahu. There is none better for a neat boutique hotel on the quiet side of Waikiki near Diamond Head. Staff is superb. The rooms are fine. Wine in the late afternoon is a nice touch. I like the valet parking.My only complaint is that there is not a restaurant in the hotel. Many years ago, there was.Go there for a fine Honolulu experience,

Wonderful boutique hotel with a great location! Can't say enough good things about our stay here.Our check-in was seamless.Our room on the ninth floor had a view of Diamond Head and the water. The staff went out of their way to help you find restaurants and answer any questions.The lack of a restaurant in the hotel didn't affect our enjoyable stay here as there were options close by. Thanks to a great team. You made our visit in a busy city feel like we were home- minus the snow!!!

After nearly two years of insane business travel, I came to Honolulu for work and booked an extra night, in an Ocean View Premium room at the Lotus, as treat to myself. The reservation, of course, had a cancellation policy that guaranteed the hotel one night of revenue if I should cancel late, or no-show.So I was shocked and dismayed when I arrived at the hotel and my room category was sold out. And, instead of being offered an UPgrade, which I've had happen in similar scenarios in the past, the only option I was given was to DOWNgrade. So the entire reason I had booked this hotel, and my entire "treat" to myself, was instantly destroyed.You clearly CANNOT COUNT ON THE LOTUS TO PROVIDE THE ROOM CATEGORY YOU'VE RESERVED, GUARANTEED, OR PAID FOR.This kind of overbooking (followed by DOWNgrading) when a hotel would have penalized ME for not showing, is simply insane. I'm sure this happens at other hotels as well, as they try to maximize their revenue streams at the risk of screwing their guests. But I've never had it happen quite like this. The only reason I didn't give a "one star" review was because the room *was* clean and comfortable. Too bad it wasn't the experience I had reserved.

Great hotel with nice rooms and view. We stayed on 9th floor and 10th floor ocean view rooms and you get a great view of the Diamond Head. However, our ocean view was partial since there are two buildings between the hotel (Colony Surf and San Soucci) and the ocean. Nonetheless, this is a great place to stay if you do not want to be far enough away and/but close enough to Waikiki.

After spending a week on the west shore of Oahu, we wanted a few days closer to Honolulu. The Lotus Hotel was the perfect place. With a balcony facing southeast, we had a great view of Diamond Head, the park and the ocean. Although we were less than a mile walk to Waikiki, we felt we were in a remote setting. The staff is incredible; taking care of all our needs.

We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our round the world trip! We had a corner room on the 7th floor. This gave us 2 balconies, with views of Diamond Head and of the Ocean in between the nearby hotels. Nice size room, comfortable bed, air-con, good size bathroom with plenty of towels each day (and refeshed at turn-down service). A 15 - 20 minute walk along by the Ocean up to the heart of Waikiki Beach (very busy!) We didn't eat at the hotel, but found a nice cafe - The Barefoot Cafe - about a 10 minute walk from hotel, right by the ocean. It was nice to sit outside by the beach eating breakfast, which was very good value. Wifi was free, there was a fridge in the room and we were given complimentary large bottle of water each day. Staying at this hotel also gives you access to a small nearby beach, which we enjoyed. The hotel provided small beach chairs and towels. It was lovely to swim in the sea.I would have given this hotel 5 stars, but for the lack of resataurant facilities. We arrived at 10pm after a long flight from NZ, but there was nowhere open nearby to get anything to eat or drink. The hotel restaurant does offer a limited breakfast, but is not open at any other time! Strangely, if you look up the restaurant (it's called The Park) on Trip Advisor it has reviews, but when I questioned this at reception they said it closed a while ago due to lack of customers!Also, when I pulled the bedside table out to look for a socket to charge my phone, I was dismayed by the amount of dust and some rubbish behind it!

Pluses: Great location at the south end of Waikiki Beach. Efficient valet parking. Minuses: Not much view of the ocean. Very slow Wi-Fi. Upkeep: of the eight sliding doors, three were not working when we arrived. One was off its track and was easily fixed. One glass slider would not lock, but we were on a high enough floor not to worry about it. But the sticky bathroom door was a problem for the whole stay.

This hotel does not have a pool or sundeck, nor all the tourist amenities but it was excellent for business travel. The internet connection in my room was fast and solid. The room (#523) was clean, comfortable, and quiet. I ate at the hotel next door (Kaimana Otani) and found the food to be good.

Our first stay at the Lotus and it was a great choice. Given a fantastic room, 1221, corner facing diamond head park and ocean. Beautiful views and a fantastic breeze which was so nice to have the windows open. Very clean, comfortable room with coffee maker and fridge. We were both surpirised both restaurant and bar closed (told bar open on Saturdays and there is coffee in the morning with continental breakfast items for sale) Plenty of places to pick to eat and or drink about 15-20 minute walk away. A very nice beach with provided chairs and towels a very short walk away with other beaches close. Queit and peaceful while close to Waikiki - very nice.

On our visit to Hawaii, we stayed at the Lotus Honolulu for a few days, both upon arrival and on departure after exploring the Big Island. This is a quiet oasis in the middle of the bustling city, yet only a short walk to all the action that Waikiki has to offer. The staff is most pleasant and helpful. The shuttle buses provide an excellent service, taking guests along their route to the other side of the Waikiki area, saving precious steps on the day’s exploration. We did, however, find the breakfast restaurant disappointing.We plan to stay at this hotel again when we visit Honolulu next time.

We stayed four nights at the Lotus Honolulu and really enjoyed our experience. The location is excellent -- down the strip and away from the madness of Waikiki, but an easy 20 minute along the ocean into the "thick" of Waikiki fun. We had a corner suite with two balconies, with a view of Diamond Head to the left and the ocean to the right (though if you go with this option, ask for a floor higher than 5-- we are on the 5th floor, and the tree top partially blocked our view of the ocean). The room was thoughtfully appointed, plenty of towels and toiletries, very quiet, and very comfortable. Our room also had a mini-fridge. I most appreciated that the $25/day resort fee included the amenities of valet parking, WiFi, yoga mats, beach towels, and in-room coffee service (as well as yoga classes three mornings/week), so there were no "surprise" additional charges at the end of the stay. (Lots of hotels tack on a $30 valet fee in addition to the resort fee, which is very cheeky, in my opinion.) The hotel also made bikes available, but we did not use them.Beware, however, that there is no pool or restaurant in the hotel. One hotel over (the Lotus is grouped tightly with two other hotels), there is access to a quiet beach, which we never saw crowded (again, unlike Waikiki). The hotel next door (Otani Kaimana) has a restaurant right on the sand (the Hau Tree Lanai). To breakfast at Hau Tree Lanai, make reservations with OpenTable. Alternatively, a five minute walk takes you to the Barefoot Beach Cafe (mediocre food, go for the view) and a fifteen minute walk takes you to Tucker & Bevvy, in the lobby of the Park Shore Waikiki, which has excellent breakfast paninis and breakfast smoothies.

This was our second trip to Lotus this year. Once again we reserved the corner room up high with views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Everything was up to high standards. I got the flu and for two days stayed in the bed with a fever and I felt like I was in my own bed. Such a beautiful view when you are sick. After worse of it was over, we rode hotel bikes, went to the beach close by and started to enjoy Waikiki.Since our first visit, the hotel owners now have 2 shuttles that travel around Waikiki and stop at all the hotels they own. This was quite convenient and we could walk short distances to where we wanted to go. There is an app so that you can see where the two shuttles are at any time. NICE. The park across the street is quite lovely too. Will return again next year.

What an absolutely wonderful hotel! It was everything we were looking for our first glimpse of Hawaii. It was a beautiful hotel on the inside. Our room was so clean and the views of Diamond Head and the ocean were amazing! The free wine was an unexpected delight. The employees were so accommodating. They provided maps, free water and ambiance. The breakfast choices were sufficient. The walk to the beach was a short distance. It was close to all the sights that we wanted to see but it was not in the heart of everything. I would definitely come back in a heart beat.

This is a well-run boutique hotel located in a peaceful neighbourhood away from crowded central Waikiki, yet still within convenient walking distance. There is also a frequent complimentary shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Our room was spacious and immaculately clean. However my wife and I found the staff manning the front desk temporarily absent on occasion.Our chief complaint is with the hotel's confusing pricing structure. We had pre-booked a room with a "Diamond Head view" a month in advance of our arrival, and were quoted a daily rate of $296.50, taxes and fees included, for a 5-night stay. The predominant view from the 5th floor room we were initially given was of a rooftop parking lot, and Diamond Head itself was mostly obscured by trees. Once we moved up to a 9th floor room with a full view of Diamond Head we had to pay a surcharge of $40 per night, plus an obligatory $25 per day "Boutique Fee," along with a "Transient Accommodations Tax" of 9.25% and a "General Excise Tax" of 4.712%. As a result our daily rate then climbed to $342.Whilst there I went online to check the latest rates quoted by the hotel and was surprised to find advertised rates ranging from $176 to $202 per night, which left me wondering whether I had short-changed myself by pre-booking a month in advance. Finally I would question whether it is worth paying a premium for an "Ocean View" since the ocean itself is only partially visible between other nearby buildings. That being said, my wife and I would consider staying here again on a subsequent visit, but only after investigating pricing and room availability more carefully.

Loved everything about this place - pay an extra $25 and get use of bikes and other amenities. Rooms are beautiful and spacious, plus a nice balcony to relax on. Yoga classes on some mornings, free wine happy hour from 4-6pm. Close enough to everything - if you rent a car there is street parking for the park ($0.25/hr meters during day and free at night)

Great location for those not wanting to be in the bustle of Waikiki. At the end of the strip, past the zoo and at the base of Diamond Head. Far enough to feel like you are not downtown, yet an easy 15 minute walk into Waikiki. Great view of Diamond Head, but we expected more of a water view as we had booked on ocean view room. We could see ocean, but only around and over the adjacent buildings. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast not included, but coffee available in the morning. Hotel had bikes available and we uses these to bike around Diamond head several mornings. Also the valet parking was included in the resort fee and the valet staff were great. Had some trouble with the ac not working the last few days, but as we had a corner room there was a good breeze so was not an issue. They comped the resort fee dive to the problem with the ac. Corner room worth it if you like views. Rooms well equipped and nicely maintained. Would stay again if coming back to Oahu, but that is mostly because it feels like you are not in Oahu when staying here.

We enjoyed our stay. View of Diamond Head can't be beat. Complimentary amenties were great-illy espresso is a new found love;dvd rentals on site. Loved how it is on the outskirts of Waikiki. Relaxing vibe with a staff full of aloha.

Our 1st impression of this hotel wasn't so great coming up to being dropped off at the entrance to check in.. It's a small distance away from the action & an older hotel or possible prior apartment that has been renovated.Be careful with additional charges when checking in.. We were explained about all the charges which we were then informed of a charge if we were interested in Valet and wifi internet. My wife then afterwards stated the fact that we were under the impression that wifi is complimentary in the rooms which then he responded it was which was odd.. It seemed as if he was just trying to get more from us but could of possibly been a mistake on his part but doubtful in my eyes.We had a premium room with what was a partial ocean view & a full view of the Diamond Head. The room was really modern with a nice open layout that had wooden shutter doors which widely open up to the patio which was absolutely fantastic!! Every morning we loved opening up the doors and allowing the breeze, sun & chirping of birds to flow right in! Each suite is equipped with a fantastic nespresso style espresso machine that was always fully stocked every morning which was great.The hotel is super quiet & clean. Every day at 6:30pm they have complimentary wine in the lobby which was a super nice touch! The staff was really friendly & helpful thru out our stay.If you're looking for a hotel on the beach the Lotus isn't exactly located on the beach although its just a minute away thru the parking lot and a private walk way between a couple buildings. The beach seems to be apart of a rowing club but no one said anything to us and it was fantastic, quiet and beautiful! The hotel provided complimentary beach towels that you can get at the front desk.Unfortunately we had a mishap at this hotel where I accidentally left a piece of jewellery in the safe that must off been missed by myself when getting ready to leave.. Unfortunately it wasn't found when I called to check if they could look. Apparently there was someone already in the room for a stay and they told the front desk that there was nothing there. In the end it wasn't the hotels fault but it's just a clear example to make sure you don't leave anything behind.Overall this hotel is a great place to stay! Aloha!

My recent stay at the Lotus was my second experience there. The hotel's location, away from the crowds in Waikiki but close enough for an easy walk, with a view of Diamond Head and the ocean from most rooms, is perfect for guests who want the best of Hawaii's beaches and also proximity to the excellent restaurants, museums, and other attractions of the city. The staff is friendly and courteous; the lobby and rooms are immaculate and attractive. One downside is the single slow and cranky elevator, another is the limited on-site meal service - only a continental breakfast is available. Manager said that the rooms are scheduled for renovation - I was happy with them as they are, and hope that this "upgrade" is not just an excuse for higher prices. There is a $25/day "boutique" fee which covers wifi - I'm not sure what else that includes.

This is a wonderful hotel. The people are very friendly and treat you like family. The location is great. Quiet, yet walking distance to the store and the busier part of town. I nice little secluded beach as well.

Absolute gem of a hotel and exceeded our expectations for our first visit to Oahu.We arrived fairly late in the evening by hire car so we were a bit disorientated but the staff were super friendly and helpful, we could park our car under the hotel and know it's safe for our time there. A short walk to Waikiki Beach and the shops/restaurants. Quite location with views of the mountains and the sea.A small private beach next to the hotel which was really clean, seemed to attract locals which I always think is a good sign when you're abroad.Breakfast in the hotel was simple but just what you needed before heading out for the day. We stayed at the hotel in December 2014 for 3 nights but the hotel was fully booked and was for New Years Evening too (even though we left that day for another hotel in our trip).

Loved the Lotus! Wanted to be out of the hustle and bustle and not opposed to getting a little exercise to find breakfast and lunch spots! Awesome service, water bottles in our car before every excursion, great advice on getting around the island. Thanks to Shelly at Tropical Travelers for finding this little gem for us. We were here for almost a week right after Christmas and it was crazy busy most everywhere but it was nice to come back to the Lotus for a glass of wine and the beautiful views from our 12 floor rooms! The only thing that would make the Lotus more perfect would be to have a dining/bar option available on site. You have to trek out to find these places and, although we loved seeking out these places, it would be nice to have something at the property.

Rooms were great, but the location isn't. There's easy enough access to a small beach, however I was disappointed at the lack of dining alternatives in the immediate area. Breakfast is poor, and with no options nearby it meant heading into Waikiki each morning - which we were trying to avoid.Nothing bad about the place at all, but the dining room was mostly vacant and completely lacking atmosphere, even though the food was fine.Good, but not great.

The rooms are more beautiful than through website (ocean view). Location is awesome because downtown is very crowded and noisy, but you still keep walk distance to restaurants, stores, bus. Sunset is perfect. Staff is 100% friendly.

We stayed at the Lotus the first two nights of our Hawaiian vacation after flying into Oahu. It's located at the very end of "the strip" so it's nice and quiet. We were on an upper floor, so the view from our room was spectacular (the beach as well as Diamond Head).

Wasn't sure about location upon arrival in the dark but woke up to awesome view of Diamond Head and ocean (granted, the high rises between the Lotus and the beach are a bit of a bummer). We stayed in this hotel one night on arrival in Honolulu and two nights on departure, and the property and staff really grew on me. They also accommodated my request to have the same room on our second stay. I would call the hotel "nicely understated", which is wonderful amidst the opulence of HNL. I also love the location at the edge of the park and within easy walking distance of the main shopping/dining areas but not in the middle of it. A peaceful, calm slice of old Honolulu. Also... walking distance to two eatery institutions... Rainbow Drive-In and Leonard's Bakery!

The rooms are very nice. There is a mini refg, coffee maker, sand espresso machIne in the room.lThere a laundry room on the third floor. The hotel has free wine every night from 3-5. Breakfast is on the second floor where you can get muffins,croissant , oat mail and coffee or tea.Valet parking only for $25. The valet , Travis, was great. He had 2 ice cold water bottles in our car as he brought it to us. The bathroom is very spacious. The shower is marble and there are 2 double sinks. All of staff from the maids to servers and the front desk personal to the valet were very friendly. We had a mountain view but we could see the ocean from our balcony. The hotel is on the quiet end of Waikiki. We didn't hear any noise from above or the rooms on our floor.

Pros -- It is a nice and well maintained hotel. It is at the "end" of Waikiki where it starts to become more residential -- so if you are looking for something away from the hustle and bustle this hotel is worth looking into. The staff was friendly and helpful. Cons -- if you are looking to go to the beach, it is close, but in our experience crowded because of the low amount of beach at play. There is a restaurant in the hotel but it is closed and only serves a limited continental breakfast (which is an extra cost). So be prepared to be looking for dining options. Fortunately the hotel next door has some good ones.

Aloha...Just returned from staying at the Lotus for our 10th wedding anniversary. Our ocean view premium room (#1221) had the most amazing views - DEFINATELY worth the extra money. Room was very spacious and well presented. All the staff were so helpful, and the half hourly shuttle was used every day, as was the wifi, and we appreciated the bottle of wine chilling on our arrival for our anniversary. We returned from a day out in Xmas day to find gifts from Santa (and the Lotus) on our bed. Such a lovely gesture. Thank you for making us feel so welcome.

The view of Diamond Head--unforgettable. Throwing open the doors to the lanai and sleeping with them open, waking to a cacophony of tropical bird song and sunrise over the mountains and ocean...unbelievable. Gorgeous hardwood floors and beautiful decor, plenty of room, coffee and wine to begin and end each day and a location on the cusp of everything. Do NOT miss eating at the Hau Tree Lanai restaurant next door (paradise). Valet parking included. Available beach accoutrements at request. The staff was amazing and made us feel welcome. We stayed here twice and didn't want to leave. Thank you for the best hotel experience ever!

I enjoyed my stay here. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions around the island. Wonderful restaurant as well. Very nice hotel in a great location. Overall it was a nice experience. Close to one of the best beaches in Hawaii. The water temp was 82 how could It not be like a dream.

I had a lovely, too short stay at the Lotus two months back, and I would recommend this very affordable place to anyone looking for a low key, civilized place to stay in Waikiki.There are hundreds of hotels in Waikiki; most of the less expensive ones are in high-rise slabs on side streets away from the beach, and even those on the beach can feel crowded and generic. The Lotus is located at the quiet end of Waikiki, right near Diamond Head. There is a small group of hotels and luxury apartments in this area, and though it's a bit removed from the shopping and tourist scene, it's preferable in many ways. You can actually find a place to sit on the beach, there are lots of pretty parks nearby (including Diamond Head), and in general it's a more interesting scene.The Lotus is small and manageable. It's easy to get into the garage if you have a car (no gargantuan parking garages), and to get out of the city fast (much less traffic in this part of town). My room was large, extremely comfortable, and more modern and up-to-date than anywhere else I've stayed in Waikiki, though still lovely and tropical. Though the hotel is not directly on the beach, it's just an easy two-minute walk away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a more relaxed and laid back Waikiki experience, who doesn't need to be right next to a designer boutique or a shopping mall. It would also be great for business or single travelers. Note that the Kaimana Hotel is right next store, directly on the beach. It's a fixture of this part of Waikiki, with a lovely restaurant and a variety of different room types. I've had nice stays at the Kaimana, but of the two, I'd choose the Lotus; the rooms are nicer, for starters. (Though definitely have a meal at the Hau Tree.)One suggestion: I loved my room facing Diamond Head and the surrounding parks. I have the sense that it's a better view than the one facing the ocean, due to how the hotel is situated. If views are important to you, I'd ask the hotel for their guidance.

I am reviewing my second stay at what is now called the Lotus Honolulu -- and I still love it. Hope to be back next year as well. I appreciate all the small touches, like an attractive urn of water in the lobby during the day, and the cool and intimate lobby with lovely koa wood panels and some seating. The Lotus is nearly all the way down Waikiki to Diamond Head, which is a great thing for quiet and calm; it's also generally the last drop off on Speedi Shuttle. This year I was particularly struck by all the earlier drop offs -- enormous lobbies and crowds at the big chains, long driveways, roundabout traffic patterns in and out of the access roads. Not so at the Lotus. Hop out of the van, say hi to the one person in the small parking lot and you are at the desk -- very simple and appealing.I'd contacted the hotel last year about the elevator doors, from the lobby upwards they are VERY heavy and loud when opening and closing, and the staff honored my request this time that I be as far as possible from the elevator. Excellent service.The entire property is non smoking but there will always be addicts who ignore the rules and pollute the balconies off the pretty, comfortable rooms. I am so sorry about this, but that's up to guests who are so rude, not management; they do all they can to respond to smokers lighting up. I will always call this property home when in Honolulu.

We were looking for a low key spot with access to the beach away from the concrete jungle of downtown Honolulu. The Lotus was amazing. We had a room on a low floor with a Diamondhead view - we were pleasantly surprised that we had a small view of the ocean as well (obviously, would have been better higher up, but we hadn't paid for a water view so we were happy with what we got)! The room was clean, modern, and the bathroom was huge. The staff at the hotel was great - everyone was friendly and helpful. Two highlights were the mountain bike and the locals beach right by the hotel. We used the mountain bikes everyday. We rode up to Diamondhead park to go hike, we rode to grab breakfast in downtown Honolulu, and we rode to a lookout for sunrise in the a.m. We didn't even need a car! The beach by the hotel was also perfect - there was a park, there were a few locals there, but it was a quiet, peaceful beach with plenty of space and not too many tourists!If you're looking for a quiet, low key spot for a vacation - but with easy access to the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, book the Lotus!

We've stayed here three times and it's always a great stay. It's not at the side of the beaches that are chucked full of people. It's down by the beaches the locals visit. On the weekends there are bar-b-que cooking and people having a great time. Very close to everything and not so close you feel like you're in Las Vegas.

This location is really excellent, off the Waikki path. I travel on business and it is so pleasant to come back to the hotel where it is quite and serene. Their is a Park across the street which is very pleasant. The beach is very excessable, only a few steps away. The staff here is excellent, they remember my name and always welcome me back. The rooms are very well appointed and very clean and comfortable. I always book at the Lotus when I come to O'ahu.

The Lotus is not in the main hotel district of Waikiki; it is beachside from Kapiolani Park about half a mile south of Kapahulu St., near the Outrigger Club. An uncrowded beach is a short walk away. Plusses: Low-rise, good rooms at reasonable prices, quiet location, and an extremely friendly and helpful staff. 2 Minuses: First, no kitchen, just pre-prepared breakfast items such as boiled eggs, fruit yogurt parfait & pastries. Tip: For a sitdown menu breakfast reserve a day before at the nextdoor Kaimana. Second, it's south of the action, and the shuttle skirts the main resort area. Tip: The City busses running by go into the heart of the hotel-restaurant area and are easy to use ($1 for oldsters; supposedly must produce "Medicare card" but we never did). The help will show you how. We have stayed at many hotels here, and will go back.to the Lotus next time.

Found Lotus Hotel at Diamond Head on TripAdvisor. Great hotel in a wonderful location next to park and with view of Diamond Head. A nice short walk to Starbucks and tons of shops and restaurants but in less densely populated and much quieter location. We're so glad we found the Lotus Hotel.

The staff was great. The beds are very comfortable. Loved the location and the beach. A great place to watch the sunset. Nice area to ride bikes. All and all a great stay and look forward to staying at the Lotus in the future.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Lotus for 4 nights on a short visit to see myfamily in Honolulu. This hotel has a terrific location right on the park-yet almost onthe ocean.The beach to which most of the guests go is only a short walk away -thehotel provided towels and very comfortable beach chairs - is a great swimming beachthe water is clean and clear - The beach is visited by a mix of residents and tourists so doesnt have the circus feel of Waikiki - a nice retreat.The hotel is small and intimate -feels morelike a guesthouse- the staff compliment that feeling- always friendly and cheerful - extremelyresponsive -The rooms are sparkling clean,bright but have wooden sliding doors to keepout too bright sun /or heat -The lanais are very welcoming -comfortable furniture andsport a lovely yellowish clean floor which adds to the nice quiet outdoor feeling.The bed was amazing- heavy.clean cotton sheets and great pillows- plenty of hanging and storage in the closet- large TV and in room game system too .There is only 1 elevator but I never had to wait very long - it too is clean and quick .I totally enjoyed my stay can't wait to return .

Viv and I stayed in the Lotus for our 10th Wedding anniversary .... The team made us feel very welcome and were always ready with advice and things to do. The in-house hire cars are fantastic and allowed us to go everywhere... Our room Ocean View Premium was fantastic ...beds comfortable and the ambiance wonderful ... like being at home ... Great place to stay without the premium of Waikiki ... only a10min walk along the beach antway ... do yourself a favour ... consider....

I have stayed at this gem at least 4-5 times. Its so quiet... but at the same time you can walk to shops. If you don't want to walk, the hotel now has a shuttle that picks you up and drops you off. The rooms are great... clean, modern. Love it! Let's not even mention how comfortable the beds are... its as good as home.

Stayed here for 4 nights staff was amazing especially Dante, he is so knowledgeable and flattering, and VERY accommodating ;). They have beach towels and chairs, and just a short 2 minutes walk from the beach. The rooms are very large, and well equipped with huge balconies and a chair and tableto relax and enjoy the hawaiian weather.

Me and my wife stayed here last week and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is located in Waikiki but is on the quieter end of the street - away from all the tourist-madness. However, you can easily walk into the action or even get bikes from the hotel. We stayed on the 11th floor and had stunning views of Diamond Head as well as the ocean. Our room was clean, spacious and well-maintained.There is a reason this hotel is ranked among the top hotels in Honolulu!

This was our second visit to the Lotus, and just as wonderful. It is quiet, peaceful, small and like an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Our view of Diamond Head was just beautiful. Sitting on the lanai at dawn watching the sun come up was wonderful. We joined in the yoga in the park morning classes and felt relaxed and comfortable in this elegant little jewel of a hotel. We will go there again I have no doubt. We have stayed in many different hotel in Honolulu but this is by far our favorite. There is no pool and no restaurant but who needs a pool with the beach just steps away, and who needs a restaurant when Waikiki has so many to offer. One last word, the staff are amazing, they go out of their way to make your stay wonderful.

The Lotus Honolulu saved me on a business trip to an international symposium on Oahu. It was half the price of the extremely expensive hotel chosen by the group down in the busy part of Waikiki. It didn't matter that the Lotus had no restaurant or pool or other amenities. I just wanted a nice place to sleep. Lotus is in a very quiet area by Diamond Head, but close enough to the bustle of Waikiki to either walk or drive in a few minutes. The hotel staff was wonderful. One of the maintenance guys stopped me and asked if I had lost my passport -- they had found it in a bag I left behind and were searching me out. The valet parking was actually sort of cute -- we handed over our car and then the valet drove it 20 feet to park it. But all that was easy to forgive because it was such a good deal and everyone made you feel good.The nightly wine happy hour was fun and relaxed. The "breakfast" was coffee plus small bakery items available to purchase. I had an end room which had two sides of windows/balconies. This is a small boutique hotel -- only 5 rooms on a floor which made it extremely quiet.It had complementary Illy coffee/maker in the room which was wonderful. Bed was very comfortable, room set up was great.Seriously, THANK YOU Lotus Honolulu.

We ended up at the Lotus after doing one of those "blind" Priceline bids, and so had no idea what to expect. First of all, the location is excellent if you love elegant and quiet, across from Kapiolani Park and on a small, quiet beach. And yet, it's within easy walking distance of all the Waikiki hubbub. Plus, the hotel supplies free bikes for getting around. Our room was exceptional--with one glass wall butted up against Diamond Head, and another giving an ocean view. Each had sliders to a little balcony. There are niceties like bottled water--as much as you want--coffee service, free wine in the early evening, slippers in the room, beach chairs and towels. All in all, a great, well-located place with friendly, nice staff.

This is our 4th stay here in as many years.....why? We love the location-it's quiet and away from the main Waikiki strip but only takes about 15 minutes to get there. The park across the road makes the area feel very tranquil and well maintained an there is a private stretch of beach, although this is quite small & gets busy very quickly at peak times. The standard of furnishings in the hotel make it feel high end and personal,and the staff have always made us feel very welcome and at home. There are a couple of small issues-there is only 1 lift which can be very slow when it is busy & you are on the top floor;also, there is as yet no restaurant & dining options in the immediate area are limited.That has never stopped us from enjoying our stays here and we plan to be back asap... or once the bank balance allows.

My wife and I spent 3 nights in the hotel last month. We were very happy with the hotel. The room was very nice. If you want to stay somewhere away from the Waikiki Beach area, this would be a good choice. There are 2 reasons I did not give the hotel 5 stars. First, there is only 1 elevator to the guest rooms. The elevator broke while we were there and we had to walk up 9 floors. This did, however, help prepare us for walking up Diamond Head the next day. The elevator was fixed in a few hours. Also there is a nice place in the hotel where you can purchase a continental breakfast, which is convenient. However, we had duplicate charges on our bill from breakfast. I was able to get this removed after some discussion with the staff at the front desk.

We stayed at the Lotus Hotel for seven nights and can honestly say our stay was very enjoyable. The room we were allocated was large and had a big comfortable bed. The room was kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff and the towels were the nicest we had on our four week holiday to the US beating bigger, more expensive hotel chains, by a mile. We had lovely views from our large balcony and saw the Green Parrots in the nearby trees. Our room was close to the elevator but we did not get disturbed once whilst staying here. The hotel is a bit outside of Wakiki and this suited us as it was so busy in the main part of town but it is a nice stroll into the centre or main beaches.All members of staff could not do enough for us and always with a smile. A bowl of apples was placed on a shelf at the side of the elevator on the ground floor each morning for guests to take. We had breakfast in the hotel on six of the seven days we stayed and found the prices were just the same as going into town and we did not have to wait or queue to be served. The hotel did not do cooked breakfasts whilst we were staying but the selection of food on offer was good enough for us. We loved the papaya filled with mixed fruit and had this every day along with a selection of other items on the menu.There is a small/nice beach for hotel residents/residents of the near condos, which is safe and if you are lucky you might get to see Rocky the local endangered Monk Seal having a sleep on the beach (see photograph), there are only 1,100 of these left in the world.As has previously been written, there are cycles, chairs etc. for hotel guests to use, a hire car for rental and free wine in reception early evening.We would definitely return to this hotel if visiting Honolulu in the future.

We spent two weeks in june/july 2014 at this hotel separated by a one week cruise around the islands with the Pride of America of Norwegian cruise lines. Hotel and cruise were great. Hotel is well situated within walking distance of Waikiki in a quiet spot with private beach and easy access to public transport. Great place to relax after a busy day in Honolulu with very friendly and helpful staff. Can only recommend it

Great views. Complimentary Wine service in the evenings. Complimentary bikes and beach chairs. Small and intimate with big hotel amenities. Turn down service. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. A short 10 minute walk to all the retail shops at Waikiki

Have just spent ten days at this lovely boutique hotel. The hotel is reasonably small, comfortable, quiet and not too far from the busy end of town. The beach area near the hotel was lovely and the 20 min walk into Waikiki was enjoyable. If you didn't want to walk there was always the hospitality bus at regular intervals. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and very clean. Coffee or tea is provided each morning with a small selection of breakfast choices. We often walked to a little breakfast spot on the each only 5-10 min walk from hotel. Cheap, cheerful and wonderful sea views. They also do lunch and dinner. A convenience store is close by. The local bus stop is convenient and will take you to some of the beaches around Diamond Head and a little further. This is our third trip Waikiki and the best hotel we have had there. Would certainly stay there again if we were to return,

The staff (reception and valet) all very helpful and friendly. The service we received was excellent. Location was great as it's away from the hustle bustle of Waikiki, and yet it was just a short very pleasant stroll away. We were able to enjoy relaxing on the beach which wasn't heaving like Waikiki always is. Then in the evening we would take a leisurely stroll to Waikiki for dinner and drinks. Lovely breakfast at Keoni's or Seaside Bar and Grill. We were in room 524, and the view from the balcony was great. We could see Diamond Head on the left and the ocean on the right hand side. (We could also see the car park directly below, but that didn't bother us.)Wifi was very good - it actually worked unlike 2 other hotels we stayed at during our stay in Hawaii.Beach towels and chairs were provided free of charge. You could also loan a bicycle (also free) which was great fun and a really good idea. A bottle of water was provided every day in the room and also small bottles in our car when we were going out.My Husband and I were there to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary, and we couldn't have asked for anything more. We had a truly wonderful, memorable time. The only thing that could do with improving is the lift. The door is very noisy when it opens and it takes ages to come - there is only one lift which doesn't help either! Also It's a shame that the 2nd floor isn't utilised more. Perhaps it could be somewhere to get snacks/drinks throughout the day not just breakfast time.

Spent two nights at the Lotus in October. The hotel is at the end of Waikiki Beach, across from a park, making it a quiet and relaxing area. It is a 10-15 minute walk to central Waikiki, no problem considering it takes that long to find parking there! We were offered an upgraded room which afforded us beautiful views of Diamond Head and the ocean. I found the rooms nicely decorated in the Asian style, very comfortable. The staff, including valets, were all very attentive and helpful. Breakfast is limited to continental style with some fruit and granola choices and free coffee. Eric was very good about service, so it still beat going down the beach to a crowded restaurant. There is an amenity fee which includes parking but it's not a bad deal when you have a car considering the cost of parking in the Waikiki area. They offer a free shuttle to and from central Waikiki, making stops at several other Aqua hotels. The major downer is the elevator. Other reviewers have commented on this lately. The elevator went down during our stay, forcing us to use the stairs to reach our 10th floor room. The staff was apologetic but, clearly, this is a major problem when there is only one elevator to serve the 12-story hotel. Overall, I enjoyed the stay. This is a good choice for location and price. Upper floor rooms are a must if you want a view, but be prepared to use the stairs!

Planning for a group meeting with rooms and meeting space. Every time I've called I've been transferred numerous times and told they don't have my reservation until I send them back my email confirmation. Haven't spoken to anyone yet that has been helpful! I'm not sure if they're under new management or what but they seriously need to get it together!

When we were picked up from the airport by the shuttle bus, the driver joked about it being in the middle of nowhere, I started to worry a bit, but it turns out that it was about 800m from the main a strip in Waikiki, and the hotel offers free rental bicycles, so it is no issue at all. The bikes actually made it way more fun. The room was lovely and the housekeeping continued all the way til 3:30pm which is so nice if you want a long sleep and still get your room made up.Check in was easy and free beach towels were awesome too.The wifi actually works well in the rooms too - probably a world first for any hotel!The boutique tax (payable on checkout for us) is a bit annoying - just include it in the price per night! I would definitely stay here again.

I was looking forward to my stay at the Lotus based on some of the reviews I read here on trip advisor. Below are the pros and cons: Pros: Very quiet and peaceful we didn't hear anything at night to disturb us the whole week Friendly staff - everyone was always happy to help and there was never a line to get beach chairs or bikes, or valet. On site amenities- the free wine everyday was awesome, as were the beach towel/chairs and bikes. I didn't realize that the valet parking was included in the boutique fee but it is so that was great for the day we had a car. Close proximity to a nice, uncrowded beach. Cons: -Lack of dining/nightlife options in the area (no restaurant on premises). -The elevator was extremely slow (only one elevator for entire hotel) and broke once while we were staying there. We just usually walked down the 5 flights of steps instead of wait. - The 2nd floor was pretty creepy and depressing since it's just an abandoned restaurant. Would I stay here again? Maybe - for us I wish we would have rented a car for the whole week so we could have been more mobile and the Lotus is a great home base if you are going to be exploring the island and just relaxing on the beach in your downtime. But if you are going to be going to Waikiki every day for entertainment, restaurants and nightlife I'd recommend staying on the strip.

Best hotel in Honolulu ! We LOVED our room, we booked the diamond head premium room, and it was beautiful & spacious and had a great view of Diamond Head ! We truly couldn't have asked for more in a hotel, they offer free wine everyday I believe from 4pm-6pm, they make sure you have ice in your ice bucket everyday in the room, and bottled water is included in the daily fee .Its the little things most hotels skip because they can't pay special attention to every guest when their resort or hotel are huge and packed ! At Lotus you will feel as if you are the only guest staying in the hotel ! It's out of the way of the hustle and bustle of waikiki but close enough To drive there (5min). You won't be sorry !!!

ok, state the ground rules: no beach, pool, or ocean views...the aqua lotus does offer nice diamond head views, views of waikiki beach from the walkway to your room.more importantly, it offers a nice small hotel with a great location (imho) - directly across from beautiful kapiolani park and about 100 feet from sans souci beach (a great swimming beach), close enough to walk to the hustle/bustle of waikiki but far enough away from it so it's not fisherman's wharf san francisco/times square ny....the staff is pretty much the same from my visit two years ago and that's a very good thing! travis & josh(nephew?) as valets, as well as the gm/manager who is always alert to take care of things. the hotel is very well managed!the hotel provides parking, wi-fi, bikes, beach towels, chairs, mats, and yoga clases - it used to be free but now is a $25 amenity fee. they now offer mountain bikes which makes the ride up and over diamond head much easier. also included with the rooms are illy cafe espresso makers - very nice! it makes up for the lack of a restaurant, though you can go down to the second floor space for free coffee and some packaged breakfast items.the wi-fi on the 12th floor was fast and great on arrival but spotty/slow the rest of the time - it worked for my iPad but my iPhone couldn't access it.i would definitely recommend this oasis of a hotel for those that want to be close to waikiki and the restaurants there and nearby on kapahulu, but not in the midst of that madness. i've returned to the aqua lotus and have been very satisfied.

We stayed for our honeymoon for 5 nights in the Ocean View Premium room on the 10th floor. The room was spacious and clean with good hardwood floors (a nice change from carpet given all the sand we brought in with us!)Our view was Diamond Head from one balcony and a partial view of the ocean from the other with some buildings blocking a full view. This was expected given other reviews we read. The staff was friendly and have several beach related items to sign out for the day including beach towels, bikes, chairs, etc. We were never left without a bike despite it being first come first serve. They also offer yoga, wine before the evening, coffee and tea between certain hours and daily newspapers but I cannot comment on these since we didn't take advantage if them. We were also told they rent out cars there for guests but we took advantage of another company which offered convertible smart cars. Yes, it is about a 10-15 walk to the "main" strip and beach but given all of our eating out and our desire to not be right smack dab in the middle of tourist-city we welcomed the walk and saw it more as an opportunity to take a stroll rather than an inconvenience. Plus, there is a convenience store literally seconds away if you are hard pressed for alcohol, sunblock, cheese or other random items. Would I stay here again? Yes, if I am with people who don't mind the short walk! The rooms were so large, clean and spacious that it was definitely worth the stay.

We just spent last night at the Aqua Lotus hotel near Diamond Head. The room furniture was shabby, however it was clean. I guess I expected more for a $225/night accommodation. We had a peaceful evening and everything was fine. The issue that was slightly annoying was the surprise 'Boutique Fee' of $25 + tax per night. We booked the room via Priceline, and everything was to be included in the quoted cost. When we checked in, we were required to pay this fee, or we could not stay. If the fee is a requirement, they should simply include it in the rate. They should also instruct their people to better explain or 'sell' the Boutique Fee so certain customers don't feel like they are being taken advantage of. In my opinion, it was an unnecessary hassle that put a damper on the stay. We've never had a fee of this type at any hotel, and in any of the countries we traveled to.

Stayed at the hotel towards the end of september (25th to 30th) 2014. Booked for 5 nights and left early because this hotel is not equipped for a pleasure trip - didn't want to ruin our vacay by spending time at this hotel. Pros: Waikiki beach is just a few steps from the hotel and the hotel provides free beach towels and chairs.Cons: 1. Service - A surly valet who expected us to unload our luggage without offering to help. We were booked for a Diamond head view room - the receptionist sent us to the room on the third floor which faces the multi-storeyed parking lot of neighboring building - no views of the ocean or the volcano whatsoever. It took a "conversation" and an extra $60 per night charge to get a decent room with a view (albeit with chipped furniture, tired wallpaper and a lumpy bed) - which was termed as a "premium" room.2. Decor - the lobby is passable, but the rest of the hotel is TIRED and needs updated furniture, flooring, wall paper, shower areas in the bathrooms, a fresh coat of paint and non lumpy beds. 3.The dark purple walls and brown chairs and upholstery in the breakfast area is Depressing - first thing in the morning. There is only one person serving the guests at breakfast, limited choices, and you have to stand around the counter waiting till she takes your order and serves you. 3. The hotel has no restaurants or food service except a meagre breakfast spread (for which you have to pay extra). The hotel is also not situated anywhere near walking distance of restaurants. The management of the hotel should take vacation and travel around a bit to understand what constitutes a good boutique hotel and good service for the rest of the world. Stay here if you get a very cheap deal or if you are on a business trip and don't use/need hotel facilities - otherwise, save your money, time and spirit!!!

Easy check-in. Room was modern, great views from balcony, clean, small shower though. Location is away from hustle and bustle, so don't stay here if you want to be in the mix of Waikiki. Since it was a bit away from the more touristy part of town, there are less restaurants and amenities within walking distance. So close to the beach.Breakfast offerings could have been improved. Only pre-made items and things that could be microwaved. Would have been nice to have hot offerings as well.Elevator is painfully slow and feels like a service elevator. In addition, the last day of my stay (of course when I'm leaving and with my luggage), the elevator konks out. Waiting for 10 minutes - nothing. I call down to the front desk and they say that, yes, it's broken, we are calling maintenance, etc. someone will come up to help me with my luggage. Waiting again, no one. So I carry my luggage down myself, in heels, 9 floors. When I get down there, they look puzzled at me. Apparently the elevator got fixed in the time I went down the stairs. Of course. Had I had the choice again - unsure of whether I would stay there. There are so many options available in Honolulu, and my experience was not to the level where I would say, "yes, definitely, coming back here again".

We were at the Lotus for two nights. The room had a fine view of Diamond Head plus a partial view of the ocean. The room was clean and very comfortable and the staff was great. The wine from 4to 6 was a welcome treat. At this time there is no restraunt . I will stay in this hotel on my next trip to Hi. I would recommend the Lotus.

We stayed six nights at this boutique hotel in their premium ocean view room which was a corner room with a view of Diamondhead from one side and partial view of the ocean on the other side both from our balcony. Just as good was the beautiful view of Waikiki beach situated at the base of the surrounding mountains from our front door. There are no rooms with unobstructed ocean views at the Lotus like one of the big hotels off Waikiki beach, but you won't have to pay $100 more per night for it. The room had sliders to cover the windows during the day to keep the room cool as it was unusually warm (92 F) when we were there.The room was clean, our king bed comfortable and everything worked including the toilet, shower, coffee maker (made great coffee), hair dryer and TV which is no small feat these days even in upscale hotels. Housekeeping was efficient without feeling like they were invading our privacy. The front desk was helpful and the valets made us feel at home. This hotel is best suited for couples as there's no pool, play areas or programs for kids and no amenities like gyms. There's a $25 per day fee that includes valet parking, use of bicycles and beach towels. There's a more private beach right behind the hotel. There's also wine from 4-6 pm daily in their lobby which is beautifully decorated. They offered Edna Valley chardonnay and pinot noir during our stay. The free WiFi worked although it was slow at times. It's about a 10 minute walk to Waikiki and they also had a free shuttle that went there every half hour for most of the day. Coffee and tea was served on the second floor, but fresh pre wrapped breakfast items were extra. There's no restaurant in the hotel currently, but then I'm not a breakfast person and we wanted to explore other restaurants for dinner anyway.

We stayed for two nights at the start of our Hawaii holiday in September 2014. We have two girls aged 6 and 8 and did not want to be right in the full-on heart of Waikiki with the high-rise, commercial mammoth hotels. The rooms are bright and have good views of the ocean and the water, we stayed in 921 which had good elevation. Rooms lower down would not have such good views. Two queen beds were ample for our family and the bathroom was big enough, though not with a full-size bath. It was quiet and had a leafy feel, being opposite the park and at the foot of Diamond Head. It's a 15-20 minute stroll into Waikiki, but if you have young kids in summer you would probably get the courtesy bus or a taxi. You can get towels, beach chairs, snorkels, boogie boards free of charge from the hotel, plus bikes to cruise into town. There are not many restaurants nearby and the breakfast at the hotel is small-scale, not a big buffet. There is not a proper restaurant at the hotel, truth be told. We liked it, it was just what we needed, but I could see how folks wanting the big hotel experience would not like it. The beach is a very short walk away past two other hotels right on the water. This hotel is not right on the water.

Here in Hawaii on business.This hotel accomudated me for 2 nights. The staff was great and excellent. The suite had a breathtaking view. I utilized the shuttle to the near by resturant and shopping strip. This hotel is great and very clean. I will be staying here again on my next visit.

Although the much needed restaurant failed,the hotel remains a beautiful boutique property in the Diamond Head district just adjacent to Waikiki.Clean lines and muted colors highlight the rooms in this wonderful hostel.Haven't been here in awhile and I was happy to find everything in top notch shape.This is the best place to stay here in Honolulu.

Friendly helpful staff who make you feel at home and like they really like helping you.The location is perfect ,the rooms are large and well thought out.The rooms were spotless quiet.Just a few steps from the beach.We shall return here for sure.The hotel is a ways from the main strip but there is a free shuttle to get you close to city centre.

If you want great aloha service in a ideal location (at the beautiful end of Waikiki) with clean and well appointed rooms the Lotus is perfect! My husband, daughter, son in law and our 6 month old grandson stayed here when we were visiting our family in Honolulu. The staff did an outstanding job accommodating all of us. This is a boutique hotel so don't expect room service or a restaurant but location of the hotel to restaurants makes up for it. We will definitely choose to stay at the Lotus whenever we come to visit our family.

I very much enjoyed our time at Lotus Honolulu. First, the location was perfect. It's on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, a lovely 10 minute stroll through Kapiolani Park to the center of all the action. Second, our 12th floor room had both a Juliet balcony and a full terrace with a panoramic view of Diamond Head and the park. The evening breeze was delightful. The room itself was modern & beautifully furnished, bath was also top notch. We were met with a full bucket of ice and the radio tuned to 105.1- KINE playing some soothing Hawaiian tunes. Finally, the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. It's just so relaxing there. Makalapua!

Just back from 9 days at the Lotus. The hotel was delightful. We went to visit with our newborn grandchild and daughter and son-in-law. We took everyone's advice and rented a corner premium room. Ours was on the 11th floor. The doors to the balconyare recessed and the other doors to the smaller balcony opened such that we turned off the AC, opened the place up and enjoyed the trade winds. The room was gently used but the decor is quite stylish. every morning I started the day with in room coffee and watching the surfers out on the ocean. We ordered take out many nights with Aloha 2 go so that we maximized our time with family. The staff are everything we expected. Excellent service and attitudes from everyone. We enjoyed being away from crowds and tourists at Waikiki. Our views were Diamond Head, the large park across the street and the Pacific. We enjoyed the beach which was a short walk. Russell's convenience store is right next door and had food, booze, ice, snorkel gear for sale, coolers for your day trips. We slept with the doors wide open and there was white noise of the city below, but for a light sleeper like myself, nothing that kept me from having a good night's rest. The other hotel guests were very well behaved. I stayed by myself a few more days and the security at the hotel is excellent. They now have gone smoke free too. The valet parking guys are wonderful and have great advice and tips. We used the bikes many days and toured the neighborhood and park. We will be back this winter.

This was a gorgeous hotel. Very comfortable, very clean, modern look and feel. I really liked the wood floors instead of the dreaded hotel carpet. It was quiet, I didn't hear a sound from anywhere and any time. The staff, including front desk, valet & housekeeping, were all very nice, polite, helpful. The secluded beach behind the hotel was a few steps away, had great waves and lovely white sand. Great view of Diamond Head crater, and Waikiki Beach/Honolulu. I enjoyed that it wasn't in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Very quiet, an oasis. Yes it is far from all the Waikiki shopping (5 minutes by car, maybe 20 minutes of walking). But it's location states Diamond Head, not Waikiki!!

We were traveling with two 2-yr old twin boys and the location was perfect. Short walk to the beach, where the hotel provides you with all the towels and beach chairs you need. Our family wants to thank the very attentive hotel staff for taking care of us during our vacation. Sarah was very polite and accommodating when taking our reservations to get us three rooms on all the same floor. Eric greeted us with a smile every morning at breakfast service, and made sure we were taken care of. The entire staff showed their aloha spirit.

What has happened to the Aqua Hotels? Have they become too big for their boots?I am a travel writer and blogger. Recently I wrote to the general manager at Aqua Lotus, and also to the CEO about an upcoming corporate trip and a possible blurb on the Aquas. We had stayed at the Aqua chains in the past and had been satisfied, We did receive an acknowledgment or reply, neither did the editor. We phoned twice and left personal messages. Also no response.We will be moving on to other accommodation. It is a pity because Aqua is unique to Hawaii and the upcoming article. However, the hotel obviously does not care about reputation and positive reviews.

Hotel staff were great and very obliging. unfortunately every time we wanted to get something to eat we had to walk about from one end of the strip to the other (3klm) or had to catch a taxi .The rooms were a good size but unfortunately only had double size beds and my husband was too long for it.Also very disappointed in the selection of food for breakfast.it consisted of muffins,bagels,paw paw with fruit salad inside,boiled eggs and coffee.Being first timers to honolulu I would of rather stayed in amongst the busy part of town!

Lotus is kinda a boutique oasis at the end of the Waikiki strip.Easy walking distance to the noise and mayhem in Waikiki proper.I had split my visit between one of the bed factory resorts and the Lotus.1) Easy walking distance to the noise and mayhem in Waikiki proper2) Beautiful room, comfortable beds and good linen.3) Beach chairs, towels and water available for the beach at font desk4) Comfortable beach close.... I liked the one in front of the Otani best.1) Premium ocean view was disappointing looking thru the condo building and over a parking lot.2) Weird-video game and DVD player in the room because they had no video on demand (couldn't tell you if they had cable as I never turned the tv on)3) Continental breakfast items available at price. Tired looking! Make it free or skip it.Small size is part of the Lotus.

Wonderful staff, large clean rooms, fantastic views. Away from the noise of Waikiki yet close enough enjoy. Right next to Diamond Head, the Zoo, the Aquarium and Kaimana Beach. Hotel has every amenity you could want from beach chairs, towels, and boogie boards to an evening turn down service and wine tasting. Absolutely Wonderful

Our family of four recently stayed in two ocean view (connecting) rooms on the 12th (top) floor of the Lotus. I was trying to decide between the Lotus and the New Otani right next door, but the recommendation of a local friend made me choose the Lotus (they also had a great switch and save rate and bigger rooms). We tried the New Otani for breakfast (great spot on the beach but found the food disappointing) and visited their beach, which is very nice and bigger than the beach right behind the Lotus, but such a short walk that we could easily lug our Lotus-provided beach chairs to the New Otani beach. We also had a guest membership at the Outrigger Canoe Club next to the Lotus so we spent some time there also. The staff at the Lotus were always smiling and welcoming, providing us with boogie boards for the entire day, beach chairs, towels and bottled water. The breakfast options offered every morning were more than adequate to get us started for a day away from the hotel. Our rooms were always cleaned when we returned. I really have no complaints and will definitely return to the Lotus when we visit family on Oahu again.

I really liked the location of this hotel. It is kind of on the end of the main strip which was good. Not far to walk, but you can get some peace if you want to. We were on the 7th floor and our room was really nice. The staff were extremely helpful when we checked in with advise on shopping and where to eat and later in our stay with in room dining. They have espresso machines in the room which we loved. Especially as we had to check out early to get our flight!

We spent two nights at Lotus - Diamond Head, in an ocean view premium room which was beyond our expectations : it was modern and spacious, clean and well equipped (and included amenities such as an expresso coffee machine which turned to be very useful when we had to wake up at 5:30 a.m. on the day we departed).Even if the room was quite expensive ($ 706 for two nights), it was good value for money (beach in front of the hotel, 10 minutes walk to Waikiki, 25 minutes drive to the airport).As frequent travelers, we strongly recommend this hotel.

Just left hotel today after a 5 night stay. Lovely people and great service but the room we had on the 9th floor was looking a little tired. It didn't help that I don't think it had been cleaned properly because I found a toenail on the entrance floor as soon as we arrived and there was dust gathering in the corner. I put this to one side/bad luck but after staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Beach Resort last year, I suppose another hotel is going to be hard to measure up to in terms of the bedding and sleep quality (the rooms weren't sound proof from delivery trucks arriving downstairs each morning and the room didn't have blackout blinds. I had to ask for an extra blanket as there weren't any in the cupboard and I froze the first 2 nights as my husband likes the aircon on).

Our daughters just checked-in to have fun at the Lotus Hotel in Diamond Head, great valet service, check-in personnel were exceptionally friendly, great room with view(s) and our daughters are now enjoying the boutique amenities! Thank you Trip Advisor... Thank you Lotus Personnel!!!!! - Happy Parents

The Lotus was the perfect place for our vacation! We were steps away from the beach and our room was absolutely perfect. We had views of the ocean and Diamond Head. The service was excellent and everyone was extremely friendly and helpful with excursions. We made use of the bikes, yoga lessons and snorkeling gear free of charge. The valet parking was excellent and was included in their nominal Boutique fee...which was much less than many of the Resort fees which typically do not include parking. The employees would have cold water for our car trips and if we happened to make it back in time for the 4-6 Happy Hour...there was complimentary wine. It was a peaceful location...a few minutes walk from the heart of Waikiki. We were so happy we were not staying in the midst of the Waikiki madness...I am sure that would have meant not being well rested for all of our activities. With their expert planning we visited all we had hoped to and had literally the best vacation of our lives. Some nights we walked to the center of Waikiki to shop or have a drink but we were always SO thankful to return to our gem...the Lotus. If we are lucky enough to return, we will without a doubt stay at the Lotus. It is a 5 star hotel without the extreme pricetag! Other hotels should take a few pointers from them. Everyone of the staff members were people oriented. Everyone seemed to truly love their job!!!! THANK YOU LOTUS!!!

I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks while working on the island. The staff at this hotel are really nice and try to accommodate you whenever possible. The hotel provides complimentary water daily which is extremely nice with the heat and price of water. The rooms are on the nicer side for the price of the hotel. The hotel shows on the web site continental breakfast. You get free coffee but have to pay for anything else and it’s not cheap. Almost $4 for a beagle with cream cheese. Currently the hotel restaurant is closed for renovations. I’m not sure what they are planning to do and it didn’t seem like they were renovating anything as no work was being done. However on Friday and Saturday nights they have closed special events going until 2am. Originally I was placed on the 3rd floor right above the restaurant and it was extremely loud, basically impossible to sleep. So I had them move me to a room on the 4th floor. It was still really loud but I could at least sleep. The special events were a major nuisance since I was there for work and it sounded like a dance club. This hotel is a little far from all of the restaurants in the area with a mile walk to the closest place to eat. So plan on taking a taxi everywhere in the area as parking is difficult in the Waikiki area. If you are only planning on staying for a couple days for vacation than this hotel is really nice, but if you are planning on staying for longer or for work I would look at somewhere else.

LH is a great Hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, just minutes away. Its close to the park, beach, Aquarium and the Shell. The room was just great, we had a view of Diamond Head which was so beautiful in the morning as well as the evening. The staff was just amazing, from the time you drive up they greet you with a smile and ask if they are able to assist in any way. Checking in was just great as well, they had my room ready, it take but all of 5 minutes to check in. The lobby was very inviting! They had beach chairs, boogie boards, beach towels, snorkeling gear and WATER available. Also in the afternoon 4-6 you were able to enjoy the lobby with a glass of white or red wine or just take it up to the room. My 9 year old son enjoyed the video games too. We will be going back to the LH just for a stay vacation!

Thank you to all the staff at the hotel, front desk, valet, house keeping. Everyone is so friendly, caring and helpful. When we first saw the location, we were a bit concerned that the beach wasn't directly accessible but honestly it was so close and convenient to get to it that we were so happy we didn't choose a hotel on Waikiki. We had a relaxing, quiet, peaceful stay and walked to and from the crowded parts. We stayed in 1025, excellent views of Diamond Head and some of the ocean. The room was very comfortable and clean.We will definitely return!

LH is just outside of Waikiki. If you prefer a more peaceful accommodation this is a good pick. The beach, park, Aquarium, Waikiki Shell, the zoo, Waikiki hotels and local buses are all w/in a 2-15 min walk. The room was beautiful & balcony w/table and chairs had an awesome view of Diamond Head, the park, and parts of the ocean. The ENTIRE staff were all very nice and friendly. Definitely a repeat stay.

I've stayed at the Lotus since it was a W years ago. The location is part of it, and now with a solid management and seemingly happy staff, the Lotus is the only place I will stay while in Honolulu. Yes, Waikiki is a 15 minute walk but (a) it's good for you, and (b) the area is quiet at night. Perfect place to stay if you run. Sad to hear that the restaurant is no longer open. The only thing this place is missing is a decent bar.

My husband and I stayed at the Lotus for two nights in early July 2014. It was our second hotel in Honolulu, so we were not expecting great service. Surprisingly, we were overwhelmed by the caliber of service at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the hotel amenities were excellent. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.

We were really pleased to have discovered and chosen Lotus at Diamond Head, thanks to tripadvisor by the way, and so we want to share our satisfaction.The hotel is quite and far from the crowded and noisy center of Waikiki where the big hotels are. The room is very large and very very nice with a lot of amenities.We use to be runners and just outside the lobby you can chose to take the path toward Diamond Head -on the right- or to the beaches -on your left- and start running with a lot of fun.My wife tried also the yoga lessons and was amazed.People are very helpful and professional and gave us a loto of support for everything.Very close there is a wonderful café (barefood beach) with very good food and very cheap prices. When we will come back, we will stay again in Lotus.

I was so surprized by the Lotus. I stayed one night and it was great. I loved the location. It was quite and the staff were exceptional. I had a Diamond Head view room and it was amazing. I love the hard wood floors and the entire decor was lovely. Wes at the Front Desk was great and went above and beyond. Robert at the valet was also outstanding.

This was a great place to stay off the Waikiki strip. Staff was wonderful and ocean view premium room was great. The complementary wine in the afternoon is a great touch and the little beach is great for a "dip".

Our stay at the Lotus Honolulu was wonderful! This quiet, sophisticated boutique hotel is within reasonable walking distance to shopping and restaurants yet is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The staff were cheerful, extremely helpful, and some spoke to us by name. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, and well designed. Ily coffee/coffee makers and small refrigerators were in each room and a small market store is next door. The beach is steps away, with towels, snorkeling gear, and beach chairs available upon request. We had great fun touring Honolulu on the bikes provided and did rent the Volvo SUV for a couple of days as well. The yoga classes, offered at no charge, were a beautiful way to start the day. Complimentary wine was served each afternoon from 4:00 - 6:00 pm. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Booked my aunty at this hotel- was great ! Rooms were very nice, clean, big with balconies. Wonderful staff and great location. The hotel even serves free wine each day between 4-6:00 pm! The front desk attendants were extremely helpful and very friendly. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quieter experience than the typical Waikiki area.

Had a lovely anniversary staycation at this nice quiet boutique hotel in Waikiki :-) The room was large, clean and well furnished. The staff were very friendly and the views of Kapiolani Park and Diamond head beautiful.

The perfect location out of the insanity of Waikiki, but just a short walk to shopping and restaurants. Wonderful staff! They had plenty of towels, chairs, snorkeling gear and bikes all just for the asking. They offer a water bottle every time you come in or out of the hotel. Great coffee in the room.

Rooms were very nice, clean, big with balconies. Possibly the best bed I have ever slept on. We had an Ocean View room on the 11th floor which had a little obstruction to the ocean (the building in front) but still more than enough, and also great views of the Diamond Head volcano. Hotel staff are very friendly, helpful and accommodating. You are a little out of Waikiki, and it's great to be away from the crowds. The hotel is right by one of the best beaches in the area (Kaimana) which has some decent snorkelling too, and the park next door which is perfect for a morning run.Overall very happy and would recommend the hotel to friends. We ended up extending our stay there, rather than staying with friends because it was just so comfortable and convenient.By the way, when speaking to locals and cabbies, they might know the hotel as the old W Hotel.

We had the best time at this boutique hotel. The hotel is located at the quieter end of Waikiki near Diamond Head. It is about a 10 minute walking distance from the main strip. We stayed at the 11th floor, room 1124 which had a beautiful view of Diamond Head and the beach. The room is very clean, modern, and comfortable. This is a boutique hotel with unique amenities like lounge chair rentals, bike rentals, and even car rental which we took advantage. The hotel even serves free wine each day between 4-6:00 pm – a great way to start the evening fun! The front desk attendants were extremely helpful and very friendly. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quieter experience than the typical Waikiki area.
