This boutique hotel is perfect for certain types of visits to Waikiki, or, more precisely, Honolulu. If you're looking for the Waikiki experience, this probably isn't the right choice. The walk to the Waikiki strip is pleasant and safe, but it's at least ten minutes to the pier (edge of the strip). The walk got a little old after a few times.On the other hand, free parking is included in your resort fee, so if you're planning on exploring the island (a great idea), then this is a greet choice. The also have free bicycles for borrowing. We took ours on the 20 minute ride to the entrance of the Diamond Head hike. That was a highlight of the trip. We also took advantage of the Volvo car rental service that was available on site. It's a little pricey-- $60+ for the day-- but they're great cars and it's very convenient. The drive around the island, north shore, etc., is a must do.The rooms were clean and modern. Ours was on the 11th floor, and we had a great view of diamond head and the ocean. If we were lower (I'm guessing floor four or below?) I might have been disappointed. Other pluses-- free beach chairs and towels for borrowing. The staff is also really helpful and attentive.All in all, this is a really nice choice if you don't mind the hike to and from Waikiki.

If you're looking for small and quiet, this the place. The Lotus is just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki to make you feel like you're still connected yet get the quiet and beauty of Diamond Head. Our room was very nice with beautiful view of Diamond Head. We actually also had a small view of the Pacific and Kapiolani park which was a bonus. Our room and bathroom was kept clean daily. The staff was wonderful! Every single person we came in contact with who worked there was very very friendly, pleasant, and helpful. The beautiful beach was a very short walk thru the parking lot. Would definitely go back!

I expected an ocean view, not a view of the garages. There is no pool. The beach is a pathetic sliver of sand. You have to carry your own chair down to the beach. Come on. Really? How can that qualify as a premier boutique hotel? Not worth it!

We stayed at the at this hotel on June 21& 22. I almost cancelled our reservation after reading some of the other reviews. After rereading the negative reviews I realized that their issues were not really a problem for us. We had a rental car and we understood that it was ocean views and not ocean front. We were on the 6th floor with 2 ocean view rooms. The views were amazing! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, especially the evening staff. Rick, ( I think) the night valet was the best. We were going to drive for dinner after flying for 11 hours and he suggested a restaurant right next door. It was very expensive but it was also amazing! The only disappointment we had here, and it is small, is the day we were checking out the valet went and got our car and parked it in front of the hotel, he never offered to help us with luggage etc., glad this was not our experience the entire stay! He had friends that had apparently stopped by and he was too busy visiting. One more thing is that we were soo glad that we were not staying on Waikiki beach. What a zoo! It could be South Beach or downtown in any other big city, shopping and bumper to bumper traffic galore! BTW they gave us the Trip Advisor price which was significantly cheaper than other comparable hotels!

Upon arriving we instantly fell in love with this place. The smell is heavenly as you walk in. The staff is kind and super helpful. The rooms were simple but with excellent attention to detail and nice quality furniture and linens. It's towards the end of Waikiki so it's calmer. The beach just a few steps away is nice and not over crowded. We had a Diamond Head view room but actually we could see the ocean as well. Refreshing lemon water in the lobby during the day and wine in the evenings. Bikes, beach toys, beach towels, and movies all available to you to borrow. We stayed for our first ten days here under TLA and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. I highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed here because of its proximity to Diamond Head and descriptions on the internet. We were slightly disappointed in the hotel itself (location, beach, rooms, no pool), but the staff was very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to be accommodating. It is NOT close enough to walk to Diamond Head in spite of the way it sounds and is jammed in among other hotels, but is not right on the beach. There is also no restaurant onsite.

Stayed here 4 nights in late April and 2 nights in early June 2014. Would highly recommend. Very comfortable rooms with great views and very helpful staff. Is at the far end of Waikiki and is a very quiet spot near the park and Sans Souci beach. A very pleasant 15 min walk down to the centre of Waikiki.Complementary wines a real bonus. Hotel run in a very low key and friendly manner.

I have stayed three times in this retreat-like boutique hotel and have never been disappointed. I also love the small private beach that is adjacent to the hotel. The views are spectacular as well. The employees were very helpful and friendly!

We stayed here 6 nights in June. We had a very comfortable room, quiet, with spectacular views of Diamond Head and good views of the ocean. We got the Diamond Head view premium, definitely worth it. The hotel is right next to both the Sans Souci and Kapiolani parks. Beyond the parks, Waikiki is a reasonable walk or short drive away. We loved it.

We reserved an Diamond-Head view room, but were upgraded to an ocean view room on arrival. Room was great and we enjoyed our balcony, although one did need to look between buildings to actually see the sea. Very clean, and well furnished room. Hotel staff are terrific, being friendly and helpful. No big lobby or beach front here, but nice accommodation away from the congestion of more central Waikiki. Also, the restaurant was not functioning while we were there. However, we had an excellent breakfast at the hotel next door and dinner nearby. It was about a 20 minute walk to central Waikiki for other options.

we found the hotel far enough away from the center of the beach but close enough to take a leisurely stroll or bike ride to be in the middle of the action. Great access to secluded beach area, excellent breakfast selection, nice touch with wine in the afternoon, and bikes for use were in great condition and made the ride to Diamond Head a pleasure.

What a gem! It was a lovely hotel in a great location. It is away from all the traffic make it perfect for a quiet and very peaceful stay. Yet, it's only a 10min beautiful walk to the middle of Waikki. I would definitely stay at Lotus Honolulu again.

very nice reasonable size white and wood room with 2 balcony to enjoy dual aspect views. Not many amenities in the hotel itself but its pleasant. Located in a quieter area close to beaches, restaurants and all other conveniences this was overall a good experience in a relaxing environment, which isn't always the case in Waikiki.

This is a great place to stay. I'm pretty picky about cleanliness, and this place exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and large. The bathroom also was clean and large. I loved the lanai and the view of Diamond Head. I left the doors open all night and was awakened each morning (around 5:15) to the manu mele (birds song). It was lovely!Just be aware of a few things that have been mentioned by many others ... there isn't a pool or a gym (but who really needs either of those things in Hawaii); the hotel is not right on the beach, but it's very, very close and has access (literally walk through the parking lot) to a great little, private beach that you share with the Outrigger Canoe Club and the Colony Surf Hotel. The hotel will give you beach chairs and towels to use too. I didn't use the free bikes because I didn't have time (was visiting for work), but I would have loved to use them. The location, for me, is perfect. It is close enough to Waikiki to walk there and do whatever you want to do, but it's also far enough away that you can avoid Waikiki. I love being down at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, but just be aware that the walk along the beach through Kapiolani park to Waikiki is about 10 minutes. Be aware (or check with the hotel) that the hotel restaurant is "closed for remodeling." That was kind of a bummer. They did serve a continental style breakfast, which met my needs, but I was hoping for the restaurant.I would recommend Tiki's as a relatively inexpensive place to eat and/or have a drink. It's at the DH end of Waikiki so not a very long walk, and the food and live music are great. Excellent quality and locally sourced as much as possible.

We arranged for VIP guest from China to stay at the Penthouse. The view of Diamond Head was outstanding. It was the most unique view of Waikki I had ever had. The hotel is located outside of Waikiki which adds to th beauty of this hotel. It is quiet and does not have the vehicle and foot traffic you need yo deal with in most hotels in Waikiki. The service is excellent and the GM a gem of a person. Although the restaurant wsa closed at the time of the stay, it is located next to two fine outstanding restaurants. The beach is within a short walking distance and beautiful Kapaiolani park is across the street. What more can you ask for.

This was a good experience, the room was nice and we got a pretty good view of the Diamond Head. My favorite part was that the hotel offered bikes free of charge, which we used a couple of times. The only reason for 4 stars- the place lacked amenities- no gym, no pool, etc. and the location was a bit more remote than we expected for the price (wouldn't want to walk around there after sunset).. That said, the front desk people were very accommodating when we had an issue and offered a small discount.

Stayed here for 5 nights for my first ever visit to Waikiki.- Room was spacious, modern and beautifully decorated. We had a view Diamond Head view, which still had a view of the ocean to one side.- Front desk service at the hotel was fantastic. We arrived very early (7am) and they were able to check us in with no problems.- Took advantage of the free wine and free yoga which were both great, and they also provided free bottled water which was really handy.- Beach opposite the hotel is lovely (quieter than the main Waikiki Beach) and the hotel provided towels, chairs etc.- Takes about 15 mins to walk to the main Waikiki strip. - The only thing that stops me giving this hotel 5 stars is the breakfast. As the hotel is away from the main strip there are limited breakfast options close to the hotel (there is a hotel you can have an a la carte breakfast at and Barefoot Beach Cafe which c. a 10 minute walk away). The hotel offers a very, very basic breakfast service (cereal, croissant). As we got up early on a few days (Pearl Harbour visit, Diamond Head hike) we needed to have a quick breakfast and it was very average. If they get this sorted, then I would rate this hotel as excellent.

We had an excellent stay at the lotus garden hotel. Very helpful, friendly staff. Nice, spacious room. Very close to the beach, they provide beach chair and clean towels, set in beautiful surroundings away from the noise of Waikiki . Had a large park across the street, where we enjoyed walking in the early mornings. Hotel also had bicycles for use. Definitely would recommend it. Only down side -was no restaurant , though they did serve breakfast for a price and provided complementary wine late afternoon. Reasonable price for our room. Would definitely stay there again.

The Lotus is a boutique hotel (app. 12 stories) away from the hustle bustle of Waikiki. Rooms are spacious and we were provided with beach towels and chairs (free) to visit the beach only 50 metres away. It's within easy walking distance of Waikiki. Free happy hour wine was a nice extra.

We recently had a week long stay at the Lotus and found it to suit our needs. It was very clean and spacious, and the service was very friendly. We availed ourselves of the free yoga and use of the bikes, and free coffee in the mornings. Reasonably and moderately priced room. Visitors should have cash ready at all times for tipping. The views from our hotel room were of the beach and Diamond Head, and we got really beautiful light in the room. Downsides: no restaurant in the hotel, No real food options within walking distance. We were advised to go next door for Japanese--and the meal was about 3x what we would have paid in Virginia for similar quality food. Beach access--we could not walk out of the property directly onto the beach without having to step over some uncomfortable rocks. There are few amenities (no fitness room or pool). However, I ran in Kapiolani Park and it was lovely. We stayed at this location because of the Hibiscus Half Marathon, which was just down the street. If we do the race again, we would possibly stay at this location again.

For a Hawaiian Zen experience, the Lotus Honolulu is a jewel in the Diamond Head crown. Here’s the perfect day: Enjoy a Waikiki sunrise with a hot cup of coffee from the second floor coffee service or from the Verismo coffee system in your room, then schedule a custom workout with a private fitness concierge or enjoy an exclusive-to-hotel-guests outdoor yoga class at 7:30 a.m. in nearby Kapiolani Park, grab one of the hotel's complimentary beach cruisers or mountain bikes and enjoy a breakfast of taro pancakes at the nearby Bogart’s Café, then fold up a beach towel and chair and spend the day at the hotel’s urban beach. When you’re ready to unwind, the peaceful lobby is the site from 3-5 p.m. for wine, rugby games are going on across the street, or check out the Honolulu Museum of Art – admission for two is included in your stay. At night, relax in your modern digs and enjoy the city lights. It’s a meditation just staring out into the night sky

About 3/4 of a mile north of the hustle and bustle of the main Waikiki hotel and shopping area, the Lotus is in a pleasant setting; near the beach, across the street from a huge park and close to Diamond Head. The walk to the name-brand hotel area is easy and enjoyable, passing the Honolulu Aquarium. It has a boutique hotel feel, derived from attentive, friendly service and quiet ambiance. There is a direct path to a small beach, only some 100 yards away. Beach chairs are provided, though of the no leg variety. A continental breakfast is offered for sale, which we found convenient. We asked for and got a high, corner room and were not diaappointed, with beautiful views of both the ocean and Diamond Head. We would definitely recommend the Lotus as an excellent value and a quiet alternative to Waikiki's big chain hotels.

the staff were great. amenities worth the extra feemy room was great. loved it all only thing keeping them from a perfect score- no restaurantbeautiful settinggreat location , close to bars and restaurantssuggest dinner at Michels but be prepared for $100 a head with wine, and breakfast at Hau Tree lanai, but again be prepared for expense

my stay in Diamond Head wouldn't have been as great if it weren't for the lotus and its primo location. Away from the bustle on a beautiful beach and surrounded by parks, and within minutes to walk to more beaches. Feeling as comfortable as I did was mainly due to the warm, friendly, and very helpful staff. It was my first solo trip and they made it my home away from home! Thanks you guys-MahaloRoger

Fantastic staff and service, very friendly and welcoming. Is a 10 minute walk to the centre of town - and I ended up really appreciating being away from the busyness of downtown Waikiki. Beautiful beach 100 metres away, lovely room and helpful staff.

I loved it here. We checked in early and walked into a beautiful ocean facing room. The room felt so light and fresh and I could have spent days just lounging on the chaise looking out at both diamond head and the sea. The upgrade was def worth it!!The staff here went over and above in helping us but especially when my husband has his phone stolen on the main strip. They were helpful in giving us advice and seemed genuinely concerned.You have access to beach towels and cruiser bikes which you should make the most of. The beach rig in front if the hotel is perfect and not too busy.If you're a walker or runner it's the perfect position to run diamond head in the morning or trek at night to watch the sun go down.

Our corner room had 2 balconies overlooking Diamond Head & the ocean. This hotel is not oceanfront but has lovely ocean views & the beach is a short walk. The hotel even provides beach chairs, bikes, waters, etc. Our room was very clean & spacious & the staff is excellent!!! The valet, concierge, etc. are absolutely knowledgeable & accommodating. Take advantage of the free wine happy hour in the lobby, great time to visit with fellow guests. It's also within walking distance of the Aquarium & the Zoo. We did not visit these but might be good for families visiting with kids. I highly recommend the Chief's Luau, it was a lot of fun.

We were in a two bedded room on the 8th floor which was great. It was nicely furnished and spacious. We had both sea and mountain views. The staff were very attentive especially Travis. The location of the hotel might put some people off if they want to be in down town Waikiki. For us it was great, quiet and just a 10 minute walk to the hustle and bustle. I would most definitely recommend this hotel and should I find myself in Waikiki again it would be my first choice. Top marks!

The rooms are modern, spacious, and quiet with lovely views. The service from every staff member was perfect! The location is excellent if you want a relaxing vacation, because it is near Diamond Head, and yet only a 10 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki. The restaurant was excellent. I have been staying here for past 10 years. The management is be commended!

I travel to Honolulu 2X a month, and this was the best hotel I've stayed at so far. You will be welcomed, and treated fantastic from the time you drive up. The rooms are modern, clean, comfortable, and the shower was one of the best I've had. I am making this my home away from home.

Just returned from my first visit to Hawaii and six nights at the Lotus. Keep it simple.. great room, we were on the 10th floor. Great staff everyone was very friendly and helpful. Location... I was a little concerned that it was a long walk, ? 1/3 of a mile to get to all the restaurants and shops in Waikiki but as the week went on I grew to love the walk into town each day thru the park for breakfast and dinner. It was a nice way to end the day, with the breeze and the beach nearby at the end of each day. If you do not enjoy walks, then this hotel is probably not for you. We never ate at the restaurant. Breakfast was a selection of cold items - bagels, muffins, fruit, etc. I'm not even sure it was open for dinner, there are way too many great choices in town to even check it out. There was some sort of function in the restaurant with a band one night and I'm guessing it could have been annoying on a lower floor but I didn't even notice once we got our room on 10.

This hotel is awesome! The view from our room of Diamond Head, the park, and the water was incomparable. The hotel is located in a quiet portion of Honolulu but within easy walking distance of all of Waikiki. The rooms were large and the bathroom was spacious with high quality toiletries. There was a small refrigerator and an espresso machine. The lanai was spacious with two chairs and a small table---just right for coffee and a small breakfast.The staff, however, truly make this place outstanding. I had just stayed at a Ritz-Carlton and the service there, while great, was not as wonderful as at the Lotus Honolulu.The beach is small but nice. Used SpeediShuttle to get to and from the airport and walked or took TheBus while in Honolulu.

I am currently into my second week at this hotel. I had to extend my stay in Hawaii and decided against a condo because this hotel is so nice. It's pet friendly, nice to my dog, nice to my elderly handicapped mother, and it's quiet here away from Waikiki. I looked at three rooms when we first got here. The balcony diamond head corner suite third floor, regular room fourth floor, and Oceanview ninth floor. The lower rooms had a lot of reflected heat from the top of the driveway canopy and palm trees obstructing the views. The Oceanview was $40 more, but we are spending a lot of time in our room and enjoying the180° Diamond Head to ocean view and I don't even notice the buildings anymore. I worried about cross-ventilation but the breeze on the higher floors is nice and constant. I've posted a photo of the emergency exit route from inside the room which shows the Open air hallway from the lift to the room.

What a great gem in Waikiki. I like staying at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki because of easy access to everything and away from the noise and hubbub of Waikiki central. This hotel was wonderful....clean, comfortable, service is excellent and staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Views of Diamond Head and the ocean were great....very relaxing stay.

Stayed for three days in Honolulu last week, Never been before and used Trip Advisor for advice. Chose the Lotus and wasn't disappointed. The service was excellent. Just far enough away form the Surfers like Waikiki, about a 12 minute walk. Taxi ride from airport was $45. The rooms were spacious, the bed was amazingly comfortable and the happy 2hrs was also very nice! With Michele's restaurant and the Hau Tree restaurant either side of the Lotus there are incredible dining and visual experiences within two minutes walk. Or you can walk down to the main strip along the beach or through the park. Maybe not the best place for kids, but for us it was just what we wanted, it was perfect!. The ocean view rooms give a great perspective of the landscape from Honolulu, the ocean (partial) to the hills. Would be the place to stay again.

I spent 11 nights in Hawaii, the first 6 at the Moana Surfrider which was noisy and cramped. I had booked the Lotus because I knew it was was close to Waikiki but away from the noise and chaos. I wished I had stayed here the whole time. I had a ninth floor Ocean View Premium room and it was just fantastic. Two balconies, modern decor, huge flat screen TV and spacious room. It is the little things I liked about this hotel - free bikes, beach chairs and towels, free wine every evening, newspapers, coffee and fruit. Every afternoon a room attendant would call in to replenish the ice bucket, and provide any other items you needed. What a pleasure to be able to sleep,with both balcony doors wide open and cool breezes instead of air conditioning. The staff are great and promptly respond to requests. I didn't use the restaurant so can't comment on it. A limited breakfast is available. The private beach is only a one minute walk with the other public beach beside it. In my view San Souci beach is the best in Waikiki with no coral and soft sand. It's only a one minute walk away. The walk into Waikiki takes about 10-15 mins. The bus to Hanauma Bay stops outside the hotel. I loved is place and will return.I would definitely pay the extra for a high floor room. The car park for the Outrigger Club is next door and the lower floors would have a great view of it but that's not why you came to Hawaii.

Large, welcoming, comfortable, stylish rooms. While you don't get an unimpeded view of the beach, it's right there, and the hotel provides towels and beach chairs. The staff are incredibly friendly, helpful, and accommodating. I also love how this hotel is close enough to Waikiki to walk, but far enough away to not be part of the madness. Peaceful, convenient, relaxing. What more do you want?!

Had an amazing time staying at the Lotus Honolulu earlier this month! My husband and I went to Honolulu for our honeymoon from March 31, 2014 to April 6, 2014. It was great! Everyone who worked there was so wonderful, helpful & extremely informative. The front desk staff was so welcoming, caring, attentive & terrific. The room was beautiful, view from the balcony was breath taking, the bathrooms were clean / big, and the bed, pillows & blankets are super comfy. Our stay was heavenly! We received complimentary wine, yoga items & ever could get a bike for travel (which was offered at first come first serve basis). The hotel is right off of the beach & just a short walk away from a park. Also it was really easy to get to many of the restaurants, the zoo & to go shopping. Shuttles were offered to come & take us on tours all over the island.Just ask the front desk for any brochures or for other information. There is so much to do & enjoy! Loved it <3

We spent 4 nights at the Lotus and thoroughly enjoyed it. The view of Diamond head was great. The location is away from the action of Waikiki but is just a short walk away. There are several parks adjacent to the hotel and the zoo. Ate at Park restaurant, the food was excellent but a little pricey. The staff is very attentive and will take care of any problems promptly.

Stayed three nights in March, following a cruise which ended in Honolulu, excellent room, double aspect (No. 625), really comfortable, beds / pillows great. bathroom and towels etc all fine. Good WiFi and TV. Front desk staff superb, good to find someone actually keen to serve and look after their guests. view of beach hindered by hotels built since the Lotus, but didn't affect our stay at all, nice balcony to use, with Diamond Head view also. Short walk to main Waikiki shops / restaurants, but felt safe and no problem. Breakfast ok (muffins coffee etc), but also worth walking to LuLu's above Starbucks, for beach view and good cooked stuff.Used Charley's cabs from cruise port $25 and then Speedy Shuttle back to Airport, (further), at $27 shared with other pick ups, excellent service. Highly recommended.

Clean and updated hotel at the base of Diamond Head. Staff was awesome. Only think missing was a pool. Great beach 200 feet away. If you are looking for that quiet oasis close to all the action, this is it! I will stay here again.

This hotel is not right on Waikiki, but that's a good thing. It is within easy walking distance of the beach, but is situated in a lovely park so it is much quieter than other hotels in the area. The park is great for an after dinner walk or a morning run. The rooms are nice, and we had a great view of Diamondhead. The staff is friendly and very efficient. The hotel restaurant Park is also very good. We really enjoyed our stay here.

As a quiet getaway, this is the place to stay….close to Waikiki, away from the noise. Modern clean designs with a top notch staff. It is a smaller place (reduces noise as well); friendly and accessible…you won't get lost. I am ABSOLUTELY DELIGHTED that they do not have a pool; a mature retreat. Next trip to Oahu, I'll will stay here again.

The choice of The Lotus Honolulu was perfect for our recent trip to Hawaii. Located just off of the Waikiki 'strip', it was a peaceful getaway yet accessible to all of the main attractions in the area. The amenities were wonderful, from the comfortable beds and excellent layout of the bathroom, to the balcony that overlooked Diamond Head. The service is top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff. We requested Premium rooms and were not disappointed.

I choose this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews and loved it. I took the advice of other reviewers and booked on a higher floor where the views were incredible. I loved not being in Waikiki but able to walk there. The staff was so friendly I felt like I was walking into the "Cheers" bar.

We stayed for three nights at the Lotus Honolulu and chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. During our stay, we stayed in two room types. Both had comfortable beds, quality furnishings with excellent housekeeping. The staff were uniformly friendly, had a great attitude and were knowledgeable about the area. All the vibes are positive. It’s been noted in previous reviews about the breakfasts, so I won’t comment on that.I would like to add our experience with two room categories:Diamond Head View Premium Room. The hotel’s website features a photo and a room description: “Luxurious corner units feature two private lanais offering stunning views of Diamond Head and the Pacific Ocean.” We were assigned room 521 with a tree blocking the view of Diamond Head from one window and from the other window a view of a parking lot and a sliver of ocean. We heard the sound of the elevator when it opened & closed, people talking and children yelling in the hallway, and motor scooters, cars & buses going by on the street. In the morning we are awakened around 6:50AM by the beep-beep of delivery trucks backing up. We asked for a room change away from the street and a higher floor. Here we learn that this category of room is only up to the 6th floor – the top floors of 7-12 are another price category, Ocean View Premium Room. With no availability on these top floors we agreed to an upgrade to an Ocean View Room and hopeful that we’ll get a good nights rest there. Ocean View Room. The hotel’s website features a photo and a room description: “Lotus Honolulu Ocean View rooms feature majestic views of the Pacific Ocean, 380 square feet of space, and a furnished private lanai.” We are assigned 1024, away from the elevator and more towards the ocean side. Take a look at the photos to see what you think of the “majestic views of the Pacific Ocean”. However, the room is quieter. But around 6:50AM those delivery trucks back-up beeping like an alarm clock. So to summarize:Depending upon how light or solid a sleeper you are, you may be perfectly satisfied with any of the rooms.If a view is really important to you, look at the photos that other guests have posted not just the ones posted on the hotel’s website.I suggest discussing your room choice with staff before making reservations.Perhaps these concerns could be rectified with a more modern quiet elevator and heavier duty sound proof windows.

I decided to write my first hotel feedback for this hotel is because it really brought me down. First of all my BF and I picked this hotel as it highly recommended by trip advisor. The hotel itself is clean. But things turned down when I lost my most expensive and most meaningful necklace at this hotel. And the stuff did not even really try to help we to find it at all. so watch out your belonging if u chose at this hotel

Before we forget, the bad news: this place at the extreme eastern end of Waikiki is tricky to find by car the first time around. That is, the one thing the hotel lacks is a good roadside sign; so we missed it the first time, and had to do a long loop around Queen Kapiolani Park, and try again. And this was in broad daylight; but at least it's a low-speed zone. The entrance to the small parking lot is subtle and easily missed, and the main hotel entrance is off that same parking alleyway, under an overhanging roof.The parking, being tight, is by valet only, but the valets are quick and polite, and they do not expect tips. The service here is young, but polite and helpful. Room service requests are quickly answered. Our spotless high corner room offered a view of Diamond Head and a partial view of the ocean (it's not a wide building, by Waikiki standards). There was a good stiff breeze in the evenings. The WiFi was free, and strong. Wine "hour" was from 3-5 and involved one white and one red; self-serve.The "Pascal Morabito" toiletries are great - little odor, and no greasy residue. The room has good towels too.The hallways are exterior only, and we did hear a child running nearby on occasion. Why do people spoil their children by bringing them to places like this? Please, folks, leave the kids at home, or take them to the Holiday Inn; this is the kind of hotel best appreciated by mature and sophisticated adults. The hotel is right across the street from Queen Kapiolani Park. This is good, and bad. Bad, because on weekends Hawaiian families gather for barbecues and loud music, which can last all day; but they're gone by 10 pm. Good, because you can walk across the park in the morning to the nearby restaurants and breakfast places on the northwest side of the park, on Montserrat (see our other reviews - Diamond Head Grill, South Shore Grill, and so on). Do this, rather than having the "continental" in-hotel breakfast, which is pricey and nothing special. The bed was low (as we like it), and comfortable. The pictures on the website gave an accurate semblance of our room. No problems at all with water or electricity. A small aquarium run by a university is a short walk along the waterfront, and is a worthwhile place to visit.We would stay here again if we were in the Waikiki area. But next time, if we can afford it, we'll try the penthouse.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and I was very skeptical on how to choose a hotel but the Lotus was great! The entire staff was extraordinarily nice from check in to check out. The location was nice and quiet from the very busy strip of Waikiki. They offer valet parking, free wine, free wi-fi and housekeeping came twice a day to see if you needed anything from ice to additional towels. Just a few steps from the beach and they provided beach towels and chairs and free bikes for riding! The room was nice and the bed was so comfortable! Everyone was so helpful with any activities we wanted to plan or do! Great choice for my birthday vacation spot!

My (new) husband and I stayed here at the Aqua Lotus the weekend of our wedding, in a premium Diamond Head and Ocean view room. The view of Diamond Head was spectacular! The ocean view was partially blocked by other hotels, but these days, that's what "ocean view" means. Nevertheless it was all around beautiful. Didn't get to explore the grounds too much but what we saw was great. There's a complimentary happy hour in the lobby and coffee on one of the floors. Will return for our next trip! Thanks!

We just had a thirteen nights in this hotel, both my wife and I really enjoyed our stay. All of the staff are excellent. I particularly liked that the hotel as bicycles at no charge for use of the guests.There is free bottled water available at all times, the parking and the internet is also at no cost and every afternoon there is a wine tasting.The hotel's breakfast is very sparse and the restaurant is closed at lunch but the hotel next door is only a minutes walk away and its restaurant serves excellent breakfasts and lunches.I ate in the Lotus's restaurant three times and enjoyed the food. Annie our server and Pam the barkeeper were both friendly and helpful with our food choices and suggestions for things to do.It is an easy ten minute walk into Waikiki. An earlier poster mentioned the "characters" in the park that have to be walked by. At no time was I or my wife ever bothered or approached by any of them. People were walking and jogging by themselves at all hours so I assume they felt safe.

We spent 4 nights here and the hotel was wonderful. Very clean, we had a corner room on the 12th floor with stunning views. The wine that was served from 3 - 5 was most welcome. There was a restaurant on site and we used this for dinner on two occasions and breakfast on one morning. The staff were very helpful and in fact this was the best bit of our holiday.

Stayed 8 nights and lotus was a retreat from the chaos of Waikiki. Enjoyed the walks into town and walking off the oversized meals of the USA. Whale watching off the balcony was a treat. Large clean rooms and bike riding, wine drinking, internet and no surprise extra charges. Thanks Lotus thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

My wife and I took our first Hawaii trip Jan/Feb 2014. Since we weren't familiar with Waikiki's hotels we decided to trust Trip Advisor's reviews. Good choice because the 3 hotels we stayed at were all in the top 10 of about 90 area hotels, and they were bang on with their reviews! The Aqua Lotus was ranked #3 and for the rooms, service, dining, location and price it should be ranked #1. Can I say more?

The location was excellent, very quiet and away from the hubbub of the rest of Waikiki. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the ice machine was broken during the entire week were there.

My fiancé and I took a trip here for a romantic getaway and the only thing I can say without a doubt is that we will return! The staff was warm and welcoming. The pictures of the room do it no justice. It was really immaculate. Don't splurge on the ocean view because the hotels in front block your view. We were on the 9th floor and really only got a sliver of the ocean. But the views of diamond head were amazing. Anything we forgot to pack or needed throughout or trip the staff was quick to provide. PROS: Great location and the end of the beach, away from the noise of the strip Friendly and welcoming staff. Very attentive Spotless room with a big bathroomNot overpriced CONS:$20 a day for parking Only a slight ocean viewSecond lenai is very smallThey only offer coffee and tea in the morning. The actual continental breakfast is unappealing and extremely overpriced (about $4.50 for a bagel)

Travel to Hawaii every year but have not been to Honolulu in about 5 years. Returned this year to the Aqua Lotus (former W Honolulu) and was pleased to find the hotel and staff as gracious as on previous visits. We prefer the quieter Diamond Head location and the opportunity to walk thru beautiful neighborhoods. Front Desk staff is top notch. Had a corner room on an upper floor and appreciated the cross ventilation and territorial view. Only issue was noise coming from the Penthouse unit above us. Made two trips (at 10:30 and 11:30 PM) to the front desk to request that the occupants of the room stop dragging furniture across the floor and to refrain from loud conversations on their balcony. Front Desk agent indicated she would inform the manager of my complaint. I ask for the manager to contact me the next morning. No one contacted me. I believe the manager was at the front desk when I checked out. He did not acknowledge me. Very disappointing.

Stayed here several times and the staff continues to be top-cabin throughout. Lovely, small, quiet hotel and you can't beat the location. The perfect place to enjoy Waikiki but escape from the crowds when you desire. Highly recommend!

Every member of the Lotus staff that we encountered was friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Our room was quiet, well-appointed, and always clean and tidy. The included 'extras' really made the visit a pleasure, including the wireless internet, coffee and wine in the lobby, and abundant bottled water and beach towels. We found the Lotus by word-of-mouth from a friend who stays there every visit, and will definitely recommend it to friends looking for a quiet home base amid the bustle of Waikiki!

We had stayed at this hotel when it was a "W" and decided to try it under new ownership. We booked a corner room and arrived late at night. We awoke the next morning to a spectacular view of Diamond Head. Everything that has been written about the staff is spot on--helpful, congenial and professional. We had breakfast the first morning in the 2nd floor restaurant seated by the window and taking in the pleasant sights, sounds and aromas from outdoors. The breakfast staff couldn't be more pleasant and helpful. Although food choices were limited, the selections were fresh and tasty. Free coffee, tea and hot chocolate are offered each morning. As the room had a nice mini fridge, we bought breakfast items for the remainder of our stay, but visited the restaurant each day for our coffee and daily newspaper.The rooms are adequately sized and outfitted with plenty of storage for personal items, a desk, chair and ottoman. A table and chair are located on the balcony but the day it rained, we brought them indoors for our breakfast and they fit in perfectly without crowding the room.A Starbucks coffee machine and coffee capsules were provided for that morning wake-up cup.Under the tv is more storage and the mini fridge..One long wall of the bathroom is vanity/mirror with a lot of space on either side of the sink for toiletries. Opposite the vanity is shelving with a large selection of bath towels, hand towels, washcloths, etc. I believe all rooms are equipped with showers, which is fine by me. Often bathrooms with tub and shower seem to be a waste of space and the tub usually goes unused.The only complaint I heard from other guests is that there is only one elevator for the 12 story building causing wait times, but with only 5 units per floor, we didn't see that as a problem. The elevator does open onto a corridor which is open air and, seemingly, some guest seem to forget they are in a hotel and use their "outdoor" voices while waiting for the elevator.The location is close to San Souci Beach,close to a bus stop and an easy walk to Waikiki.The clientele is well rounded with young families, couples, seniors and it's evident that manyare frequent visitors.

This place is great. Very near Waikiki but not in the middle of it. Avoids the crowds and is a nice quiet environment. The view of Diamond Head is super. They recommended the restaurant in the hotel and we decided it was a convenient place to get a couple drinks, dinner and not drive or take a cab after traveling all day. So glad we did. The restaurant did not disappoint in any way. Attentive service and a selection of amazing appetizers and entrees. The breakfast in the restaurant is a basic selection of choices, and does not appear to have the same point of view as the chef who created our amazing meal the night before. I will definitely return to this hotel and restaurant..

We own a condo next to the Lotus and have for the past 10 years. Occasionally we need to have friends or family that come in from the mainland stay near us. We pick the Lotus for its location...not in the craziness of Waikiki....but a hundred yards from the best beach in the area, the beautiful Kapiolani park on the other side and the Lotus frankly is at the foot of Diamond Head. The entire staff is amazing...I say again...the entire staff! Modern but with an Aloha Spirit! If you stay anywhere else....you are probably not thinking correct. I never write reviews....I am just compelled to share the hidden beauty, comfort and peace you will find if you choose the Lotus Honolulu. Marc Van Buskirk CEO-GovX

We stayed at Lotus for several days based on the reviews on TA and our experience was slightly above average after taking many things into account. The hotel's greatest attribute is the customer service - possibly the best service we have received at any hotel in North America and likely do to the fact that it is a boutique hotel with less than 50 rooms therefore the attention to guest satisfaction is higher than a standard hotel. For this I give them full credit as everyone from the valet to housekeeping do a fine job (the staff here actually run to complete tasks which wasn't necessary but fun to watch). The free evening wine and water during our stay were nice touches as well. The hotel was recently renovated but that doesn't mean everything is new as many areas of the hotel and room were untouched. For example, our bathroom was very old and motel-esque and not particularly clean compared to other $400/nt hotels. Higher end hotels will often do a renovation which means everything is new in the room but I would classify the Lotus as having done a partial renovation. Now, I should clarify that we have been to Waikiki a dozen times and if this was our first stay in Waikiki we would have been very pleased overall especially if we knew beforehand that there is no pool, pool access or fitness facility and didn't expect these amenities, which we were aware of. However we have been to Waikiki and stayed at other hotels therefore we have the luxury of making comparisons which is why we suggest this hotel is average. The location is definitely away from the crowds of Waikiki on Kalakaua but a short 10 minute walk if you want to be in the Waikiki mix but there is a large park almost beside the hotel which has some interesting characters. The massive park across the street is filled with people doing athletics. The hotel shares a private beach with Outrigger but it is very small and there is a lot of coral and rock a few meters into the water so bring water shoes if you intend to hit the beach and enter the water. I would recommend staying here for $200/nt but at $400/nt you can do better unless your primary focus is service within the hotel because that aspect is unparalleled. We did not try the restaurant during our stay but the reviews on TA appear to be good.

I will stay here again should I have the good fortune to return to Oahu. Great location. Tremendous staff. Had a view of Diamond Head and the beach. Close to everything, but far away enough to feel more private.

Helpful staff and welcoming ambience. Rooms are larger than usual and the views spectacular. Worth paying for the Ocean View and ours (Rm 825) also had mountain views. Free tea/coffee; iced water in lobby; and free wine were "value add" inclusions. A pool would be a bonus.

This was formerly the W Honolulu. Quiet part of town at Diamond Head, about a ten minute walk to the centre of town. Rooms really nice and contemporary. no pool, but beach a couple of minutes walk and towels can be provided. The staff were excellent especially the guy on reception with initials on his badge something like PK (?), he was friendly, interested and charming. Restaurant food very good, but dining room needs livening up with some candles and flowers on table an better lighting - does not do the food justice.

This hotel was wonderful! The people and the location were the best. Far enough away from the Waikiki hubbub, but a stone's throw to walk to Waikiki Beach, amazing restaurants and shopping. Great location. No need for a car. We preferred the more private beaches right behind the hotel. The surf was gentle, and swimmable (or standable!) not the throbbing body surfing shores of Waikiki (unless you choose to paddle out a ways. This was the only property that we searched that didn't have a "hidden" amenity fee of at least $50 per day as it included FOR FREEWIFI, YOGA, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, beach towels, chairs, OPEN WINE BAR during"happy hour" (3pm - 5pm) NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL A HAPPY HOUR! Last but not least one of the most exemplary concierge services I've seen in the world, BAR NONE.

Perfect location. The hotel was a quiet refuge from the frenetic activity and noise of downtown Waikiki while still being an easy walk to all amenities. We had a room (1022) with a great view of Diamond Head and the ocean- the beach was a minutes walk away. Free beach towels chairs and mats were provided, free wine every afternoon in the lobby , cheaply priced laundry facilities and a staff that was friendly and accommodating. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

If you like smaller, intimate boutique hotels; then the Lotus on Waikiki beach is for you.Beautifully appointed lobby and guest rooms with all the modern conviniences. This was our anniversary and splurged on a corner, upper floor room with full ocean and diamond head views. We could see the surfers and hear the waves crash from our two balconies. I recommend the '25 room types - well worth the extra few dollars. We took part of the hotel's complimentary one hour yoga each morning, at the park next to us. Wonderful way to start your day. The hotel also offers complimentary wine at cocktail hour. The staff is excellent, professional and very courteous.Take note that though the hotel has a restaurant; it offers limited service so best to double check hours of operations when you check in. The lotus is in a mostly residential location with few outside restaurants nearby (Waikiki strip is a 20 min walk).

This is the only area on Waikiki where I would book a hotel. It is removed from the noise and crowds of Waikiki, which is basically identical to Miami Beach (countless high rise hotels and shops along a nice stretch of beach). Lotus is next to a large park and has wonderful, unobstructed views of Diamond Head. It is not right on the beach (1 minute walk) and views of the ocean can be obstructed by other hotels, but Diamond Head views more than compensate! Restaurant is excellent as is the room decor. Online photos accurately reflect the high quality and relaxing, uncluttered atmosphere of the rooms. If you are going to be in Waikiki, but want a more peaceful atmosphere, this is the spot.

My wife and I discovered the Lotus Honolulu in September 2012 when we couldn't book at the Otani for a night on our stopover from Maui to the mainland. What a gem it turned out to be! When we returned again in January 2014 for a week's visit with our son (stationed on Oahu) we knew that the Lotus was where we wanted to be!The Lotus is far enough away from Waikiki to miss the the crowds and noise, but close enough to walk there for the restaurants and shopping if you chose. The hotel faces east with great views of Diamond Head. More limited views of the ocean, but you could throw a stone to the balcony to the beach. The beach is very quiet and shared with the Outrigger Club (from The Descendants). We had wonderful swims each morning out to buoy/windsock (300 meters each way) in a beautiful, protected waters. There is a larger beach right next door at the Otani if you needed a bit more. Beach towels and chairs provided at the front desk.The rooms are very nicely appointed, up to date, and well kept. Our king bed was extremely comfortable. The balconies offer that wonderful Hawaiian breeze that can only be described as heaven! We slept with the sliding glass doors open each night! Complimentary Kuerig coffee and bottled water in the rooms and wine in the lobby in the early evenings. Absolutely no issues at all with the hotel. The best feature of the Lotus is the amazing staff; from the valet, to the front desk, to breakfast service, to housekeeping! Low key, very polite, and very attentive. They quickly responded to any request or question we had and provided great input on the island and activities. I met the hotel manager at breakfast one morning and he shared his vision of what he wants for the Lotus; a quite, comfortable, welcoming hotel that travelers will want to return to. Well, it is all of the that and much more! We will certainly be back to our quiet heaven in Honolulu!

Our stay over Christmas and New Years was fantastic and far exceeded my expectations. We were travelling with 3 kids and I was worried the two rooms we booked would not be together and we would end up with one of the lower floors. We booked the D.H. Premium View and D.H. View. I sent an email to the Gen. Mgr. Joshua Gray and he made sure we had the top floor for that room and we were together. He also made sure there were two dbl beds in the kid's room and a king in the adult room. (The also provided a roll away bed so the two kids didn't have to share a dbl bed.) The staff was professional and fast. One of the coffee makers wasn't working in our room and it was replaced in less than 5 minutes. When we arrived, and during our whole stay, Wes worked the front desk was awesome. He helped us with everything we needed including printed directions and advice on anything we needed. I can't say enough good things about ALL the staff! (Thanks again Wes!)The rooms at Lotus are clean, new, updated, warm, comfortable, roomy, and have a great view of Diamond Head. You can even see a little of the ocean from our 7th floor room. This property is not beach front, but it's only steps away from beach. (Who needs a pool when you have the beach!) The hotel provides towels, chairs, sand toys etc...for whatever you might need at the beach. They do offer complimentary wine in the afternoon. We didn't make it to any of these afternoons, but it looked like the guests enjoyed the benefit.The main reason we picked this hotel was the location. The main area where all the hotels are is very crazy. We liked the Lotus because it's not on the strip but close enough to walk. With all the food I was eating, it was nice to walk a bit. The hotel also provides bikes to borrow for free. Parking at the hotel is valet. I was hoping to get away from the valet parking, but I decided to just pay for the convenience. If I could offer any areas of improvement it would be having the trees cut so you could have a better view of Diamond Head, especially below the 7th floor. It looks like the trees were basically cut right at the 7th floor. Below the 7th floor, I think the view would be partially obstructed by the trees. To be fair, I don't think the Lotus has control over the tree cutting. I think the trees are on City property. In any event, if you are on a budget, and can only afford the lower rooms, ask for the 7th floor. We saw the sunrise every morning over Diamond Head and it was beautiful.To sum up, there is nothing I have to complain about the Lotus. The staff and accommodations were excellent. It has a feel of very high quality hotel without the pretentiousness of some hotels. It was nice walking around the hotel and having the staff know your name. We had a fantastic stay at the Lotus.

The Lotus Hotel Honolulu is a great hotel. The staff was extremely warm and welcoming from the second we walked in. My boyfriend and I had been snorkeling all day and we looked pretty haggard when we arrived- a contrast to the other guests in the lobby. However, we were treated just as well as other guests. The man working the front desk was incredibly kind to us and everybody else checking in/asking questions- it seemed like a genuine kindness, which I appreciate. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are comfortable and extremely clean. Our view and patio were breathtaking and I felt a bit pampered staying there, even though our room was not as expensive as other hotel rooms in the area. It was about a mile walk to the downtown area where Waikiki beach is, but it was a nice walk.This is especially nice as the downtown area is loud and bustling. The rooms are much more quiet because it is away from the craziness that is Waikiki. We were constantly treated well and it is very close to the park and Aquarium. There is yoga in the mornings and you can borrow anything from bikes to beach equipment from the hotel. I regret only staying here one night and my next trip will include more stays at the Lotus. I'd definitely recommend it as a safe and pleasant place to stay in Honolulu. It is more of an adult oriented hotel- it is not unfriendly to kids in the slightest but this would be a fantastic hotel for a romantic weekend- note that it doesn't have a pool, but seriously, you're a few feet from the ocean- you don't need a pool, I guarantee it.

I have now stayed at this property 4 times! I have stayed at many other properties but this one always manages to treat me like family and the location just outside of the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki strip - yet close enough to walk - is perfect.Repeat business is hard to get as you have to be consistent in many aspects of your service delivery, from the Front Desk to Valet to Housekeeping, this hotel has maintained this high level of consistency. I am very happy to call this property my home away from home when I am in Honolulu. I thank Clarissa and the excellent staff at the Aqua Lotus in making our last visit to Honolulu so special........ again!

The Lotus Honolulu offers great value for the dollar. All the luxury and amenities you would expect in a five star establishment. Love the fact that it is located just outside all the craziness of Waikiki. Easy walk to shopping and restaurants. Especially pleased that there wasn't a nightly resort fee, everyone who works here is so friendly and helpful. From Travis and Sean talking good care of your vehicle, to Wes and PT welcoming you at the front front desk and helping make plans for an enjoyable time on O'ahu. I can be pretty particular as a frequent traveler, but have nothing but positive things to say about the Lotus Honolulu. Would highly recommend!

If you want to stay close to the beach and close to Waikiki but not in the midst of the masses then this is the place for you. It's a good 10min walk along the coastline to Waikiki and depending on where you want to go, you might walk up to 30min. But for me this was a relaxing evening walk that I enjoyed. Driving is of course always another option.Count in the cost for valet parking cause there's hardly any public parking space available in that area. However, the stuff has been very friendly from the very first moment. They gave me a room on the 11th floor so that I can catch a glimpse of the ocean when I look out of the window. And whenever I needed my car, we had a nice chat and I got offered some water for the trip. Easy to step out of the hotel in the morning and go running and also very close to Diamond Head which one should hike up before it get's hot over lunch time. Hence I appreciated the short drive to get there.

Spent a week at the Lotus with my teenage son in tow; we had a great stay.. I really cannot say enough good things about the front desk staff here…so friendly and helpful, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome…The rooms are great, still plenty of space with two beds and our views toward Diamond Head and the beach were spectacular…A special shout-out to the gal who worked the front desk on New Year's Eve (Sara perhaps, apologies if that is wrong), she truly went above and beyond to try to get us a taxi back to the hotel…Again, nothing but positive things to say about the Lotus, would certainly stay here again and recommend it to others.

We stayed at the Lotus for 5 nights during our 2+ week vacation in Oahu and Maui. The front-desk staff and valet staff were all very friendly and helpful, with a smile and an "anything I can do for you" persona. They all know you by name.Beach chairs, umbrellas, bottled water, and beach towels are free and available at all times. The $20 per day valet charge is well worth the cost.The complementary 7:30am morning yoga across the street in the park during sunrise is energizing and invigorating.It is a lovely and restful 15-20 minute walk to/from Waikiki beach, so after you've had your evening meal, you can stroll back to the Lotus, and enjoy the peacefulness of its setting. Within those few minutes you are swept away from the noise and neon of Waikiki nitelife.Would definitely stay there again, and highly recommend it to others.

My family spent Christmas week in Honolulu. I decided to stay here based on trip advisor reviews and it was great.All the reviews were accurate.Great staff! Great location! You are close to everything but won't hear late night craziness :)

Stayed here for three nights at the end of a 9 day holiday to Honolulu. Having done most of our shopping and sighseeing, we looked for a tranquil location near Diamond Head. The Aqua Lotus is a perfect choice for peace and quiet away from Waikiki. The room was impressive with lovely views of Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head. The room was tastefully presented and had two balconies catching the breeeze from the ocean and the mountain. The beach is only a short walk away and if you needed to go back into Waikiki, the bus goes right past, but you can walk there in about 15 minutes. The view at night back to Waikiki is one of the best you'll get anywhere.

We booked this hotel at the last minute = we were originally going to stay at the Waikiki Marriott Resort, but as we got closer to our arrival date, the reviews on Tripadvisor about the Marriott were so bad, we cancelled, and due to the great reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked the Lotus.What a wonderful surprise! The lobby is lovely. There is always fresh fruit and fresh water. The complementary wine in the afternoon is an added plus, as is the free coffee in the morning. If you don't want to buy breakfast from the restaurant on the 2nd floor, there is a convenience store next door. But make sure to eat dinner at the restaurant - great food and friendly servers. We went up for dessert one night, and two nights later, when we went back for dinner, Lisa remembered us! The front desk welcome was so warm and helpful - TJ and Travis really went out of their way to give us information, and to help us book our tour of the Arizona.The room was beautiful!! From our balcony, we had great views of Diamondhead and the ocean, admittedly with a parking lot in front, but the other 2 views made up for it!The beach was just a short walk, and thanks to Travis, we went equipped with beach chairs and towels. Small, but quiet beach - just what we were looking for.Admittedly, central Waikiki was a bit of a hike, but considering the craziness ( sort of like Times Square), we loved the location. We had been told not to get a car for Honolulu, and the advice was right on! Traffic is horrendous and there is no place to park. One day we walked down, but since I had a bad leg, we cabbed it down. One day we were actually able to take a bus back to the hotel, but that didn't happen again - they stopped running at 4:30 in the afternoon!? I made the suggestion that the hotel could offer a shuttle service just to central Waikiki a few times a day.I don't know if I would visit Honolulu again, but I do know that I would definitely stay at another Lotus property.

It's a small 12 story hotel with about 50 rooms but it's obvious the Lotus was renovated within the last few years. The staff was great, the room presentation was great! What a nice treat to walk into my room with Hawaiian Music playing and my Ice bucket stocked. I would suggest trying to get a higher floor but you may not get it with the limited amount of rooms. It never hurts to ask. The only odd thing about my room was the shower/Tub combination. It was really a stand up shower and not a tub. It's a bathtub only an toddler can use. I give the Lotus high marks. If you don't mind a "Non resort Stay" but a high quality hotel next to the beach, then the Lotus is perfect

This beautiful hotel is in a quiet area at the end of Waikiki Beach with an absolute gorgeous view of both the Ocean and Diamond Head. My wife and I rented a car and used the Valet parking service of the Hotel but often walked into the busy shopping area of Waikiki.Our room was very modern and comfortable. The hotel itself is slightly dated but well maintained! The hotel staff was excellent from the Valet parking attendant to the housekeeper to the front desk staff. All were very knowledgable, professional and very attentive to our needs.The only thing I was slightly dissapointed in was the breakfast selection in the Restaurant.

My sisters & I stayed at your hotel last wknd when we were in town to run the Honolulu Marathon. I've been to Oahu (specifically Waikiki) hundreds of times & I can't believe I never heard about your hotel before. I love the quiet location away from the hectic craziness of Waikiki. The accommodations were wonderful - very clean, beautiful, with a simple elegance. Our room was a comfortable size the for 3 women :) and the bathroom was nice & spacious. Your staff was awesome, friendly and very professional and made us feel at home. Thank you for the great service and wonderful hospitality. We will for sure spend more future vacations with you all.

It's bad enough that we were flying in from American Samoa and California to run a scary 26.2 miles...then to book a hotel room at a place we've never been to...we were a little anxious about that! But there was no need - from check in to the minute we left the hotel we were assisted by friendly, helpful, knowledgeable staff who went out of their way to not only get us in and out of the hotel, but also talk about our stay, the marathon, our experience! We never felt rushed, and the hotel is in a great location away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. While there may not be a pool or bouncing nightclub the beach and the serenity of this hotel provides a home-away-from-home experience that we appreciated, as well as direct access to a beautiful and less crowded beach. We will definitely be staying here every time we're on O'ahu! Thank you staff and manager for adding to our awesome Marathon experience!

After a long flight from New York all we wanted was some rest and relaxation. This hotel has a great view of Diamond Head and it literally 1 minute away from the beach. We told the gentleman at the front desk that it was our anniversary and not only did they upgrade our room to the top floor facing the beach, they sent up a bottle of white wine and got us dinner resevations at Hau Tree Lanai at the neighboring hotel. Amazing hotel, room, view and service and I will for sure stay here again!

I am a local resident who lives in a neighborhood about 10 minutes away from this hotel. Since my first stay here it has become my favorite place to get away without going too far. I found that lower rooms with Diamond Head view are ideal for me, you get mountain, park and even a little ocean view. Rooms are good size!Service was excellent from reservationist, front desk and breakfast bar waiter.Good for walking and close to a great local beach and it's on the bus line.

Just spent 10 wonderful days at the Lotus with my daughter and sister. What a fabulous hotel. From making the booking, checking in, various requests throughout our stay and checking out - all so easy and nothing was too much trouble for the wonderful staff. The hotel is perfectly located across from a lovely park (free yoga several mornings a week) and about a 10 minute walk from downtown Waikiki. On arrival we received a complimentary bottle of wine plus a welcome gift. We booked a (corner) premium room with ocean view - highly recommended and very spacious with nice furnishings and great view of Diamond Head and Sans Souci Beach. The complimentary afternoon wine was also a nice touch. We would definitely stay at the Lotus again and highly recommend this great boutique hotel.

Service was first rate, the room was very nice. Stayed in premium ocean view, great view view of Diamond Head from the lanai; also view of the ocean. Conveniently located across from a park at the quiet side of Waikiki yet within walking distance. Short walk to the beach at Waikiki and short drive to Diamond Head and Hanauma Bay. Also enjoyed the nice touch of afternoon wine. The entire staff were very personable and accommodating and greeted us by name each time. Will recommend to family and friends and definitely stay again on our next trip to Oahu.

We stayed at the Lotus in November... We wanted to be close to the attractions but farther away from the noise and hustle of the main strip of Waikiki. Lotus was in a perfect spot with a perfect view out our window of Diamond Head! The staff was very nice and helpful, and the rooms nice and very clean! The valet attendants were the best, getting our car ready every morning, offering us bottles of water for our drive, or even running up to my room with a map and a personal charted path to a destination I was heading to. Just a great experience overall! I miss it already!

Lotus Honolulu is a wonderful hotel with outstanding albeit understated service. The team are well skilled to deal with the diverse questions of travellers & tourists alike. The rooms (diamond head, beach view) are amazing, great size, very comfortable bed, inclusions very homely & unforgettable views.I loved the boutique style if the hotel & that it was away (albeit only 10/15mins) walk from the hustle / bustle & people watching of Waikiki. There are a range of very good restaurants very close by. For me it was a haven & one that I will certainly enjoy again. The little complimentary add-ons ie complimentary coffee in the morning & wine in the afternoon are a surprising & appreciated value add to the holiday experience.Thank-you & keep up the great work.CheersGayle

This hotel is everything you want in a boutique hotel... friendly, personal, modern, clean, and easy to get to/from your room without a 20 minute walk. It's a bit down the beach from the big resorts, restaurants, etc... which is a very nice walk when you're not in a hurry, but a bit far if you're lugging bags, etc. (check out the bus system before you go... I didn't "discover" this until the day I left).Rooms are spacious and clean... and view from my lanai was great. A very pleasant place to sit and relax.But it's the staff that won me over... they were genuine and friendly from the beginning. When my wallet was lost/stolen near the big resorts of Waikiki beach, the Lotus staff were kind and sympathetic at a time when I needed it. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Never been to Hawaii before and found this little gem of a Hotel online. Stayed for 3 night early November before we visited Big Island and Maui and liked it so much we returned to Honolulu and stayed here another 3 nights before jetting back to Australia.Rooms-especially from 8-12th floor have good views over Diamond Head and ocean, nicely upgraded and fantastic bed and pillows. Service is good,very helpful and friendly.Loved it because in walking distance from Waikiki strip but you can leave all the hustle and bustle behind and retreat back into this little serene environment.Parks all around.Good beaches in front.Towels,water and chair supplied free by Hotel.If you want a very special dinner eat at Michel's next door right on the beach.That and Orchids were the 2 best meals we had anywhere in Hawaii.No good coffee close by-but that applies to most of Hawaii & for that matter most of the USA.

We live on Oahu and had to have our house tented for termites, so had to get out overnight. The Lotus welcomed us, including our dog, and were flexible on early check in and a extra half day rate for a very late check out. They were very friendly, provided treats for the dog, and recovered by iPad that I accidentally left in the room for me. The location cannot be beat if you want to avoid Waikiki, and the complimentary wine in the afternoon and coffee in the am were nice touches. I would return if I needed a stay-cation, and would recommend this to travelers.

Stayed a week at this hotel on business. Really enjoyed the room and the hotel staff (PJ & Zachary were especially helpful, knew me by name,etc.). The room (1024) had a large balcony and views of Diamondhead and the ocean. The beach is literally less than 100 steps from the hotes via a little path - you don't even have to cross the street. The only unfortunate part of the hotel is the elevator... I guess I'm used to a bank of elevators in high rise hotels, but this is a smaller, boutique hotel with only one elevator. Bikes are available for loan, wine is available in the lobby from 3 - 5pm, coffee and tea available in the restaurant in the morning beginning very early so business folks can participate, large balcony, yoga instructors... nothing bad to say about this hotel.

This was our first trip to Hawaii so I relied on my travel agent to find a nice hotel in Honolulu. Did not want the mega hotels on Waikiki but something still handy to the beach. The Lotus was perfect for that. Located across from a park and next to a beach park, the area was quiet but still handy to everything. We walked along the waterfront each night to watch the sunset and one evening walked to Waikiki to experience the atmosphere. The newly opened restaurant was very good. The breakfast was continental so we did not use it too much. I believe they will be changing this so check when you inquire on reservations. There is also free wine in the lobby from 4 to 5 and their selections were quite good. The staff were always helpful and friendly. All in all, this was a great find and will definitely be the place to go for a return visit.

Rooms and Staff superb. Not having a pool wasn't a big deal for us. Valet exceptional, provided water and very detailed maps to go sight-seeing. Hotel just outside Waikiki so you not in concrete jungle. Can't say enough for the stay. Hotel Breakfast was informal yet intimate. Few Hotels near Public Park, so Beach Area very accessible. PT and Denise where Tops.

LOVED my stay - my new favourite Honolulu hotel, just a little outside the busy Waikiki craziness yet close enough to stroll down for great people watching. Pet friendly! Abby loved the park. Beautiful and recently updated and very current. The main lobby has not been updated yet and I hope they don't . It is so lovely with its combination of lovely oriental wood screens and modern furniture. Please don't change!!!

We were in Hawaii for my daughter's birthday and the staff here made a great effort to make her day special. The room was beautiful with fantastic views. We splurged on the corner room and were not disappointed. We were pleased with the restaurant food, atmosphere and our waitstaff was relaxed and friendly. Would not change anything except possibly staying longer. Our one night was not quite enough.

If you are looking for a very nice boutique hotel a little off the beaten track but still in Waikiki then The Lotus is where you will want to be. Actually in the shadows of Diamond Head and a beautiful beach for your own use pretty much. All rooms have a view of Diamond Head and some of beach area. The higher you go (it cost more the ) the more of the beach area you can see. But, not really worth the upcharge.The service at the Lotus is outstanding and very accommodating. The restaurant is very nice and the new chef does a great job with his seafood dishes he serves up. Our waitress was extremely helpful too.Next door at the New Otani Hotel, their restaurant serves breakfast and lunch if you remain in this area. The Lotus is only open for dinner along with their bar. However, the Lotus has a continental breakfast area that is very good and reasonably priced. We used it several of the mornings and were very satisfied.Also, right next door on the other side of Lotus is the acclaimed restaurant, Michel's. Wow !! What a great place to dine. The food was outstanding. But, again, not cheap.

A little gem at the end of a very busy beach area, we had a wonderful corner room (1121) which enjoyed two balconies to benefit from the beach views and diamond hill. The room was modern clean and we truly loved it. We didn't have any problems with there being no pool or bar, it gave us the chance to go and taste the Waikiki beach area, the small quiet beach just five minutes walk away was really something to chill and watch the surfers. After visiting the main strip we could see that our hotel took advantage of not being in a built up area with no room to breathe. We took advantage of the bikes and chairs and towels for the beach. The staff are brilliant offering a great service to our every need from ordering a shuttle bus only 12 bucks to pearl harbour or organising ice for our room. We are so pleased to have chosen this hotel so really appreciate how beautiful the island is.

Stayed at the Lotus for four days beginning of September. All I can say was awesome. It was at the quiet end of Waikiki beach , the views were amazing of Diamond head. Would definitely recommend . Free wine was perfect , after our tiring days visiting the island.

My first ever post. I usually don't bother. But I was so impressed by the Lotus. Great location, immaculate rooms, beautiful views. Other hotels can boast similar pro's - but when you include excellent value for money, complimentary bikes, 2 hour wine tasting every day, yoga in the park, a simple yet tasteful breakfast selection and super friendly staff then it goes from 4 stars to 5. Hard to think of a con - maybe a mini bar selection might be a value add. If I ever make it back to Honolulu I will be staying here. Check the hotel website for prices as well - I found a room almost $30 cheaper on the hotel site than other booking sites.

My boyfriend found The Lotus. We are both in our early 40s. What I enjoyed the most was that the location is private, quiet and beautiful. The hotel is very close to Diamond Head. I loved the view from the room. Our first room 521 was lovely. Large corner room w terrace. We then moved to 1022 for an oceanview, partial ocean view and still view of Diamonhead. We also enjoyed the on room coffee maker. Nice.Pros are the staff. Very attentive and courteous. Hotel's decor is gorgeous. Zen feel. Candles everywhere. Wine happy hour complimentary. Delicious red and white provided. Complimentary yoga classes which we did this morning. Quality instructor. Public beach a short walk away. You feel like your w the locals. I like thatCon. Movie didn't work in room last night. No big deal we found something else to do. ;). Would have liked a hot tub. that's all.

This was our first trip to Honolulu and we were apprehensive about staying in Waikiki, but the Lotus proved an excellent choice for us. The staff offered a warm welcome, and great support throughout our stay. Our corner room on the 10th floor was very nice, comfortable and spacious enough to work and relax. It gave us a lovely overview of the park below, Diamond Head, cloud shrouded mountains, with ample slices of ocean, plus a full city skyline from the walkway to the room. Since we are from the "country," these expansive views, and the mix of sounds from birds flying around the tree tops, tropical breezes, to the daily soccer matches in the park, provided the perfect backdrop to ease us into the city life. There is some street noise and a couple of condos which reduce the views of the ocean, but that comes with the territory. As a middle-aged couple on a business trip this location was an excellent choice for work and pleasure, a walk to the beach, a little swimming, and a short drive to U/H and other locales around Honolulu. The Waikiki strip, the aquarium, zoo and Diamond Head are all within easy walking distance. The valet parking is top notch and we never had to wait for our car. The complementary afternoon wine (quality) and cool, comfortable, quiet lounge area was very refreshing.Overall we had a very nice experience. Thank you Lotus!

there is something seriously wrong either with Honolulu or with the reliability of reviews here, if the Lotus is rated #4 of 83 hotels in Honolulu. Seriously people?I have written very favorable reviews of other places (see prior). And in fairness, the Lotus is an OK place. But the disconnect between the rave reviews of others and what you actually get is stunning. Given its rank, and its reviews, I can only blame myself for not looking more closely and reading the Lotus web site with the same skepticism that one would use when reading real estate listings in New York City.Let me start with the good: The Staff is truly wonderful, kind, helpful and deserve to work at a better hotel. This review is in no way a criticism of them. They could not have done anything more to improve our stay, which is why we did not complain to them. The issues with the hotel are beyond their correction. Also good: Free bicycles to borrow; attractive quiet lobby.The disappointing:1. "steps from" the beach is NOT on the beach; there is a row of buildings between the Lotus and the ocean, blocking what otherwise would be a great view2. No pool!
