I blame myself for not picking this up; but it never occurred to me that a top ranked hotel in a vacation destination would not have one. So if you are looking for a comfy place to lounge in paradise, keep looking...3. No room service4. No hotel bar5. No vibe6. Views of parking lots from the rooms7. No headboards on the beds8. Beds are double sized, not queen sizedYou can borrow small beach chairs and towels from the front desk to pad over to the beach. This is actually pleasant enough. It helped us get over our disappointment in our mistake.

5 stars for decor The rooms are updated and beautiful: white linens with brown accents (no nursing home decor like most hotels in Waikiki), hardwood floors, and modern bathrooms. The lobby is modern and chic with colorful pillows and lots of comfy couches. 5 stars for customer service We were greeted immediately by the gentleman at guest services, PT. He was inviting and knowledgable. We were an hour early for check in, but our room was ready and we were allowed to get in earlier than check in time. PT remembered us and our room # the whole time without us having to constantly remind him of who we were. On the last day he asked about the wedding we attended, which meant he remembered our brief conversation upon our arrival 5 days later.  Travis helped us with bike rentals and was always friendly and accommodating. He gave us complimentary bottles of water and not only explained the bike laws, but gave recommendations for food!4 stars for experience Upon our arrival we were checked into a room with 2 double beds. I had reserved a king, but they had none left. If you read the fine print it says 2 doubles or king even if you click the button for the king online. We were informed that bed type could not be guaranteed, but we would be switched to a king the next day when one was available. Then the next morning we were awakened to construction on our patio. This was dreadful after staying out late our first night. We immediately called the front desk and were told there was nothing to be done about the construction, but were met with profuse apologies. My boyfriend called down a bit later since we were unable to keep sleeping and after speaking with the manager we were comped our first night. After that episode our experience was flawless. We were moved to the new room, never again woke up to construction and continued on to have a great experience at aqua lotus. 3 stars for view You have a view of diamond head and the ocean, but it's obstructed by a parking garage and many other buildings. From the lanai it's hard to block those things out of your view. From the bed it's gorgeous bc you can't see those obstructions as much. 4 stars for convenience The hotel is off the Waikiki strip, which can be a bonus if you want to be away from the congestion and noise. It's a bit more difficult to get places than if you were just staying downtown. It's about a 20 min walk to Waikiki proper and a 5 min bike ride. The hotel gives you bikes to rent for free which is fantastic. There's no "resort" fee, which you have to pay regardless of whether or not you take advantage at many of the hotels. And guest services will call you a taxi whenever and they were always right on time. 4 stars for hotel bar The bar staff is very welcoming, accommodating and knowledgable. When my boyfriend asked for a shot f a specific gin they had 3 types from that maker. She let him taste all 3 to see which he liked best. A lot of their specialty cocktails came with vodka, which I don't like. Melissa was happy to make me my own special cocktail with a little extra love. One night they had live music. And they even let you take bottles of wine to your room. The only sad thing is they're only open till 11pm.

We had an excellent time at the Lotus. The staff is amazing and made us feel at home. We had an awesome corner room on the 11th floor that looked right at Diamond Head and had good views of the ocean. We could even see the lights of Waikiki if we looked out the door of our room. The restaurant is new-ish and they are still working out the menu. I give the food an average rating.

Loved our stay. The staff were nice at all levels. The views were great and it was a quiet escape from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The price was very affordable compared to other comparable hotels. Great location. Close to everything.

We arrived at the end of September to the Lotus Hotel . We had a corner room and it was very spacious with a patio. Hotel was right off the water and we had a Great view of Diamond-Head. The hotel is near shops and restaurants. Hotels provide free bicycle and beach chairs.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and I did a lot of research on TripAdvisor prior to going. This hotel was FABULOUS, exactly what I wanted... but it's important to know what you want: I was looking for a smaller, quieter, boutique-style hotel where I could get a great room with fantastic views and high quality service at a reasonable price. I wanted to be right on the ocean (not across the street from it), away from the crowded bustle of Waikiki (yet within easy walking distance of it). This hotel was all that and more: view of the ocean and Diamond Head, Triple A staff, right across from Kapiolani Regional Park (lots of fitness activities going on there), within in walking distance of zoo, aquarium and plenty of bus stops (bus system is pretty easy to navigate and inexpensive, but no problem getting a cab any time if you prefer - I did both). The hotel offers complimentary WIFI and wine between 3-5 PM, there is now a restaurant open on the premises (dinner only). There is complimentary coffee/tea service in the morning on the 2nd floor where you can also purchase. simple continental style breakfast items. My room (8th floor corner) had 2 balconies, complimentary water, refrigerator and a Starbucks Verissimo coffee maker that produced first rate lattes! Room service was twice/day. The decor was lovely,the room/bathroom was large,and the beds were extremely comfortable. There is an ATM in the hotel's spacious, serene and tastefully decorated lobby, a nearby convenience store and the award-winning Michel's Restaurant (French Haute Cuisine with an amazing view... you will not regret ordering Cherries Jubilee).I would re-book or recommend this hotel in a heartbeat, unless you ABSOLUTELY want a large, noisy, cookie-cutter, crowded hotel within the high end shopping district where you have to cross a heavily trafficked street in order to be at an over-populated beach.

Very comfortable and everyone was super friendly and accommodating. I love the Breakfast Room, particularly the granola, the Dining Room, and the wine list. The view was marvelous and I could watch the sun rise over Diamond Head. I appreciated the tone of the hotel which was not as commercial as many hotels.

Great hotel! Been visiting the Lotus for years, very help and friendly staff. Excellent restaurant and breakfast terrace and enjoying the complimentary wine in the afternoon. Great location and the rooms are a great size and well kept. Enjoyed the peaceful surroundings and the easy access to the neighborhood. Will be back soon...

Amazingly clean, professional staff, love the bikes, yoga and wine every afternoon. A fantastic value! The staff was fantastic, restaurant nice and the breakfast bar excellent! The people that managed that were great!!

A fabulous property directly across from Diamond Head. Very special, very romantic, light years from your typical bustling Waikiki hotel. Terrific service, beautiful ocean view rooms tastefully decorated and surprisingly very reasonably priced. A crowning touch is the Park Restaurant located in the hotel. Very creative menu wonderfully executed with top notch service. Looking forward to returning on our next visit to Hawaii.

The room is bright, airy and both the room and bathroom are spacious and comfortable. It is modern and the staff are friendly. It is an easy walk to the main Waikiki area along the beach and park.We ate at the restaurant 'Park' on our first night as we were exhausted from international travel- it was fantastic- food was great as was the service.The lobby is nothing fancy nor the lift but the rooms and restaurant do feature- we would stay here again.

The Good:- The rooms look new, with a modern decor that is kept clean. - The hotel is a little off the beaten path of Waikiki in a quiet part of Waikiki, yet still with walking distance of the shopping, restaurants, and bars. I prefer the quiet area, as I come to Hawaii to relax - not eat at Cheesecake Factory, shop at the Ferrari Store, and get over-whelmed by a "World War Z" swarm of tourists on the beach.- The hotel has its own restaurant for dinner (no breakfast or room service, however), and there are three nearby restaurants (Michel's, New Otani Hotel, and Beach Front Cafe). - The hotel has free wine from 3-5PM (legit!), and coffee/muffins for a charge during the morning (lame).- Next door is a small convenience store selling sundries, snacks, hygiene products, alcohol, etc.- The staff is efficient, friendly, and cool as [--] (offering paper cups so we could take our "juice" to the beach).The downsides: - Hotel is not beach front, and the "ocean view room" pictures are terrible misleading. The "ocean views" are the backsides of two taller buildings (which are beach front); in fact, you are better off getting a Diamond Head view, as they may offer great vistas of Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head. However, the hotel is within very easy walking distance (like ±150 feet), and they offer beach chairs.- No pool or gym. But whatever, you can swim in the ocean and do a few hikes.- No breakfast. The Beach Front Cafe is really good (and offers cheap eats), but requires a short walk to the park. But, damn, why not serve a basic breakfast, even for a charge?- No Room service. You have a restaurant, why not go the slightly extra step?- And, the travesty of travesties, no MINI BAR! How do you expect me to get "housed"?Bottom line: I would stay here again if I stayed at a high room facing Diamond Head... and brought a supply of cereal and wine.

Awesome staff! Very friendly and awesome views!! Great restaurant for drinks before the night or a great dinner! Awesome pupu's as well! Very great drink list. Room kept up very well and all things were replenished frequently. Would recommend to all my friends and family. Can't wait to go back!!

We stayed at aqua lotus for our first trip to Waikiki and I must say I was highly disappointed by trip advisor rating.First let me say the hotel is beautiful inside. The rooms are cleaned and service is great the problem is those are the only positives I can say.The hotel is far from any action which made evenings horrible for my wife and I. If you stay out too late you have to walk past homeless park where there are tons of homeless people. It makes you feel worried. Nothing happened mind you but walking at night through that is not exactly what I call paradise. There is no easy access to beach. The hotel provides you with cheap beach chairs which you have to walk to a beach a couple of hotels down. It gets very annoying as I was informed the hotel was beach front. Also the hotel is so far that no excursions picked us up. We had to got other hotels for pick up.There are no real options to eat at the hotel. The one place there was not our taste at all.I think this hotel works for older people. There is no life in lobby it just feels empty. If your goal is quietness and no action stay there. It's not cheaper than other hotels so if you want fun and life don't stay here

This was our first trip to Hawaii and Honolulu, and I couldn't have been more pleased with Aqua Lotus. I had heard that Waikiki was big and bustling like Miami is to Florida so I assumed all hotel options would be huge resorts. What a delight that our travel agent recommended Aqua Lotus. Every evening, I felt like I was coming "home", not to a hotel. It was easy to come and go whether on foot, bike or car. The staff was so warm and welcoming - I almost felt like giving them a hug when we left! The room was comfortable and we loved sitting on the lanai and enjoying the view. If we are fortunate enough to return to Honolulu, we will DEFINITELY stay here!

We had trip of business and pleasure--- we stayed here during the 2nd part of our 5 day trip for 2 nights. This was the business part. I chose the hotel based on reviews and price. We booked a good price for Honolulu that was company budget friendly for Honolulu. We stayed on the 8th floor--- the hotel is in a weird location near some condos and a large park-- away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I have mixed feelings about the hotel--- the rooms were nicely decorated with laminate wood and the staff was friendly and efficient- especially the valet parking! The hallways are open air and there is only 1 elevator (not a huge hotel so that was ok). Not much to eat or do around here, but the hotel is quiet. You have to take a little walk to the beach and some rooms have partial ocean views-- which ours did. If you like resort feel, convenience of shopping and restaurants right out the door and all around this is not the place to stay and probably not that great for kiddos? If you want modern, quiet, nightly wine service and a boutique feel- this is your place!

We chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed . It is a lovely boutique hotel on the east end of Waikiki near Diamond Head. We liked that it was away from the hustle and bustle do downtown Waikiki yet still near the beach. The service was excellent. We had a a wonderful dinner at their new restaurant and also had a lovely dinner at a restaurant nearby called the Hau Tree restaurant. If you are looking for a smaller boutique hotel with lovely views, comfortable rooms and gracious staff, we highly recommend this delightful hotel.

We had a very pleasant stay at the Lotus. Staff was extremely friendly and helpfull.The peaceful location, only a 10 minute walk from the main strip of Waikki, we found to be ideal.The room was elegant and comfortable and had everything we needed. Complementary bike use, towels, beach chairs and wine was usefull and a nice surprise.Restaurant Park is recommendable. Very good food at reasonable prices and super service. We hereby give the Lotus Hotel our best recommendations.

Perfect place near Waikiki but still quiet with very nice and clean room. Very friendly personal.We enjoyed their complementary bike use, towels, beach chairs and wine tasting from 3pm to 5pm. Well situated Near Diamond Head and it very pleasant trail;

This is my favorite hotel in Honolulu. The hotel is located across from the Park which is wonderful to walk around. I travel on business and it meets all my needs for quite, safe and clean. the atmosphere is very restful, the staff very attentive. Of course the complementary wine is delightful in the evening. The room is elegant in it's simplicity and very comfortable.I enjoyed the Park restaurant, it is so nice not to have to go our for something to eat. The food and service are great.

This place was perfect for people who don't want the obnoxious noise of Waikiki, but still want the beach view. It's about a 10 minute perfect walk right into the center of things. The decor is simple and elegant. I only had a snacky treat at the restaurant, but man, that crispy cauliflower was DELISH! It's a great little place off the beaten path - but no so off that it's a pain to get anywhere. You're right there, without the traffic and noise.

We had a great time at this hotel. It was much more personal than the large hotel chains on the main strip of Waikiki. We enjoyed their complementary bike use, towels, beach chairs and wine. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

My partner and I stayed 4 nights here in June this year and we enjoyed our stay very much. We were lucky enough to get a corner room with a great view of Diamond Head and glimpses of the ocean too. Our room was well appointed: I found the bed very comfortable, the shower was great and everything was very clean. There is plenty to like about this hotel: the complimentary wine served daily, free bicycles to ride into Waikiki, free (and reliable) internet access and the friendly service. Unfortunately the one morning my partner and I wanted to borrow the bicycles, there happened to be just one left! So a tip to guests: get in quick! If I had to think of any disadvantages to staying here it would be the distance to the main shopping strip. It is a good 10 minute walk to the main part of Waikiki. We liked the walk though and it is nice to be situated away from the crowds.

We stayed here for a 1 night stopover to break the journey from Sydney to San Francisco. It met our needs perfectly, We pre booked a shuttle from and to the airport which worked well. We weren't initially given the room preference I had requested, but after a bit of a hissy fit (sorry) reception staff graciously upgraded us to a beautiful corner room on an upper level, which was perfect in every way, including view of water and Diamond Head. Reception area had chilled water available at all times AND COMPLIMENTARY WINE, in late afternoon, of which we partook. The Hotel is quiet and peaceful but only a short walk to the hubbub of Waikikki. It is also more modern than a lot of the hotel options we looked at.

This was our first visit to the island of Oahu and we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. A few minute walk away from the hustle and bustle, a fantastic viewof diamond head and the ocean, a staff who were by far the most pleasant group of people we encountered in Hawaii and The extra smiles and amenities (like the bicycles) made this hotel a real treat. They were practically our travel guides the Whole trip. Friends who stayed at other hotels inside Waikiki during our trip wished the had booked with us. Make sure to visit Park and try the Opah and 25 wines for $25!!

Our daughter just had a baby and we planned to stay with her and did for a while. We needed a break and this hotel was perfect! The staff were very helpful and the room was clean. Just a short walking distance from Waikiki restaurants and the beach was right there. We had beautiful views of Diamond Head and the ocean. It was the break we needed!

It's no longer a secret: that the success of this hotel is in the consistency of service delivery - from the front desk to housekeeping - which ensures repeat guests like ourselves. We have stayed here 3 times and experienced the warm and friendly service from Travis calling us by name as we drove up and Clarissa's Aloha spirit at the front desk, welcoming us back. The room is always spotless and ever so comfortable with a lot of great amenities. Also wanted to mention a new addition since our last stay and that is the new Park Restaurant located within the hotel. Excellent cuisine and service - we went there twice during our stay and of course, the location cannot be beat. We will be back again. Mahalo to the great staff of the Lotus!

The staff very aways a delight to deal with. The rooms always clean!! Only a couple blocks from the beachside for great access. And the price was truly fantastic!! Definitely a wonderful experience. Whrn I plan my fifth trip back -- I will stay there again for sure!!!

go there only if you fancy small hotels without public areas, shops and typical big chain facilities.dont get fooled by the hotel location, it is still a walking distance of main attractions, not to say zoo or aquarium, waikiki is a 10m walk and the promendade along the beach and the park welcomed after crowdy's waikiki. true that food options are limited around for those who do no want to walk, nonetheless, 15m to bogarts'. hotel does provide some kind of basic breakfast which is probably not what you would be looking for but enough to give y ou stamina to reach the next food spot. the beach behind the hotel is small but less crowded. why would you need a pool then. rooms are well decorated, clean with a nice view on either sides,corner rooms, named premium, a must have, and much quieter than in waikiki. hotel provides free bikes but did not feel need to use them given the short distance.we got a good lastminute deal but otherwise price can be on par with centrally located 4 stars in waikiki and not sure would be a real bargain for some travellers. advice: try to get corner rooms at discounted price and go there if you favour quieter environment and ready to walk. if so, perfectly recommendable.

This is the perfect spot if you are in Waikiki. Away from the tourist horde, great swiming spot in front and a short walk to the main tourist area. Rooms are a good size, clean and quiet. The afternoon free wine in the lobby is a good concept that gets people togerher. Prices are fine and the staff vey helpful. We really couldn't fault it and would certianly stay agian.

My Mother and I stayed here the last day and night of our trip to Hawaii before returning to NJ. I had read the reviews over and over and thought that it would be nice to be away from the crowds and tourists in the main area of Waikiki. Well, the hotel is secluded and our shuttle bus driver had never even heard of it. The entrance is weird as it through the parking garage. We were not welcomed as others had said they were. If you stay there, make sure you have a car. There are no restaurants around at all to walk to unless you pay the high prices of their restaurant or two others in a nearby hotel or condo. The room was very nice, although there were stains on the folded bedspread at the end of the bed which should not have been and of which we complained. We were very unhappy there and wanted to change to another hotel that at least had something around it. The hotel is close to the beach but not on it. They offer you very low sand chairs that are rusty. My Mother may have gone to the beach if there were lounges but she doesn't sit on such low sand chairs which was the only choice. There is no nice outside places to sit if you do not go to the beach, only the balcony. We had many questions about things, like excursions to Pearl Harbor, trollies,and the guy at the desk merely gave me some pamphlets and did not offer to make any reservations for us until we asked. They were not helpful at all. I spoke to the manager and he said that his hotel is not a full service resort and does not have an excursion desk. That is a poor excuse as the most hip, chic boutique hotels in the northeast make sure their customers have everything they need. When I asked if they had the menus of the other restaurants nearby to look at, he said that he does not promote other restaurants. Well, the manager did reduce the cost of the room by 50% which was a nice gesture and did cover one taxi ride but we still had to pay for several other rides back and forth if we wanted to go out. Maybe if you have a car, it can make a difference. I would not recommend this hotel if you like service. Walking to the beach carrying one of their old sand chairs made me feel like I was staying at someone's apt. for the night. I think the place used to be a condominium and it must have been converted. Lobby is small, freezing cold and you never see many other guests. Boutique hotels can be great but the Lotus just didn't live up to its reviews. Everyone at the desk did not seem to know much. I would not recommend this hotel. We were extremely disappointed for our last day in Honalulu.

The Aqua Lotus is a short walk (10 minutes) along the beachfront park to the busy hub of Waikiki.Then you hit the noise, traffic and crowds. I loved staying a little bit away but could easily access Waikiki without needing transport. The hotel is small, friendly and had nice decor. It was also super clean. My view to Diamond head was really nice in the morning. I felt very safe walking between the hotel and Waikiki (as a single female), even after dark (latest I did it was 9pm and there were still people around the park so it felt ok). You can borrow bikes to ride the short distance but be very careful to dismount when you hit the Waikiki zone as the police will fine you for riding on the path.I suppose a pool would have been nice that's the only negative thing I can say.

Stayed here as a little treat after a week in pretty cheap digs on the Big Island. We chose this hotel for its location and we were not disappointed. We loved the small but more than adequate "private" beach that is not as private given all the other condo's in the area but very subdued compared to the main strip of Waikiki. We also loved the free WiFi, wine, coffee and especially the bicycles, which were retro but very safe and well maintained. The staff were absolutely fantastic and felt like friends saying hello and checking how you and your day was. Those little personal touches really do make a difference. The breakfast was simple but more than adequate and at a very reasonable price. As for the room we had a corner room which gave us Diamond head and marginal sea views. It was wonderful to sit out on the little balcony wine in hand in my fluffy rob. After slumming it for a while I felt like a princess. The bed was comfortable and the pillows made you feel like you were sleeping on a cloud. We also loved the fact this is a dog friendly hotel and met many lovely pooches with equally as lovely owners. Highly recommended. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed 4 night at Aqua Lotus Honolulu. It located at the end of Waikiki area.. $10-$15 by taxi to the central of Waikiki and 20-30 mins by walk. We like the room, it is modern, clean and very comfortable. Staffs are nice and I will definitely recommend for your stay..

When I drove in to the parking garage of the Lotus, I was met by a smiling, helpful, young man who immediately assisted with valet parking and my bags. He asked my last name and remembered my name each time I saw him. The hotel lobby is candlelight in the evenings and well as a 3-5 open bar happy hour. The Check in was smooth and friendly. I entered my room to a letter from the manager welcoming me. Each night when I came to the room, the lights were on and the music was playing on hawaiian music. The room was cleaned each day. The hotel is very clean and beautiful. The different color lights at night make this hotel beautiful. The view from my room was Diamond Head, Kapiolani Park and Ocean View. I loved the lanai in the mornings while I drank coffee.

We finished off our tour of the islands here, out of the bustle of main Waikiki.The rooms are impeccable and stylish, super comfortable beds and pillows and the bonus of a coffee machine was a real winner for us.A decent coffee in the morning right in the comfort of your own room, free wine in the afternoon to relax in the comfortable foyer and a free bicycle whenever you want it. What more could you want?The staff were helpful and attentive and made us feel right at home, relaxed and comfortable as soon as we arrived. Even the service staff who came to clean our rooms and turn down our bed in the evenings were simply charming. Three cheers for their demure professionalism, which often goes unnoticed.Don't be concerned by the location, sure it's only glimpses of beach views and it's not right in Waikiki. It's a 1 minute walk to a lovely calm swimming beach which is shared by other hotels but not crowded at all.A comfortable 10 minute walk up to the main streets was no problem for us to ensure we weren't located in the mayhem of Waikiki. There's regular trolleys, buses and even free bicycles to get you into town if you don't want to walk. We thought the bicycles were great !One of the best thing about this hotel is that it ISN'T in the madhouse of the big chain hotels up on the main strip. Literally thousands of tourists jammed into that hotel and beach strip was very unattractive to us.We were told by others the restaurant was also very good, shame we missed the opportunity to try it.There was absolutely nothing we could fault about this hotel. When we go back to Oahu this will be our first choice without a doubt. Any excuse to ride a bicycle up into town is a bonus. :-)Well done, Aqua Lotus.

In fairness, we are pleased to reply to the snide remarks by Shinobi9.Perhaps our personal experience in observing this person's attitude at the Front Desk may givesome clarity to the true content of his caracter. This loud elitist group were in the Lobby Lounge with their feet on the tables. The person in question resented the fact that his room was unavailable before the normal 3pm check-in time. Further, we observed this group leaving the beach, while leaving their trash behind. Obviously, they don't respect Hawaii's delicate envoironment.As for the most competent Carissa, after staying at this Hotel for the past 10 years, several times a year, with the same outstanding Staff, she doesn't deserve anyone backstabbing her, since a Manager is always available to handle any complaints.

This was our second time staying at the Aqua Lotus and we were just as happy as the first. The rooms are well appointed, the location is great and the staff couldn't be nicer. We didn't get a chance to try the newly opened restaurant, but the joint was, as we say, jumpin' which surely bodes well. A nice Zen feel to the hotel--and slightly out of the Waikiki wackiness...but not too far out. Waikiki is just a beautiful oceanside walk away. And it's also easy to walk over to hike Diamond Head and then reward oneself with ahi and eggs at the fabulous Diamond Head Market. Ono, as we say!
user_location: New York, New York, United States

review_body: Overall the hotel is great. Perfect location and great decor. I like boutique hotels and this one does not dissappoint until you speak to the staff. To be fair, this is a classic situation where one person ruins the entire experience. Carissa is just not the type of person who should be at the front desk of a hotel... anywhere.Everyone else was highly accomodating with the exception of her. I hope they correct her attitude asap.Other than that one large negative factor, this hotel is amazing and I will still stay here again even though there was that one person who was very rude.

We had been staying on the windward and north shore for most of our trip. We wanted to stay in town beef we headed home. The Aqua Lotus was perfect! The rooms were beautiful, beds amazingly comfortable and the service impeccable! Highly recommend staying at the Aqua Lotus in Waikiki!

Location is only a 10 minute walk from the central Waikiki hub bub. Beach access is almost direct. The hotel provides beach chairs and towels. They're also across the street from a huge park, where they offer free yoga lessons (great for beginners). The nightly *free* wine service featured a two delicious CA wines. The decor is clean and modern, the bed incredibly comfortable, and the views, while not unfettered, were gorgeous. We tried all the vegetarian options at their recently re-opened restaurant, Park, and were very pleased. The service and cocktails were also fantastic. Reception and valet couldn't have been more helpful and nice. Our reservation was a bit complicated - paid for some nights with points and had a package waiting for us - but the front desk had read the file notes and were totally prepared, with no fuss for us to deal with. No pool or fitness center, but with the beach and park jogging trail right there, who needs them? Mahalo for a great experience, Aqua Lotus!

Within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach and Kuhio Beach, and the Kalakaua Ave shopping scene, Aqua Lotus is just far enough away to provide a bit more tranquility. The Lotus sits right on the beach and has a more intimate feel than the large resort hotels on Waikiki. The contemporary and uncluttered look of the lobby and guest room reminded me of the boutique hotels along South Beach...art deco with a touch of polynesia. If that sounds weird, don't fear, it's a cool and appealing combination. Room was spacious, and very comfortable. Staff was pleasant and ready to help. And if you can find a way to snag a short term guest pass to the Outrigger Canoe Club next door, you might choose to spend your entire vacation within a 100 square yard space.

This is my first review on TripAdvisor.We arrived on the 8th August 2013 and received an exceptionally warm welcome, check in was smooth and we were advised that we had been upgraded, which was unexpected and appreciated. Next day we ate breakfast in the restaurant and again we were greeted by Denise bright, friendly and personable who made us feel truly welcome and nothing was a bother.After reviewing comments about Park restaurant called ahead to make a booking and spoke with Dante, which set the tone for our dining experience. Our meal was divine and the service provided by Miley simply outstanding! Glad to be here for another couple of days!

The Lotus is probably one of the best kept secrets in all of Waikiki. True it is expensive, but hell what hotel in the area is not! I've lived just down the street from The Lotus for a long time and always come here when I have guests in town or have a project going on at my apartment. The staff here are absolutely excellent and very friendly. The rooms are awesome and very comfortable. One of the things I really dislike about the hotel is the lack of continental breakfast, even the crappiest hotels offer this! I guess people prefer to sit around at 2 in a dark lobby on sunny day and sip wine for free. Also, what's up with the ocean view vs. Diamond Head view? They won't give you a floor above 7 unless you booked an "ocean view" room. Not sure why 7 and above constitute ocean view when the view is absolutely no different!! Overall, a good hotel in probably THE BEST neighborhood on all of O'ahu! Come here if you're looking for an escape from the usual noise and crap in Waikiki.

Finally a restaurant that is as cool as the hotel...they got a young chef with 3 star experence in a resturant called Park. Now they got it all? We sat at the bar for dinner and they offered us the wine list they had 25 bottles for $25.00.... Never saw that in a restaurant before

The Lotus Honolulu has earned my 1st Tripadvisor review!!!! I've always read reviews before booking but never took the time to write a review. I guess I’ve never experienced such hotel staff; they go above and beyond to give you the ROYAL TREATMENT… I've never experienced the red carpet before but I’m certain it feels like staying at the Lotus. My 10 day stay was nothing short of spectacular! Upon arrival the staff was warm and welcoming. They greeted me with smiling faces and a water bottle. The hotel is clean, the décor is relaxing, the rooms are clean and spacious and the entire staff is so attentive. The General Manager, Joshua is also attentive…making sure each guest is happy. He even personally signs a thank you letter to each guest…WOW!!! I overheard a conversation with him and a guest who was staying for his 10th wedding anniversary... the restaurant had not reopened yet and the guest wanted to do something special for his wife… a special breakfast in bed… Joshua made it happen! You can’t get this ROYAL TREATMENT at the large hotels and certainly wouldn't see the General Manager taking such care of the guests. As everyone else has stated, the hotel isn't in the middle of the madness… it’s peaceful and relaxing. The walk to the restaurants is a quick one but it’s even quicker if you check out a beach cruiser bike from valet! You really feel spoiled by the staff and the multitude of extras are great… from beach bikes, chairs, water bottles, wine at night in the lobby, yoga in the park, and the Zen feel of the hotel… you won’t want to leave!!! Thank you Joshua and staff for the amazing, unsurpassed ROYAL TREATMENT…. I will certainly return…. you've all earned my review and 5 glowing stars!!!

Stayed here for two nights. Location is quiet but be prepared to pay extra for taxis to go to any decent restaurants as not much nearby. Our bed the first night was terrible. The mattress was very saggy and my husband who is 6"2 had his feet hanging out the end of the bed. Staff were very helpful when we complained and moved us to a room with a king bed which was much more comfortable. Overall, it is a friendly,clean, comfortable hotel but expensive for what you get.

Upon the recommendation of a friend, I cancelled my reservations at a prominent Waikiki property in favor of the Aqua Lotus -- and I am SO glad that I did. As a business traveler on vacation (and celebrating my 60th birthday!), I was looking for an escape from the hustle & bustle, busy schedules, phones, etc. and found this property to be the perfect spot for a week of relaxation. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean, but the friendly staff (maintenance staff, housekeeping, front desk, valet, management etc.)sets this property apart from the hundreds in which I've stayed. The views from an upper floor corner rooms are wonderful from sunrise to sunset. With the opening of the new restaurant ("Park"), the hospitable experience will become even more complete. I look forward to returning again soon!! Thanks, Joshua and team!

This was my second stay at the Aqua Lotus and I was not disappointed upon my return! This hotel is an oasis in the midst of a very busy tourist town. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the views of Diamond Head, Kapiolani Park and the Ocean change with the time of day. Having a good-sized lanai with the breezes provides for quiet time to read, reflect and meditate. The beach is tucked away and uncrowded with enough water activity and family companionship to balance it out. Seldom have I found a staff that is so friendly, yet professional. Everyone is respectful, gracious and accommodating. This is a place for those who seek quiet and peace, comfortable surroundings, exquisite views and beach or neighborhood walks. It was more like being in a home than a hotel. This is a one of a kind place and I highly recommend it!

My partner and I just returned from a stay at the Aqua Lotus. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Honolulu, and this hotel ranks high up on my list. From the moment we arrived, we felt welcome and the quiet location is a definite advantage over the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable. I would have preferred a few more TV channels, but I did not come to Waikiki to watch TV, so no biggie. The beach is convenient and not nearly as crowded as other parts of the Waikiki. The staff is excellent. They go out of their way to make sure you have everything that you need to have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. It appears that a restaurant is opening very soon. We peeked in and it looks beautiful! A little disappointed it was not open while we were there. I guess we will try it out next time. We will definitely be back.

Yes, my first review... I started reading TripAdvisor posts after I had begun to plan our family trip to Hawaii, and as a result, I cancelled our reservations at a larger resort in a busy area of Waikiki so we could see if the Aqua Lotus lived up to all the great reviews. It sure did! Honolulu/the Waikiki area are wonderful of course, but as it is a busier area, it can be overwhelming for us folks who are used to the suburbs. Returning to this hotel after each day of sightseeing was soothing for my husband and I as well as our two daughters, 10 and 13.  As everyone says, the staff is without a doubt the best I have ever experienced in any other hotel, and we travel a lot. It was so nice to pull up our car and have someone ask how our day was, help us find a place to order pizza etc, this after the staff always made sure we had some water before we started out each day. While heading out to watch the 4th of July fireworks on the beach, we realized it would be a lot nicer if we had beach chairs. Of course when I returned to the lobby, we were immediately offered chairs we could borrow. We loved the views of Diamond Head, and felt "at home" in a busier part of Hawaii. In fact, when checking out, I asked a couple in the lobby if I could just cut in to say thank you at the front desk for a wonderful stay. It turns out that couple included the manager of the hotel, who truly takes pride in his staff. What a magical start to our amazing vacation!

On the far end of Waikiki- The beach is nice and uncrowded compaired to where all the shopping and tourists are. There is a beautiful park there. There is no pool, but come on, the beach is right behind it. The hotel itself is very zen - peaceful and comfortable. The staff is SOOOOOO wonderful. Helpful, friendly. Couteous. Had a very enjoyable stay

This newly renovated hotel has good views of the ocean and diamond head. While located on the eastern end of Waikiki, it is a close walk to the beach and other attractions. Conveniently located right across the street from the park with lots of people watching and a great place for a jog. Convenient to public transportation. The staff are attentive to your needs and take pride in their work. We would return again.

I stayed at the Aqua Lotus in early March 2013, en-route from Australia via Guam to the USA. I had done a little research prior to booking my hotel in Honolulu, and was richly rewarded with my stay here. From check-in, to check-out, this hotel was outstanding in all facets of service. Check-in was quick, seamless, the staff courteous, and genuine. The beauty of the Aqua Lotus is its (small) size and location. What it lacks in not having a pool, it makes up for in superior service and location - (right on the beach, with a 15-minute walk to the Waikiki strip, well enough away from the noise and bright lights). Rooms are well-appointed, clean, and most importantly, quiet, with an incredibly comfortable bed. I booked a corner suite, on an upper floor, with beautiful views of Diamond Head and the beach. The knowledgeable reception staff was always happy to assist with bookings, recommendations on places to eat and share valuable local knowledge on things to do and see. The restaurant was undergoing refurbishment during my stay, but breakfast was still offered, with a wide array of healthy and appetizing options, great coffee and unobtrusive, excellent service.In comparison to the over-inflated prices of the soulless, cookie-cutter hotels on the Waikiki strip, the Aqua Lotus represents excellent value for money, with friendly, helpful staff that are a standout, and comfortable rooms that will deliver a memorable stay. Highly recommended, but don’t tell everyone. It’s Honolulu’s best-kept secret.

This stay was part of a two island 5-year anniversary holiday for us. After literally TONS of research on my part, this hotel won my reservation for 2 nights in March just so we could visit Pearl Harbor (my husband is a Navy vet). For us, this hotel fit our needs perfectly and beautifully. Neither of us likes to be right in the thick of urban, so the location out-of-the hub of Waikiki was divine for us. This hotel is certainly off the beaten path but in a beautiful spot.We especially liked our view of Diamond Head and the green park across the street. We could see a pretty good amount of ocean from this same side balcony. From the front balcony, there was a sliver of ocean to be seen between two buildings, but we were ok with that. I think sometimes the whole "oceanview" aspect can be slightly over-rated. See the photos I uploaded for the various views from the room.Our room was on an upper floor (I don't remember which floor exactly) but I know we had unobstructed views from our balconies, from the elevator balcony, and also from the fire escape balcony. The views of downtown Waikiki at night from the elevator balcony were beautiful, with all the twinkling lights.The walk to town wasn't too long, in fact, I enjoy any opportunity for exercise, and this was a delightful one. Isn't any walk on a Hawaiian island a joyous experience, and something to lock into memory??!Staff was great during our stay, no issues there whatsoever. I didn't even think to look into the restaurant option, so if it was open (or not) during our stay I wasn't really aware. The lobby is a very relaxing atmosphere, and the lemon water is a nice welcoming touch, as is the wine during the late afternoon.Loved our room. I decided to reserve one of the corner rooms and I wasn't disappointed. Large and airy, we really loved it. I don't recall any cleanliness issues - everything was very clean for the most part. I also especially liked the Starbucks Verismo brewer -- took a bit to get the hang of it (I don't think the instructions were very clear!) but once I did the lattes were absolutely delicious.Considering the prices of most of the hotels in Waikiki, I think this hotel's rates are appropriate for what you are getting. Not too high, and not so low that you might question your choice.Not only would I recommend this hotel for those who don't want to be in the middle of downtown Waikiki, but I know we would definitely go back. Someday!

I paid extra for a beach view room, but when I got into my room, all I could see what the buildings infront of mine and I could see the beach in between the two buildings. Not ideal. The room was beautiful. I loved the wood floors and the bed was HUGE! It was away from the chaos, about a mile or so and was peaceful. I would stay here again, but I would NOT pay extra for their beach view room again.

This hotel is quite nice, it's very clean and comfy there, the rooms are extremely comfortable and well-designed. Still the stuff wasn't polite, which was the only minus I foundbut I would recommend it

My husband and I stayed here 2 nights when we arrived in Honolulu on the first part of our trip. We liked the quiet setting across from a great passive use park and with views of both the ocean and of the mountain from our balcony. The walk into town was a short, enjoyable one so we didn't mind being a bit apart from the hubbub of Waikiki as this hotel is outside of the main hotel area. For us, that was good as it made for nice quiet evenings and mornings.The staff was pleasant and helpful. Our room and the premises were clean. They lent us bikes when we wanted to ride and beach chairs and towels when we were headed to the beach. The restaurant was not open when we were there and that would have been nice to have, but otherwise we had a pleasant experience here.

I stayed at Lotus for one night on a Friday night with my Shiba dog due to having the house fumigated. Most everything is as noted in other reviews: * no on-property restaurant * only one elevator * 12 floors with 5 (??) rooms per floor * small in-room refrigerator * flat screen HDTV * cork puller and ice bucket in room * alarm clock / player with iPod dock. * location near urban core of Waikiki, but not in it * wonderful staff * nice, quiet location adjacent Kapiolani Park * in-room hardwood floors that seemed rather strange at first * shower (no soaking bath) * complimentary wi-fi * complimentary coffee & tea service in lobby (morning) * complimentary wine service in lobby (evening) * beach chairs & towels available for guest use * cruiser bicycles available for guest use * valet only parking * calming 'zen-like' theme throughout hotelWhat made this place a great choice for me was that it was pet friendly (I needed a place to stay with my dog) and because it's not in the urban core of Waikiki. The general ambience of the place is more like that of properties in Kaanapali, Maui; as opposed to typical urban core Waikiki hotels.I think this is a special preference type hotel; not for people with 'big box' hotel (Hilton, Marriott, Hyatt) expectations who need all the associated on-property restaurants, bars, pools, nightclubs, etc.

This hotel is a great place to stay to be out of the tourist density. It is quiet and peaceful. The hotel has a sweet little lobby with iced lemon water, complimentary wine in the late afternoon, free apples and breaky and coffee pod machine in room. We went for a great bike ride out of town and it was cool....and yes, free bikes - how good is that! It was only a 15min walk into the heart of the action, and we enjoyed walking in and out. The beds we super comfy, and the staff just lovely. We were very happy campers!

I'm giving the Aqua Lotus 5 stars because I would stay there again without hesitation, not because it was perfect. It's a few minutes' walk from downtown Waikiki -- this may not suit you (whoever you happen to be), but I was fine with it and it means that the Lotus is much quieter than may otherwise be expected of Waikiki hotels. Sunrises in June are blocked from optimal off-the-premium-balcony photography on floors 1-8 by a tree, but there's an open-air fire escape that provides ample photographic opportunity. The property is an older-but-renovated property -- I was satisfied with the state of everything I encountered, ymmv, and (more importantly) wasn't constantly disturbed by A/C or neighbor noise -- and the main restaurant was closed for renovation while I was there. Additionally they had router problems on their wireless guest network for a bit -- but T-Mobile has solid 4G coverage there, so I worked right around it. Their staff is solidly fantastic: friendly, helpful, and accommodating. So, quiet location, reasonable price, great staff, totally acceptable facilities: I'd stay here again and thus give it 5 stars.

Stayed at aqua lotus for5nights in June.This was the last stop of our 5week trip to USA.Based on all the reviews on this website I was really looking forward to our stay at Aqua Lotus.This review is an honest review based on the room and service .Check in was at 7pm ,quick, efficient and friendly. Most of the questions were asked by myself and then I found out we were given a room on the 3rd floor,enquired why I didn't get a high floor, was told would be $20 more per night.This information would have been handy when booking.So we decided to see the room before deciding to upgrade.Our room was on level 3 right in front of the laundry and ice room. We agreed to stay in this room just because of the laundry,another big mistake.The ice machine is very noisy and we could hear the noise most of the time.Also this room is a very noisy with noise continuously coming from above and next doors.this was very very annoying.Room was big with 2twin beds, bathroom was old,and toilet blocked a few times.Facilities in room were iron,safe,hair dryer ,coffee machine and fridge-no mini bar which didn't bother us as we never touch things from there.I was very unhappy with our room as it was the lowest level from which rooms are in.level 2 has breakfast which you can purchase, free coffee and tea available from 7am to 10am.Also restaurant opening in July 2013 on level 2.moving to the elevator , what can I say.....14floors and one elevator which takes more then 5minutes to get if you are lucky.we managed to use the stairs on most occasions after waiting more than 5minutes .also note our room had a security alarm sensor,made me worry about security of our room as it could be easily accessed by outsiders as the corridor was open hallways.Our room cleaner was very efficient and did her job really good.Another good point was the coin laundry room which accepts quarters only $1 for wash and $1.50 for dryer,only issue was thy need to be cleaned and serviced regularly as dryer was not working on one selection. I was looking forward to a great end to our holidays at Aqua Lotus, this wasn't the case.We had booked 4months in advance and were looking forward to our stay here.the staff were the friendliest bunch, they helped us with any queries from bus information to shopping mall queries.The staff made our stay very pleasant.

...that this hotel didn't have a restaurant. It had a little area on the second floor that was more like a cafe, and they served breakfast (complimentary coffee/tea, bagels, pastries, fresh cut fruit, etc.), but considering the Lotus was a bit of a walk away from the Waikiki hotels (and that the New Otani hotel next door required reservations for their restaurant), I would have had a much more convenient stay during June 2013 if they operated their own restaurant. I also had a bad experience the first time ordering breakfast here: I walked into the second floor and asked the employee there (a man with short black hair) if this was their restaurant, and he gave me an attitude saying, "This is it!" I already felt put off while ordering a bagel with cream cheese and lox, and when I brought it back to my room, the capers that came along with it was sloppily plopped all over the container. My bagel was wet and soggy. However, a few days later during my stay, I reluctantly entered the second floor again and a nice lady with blonde hair greeted me with a more welcoming attitude and prepared my breakfast much more neatly. I wish I could've met her the first time rather than the other employee. However, some earlier reviewers mentioned that this hotel is planning to add a restaurant to their facilities, so that will certainly be advantageous to future guests.Other than that, my stay here was great. I liked that it was away from the main part of Waikiki so that I can enjoy some peace and quiet during the daytime. The staff was always friendly to me and always tried to make conversation like asking me where I've been visiting while I've been in Hawaii, my future plans, and giving me sightseeing suggestions. My room was always clean when I returned to it. Although they don't have any on-site spas or restaurants like the other hotels, I think that they networked very well with an outside massage service called Infinity, and a local food delivery service that provided a dine-out menu to guests. I think these are what have kept costs low for hotel guests; low overhead costs for the hotel. On top of that, the refreshing ice water they provide in the lobby and the complimentary wine between 4pm-6pm are great perks. One more critical word: the lobby has these lovely sofas that look adorable, but do need a bit of cleaning. I saw a couple of stains on them during my stay. Other than that, the floor is always swept and the facilities look clean.

We had a wonderful stay at the Lotus! Our room was much larger than we expected and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and courteous. Everyone seemed to go out of their way to make us comfortable. I cannot recommend this hotel enough! I wouldn't think of staying at any other hotel in Waikiki.

We were very impressed with the Lotus hotel. The rooms were well-appointed, lovely and spacious and had the most beautiful views of Diamond head and the ocean. The staff could not have been more helpful and were quick to advise of all the great services the hotel had to offer including free iced water in the lobby, bikes and towels available to use for free and Wine-o'clock in the lobby. The Lotus is located a short 15-20min walk from Waikiki beach which means it is away from all the busy streets but also means you are not in the centre of the action and may need to walk/bike/taxi to where you want to go each day. A beautiful, small hotel with wonderfully helpful staff.

I travel a lot and the in word for the last few years seems to be Boutique. I'd like someone to define what criteria makes that a fact for a hotel. I stayed here for 4 nights in July 2012, so the restaurant was still not open. So a thermoses of free coffee in the morning or glass of house wine in the evening are the only beverages on offer. There is also no uninterrupted view of the beach or ocean, which can be seen in the distance or a partial view between the condos Which for a beach front category hotel is a bit of a letdown. The rooms are nice and minimal furnished, which is a good thing, coffee, free wifi, so the usual list, but you don’t come to Hawaii to stay in your room all the time. They offer bikes and free yoga on the beach, but I cannot rave about this like others. I stayed at the hotel next door recently and the difference in amazing Pacific ocean view rooms and a good service makes me rank the Lotus as 3 ½ stars, I’ve stayed in over 5 hotels in Wakiki in the last couple of years, so I think this ranking is realistic. All other reviews about great location away from the crowds are true. Excellent location, but this is not the only hotel in this area, so pay your money and take your choice.

Great hotel. Great staff. Great everything. Arrived at Aqua Lotus on June 9, 2013 and was immediately impressed with the hotel and staff. They were friendly and helpful from the valet to the front desk clerk. After hearing it was our first time in Hawaii, he gave us tons of recommendations ranging from food to activities to where we could find the best beaches. As an added surprise, he upgraded us to the corner suites, which are VERY much worth it. The mountain and beach view is simply breathtaking. Everyday from 4-6 there is complimentary wine served in the lobby. Some wine, the view from our balcony, and the perfect Hawaii weather made for one of the best experiences I have ever had in a hotel. I won't bore you with the details of the rest of our trip but I will highly recommend you try this place out! You will not be disappointed at all!

I would give the Aqua Lotus 6 stars if I could. We are residents of Hawaii and have stayed at all the big, expensive hotels in Waikiki and Kahala. Without exception, the Lotus offered us the best hotel experience we have had since Kona Village closed its doors! My top priorities are always a really quiet room, a good bed, a lanai door that allows one not to use the A/C, which was actually pretty decent, compared to other properties. The thoughtful amenities: fresh ice water, crisp apples, daily newspaper, afternoon wine in the lobby may seem like tiny details, but they are appreciated. The room was spotless and cleaned on time every morning. Everyone from the valet boys, front desk, and housekeeping should be given a raise..they are all wonderful and seem to take real pride in their jobs.Every employee we came in contact with is from Hawaii and exuded aloha spirit at its best. I am not a high maintenance hotel guest, but I do require really good basics, and the Lotus delivered! With the best ocean in the world just a minute's stroll away and beautiful, green Kapiolani Park at our front door, the Lotus was perfect for us. Mahalo nui loa.

If your looking for quality lodging close to the action then lotus aqua is a very good option.Premium rooms are excellent. Good bathrooms, good beds, wifi included.Beach small and not crowded. 10 mins walk to Waikiki prime along the park/beach front. Perfect At the end of the day! Small walk home! Room cost is moderate. But you always expect to pay a premium for this position. I recommend you consider this as an option for your stay. Staff very helpfull. Wes and others are always willing to assist.

This hotel is not a resort (nor, for that matter, are most if not all of the hotels in Waikiki). It has no pool and is surrounded by parking lots. We knew that before we arrived and were very happy with our stay. The room is decent sized and comfortable, with nice amenities. The staff are friendly and helpful. I like the location in the park and away from the crowds of Waikiki. The nearby beach is perfectly nice. All things considered it is a good option and a good value for Honolulu.

We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel is close to Kapi'olani park and Waikiki aquarium. It is reasonably close to the commercial district but situated in a quiet locality and avoids the noise and madness of central Waikiki.The room was well-furnished and recently updated. We went with a premium view room and the upgrade was worth it for the view of the diamond head and the ocean.The hotel provides access to a private beach shared with another property. The beach is small but clean and the waters clear and calm. This was ideal for a novice swimmer like me. The hotel provides complimentary beach chairs and towels.The best part of this hotel is the staff. Everyone I met was very friendly and helpful and it really made our trip all that more enjoyable.There are a few nice touches:- Wine served in the evenings in the main lobby. Great little gesture from the staff to organize this daily and we enjoyed a glass of wine on the house in the evenings.- Free bicycle rentals to bike to Waikiki if you are so inclined.- Free internet.- Good breakfast.There is no lunch or dinner available on premises. I believe they plan to launch a restaurant later this year. The most reasonable food option in the area is Barefoot Beach Cafe in Kapi'olani park.We enjoyed our stay very much and I heartily recommend this hotel.

We booked this boutique hotel based on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. I had requested a high level room as I am a light sleeper and we were put on level 12, the top floor. Room was bright and spotlessly clean. Bathroom modern and also spotless. Had a shower cubicle rather than old type bathtub which was nice. TV needs attention though in that picture was misshaped, probably using analogue signal or something weird. One thing though, you do need a car as it is a long way from Waikiki. See tip for parking suggestion. There is no restaurant currently, but I believe this is only during renovations. Overall, great hotel.

Just returned from our second year of staying in Hawai'i and at the Aqua Lotus. We happened upon it by chance last year but came back this year because of how much we enjoyed the Aqua Lotus. Everyone there is incredibly friendly and the service is amazing - we were both somewhat shocked when we checked in this year and Sarah recognized us.The location is great. While you aren't directly on Waikiki, we find that a bonus. It's a quick walk through the park to get up to Waikiki (literally) for the famous beach, shopping and other tourist interests, but when you're ready for some peace and quiet you have it. We very much enjoyed our balcony each year and having a glass of wine while watching the surf or Diamond Head.Looking forward to next year already.

This was my second time staying at the Aqua Lotus hotel while visiting Waikiki. My first stay was with my husband when we flew down to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We were treated so wonderfully, the room was amazing and comfortable that when we decided to take another trip to Oahu I did not hesitate to book again with the aqua lotus. I am so glad we did book again with them, because my stay the second time around was just as memorable and wonderful as the first time! This is now officially my home away from home when I go visit Waikiki. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a fantastic, relaxing and memorable trip. You will feel like family and royalty all in one while staying at this hotel.

We chose Aqua Lotus because of Trp Advisor reviews. Service is excellent, goes beyond getting the job done. For example, twice I had to have documents printed and by the time I called the front desk to see if they got my email, they were already doing the printing. We had a corner room which is larger than standard, and it was one of the most roomy hotel rooms we have ever had, anywhere. We did not have a rental car in Oahu so had not only our luggage but golf bags and still there was plenty of room to keep everything stored neatly and out of the way. The restaurant was closed for an impending remodel, but the hotel served a variety of breakfast items starting at 6 am and all at reasonable prices. We took advantage of the dining options at the New Otani hotel next-door. The only drawback with the Lotus is that the only good way to get to "the action" in Waikiki is walking......which we did.......and it was a nice stroll. But for someone with mobility issues, it might be a bit out of the way. The Lotus was clean, quiet, well-appointed and with all-around high level of service. Where else has a custodian ever thanked me for staying at his hotel? That level of pride in execution was evident throughout.

Great Service,Employees and Room. Positives: Great Views...close to the beach(free towels and chairs - Free Bike usages, close to the Zoo, Aquarium, Waikiki eat and drinking locations, shopping. They provided wines couple nights we were there and even free massage in the lobby.

Let me start with the fact that I am in the hospitality business. That being said, I would be proud to have any of the Aqua Lotus staff work for me. Upon arrival there was a misunderstanding regarding the requested room. The attending bellman, wish I could remember his name, went to the front desk to resolve the issue. It was addressed quickly and without any argument. I live in a rural area and the quieter end of Waikiki work well for my husband and I. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and the decor pleasant. Although not directly on the beach, it is a very short stroll to a uncrowded beach with calm, clear water (who needs a pool, you're in Hawaii). A short walk through the park and pass the aquarium is the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach with dozens of restaurants. I have already recommended the Aqua Lotus to others and look forwarded to returning someday. Great Job!!!!!

I got this tip from a family friend, that the Aqua Lotus was the place to stay. I will be back: it's out of the wildness of Waikiki with perfect views of Diamond Head and across from the enormous Kapiolani Park. I could easily get to the fun on the famous beach, but I wasn't in the swirl, a perfect fit for me. The small property was excellent, although they do need to fix the bearings on the elevator door -- it grinds like mad with every open and close and can be heard in the quiet. Rooms were very nice, and it was just right for me.The lobby had a big carafe of icewater with mint or fruit in it in the afternoon, and the rooms had very sophisticated espresso machines, although the instructions were kind of hard to understand and in general those "pod" machines make awesome coffee but lots of waste, so it's a luxury but a bit too much. (I liked it but wouldn't own one.) The lobby also had lovely koa panels and tasteful decor, and was very small so it felt like a living room.

i suggest to every european to stay away from this hotel!after 24 hours of flying you get a room with a beautiful view of.... the car park!welcome to honolulu!i had a Room Type: Diamond Head View Premium and asked to be transfered, but was told that the hotel was fully booked.....while on the internet the rooms were offered with 30% (!) reduction!5 dreadful days for $ 2000.- !!!! (without breakfast)they praise themselves with tripadvisor, don’t believe a word (just read below)the hotel has no pool and no beach front (access between the blocks to 5sqm of sand)the premium rooms have 2 balconies.... on the second balcony you can’t even swing a cat (see photo)no restaurant no bar, just a breakfast army dining hallone elevator for the whole hotelroom is not cleanthey are talking about rennovations.... see the mould in the shower and rust on the sink plug (photos)the peaceful night in paradise starts with street noise. when it finally stops , the cheap fridge must announce loud and clear when the compressor starts working and also everytime it stops!have a relaing holiday!  and if you decide to book a room in this heaven, don’t book directly with the hotel (let them pay the booking.com/orbitz.com etc commission) even if they talk about cheapest offer!PSFEB 22ND THE MANAGER PROMISED ME A PEANUT REFUND OF $200.- ....... I AM STILL FIGHTING FOR IT!!!!!what is the trip-advisor note doing at their reception......???

Our stay there was great! It was off the beaten path and quiet. The staff made us feel very welcome, and every night there was free wine in the lobby! How great is that? You could even go on a bike ride around Kapiolani Park and Diamond Head. The beach outside of the hotel was great for adults and children. Each room has a great view of beach and Diamond Head. Spectacular!!!!

Overall a pleasant stay near Waikiki. Positives include a retreat from the heavy tourist area of Waikiki but close enough to experience it all. Travis is what made this property standout. He was attentive, always helpful and wanted to make our stay special. Allen also was pleasant. We stayed in an ocean view premium on the 12th floor. The full view of Diamond Head and expansive views of the ocean were excellent. It is a smaller property so the feel is relaxed. The beach is close and it seemed more locals were at this end of the beach so we never missed the pool. While they offer free coffee in the morning, it is odd that they have a large area on the second floor for a restaurant but it is largely unused at this time. The wine in the afternoon is a nice touch and we appreciated the lemon water throughout the day. The bikes are fun but both needed air in the tires and it did not appear the staff was interested ensuring the maintenance of the bikes. For the price of the room, I would have expected better soundproofing. You unfortunately hear conversations through the connecting doors in the room. On the plus side, housekeeping goes out of their way to ensure you have what you need for a comfortable stay. The location is great for taking walks around Diamond Head which provide great views of the ocean.

We thoroughly enjoyed our quiet location although it was a decent walk to town. We made good use of the complimentary bikes which was a fun and faster way of getting around. Taxi was approx $15 from lotus to the pink palace which we thought was pricey but largely due to the maze of one way streets! You are unable to book bikes so first in first served. We stayed in a premium ocean view room which had a wrap around balcony and spectacular views. I would recommend requesting a room number ending in '21' rather than '25' as although they are both premium ocean view they are on opposite sides of the hotel and the '21' has far superior and less obstucted views. We were disappointed that although we had requested a king bed we were put in s room with 2 small double beds and were unable to change because the hotel was full for duration of our stay. Unfortunately they stipulate that they cant guarantee which bedding configuration you will get but this was definitely an issue for us and we would have booked elsewhere had we known we would be in a room with double beds. The lift was slow as there is only one in the hotel so make sure you allow for this. Apart from those two issues it was a lovely hotel. Allen the bell boy was extremely knowledgable and helpful, Sarah at the front dest was extremely accommodating and friendly as was Denise in the breakfast restaurant. The rooms were beautiful, spacious, airy,inviting and quiet and we all enjoyed the complimentary wines between 4-6pm each day down in the lobby and as we were a party of 6 the lobby was a lovely area to socialise and play cards etc. If you would like to travel any distance you need to book the shuttles a day ahead or you will be paying for an extremely expensive taxi fare EG $140 round trip to the outlet stores in a taxi as opposed to $22 in a shuttle but they require a days notice. The beach was lovely for sunning and swimming and the hotel provide you with beach towels and mats. We had two outstanding dinners and both only steps from the hotel. The first at Hau tree Lanai and the other at Michele's .. I would highly recommend both of these restaurants. Happy holidaying :-)

It's my first time in Hawaii and i had a great time. Excellent view of the Diamond Head and Ocean View. This hotel really made my trip unforgettable and i will definitely come back. Nice and clean room, coffee is free in my room, free wine near the lobby, our bed and pillow are so comfortable, great space for a family, and most of all the staffs are so friendly and helpful. 5 mins walk to the beach. You can ask for beach chair, beach towel and bikes at the front desk at no cost. Staff will also help you with the directions and places that you can't miss while your in honolulu. Im so happy that i choose this hotel and to all the staff thank you that you made our stay so comfortable, relaxing and we really enjoyed our stay.

The location made for excellent views from my room of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. The property is also conveniently located next door to an outstanding restaurant called Michel's and Kaimana Beach for breakfast next to the beach, not to mention that you are within easy walking distnace to the hustle of Waikiki with shops and entertainment. Or you can simply relax in an elegantly decorated room with great amenities such as a coffee maker (with extra pods supplied by housekeeping), a refrigerator - which is unusual for hotels nowadays, complimentary bottled drinking water - nice touch, an I-pod stand, and did I mention the views?The staff "live" the Aloha Spirit and are ever so eager to be helpful and friendly, from the time we checked the car with Valet to Check-in to Housekeeping. What a breath of fresh air! The lobby even had complimentary lemon water for when you come back from a walk and need to replenish. Yes, we will be back again and will tell all of friends that this IS the place to stay!

This just has to be one of the best values in Honolulu. We love the location, far enough away from the hubbub of Waikiki for a good nights sleep (in an attractive, clean, well equipped room and a comfy bed) but yet just a short walk to great restaurants, activities, and sights. My wife and I checked out the free bikes and rode all over Honolulu. The valet parking fee is reasonable however, we had no problem parking for free a short walk away along Paki or Mansarrat Avenues.

This hotel MADE my trip. Every single staff member was friendly and helpful. They truly care about their guests. The location was PERFECT...away from busy Waikiki Beach, but close enough to walk to it. What makes it even better is that there are really nice small beaches close by too. The room was beautiful, clean, and extremely comfortable. It had gorgeous, relaxing views of the ocean and Diamond Head. As someone who has neck and back problems, the bed was awesome. Instead of using an air mattress, I could actually sleep on their bed. I haven't been able to sleep on a hotel bed (except for Radisson Hotels) in years. They are renovating their restaurant, which I hope will be affordable despite the restaurants nearby being ridiculously expensive. However, they do sell light breakfast options. The food was very tasty, fresh and well prepared. The homemade granola is the best I have ever had...yes the granola. I hope they sell it at some point. It was flavorful and hearty, but not so hard you could break a tooth. The service from everyone there was nothing short of amazing. I have traveled plenty inside and outside of the United States to know what a true gem this hotel is. I hope it stays exactly the way it is (except for the restaurant). I would go back to Hawaii just to stay at this hotel. That is how great it is!!

Yup, it took some fiddling around to make the machine work, but the cappuccinos were pretty good (with no extra charge). Another outstanding feature was the comfort of the mattresses, which have a plush top layer. However, the beds are somewhat smaller than typical, and we were woken up at midnight by a loud party above us. Overall we were pleased to find many nice amenities described by others. For those who do not wish to pay $20/day for hotel parking, it is possible to find metered street parking nearby, or free parking at Kaimana Beach Park or the opposite side of Kapiolani Park. Unfortunately, Kapiolani Park has become sketchy at night and my wife did not feel safe walking alone between the hotel and Waikiki.

I can't say enough nice things about it! My only complaint is the lack of "Hawaian" music in the public areas and elevators. Music ranged from classical to rock. For me, that was disappointing.For an inexpensive and fun breakfast, head down the street to the Barefoot Beach Cafe just past the Aquarium. Friday nights watch the Hilton Hawai'ian Village fireworks from the same spot!

We really enjoyed staying at Aqua Lotus in Honolulu. Easy walking distance into the busy Waikiki, the Aquarium and the Zoo!. Staff there are very helpful and very friendly. We asked for a Japanese restaurant recommendation near the hotel, and it was so tasty and good value for money we went back again the 2nd day! The hotel also have complimentary red and white wine in the hotel lounge daily between 4pm-6pm and chilled lemon water in also availble in the hotel lobby during the day for hotel guests. We had a great view of Diamond Head Crater, the ocean and the Waikiki beach from the balcony in our room. Have told our travel agent to recommend his clients to stay at Auqa Lotus Honolulu. We will definitely stay there again when we are in Honolulu again.

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Lotus for 5 days earlier this month, and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The location of the hotel is perfect - right across the street from the STUNNING Diamond Head, and within walking & biking distance from the madness of Waikiki. We really loved being a little bit removed from the hustle and bustle when we came "home" to our hotel. The rooms at the Aqua Lotus are beautiful - newly remodeled and just gorgeous. The bed is like a big cloud to sleep on. :) The staff was all super nice and very helpful, and we had so much fun riding the free beach cruisers around to explore the rest of the area. If there was one "negative" at all about our stay, it's that the restaurant at the hotel isn't operating right now, so we had to go off-site for all of our meals, which of course isn't terrible, but sometimes it's convenient to be able to eat right downstairs from your room. Thank you so much to everyone (especially Corinne) at the Aqua Lotus, we can't wait to return! Denise & Russ

My husband and I loved the location of this hotel. Nestled on the Diamond Head side of Waikiki, it's far from the crowds of tourists. We woke up to a beautiful view of the mountain and a semi-obstructed (1 hotel) view of the ocean. There is a nice walkway along the beach that takes you to the more busy part of Waikiki (about 15-20 minutes). The hotel staff were friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. The valet made some great suggestions about local restaurants. There was no pool, but I enjoyed the short walk to the beach. It was pretty secluded when I went. I must say that the hotel buidling was disappointing. The lobby and elevator were in need of some sprucing up. The hotel website photos were outdated. The room, while clean and spacious, had several issues. There were stains on the ceilings, smudges on the bathroom counters, and the sliding wooden door to the lanai would not budge. We had to call the front desk twice (sliding door which required a crowbar to move and missing tv remote control). The room safe appeared to be very insecure. It was on a pedastal which was wobbly. The room also smelled somewhat musty. It was nice, though, to have the double lanais to air out the space. I booked the room through Jetsetter. Had I read a more honest review, I would have booked elsewhere. Overall, this hotel was adequate.

Stayed for 5 nights and found it to be an oasis from the Waikiki bustle. We used the complimentary beach bikes to pedal our way a few blocks to the nightlife further down the road.
