Very relaxing and the service was outstanding. The hotel does not have a pool but the accommodations made me so mellow that I did not mind walking past the next building to get to the beach. Oh, and beach chairs were readily available from the valet. Will stay here again!

Located near Diamond Head, the Aqua Lotus is everything we wanted. Steps from the beach, near Queens Park, the Aquarium, the Zoo, fine dining Michel's Restaurant, and the (private) Outrigger Canoe Club.It's elegant, quiet, friendly staff, clean, great views of Diamond Head, the ocean, the park and Waikiki.Breakfast is available on the second floor, but more importantly, it is walking distance to our favorite breakfast place: Bogart's on Monsarrat. Looking forward to going back there.

The hotel is small, clean,simplle, andquaint (loved that it had hardwood floors instead of carpet). There was not a staff member who did not greet me with a smile or assistance, they made me feel like I was someone important. The location is great and the environment is so diverse, from upper class to skid row. The complimentary bikes the hotel offers gave us an opportunity to explore our surroundings in a safe and active manner. I will like to give a special thanks to Aqua Lotus staff member Joshua,Allen, and Travis. If ever I return to Oahu, Aqua Lotus will be where we stay.

A friend referred us to this hotel. We wanted to be away from the main Waikiki area and didn't know what to expect from this hotel. Overall, it's clean, nice linens, it's small so it's never too crowded but what stands out the most is the outstanding service from the staff. They are low-key but so friendly and helpful and go out of their way to make something work. Would stay here for sure next time in Oahu.

The rooms are quite nice, and the service is really exceptional. However, there are just a few things that one expects when reading the reviews on TA that fall short. There is no pool, and the "public" beach a few steps away is really public (down market). The Internet in the room could have been better supported, and the breakfast is ONLY cold stuff. The coffee, while free, is in the restaurant (and not that good). Why you cannot have a coffee maker in the room (small Nexpresso machine with 1 packet) is a mystery. Service is a bit haughty at times, but almost everyone tries to accommodate. The rooms are tasteful.

This little gem exceeded our expectations - lovely peaceful room, friendly staff, wine happy hour, complimentary bikes...everything was great. Thank you to all of the staff that were so sweet during our stay.

Our family stayed at this hotel for the first time. It is a great location, not in the heart of Waikiki, but still convenient and close enough for the beach and restaurants. The staff there was very friendly and accommodating.

This was our 2nd stay at this hotel. After many visits to Honolulu/Waikiki we long ago decided that locations in the Kapiolani Park area beat the hustle and bustle of Central Waikiki. Still only a short walk to get to that action if you want to. My wife and I both like to exercise and nothing beats the trails at Diamondhead or jogging in the park. The beach in front of the hotel is great and the hotel provides beach towels and chairs for guests. Another big plus are the complimentary bikes for guest use. Check this place out! You won't be dissapointed.

I stayed here for a second time and continue to love the simplicity and general comfort of this hotel. The small beach is lovely and not crowded. The view of Diamond Head is as good as any view of the ocean. Everything has a high quality feel to it but there are no unwanted 'frills' which would just increase the price. I liked the Starbucks coffee maker in the room which was new since my last visit. They have a beautiful dining room with a bar which is unused (except for breakfast) and I am hoping that they may add a restaurant.

I absolutely love this hotel! The staff is awesome, the rooms are terrific, and the view of Diamond Head and the park from the corner rooms especially is just perfect. It's close enough to Waikiki to walk but far enough from the madness that you actually can get some peace and quiet. This place is not for families as they do not have many of the traditional amenities like a pool, hottub or even a restaurant. But for the savvy traveler seeking a classy and relaxing alternative to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, this place is your best bet.

Our family of four recently stayed three nights at the Aqua Lotus. The staff bent over backward to make sure we had a wonderful stay there. The rooms are very nice and well equipped with fast easy wifi, spa level toiletries, a complimentary bottle of Hawaiian purified water, a filled ice bucket, etc. Easy access to the beach and some wonderful restaurants. Highly recommend!

We spent 2 nights at the Aqua Lotus and loved it. Our room was a corner on the 11th floor, with a great view of the beach, diamond head and the park. I definitely recommend paying extra for the corner room on the higher floors. We especially enjoyed the large veranda. The quiet location is great with a nice beach a 3 minute walk and they even loan beach chairs and towels. Some nice touches are the complimentary wine from 4-6 daily and the complimentary bicycles that we enjoyed riding to lunch in this quiet area. There are several nice restaurants nearby.

We had booked 11 days somewhere else downtown to only check out after a day due to the constant traffic and truck noise. We sort out somewhere quieter that was actually renovated & actually had a view minus all the noise. We happened upon the Aqua Lotus and were delighted with all of these things. From the moment you enter your room, to the nightly free wines downstairs, to the lovely views across the big park to the water with minimal noise at night, we just loved it. The staff were all a delight and it was hard to leave on the last day we were so fond of it. Our stay there ended up costing us $500 less then we had originally budgeted based on the other hotel, so we came out really in front. Michelle

From the moment we arrived on site, the staff was warm and so accomodating - attentive to all our needs. Our well-appointed room on the 12th floor had views of Diamond head and the beach! We arrived in the afternoon to complimentary wine in the lobby - something that apparently happens every evening from 4 to 6. And the hotel location is away from the hub-bub of Waikiki - peaceful and relaxing. And again, I just cannot say enough about the staff at the Aqua Lotus - they really went above and beyond what was expected of them and made our already wonderful stay, even more wonderful..

The staff immediately make you feel welcome at this hotel. Perhaps because it is a smaller hotel, the staff are much more personable than at larger hotels. There is access to a private beach area which is quite small, but you can easily walk to other beaches. The hotel provides free towels, beach chairs, and umbrellas for guests. The location is great because it's set away from the noise and tackiness of Waikiki but it's an easy walk if you want to hit the stores and restaurants there. The area next to the park along the south side of Kalakaua isn't well lit at night so we chose to cross the street and walk under the street lamps.The view of Diamond Head every morning is absolutely gorgeous. Rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. There is no restaurant on site, which would be nice after a busy day when you are tired are just want to grab a quick bite at the hotel before bed. Despite the "no smoking" sign on the glass door leading to the balcony, our neighbors smoked on the balcony every day, and each time they would light up we would have to leave the balcony. It would be better if the hotel would emphasize the no-smoking on the balcony policy upon check-in. There is no business center to print boarding passes, but the front desk was happy to print our boarding passes for us. The friendliness and helpfulness of the entire staff really made an impression on us. Overall, a great place to stay in Oahu.

What a wonderful place to stay! Our room was large, beautifully decorated, extremely clean and comfortable. The bathroom was filled with soft plump towels, the combination shower/tub was so luxurious - very spacious and lined with stone, not tile. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets rich and silky. My wife wanted to take the bed home, it was that relaxing. The view from our 12th story unit was breathtaking. Walking out of our front door we had a million dollar view of downtown. The view from our deck was Diamondhead and the beach. Of note the hotel treats guests to wine in the lobby from 4 to 6 PM. It was more than decent wine and fun to talk to other guests. They also offer coffee and tea plus a light breakfast. I cannot eat wheat and many breakfast items contain wheat, so the staff prepared some yogurt as well as a plate of fresh fruit - just for me, compliments of the hotel!The staff were welcoming, helpful and kind to us. We also loved the location which was past the parks located at the southern end of downtown. No tourist noise or traffic here. Mornings were walked along the beach-fronted park or through the park next door. Later we visited the zoo and aquarium, both nearby. Yet, we were still in easy walking distance of the downtown.The hotel does not have a pool, but has esay access to the beach. It also provides complementary bicycles for guests.Great location for a vacation or extended stay.

Stayed two nights in the penthouse suite. Very spacious and takes up the whole top floor. Elevator (the only one in the hotel) stops at the 12th floor and you need to take the stairs up to the suite. There is a lanai that wraps around pretty much the whole suite. Unobstructed view of Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park but the view toward the ocean is mostly blocked by three large buildings. The room contains unique older wood furnishings. There's a full kitchen. The room was very quiet. There is no restaurant or room service although they do serve a mostly continental breakfast on the 2nd floor. The the room really needs some updating though. The sofa is stained and should be replaced or reupholstered. Some areas of the wallpaper are peeling away from the walks and the curtains are very old. The carpet is dirty, the marble floors are very old as is the kitchen. The shower in the master bedroom is very small. Basically, the whole suite needs updating. It just had a very dated appearance. Too bad too, as it could be a really super nice place with some work. Service was good and friendly. I'd definitely stay again if the room was given a makeover.

Great location with pleasant walk down to iconic Waikiki. The meet and greet develops into a really informative chat about how the place works. Hotel room was newly renovated, stylish, spacious and good views. Staff organised early wake up call and taxi which worked seamlessly. A no hassle stay.

I must say this is by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. The staff were beyond friendly and accommodating. I called to request a higher room since I read some bad reviews about the lower floors and got exactly that. The view from the balcony is peaceful and breathtaking. It felt good to walk away from the busy city and lay my head in a quiet area. Everything is in a 10min walking distance. The hotel provides complimentary towels, bikes and WINE from 4-6pm. Everything in the room was spotless. I absolutely loved my experience here and will definitely return. Although there isn't a restaurant it helps that there are local restaurants and hotel dining options within walking distance. If anyone is looking to take a relaxing trip DO NOT STAY in the middle of the city. Most of the big name hotels have balconies facing other hotels and nothing is actually on the beach. Everything is across the street from the beach. Save your money and get some peace and quiet at night. Stay at Aqua Lotus.

Small, nicely decorated and great location. I enjoyed the complimentary bikes. Friendly and helpful staff. Laid back place. The beds, in my opinion, are too soft. The wood floor was rather sticky, but other than that the room seemed very clean and cozy.

This hotel is on the far side of Waikiki near Diamond Head, with Kapiolani Park across the street.We chose this hotel because the rooms have recently been renovated in a spacious, clean, asian style. They are spotless and very comfortable, with hardwood floors, platform bed, 2 balconies on our corner location and lots of room to store our suitcases and golf bags. After travelling around for 7 weeks, this was a good choice for us. Quiet, with a view of Diamond Head and all the walkers and joggers that pass by every morning.There is not a restaurant in operation yet so it is a hike or a drive to find food. The valet parking is well run by very nice young men. There is coffee and wine served in the lobby at various times of the day. Beach towels and chairs are available to sit at the small beach down the path.If you are looking for the hubbub of typical Waikiki, you will probably be disappointed in this hotels location, but there is very good value in the room size, location and renovations. We will definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

I was in Honolulu for work and stayed at the Aqua Lotus for 6 days. I was pleasantly surprised with the clean, modern, and comfortable room. A balcony with a view of diamond head and ocean was amazing. The downside to this hotel is that they currently don't have a restaurant, however are in the process of renovating their space and putting a restaurant in. The second downside is the location, at the end of Waikiki it's slightly difficult to get places, however with the weather, it is completely walkable. I was able to walk to the shops and restaurants most of the time, but at night took a taxi. The staff were very accommodating and helpful with recommendations, and the access to a small private beach allows you to escape the wild and packed beaches of Waikiki. If you're looking to be slightly off the beaten path of the noise and cluster of Waikiki, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Bad location. Stay away. I paid for a premium diamond head view and got a view of a tree, roof and parking lot. The pics of the view on the website are misleading. The beach access and beach behind it is small don't even go to it. They don't have decaf coffee so bring your own if you go.

This hotel is the best we’ve ever been to. Not just because of the quiet, clean, and comfortable rooms, but because of their first-class hospitality and generosity. After learning that we got scammed out of our condo and spent the night in the car, they allowed us to check-in at 8 am and even provided a complimentary night on them. They let us stay as long as we needed and gave us a big discount. They also have great amenities: cribs and microwaves for the asking; beach across the parking lot; beach gear and sand toys; complimentary coffee, ice water, and wine. We also loved how it was far enough from Waikiki that it was quiet, but close enough to walk to when we wanted. Thanks Aqua Lotus for saving our vacation.

loved the location.drive right in and easy check in and in the room in minutes.everyone was so pleasant.loved the wine in the afternooncar was right there and valet pulled it right up,no waitingwill be back

We are very pleased with this hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. They have free coffee in the morning and complimentary wine from 4-6. The staff is extremely friendly. They also offer free bikes and beach towels. It is in a very active area yet the rooms are very quiet. They do not have a pool or fitness center but I can't remove the terrible rating.

I stayed in two hotels in Waikiki. This was definitely my least favorite of the two. The Lobby and the room were quite nice, the staff polite, and the area is far more quiet than other parts of Waikiki. There is also a stellar view of Diamond Head. If these are all the requirements you have, then this is your hotel.Personally, I don't care to have to walk fifteen+ minutes past areas that are less than safe to get to the very edge of everything Waikiki has to offer...particularly with shopping bags. Then there is much more walking to get to various shopping and dining venues. This is not an area I would recommend walking through at night, particularly if you are alone. It's not really rough or anything, but I wouldn't want to risk it. During one walk I saw a half naked man surrounded by police on the sidewalk; the next day I saw a man trying to hold up a beach towel and dress at the same time as he stood against a car. I also didn't like the "view" of the ocean...which was barely a view at all. The bulbs in the rooms are blindingly bright, and the cover they throw across the foot of the bed was stained. I rolled it up and tucked it away during our stay...trying not to think of what it might be stained with! In fairness, however...this was the only real cleanliness issue I had during my stay. The paint is peeling away from the outside of the building, and, though you need your key to use the elevator, your door is open to the outside...not an indoor corridor. There is also no complimentary breakfast of any sort, as I recall.All this for more than an extra hundred dollars over the price of the other hotel? No thanks! I won't be staying here again. They aren't terrible, there are just too many better options.

This was by far our most relaxing vacation!! Just far enough away from the hustle of all the stores, but close enough for a nice walk in!!! The amenities are first class (pillow, bed, and shower head) are all things I wanted to take with me!!The staff is so friendly and always helpful. Beach Chairs, beach towells, bicycles, umbrella, wine bar happy hour are all available for the asking.My only problem with the place is that it is a very long ways from home and we could not stay longer!!Well done Aqua Lotus!

We stayed in an "ocean view" corner room on the 10th floor. The ocean view is just a peekaboo view through the buildings that are actually on the beach. This was not a surprise, we got that before booking. The view of Diamond Head was stellar. We loved that the windows opened on 2 adjacent walls allowing the lovely breeze to circulate though the room. As others have noted, the elevator is incredibly slow, but we were never in that much of a rush.What we did not like was that it seemed every time we went to the lobby, there was never anyone at the front desk. We had to wait or hunt down someone to retrieve our car. Also, the "restaurant" was always out of items when we stopped in for breakfast. The "business center" is a very tiny room at the end of a dark hallway. When I went there to check into my flight and get a boarding pass, the entire stairway up was not lit and extremely dark as was the hallway getting to the room - very creepy and hard to navigate. Then when I checked into my flight, I had to pay a fee of around $7 dollars for a 10 or 15 minute session on their computer and was charged 75 cents for every page that printed out. I've never had this experience at any other hotel. If it weren't for these issues, I would have given it 4 stars.I thought that being away from the heart of Waikiki would be nice, but we found ourselves walking down there every day and then longing to be closer. We loved the upgrades made to the main avenue (Kalakaua?) and the new City Walk neighborhood at the south end of the strip and wished we had stayed down there instead.Just a side note, not about the hotel - it had been maybe 7 years since visiting Honolulu and we were appalled at how bad the traffic has become. We wasted so much time trying to drive from one spot to another. On our trip up to the north shore, the back up was so bad it took us over an hour just to get to the outskirts of town. Pity.

Afte a long day of flying to Honolulu, we were both looking to relax in our room. However, when we arrived, our reservations were not in the hotel's system. Matthew Pickett, General Manager, took the time to investigate and deternined they had forgotten to book our room and they were totally booked. He spent the time to accommodate us at a sister property with an upgrade that he would pay the difference. Matthew turned a negative experience into a very positive experience and everything was handling very well and the other accommodations were excellent. Even though we never did stay a night at the Aqua Lotus hotel to enjoy the accommodations, we would book again as everyone there bent over backwards to ensure we had a good experience with them. I would not hesitate in booking a room there again in the future.

I've stayed at the Lotus 2x (2011 and 2012) and love that it is in the quiet/peaceful "end" of Waikiki across of Kapiolani Park/Diamond Head, which in my opinion the best place to stay in Waikiki. The rooms are lovely, spacious and comfortable with a mini fridge discreetly tucked away below the t.v. in a cabinet. Bathrooms are also spacious. House-keeping is good. Although we had an "ocean view" two times, it was a brief expanse of the Pacific glimpsed through tall buildings. There is a "lack of privacy" as folks from nearby buildings can easily see into your room. The first time I stayed at the hotel there was a roof-top party with a blaring bass that went on past 9pm. While management was sympathetic, they made it clear that the party was "within" their rights to carry-on into the evening. The very comfortable bed and high count sheets were fabulous. The second time I stayed at the hotel the bed was saggy, and it wasn't possible to switch rooms which made for a sore back. I would stay at the Lotus again because of the fantastic location, the quiet "local" neighborhood and easy access to local eateries and shopping on foot. San Souci beach is a short walk away. Way less crowded, if you're game to walk further is Diamond Head Beach. FYI you can park across the street in metered public parking (free at night) to save the cost of hotel parking. However, be sure to plug your meter in the morning or find other free street parking. If you want to stay in Waikiki and have a "local experience" you will LOVE the Lotus. This is the perfect place for solo travel, a couples retreat or friend's get-away. You will immediately feel at peace and at home on this property. Diamond Head, otherwise known as Mauna Leahi is a wahi pana or sacred and storied place for Hawaiians. Being so close in proximity to the Lotus, I always feel the mana or sacred energy of Mauna Leahi can be felt on-site. I grew up on Oahu and have always loved this section of Waikiki. The only reason why the Lotus did not receive 5 stars was because of the "noisy party" and "saggy bed" situations. I travel for a living and need to receive a sound sleep for early mornings.

THe Aqua Lotus was a fantastic place to stay. We stayed for 15 nights and would highly recommend it to our friends and family. WE were pleasantly surprised at thequiet, zen like appeance of the lobby. It made you relax the minute you walked in... very nicely decorated... but yet simple. The rooms were all brand new.. very quiet.. nice view of Diamond head and view of the ocean. Saw whales from the balcony every day! Staff were more than exceptional! They were always there to service your needs. The free wine bar was a nice touch as well as the free coffee and tea the free bicycles, newspaper, beach chairs and towels, Nice to be a 5 minute drive from the business of Waikiki or a 15 minute walk. At the end of a busy day it was like coming to a second home. The staff knew us by name and were more than willing to offer their assistance. The breakfast restaurant was perfect... coffee, muffins, yogurt and granola, boiled eggs, pastry basket bagels etc...nice not to have to go out every morning...great coffee maker in room... microwaves on request and a fridge. Also washer and dryer on 3rd floor which was great for our extended stay.. nice surpirse! We will be back!

Away from the Waikiki crowd yet still in Waikiki, the Lotus will more than satisfies those looking for a quieter, friendly place to stay. Rooms are attractive, well-appointed, and of good size. What makes the Lotus excellent is the location and the staff. Everyone smiles. Everyone is helpful and committed to making your stay memorable. The wonderful San Souci beach is just steps away from the Lotus. Kapiolani park surrounds the hotel. Diamond Head looms in the distance. The hustle of Waikiki is a pleasant 20 minute walk along the shoreline. You will be glad to return to the tranquility of the Lotus.No restaurant? Who wants to eat in a hotel restaurant anyway if you have a car? Just up the road is Town restaurant, the best in Honolulu, in the Kaimuki district, about 10 minutes away. Eat malasadas at Leonard's bakery, about 7 minutes away. Go early to the Saturday Farmers Market at the community college about 7 minutes away. Eat a plate breakfast or lunch where President Obama eats at the Rainbow Drive-In about 6 minutes away. That's away from the Waikiki beach commercial madness.As for the $20/day for parking, your car is secure, delivered to you promptly and with a smile.The Lotus is for independent travelers. If that's you, the jewel is in the lotus.

Service, service, service. We found the the employees at this hotel among the most helpful we have encountered in our travels. They were uniformly cheerful and interested in meeting our needs.We liked the location, away from the more hectic area, but a nice walk along the ocean, into town. Although this hotel is not beach front, it was more than adequate in terms of view. Sunrise behind Diamond Head was lovely to watch and one of my favorite pictures from our trip is of my husband relaxing on our balcony just looking at the scenery. The room was roomy and very comfortable.

The Aqua Lotus Honolulu has the very best staff! They made us feel very welcome! Our room on the 11th floor had great views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Loved the location away from the noise of Waikiki but close enough to walk to. Everything we requested at the time of booking was provided. Nice clean room, comfortable king size bed and fridge for our drinks. Close to beach and they provide beach chairs and beach towels. Hope to stay here again!

Great Experience. Simple and well designed hotel. The rooms are comfortable and chic. Staff very friendly and helpful. The only thing the hotel is missing is a restaurant...but they have one opening soon.

I stayed two nights here. I preferred the location of being a 15 minute walk from the hubbub of Waikiki so that it would hopefully be really quiet. Like many other reviewers, I requested a king bed and got two doubles instead. Not a big deal, but this is not an inexpensive place, and I had called well in advance to request something I didn't get. The view was decent (Diamondhead) and near Sans Souci Beach. Very clean room, nice staff at check in (though I had trouble finding staff when I had to check out.) The room wasn't quite as quiet as I had hoped. Also, the price is surprisingly high given that this is a hotel without a restaurant or room service, a 15 minute walk from Waikiki where you can get to restaurants (but not a great walk after dark), no pool, no breakfast (there is coffee). I had gotten an extremely good deal on price reserving a year before, but since then the prices have doubled and I no longer think it is decent value, as there are many places within Waikiki with more to offer in terms of amenities at more reasonable prices. Four stars for the location and room quality, but less in terms of value.

Others have commented positively on the quiet location and helpful staff. We concur. We enjoyed the (limited) breakfast service and the tasteful Oriental decor throughout the hotel. As others have commented, the third floor is the least desirable. We stayed in a spacious corner "Diamond Head View Premium" room (#321) for 4 nights. The room coffee maker (Verissmo/Starbuck's) is a nice feature, along with lemon water in the lobby and wine (4-6 p.m.), also in the lobby. The nearby Hau Tree Lanai Restaurant in the New Otani Laimana Beach Hotel was good and convenient. The walk to the mid-section of Waikiki is about 20 minutes. We would stay at the Aqua Lotus Honolulu again--very nice!

I want to write an honest assessment of this hotel because I was very disappointed when we arrived for our 10 day stay. I have relied on trip advisor reviews when making reservations. But, this time I felt I did not get an accurate picture of what this hotel was going to be like. When we first arrived the front desk said we only had a reservation for 7 nights. We had a prepaid voucher for 10 nights! The clerk just kept shaking her head. There was no welcome, so happy you are staying with us!! Once in our room we found 2 double beds. I was informed that they do not guarantee king beds and that the only king available was in 2 days and would cost $40 more per night. Then she said "oh and by the way the manager said you can stay the extra 3 nights". Gee thanks! As for what the hotel actually offers....I knew we were off the beaten path away from Waikiki. That was part of the reason I chose this hotel. It is almost a mile and a half walk to the center of Waikiki. It is a lovely walk but, as another patron said, I wouldn't feel safe walking back alone at night because of the homeless population living in the parks next to the hotel. The "private" beach is a small patch of sand at the back of a parking lot down an alley through a gate that they lock up at night. There are beaches within walking distance that are much nicer.There is a restaurant but it is not open. There is no room service! The free coffee is available until 9:00am. So if you sleep in a bit you can forget that. But it isn't very easy to sleep in as you can hear the staff in the halls working very early in the morning.The rooms are kept very clean. With the exception of some mold on the shower doors and on the ceiling in the bathroom.There is one ice machine in the hotel that was so filthy I would not use the ice. There are also 2 washing machines and dryers ( in the same room as the ice machine). This room smells horribly! The machines are filthy. I went to do a load of laundry and found the staff in there washing hotel linens. This gave me pause... The hotel seems to be understaffed. There was one girl at the front desk. Many times she would be on the phone taking reservations, and unable to help any hotel patrons. This is a hotel for self sufficient guests. If you are looking for any attention at all Find a different hotel.As for what the aqua lotus does right? The VALET'S they are the true stars of the hotel. They park your car, give you directions, make suggestions. They are the concierge service of the aqua lotus. Travis in particular was very wonderful.

Great, quiet location. Friendly and helpful staff, from checking in, to housekeeping. to the valet guys. Love the complimentary coffee in the morning. lemon -ice water during the day., and the wine in the afternoon. A 3 minute walk to the Sans Souci Beach at the back of the hotel and about 10 minutes to the Waikiki Beach. The rooms are a great size with a coffee maker, bar fridge and microwave (if needed).The rooms have been remodeled, with a wonderful view of Diamond Head and the ocean, on the higher floors. Bikes, beach chairs, and yoga mats are all available. Yoga is offered in the park, accross the street, four times a week.This was my second year at this jotel and would return.

my family spend quality time @ lotus hotel last week. We stayed for 3nights and i absolutely in love with diamond head view. The mountain and ocean view was lovely (ocean is kind of hidden between other building but other things are beautiful enough). I loved spacious room and everything was prepared and lotus offer free wine and coffee time loved every detail.Then there was one minor mistake, We booked two rooms with booking.com then when we arrived at the hotel, desk person just told me they can only see one reservation. We arrived little early (during lunch time) so they are eating something while they inform this terrible news( that we only have one room). At that moment I really hated this hotel, I was with my mom and dad, they are greatly stressed about this news and I was very very upset about desk man's attitude. fortunately I had my reservation print out that clearly saids two rooms, then they said they are going to contact booking.com and sort out. I had to write it because that moment my stress level was beyong my control.BUT AFTER THAT lotus hotel's service was greatthey compansate my stress with free upgrade rooms (to better view) and free valet service.I was very happy to see how they handle this problems. My initial disappointment was all gone after that. Everyone at the desk was helpful, friendly and cheerful I loved boutique hotel atmoshere that they have. Loved beach equipment rental service and bicycle rental service loved location I will definately come back to this hotel I would gove 5 star but with one minor mistake 4 star.I can't wait until my next visit here and hope I can give 5star next time:)overall I highly recommend this hotel

This hotel is a real find! I travel to Oahu regularly and will stay here again. It is just outside the craziness of Waikiki so it is quiet, but you can still walk into Waikiki in 2 minutes. The staff was just awesome, from the valet to the housekeepers. The lobby is chic, the rooms were spacious, comfortable, and super clean. I loved everything about it. Couldn't recommend it more for a Waikiki stay.

We stayed at Aqua Lotus Honolulu for two nights prior to boarding our cruise. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms too. The room have been apparently refurbished recently. We were upset about the room at the third floor since there was a platform in front of our room with several birds. The good thing is that we could awake with birds singing, the bad thing was that they defecated in our lanai, and we had to take care of with the kids so that they would not step in the bird's feces. Moreover, the hotel is at around 15 minute walk from Waikiki, which depending on your objectives can be good or bad. The walk until Waikiki would be pleasant, however, I would not recommend making it late at night since we felt unsafe in view of the homeless population living in the park birder in the sidewalk that takes to the hotel.

This hotel was everything we could have wanted for our stay in Honolulu. Rooms are large and have spectacular views of both the ocean and Diamond Head. If you can, try to stay on one of the higher floors to ensure yourself the best views and provide a bit of "buffer" from ground level noise. Aqua Lotus is set a bit back from the main shopping/dining areas, but the walk (right along Waikiki Beach) is very pleasant at pretty much any time of the day or night. Our only qualm was that the walls are a bit thin. This didn't bother me much, but could trouble light sleepers on the lower floors. Otherwise, we couldn't ask for anything more. The staff are amazing and seemingly always willing to go the extra distance to provide an outstanding experience.

Lovely hotel at the quiet end of Waikiki. Loved coming back to our hotel and getting away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Amazing views of Diamond Head crater and lovely parks. Saw lots of Wedding photos being taken in the park across the street with the Diamond Head backdrop. One of the top ten most romantic restaurants in the US, Michels, is in the next building on the water. Expensive but worth it. Hotel has bikes for its guests and there are lots of bike paths outside the door. Free yoga classes on the beach and more importantly Happy Hour every day from 4-6. Dont miss breakfast prepared by Denise. She surprised us every day with a wonderful creation. Such a warm welcoming greeting from her every morning got our day off to a great start.

I was looking forward to staying at this hotel for 3 nights over this Easter holidays. Unfortunately I had to cancel as the hotel would not guarantee a premier ocean view room with two double beds. There were three of us on the booking 2 adults and my teenage son - aged 15. As we were flying from the Uk ( 21 hour flights) I wanted to ensure we had a room with two double beds. After booking directly with the hotel online - I emailed to ensure we could guarantee the two double bed configeration. I was told a request would be made but no guarantees and that if they couldn't give us a room with two double beds they could put a roll away bed in the room. I then emailed them to state that after that after such a long a flight we needed to know that two double beds would be guaranteed or I would need to cancel. I didn't get a reply to the email - 1 day later (today) I telephoned to check - and was told no guarantees. I therefore cancelled. I do not understand why a hotel - with x amount of double bed rooms could not allocate one to our booking.Very disappointed.

Stayed at Aqua Lotus for one night in February as a stopover for our flight to LAX. The staff were friendly and helpful and even arranged for the cleaners to make our room a priority so we could check in early! It's a 30 minute or so walk to the main city part but its right near the beach which is nice. The green trolley line comes straight past and the aquarium is just up the road. Overall a lovely stay.

This hotel goes beyond expectations to provide beautiful rooms with mountain and water viewsIn addition they have free bikes, wine and coffee each day. The rooms have beautiful views of the ocean and mountain. They have fabulous terraces as well. The only negative is that it is not near the center of town so that you need a car or public transportation to go to restaurants. Management of the hotel is exceptional.

I stayed here when it was the W Hotel and was very sad when they closed it. I was excited to see it back as an Aqua Hotel. I travel to Honolulu 4 times a year for work and have stayed in many Waikiki Hotels. The Aqua Lotus was amazing. I got a corner room (highly recommended!!) and the staff could not have been nicer. Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to make my stay a great one (free bikes, free beach chair and towels!). The coffee makers in the room make lattes. The rooms are outstanding. STAY HERE!!!

If you have to spend time in busy Honolulu and want to be close to the ocean, this hotel is a good choice because it's away from the densely populated Waikiki area and very near the beach. It's across the street from a large park and quite close to Diamondhead. Great room and very helpful, friendly staff. The only negative was the lack of a restaurant. They served a limited breakfast (not free), but orange juice was not available when we were there. However, there's an excellent restaurant in the hotel next door, and a walk of a few blocks gets you to Waikiki, where there are many good places to eat.

Came here for honeymoon, feel so relaxed and at home. Super clean and friendly, walking distance to centre or $6 by taxi which staff will call for you! Amazing views from balcony and beautiful park across the street. Quiet beach next door, 5 stars would definitely stay again!

I loved this hotel! It had no pool (that's what the ocean is for) but an incredible view of Diamond Head, Kapiolani Park and the Ocean (which was a lovely surprise). We had a corner Diamond Head Premium room on the 7th floor and it was very quiet. The staff were all spectacular! Warm, friendly and extremely helpful (especially the valets and the housekeeping people). It was the perfect distance from noisy, bustling Waikiki. I've stayed in the dead center of Waikiki and I was truly spoiled staying here. There is a small hotel cafe with nice sitting areas but no formal restaurant. They are working on that part. The bed is soft and comfy, the happy hour wine was great and now I don't think I can stay anywhere else. Mahalo and Aloha from a former Kamaina!

This was our second stay at this hotel. Previously a W, we enjoyed our room and found it to be in a great location. On our recent stay, we found the Lotus to be as equally as accommodating and the staff even friendlier! Check-in was quick. The valet service is so convenient and fast as well. Being a smaller hotel, you don't get the crowds of people.The hotel has no real amenities to speak of, no pool or restaurant. However, an awesome beach is steps away and two good restaurants are next door, Hau Tree Lanai in the New Otani hotel and Michel's in the Colony Surf. Michel's serves classic French and has a great view (more on the expensive side). Hau Tree Lanai is more casual, fusion flavors.We were fortunate enough to stay in The Diamond Head Suite, the penthouse. It's amazing!If you would like to be near Waikiki and still go shopping, people watch, have choices of restaurants, but sleep a little farther away from the crowds, this location can't be beat. I would recommend this location to anyone who is looking for that mix in Waikiki.

We had a great room #825. It was on the corner so we had a beautiful view of Diamond Head to the left & 2 beautiful views of the ocean to the right. The room was nice, big and comfortable. I was with my niece & sister-in-law so with 3 women, we needed a nice bathroom & that's what we got! Great shower & plenty of counter top space. I requested a microwave & they brought one up. The beds were very comfortable & we slept every night with the sliding glass door open enjoying the fresh air & the sound of the ocean! The room service was awesome, they were soo friendly & gave us complimentary bottles water every day. The desk clerks were the best! I want to give Wes a special thank you for being soo friendly & always having a big smile on his face. He really made us feel welcomed. As I said, everyone there was very attentive & we will definitely go back.  It is about a 15 min walk to the first part of Waikiki but the walk is beautiful & it we stopped in the morning at the Barefoot Cafe & ate breakfast on the beach. The hotel is just a couple of steps from the beach & the hotel lends you beach chairs & towels. I can not say enough about this hotel. I will tell you, you need to get a room on the 8th floor or higher for the view. We booked through Expedia & got an Ocean Premium room at a great price! We are already planning our next trip & I know we will book again at the Aqua Lotus. I've stayed in several other hotels in Waikiki & the rooms were half the size for the same price or more!

This boutique hotel will exceed all your expectations. Perfect location away from the bustle of the concentrated high rise hotels in the center of Waikiki Beach. Yet walkable access to everything. The room was beautiful with great views of Diamond Head and the downtown skyline and beach. Best of all is the friendly attentive staff, providing beach towels and bottles of water whenever we ventured out. There are two very nice beachside restaurants in the adjacent buildings.

This hotel is in a fantastic location 25 mins easy wallk from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. My room had a specatuclar view of Diamond Head which looked gorgeous throughout the daylight hours. My room was beautifully appointed and a very comfortable place to relax after a hard day at the beach or shopping. Hotel staff are happy to provide beach chairs and towels and there are two small beaches within a few minutes walk. A nearby mini mart provided some essentials. The hotel next door had a rather expensive but quality restaurant and it is a pity the restaurant space in this one is not being utilised but left empty.

First, the hotel doesn't have a pool, beach, nor ocean views. If those are deal-breakers then you may want to stay elsewhere but you would be missing out on a gem.The Aqua Lotus does have a friendly welcoming staff (valet, front desk, housekeeping, managers), nice Diamond Head views, a location directly across from beautiful Kapiolani Park, good-sized clean contemporary rooms, and it is removed from the crazy madness of the heart of Waikiki (a ten minute walk along the beach). It is about 200 feet from Sans Souci Beach - a really nice swimming beach at the edge of Waikiki. It does offer beach cruiser bikes to explore the local area as well as beach mats and towels for guest use. A unique historic district of older homes and cottages are just steps away at the base of Diamond Head and a good long walk brings you up to the Diamond Head overlook. Access in and out to the rest of Honolulu is easy and you can skirt the traffic on Kalakaua in Waikiki.Improvements would be an extra elevator (only one) and a full service restaurant - it has a restaurant space that serves breakfast overlooking the park (nice) but it isn't fully operational yet.I definitely will return here on future trips to Honolulu. I've stayed at the Halekulani (5 star, $$$$$) and the Waikiki Parc (meh...) and I prefer the location of the Aqua Lotus despite its lack of beach & pool. Go figure...

We chose the Lotus because of a discounted rate on the first night and it's location near Kapiolani Park. Even though it is not on the beach, access is only steps away.I understand this property was once the W and before that the Doubletree so its not brand new. Our room was on the third floor and probably had the worst view in the hotel - roof of the porte cochere below, parking garage across and ocean view blocked by condos. Security-wise that probably wasn't great either. Anyone on that floor could walk on the roof to your terrace and possibly break in, though we had no problem. Still it had nice morning sun and the room was spacious. There was a small kitchenette and a bathroom with a nice stone tile shower instead of tub. The furnishings were new, clean and modern and the wider room made the room seem brighter than a typical room.The platform bed however had a poor double-size mattress that sloped to the center. For one person that may not be too bad but for two it was. Add to that was the oversize linens housekeeping used to make up these beds made getting into bed impossible without ripping the bed apart. I had to remake the bed every night, and housekeeping kept making the bed same way every day.Parking is extra, and valet is required given the limited spaces available. But our car was always in a good spot and we could always grab the keys, jump in and go.There was no restaurant on the property during our stay, but other amenities like complementary wine every afternoon and free coffee each morning were nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. Beach towels and chairs were available to take to the public beach across the parking lot. I asked for and got a bath scale to help weigh our suitcases before we left. And the valets were great with directions and ideas for restaurants. There are coin laundry machines on the third floor too.There is no spa or fitness center either but the park across the street is flat and easy to walk or run around. There is a parcourse and public tennis courts too.Of course the location is the real attraction here. Kapiolani Park is big and quiet and short walk to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Getting around the island is as easy as a quick drive up Kapahulu to the H1.Despite the bed and the third floor, I liked the Lotus and would stay here again.

The hotel is clean and the room was modern and nice. It is in a quiet part of Wakiki beach, which is good. But it is overpriced for what you get, there is no pool, the views are nothing to write home about and services are minimal. It would be great if the prices were slashed by a third or so.

The area of the Aqua Lotus is exactly what we wanted. It is located away from the busy side of Waikiki. It is easy to get to and from the hotel. I realize for some, the mandatory valet was not appreciated. To us it was well worth the fee. With limited parking at the hotel, it was nice driving up to the front door after a long day and having the valet take care of parking. The entire staff was extremely courteous. Although all the staff is great, Allen who is the valet and porter was extremely welcoming. He always greeted us by our name, asked us if we needed anything and just made sure he was taking care of us. The views are breathtaking as well! With the cleanliness of the hotel, magnificent employees and an A+ location, we rate this hotel Five Stars. We will definitely return.

We just stayed in Aqua Lotus and we chose it, because of its excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel is good, no doubt. Located about 15 Minutes walking distance to the first Hotels and Shops of Waikiki Beach. But I have to take take off points for following down sides:- no sea view. only view to park, Diamond Head or a parking lot of other buildings at the beach- the building is a beton square, beautiful inside but not from the outside, no green area. - the rooms were noisy (wind and fridge, etc.)- slow wifi- there were no shops nearby, thats ok. But to charge guest 4.50 US for a croissant at breakfast is no service!! They do have a restaurant but last week it was closed. - it was too cold in the lobby area, freezing!- i asked the lobby for island weather (cause it was raining in Honolulu and we wanted to escape) and he looked at his Iphone (for Honolulu!) and sayed it was just a bit of rain. That was it! I have an I phone as well.. It was a good hotel, the people were really nice, the rooms beautiful, BUT its not the best hotel you can stay at in Honolulu for that price.

This hotel is off the beaten path. So if you want the crush of humanity that is Waikiki, be aware. It is tucked in between the ocean, a park and Diamondhead. Everywhere you look is a great view, and we could see all three from our tenth floor corner room (requested). And it is only a ten minute walk to all that is Waikiki, so we had goo food and nightlife within walking distance. They also provide free bicycles, free wine in the afternoon, free coffee in the morning, free beach towels. They have a funky/quirky vibe here and it is very relaxed. No pool and no fitness room, but so what.

I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel IF you don't mind walking about fifteen minutes to the heart of the action in Waikiki. The hotel is across from Kapiolani park, which is populated by locals, morning joggers, and yoga and tai chi devotees. If you walk about ten minutes in the other direction, away from the center of Waikiki, you're in a cute neighborhood of 1930s bungalows. Kaimana Beach is a minute's walk away, and although it's public (as are all the beaches in Hawaii), it feels almost private. Next door in the New Otani hotel, the Hau Tree restaurant is a real delight for breakfast and lunch. If all of this appeals to you, don't hesitate to book this hotel.In addition to the location, the Aqua Lotus has a lot of other things going for it. It used to be the W, so it's bright and modern (except for the lobby!), with wooden floors, super comfy bed, and a small but good bathroom. Alas, no bathtub. The view of the ocean is blocked, but depending on your room, you can still see it. And you can most certainly request a room with a dramatic and VERY close-up view of Diamond Head. (Our corner room on the eleventh floor had both aspects.)The housekeeping is excellent. It's impossible in Waikiki not to bring a lot of sand back into your hotel room, no matter how careful you are. Housekeeping somehow managed to vacuum it all up every day, even the sand on the lanai (balcony). Our room was kept spotless.The front desk is friendly and helpful. Small gripe -- our flight was delayed so we didn't arrive at the hotel until 4 a.m., and we had to wait a few minutes until someone showed up at the desk. But . . . it was 4 a.m., after all. You can get beach towels and other beach gear from the front desk.There are other pluses, which other reviewers have mentioned. We love the location, so we'll definitely use this hotel again.One final thought. This side of Waikiki has some vagrants. But they don't panhandle, and they don't really bother anyone.

The Aqua Lotus is a peaceful place near a quiet beach. Morning coffee and afternoon wine is served complimentary. The staff is friendly and very efficient. Valet parking is mandatory and $20 per day. The staff knows you by name from the first day and gets you car as soon as they see you. The only food available is a limited continental breakfast on the second floor. There is a beachfront cafe about a 10-15 minute walk away, otherwise you have to drive somewhere to eat. It's only a 10Min drive to Waikiki.

My wife and I stayed three nights at the Aqua Lotus over Christmas and had a pleasant stay. We moved to this hotel after five nights at the Trump at the other end of Waikiki, so this was an interesting contrast. The Lotus is a small boutique hotel that is pretty isolated from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. It actually is a little further from Waikiki Beach than I first thought. I would say you are a good ten to fifteen minute walk before you hit the first hotels (Marriott, Aston Waikiki) and shops, so keep that in mind. I believe the hotel used to be a 'W' property, and it retains that funky vibe along with the dim lighting in the lobby. There are only one or two staff at the front desk, it's pretty relaxed and casual. There is no self-park, valet parking only. The rooms are very nice, modern, comfortable, inviting. Maybe nicer than at the Trump, although there was no kitchen. But it does have a fridge.Since the hotel has no dinner restaurant, you will have to go out to eat. Immediately next door there are three excellent restaurants. Michels at the Colony Surf is an outstanding french/italian restaurant in a gorgeous setting, right on the beach, with tuxedoed waiters, luxury dinnerware, soft live music and tiki torches, very romantic and very high priced. We had a very nice meal here, it is a beautiful spot.Also next door at the Kaimana are two others. Miyako is on the second floor and is a japanese restaurant with a great view. I would highly recommend you book one of their three cabana tables (2-5 people), they are gorgeous, private, and scenic. The menu is fixed for the cabanas, only a couple of choices with 6-8 items on each. All the food was excellent. Try to book here for sunset, it really is gorgeous. The second restaurant at the Kaimana is the Hau Tree Lanai, another beautifully scenic restaurant right on the beach and under three giant Hau trees. We had a lovely breakfast here although a sudden shower had us running to another table. Other than these, plus a second floor casual breakfast spot at the Lotus, you will have to travel a fair ways for other dining choices. I would recommend the zoo, which is very good and not far away. The aquarium is very close as well. It's quite small and would only take an hour of your time. While I really liked the vibe of the hotel, I am not sure I would stay here again if coming back to Waikiki, as I feel it is just a bit far from the action. I think the Lotus is great for a short stay, 2-4 days maybe, but if you are staying longer you might want to be nearer the other end of Waikiki. Still, it's a very nice hotel...

My friends and I stayed here in September. The staff was efficient and friendly. We used the complimentary chairs/ towels for Hanuama Bay. The small beach close by was quiet and lovely. This was jnlike the overcrowded areas of Waikiki. There is daily morning coffee/tea in the hotel lobby and wine in the evening. We valet out car with a daily fee. The toiletries provided were great especially the lotion, it lasts long despite other hotel brands. We had a great view of Diamond head from the bed! it was a breathtaking view! Mahalo!

We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our cruise. What a way to spend the last days in Hawaii before heading home. We had a room on the 8th floor overlooking Diamond Head and the Ocean. Everything about this hotel was right in line with a Boutique hotel you would find on the mainland. The hotel is small enough that after a few days the staff knows your name and where you are from. Even coming down to retrieve your car from the valet he doesn't need to ask for your name. We arrived very early the day of check in, but the staff held our luggage while we went out and explored. And we had a very late flight the day of our departure, and again the staff held our luggage. Housekeeping was fantastic, they came twice a day. They actually surprised us on the first day as we were not expecting a turn down service and left everything out. They did not disturb any of our personal belongings. Everything you would expect from a hotel is right here. The walk to the restaurants can be a bit far for some people. My wife did feel a bit nervous walking the route to Waikiki in the early evening hours as the lighting is not great and the park seems to fill up with homeless, but we made it safely. The other evenings we chose to drive to the main part of Waikiki instead. The only downside we found was with the internet speed. The wifi was a bit on the slow side, but it was free! Overall a fantastic stay and would recommend highly to couples traveling without the kids.

We visit Oahu at least once per year and this was our first experience staying at the Aqua Lotus. We were pleasantly surprised and extremely pleased with the location and proximity to so many attractions: Diamond Head, Waikiki beaches, Kapiolani park/tennis courts, restaurants, the Zoo and Aquarium. We also appreciated the friendliness and responsiveness of the staff, cleanliness/quality of rooms (added bonus: great sunrise view over Diamond Head and sunset view over the beach) and overall vibe of this hotel. This particular visit was a family vacation and traveling with 3 young children can sometimes be challenging, yet we found we were all quite comfortable in our room and as an added perk, we discovered the kids (or just the young at heart) could play Wii in the lobby and there are even laundry facilities available to guests. We all enjoyed walking from the front door of the hotel to so many places nearby and felt this was truly a hidden gem unlike larger hotels that lack the intimacy and privacy that this hotel has to offer. We would highly recommend the Aqua Lotus Honolulu for business travel or a family vacation and will definitely be back on our next visit to Oahu!

Quiet location away from the bustle of Waikiki. Rooms were very clean, super comfy bed, enjoyed having a complimentary glass of wine in their lovely lounge area, awesome in-room coffee maker, (could have used some half & half) restaurants within walking distance, nice beach walk and park . . . The next time I'll make sure to take advantage of the bicycles! Will stay again.

Awesome hotel --- thanks to the staff and quality of the rooms and hotel. It was a great experience for my first trip to Oahu. The main purpose of this trip was to take my 2 1/2 year old grandson to the Zoo, Acquarium and see Santa Claus at Ala Moana Center. The hotel was convenient to all these places. We enjoyed the friendly atmosphere and the great view of Diamond Head and the Beach from our balcony. We will definitely stay here again and will recommend to my friends and family on the Mainland.

After spending one night at the Marriott Waikiki the Aqua Lotus was a welcome oasis from the giant outdoor shopping mall that is most of Waikiki. There are so many reasons I loved this place. The location was perfect. The staff all went above and beyond in service and friendliness. The room was gorgeous an very clean. The hospitality was second to none! Are you going to the beach? Here is a beach chair for you! Heading out to explore? Take one of our bikes! Ready to relax? Have a glass of wine!I will be making an effort to stay here again, and to spread the word to anyone and everyone about this AMAZING place!

Have been travelling to Oahu/Hawaii for years. First time staying at the Aqua Lotus. Clearly, Management focuses on service and overall comfort for their guests. Staff is always smiling and friendly. Rooms are newly renovated, ultra clean and spacious. Views from guest suites are ocean view or of the incredible Diamond Head crater. Beds are comfortable and BIG. One of the best experiences ever in the islands. Incredible location, easy access to the beach/nightlife/restaurants, at the eastern edge of Waikiki near Diamond Head, right across the street from the Kapiolani Park, which is the finish line for the Honolulu Marathon. Close to the Waikiki Aquarium and the Honolulu Zoo. Great property, friendly staff, outstanding experience. Perfect location for business or vacation. This medium-sized boutique property is a genuine competitor with the "big-box" hotel chains. Will be back for sure.

Truly flawless experience with the staff, a great room, and beautiful area that seems a little quieter / less annoying than that of the hotels further north. Bathroom is relatively no frills, but clean and nice, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Some potentially useful insight for first time visitors:- There's parking and a valet, helpful if you'd like to get some basic groceries, which you can put in the mini-fridge. There's a Whole Foods in a reasonably drivable distance. The market next door is convenient but pricy, and the only liquor source in the area. - Call the front desk for a taxi, it'll be there within minutes (for late night dining/drinking). - Bicycles are available from the valet with no hassle, and make short work of a ride downtown. - If you're there for the Honolulu Marathon, buses to the start are about a 15 minute walk away, it is still quite convenient. - The beach next door is pretty great! Borrow some chairs from the front desk. - No restaurant at the time, but basic food available for breakfast on the 2nd floor. Likely to be home base for next year's visit.

The Hotel is very clean. They have the best staff, they are always willing to help you with anything you need. The location is away from all the tourist buses and noise of Waikiki, which is great! everything within walking distance to the hotel. I'm sure your enjoy your stay, as I did.

we wanted to experience different hotels at different price range. the lotus hotel was the most expensive out of the 3 we had. and it was also the best to have. "you get what you pay for"!one of the valet guys was extremely helpful and friendly. we didn't feel pressured about tipping them. the guy at the counter was super friendly and welcoming. we asked to see if we could pick a room between the 2 he had available (because we wanted to make sure we had a good view for our time-lapse), he was very nice about it. they had complimentary wine at certain hours too, oh and the spicy hot apple cider available at the counter too! loved the room, loved the overall decor and quiet environment. the most comfy bed i've had in my 8-day stay in honolulu!

Wes at the front desk and Allen (valet) were awesome. They got us a better room on a higher (6th) floor, and helped us out with getting to our activities (as well as recommendations on what we can do/where's better to go to).Very modern rooms and furnishings, great looking, clean bathroom, nice coffee machine, but lacked a microwave. Balcony looked out at the Diamondhead, and the sun rises from behind it, pretty awesome. On the flipside, there isn't much of an ocean view since the hotel isn't very tall, and it's surrounded by two taller buildings facing the ocean. Still, it's at a quieter part of town if that's what you prefer; and within walking distance to the beach, Michel's, Waikiki aquarium and zoo.Great experience overall indeed.

Faboulous service at this small out of the way hotel near Diamond Head. It's in a quiet location which means a short hike to downtown Waikiki . The rooms are quite modern and comfortable but this is my concern which affected us during our two night stay. The hotel has just been renovated which is great but what on earth possessed them to put in hardwood floors!!! This means every sound from the floor above is transmitted even amplified to the floor below. Now if you have quiet considerate people there is no problem but some people choose to moved the furniture and the siding doors at all hours which means you get woken up. The staff were great and had several helpful suggestions.

The front desk staff were friendly and gave us some ideas for things to do. Small boutique place but our ocean view was worth the extra money. The coffee was OK but we found some better coffee down the street. I would recommend this to my family and friends.

My family and I stay at the hotel aqua lotus for 10 nights and it was by far the best friendly staff I've ever encounter... Big appreciation to Dante the front desk guy for going the extra mile to help my kids with what they needed ... Thanks to all and see you again

Management has changed but the quality remains excellent. This is a small, boutique hotel at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki where it is pleasantly peaceful. It is a short walk away from the action if you so desire. Hotel guests are treated very well, coffee in the morning, wine at night, what could be better? Kaimana Beach is right outside, one of the safest, loveliest beaches in that area, popular with locals and tourists. The rooms have zen style, comfy beds and lots of room. I don't care for the rooms in the front, but that's a personal preference. Staff is very helpful. We will certainly return to the Lotus as we travel to Hawaii frequently.

The front desk staff went out their way to help us sorting out problems, including an erroneous ticket from a parking garage. She also assigned a corner ocean view room to us without being asked. Definitely will stay here again or recommend this hotel to friends and families.

I would definitely come back to this quiet small attractive hotel near Kapioloni Park, the aquarium, and Diamond head. As pointed out, there is no pool (a bit of problem when we learned we had landed during the "box jelly fish window", which precluded swimming two days (check the web when planning your trip to avoid these times, which coincide with the moon's cycle!). Nor is there a restauran. Other than two higher ends restaurants in the two hotels nearby, no place to eat for close to a mile. It was only the day we were checking out did we learn that they had started serving a limited breakfast in the prior weeks (no notice anywhere!). Fortunately this wasn't a problem for us, as we are members of an athletic club in Seattle, which gave us total priveleges to the Outrigger Club next door, where we lounged on the beach, and ate most meals (very reasonably priced). We did appreciate the extra details offered - coffee in the a.m., rotating flavors of infused ice water in the day, and wine from 4:00 to 6:00 - with lovely big wine glasses. A refrigerator in your room allows you to have your cereal, cheese and sandwich makings, should you choose... The hotel also offers thrice weekly morning yoga in the park across the street, which we enjoyed. And I have to say, after walking once to the hustle of Waikiki, we were very pleased to stay put. We are runners, and the park and Diamond Head gives both short and longer running routes. Beach chairs and towels were appreciated, and the fact the hotel wasn't right on the beach was no problem. It was a very short path between two other buildings to the uncrowded beach. We meant to borrow the cruiser bikes which were always available for a trip to Waikiki or to see residential area of Diamond Head, but never got around to it. The rooms were vary spacious (we did NOT have a corner with two balconies), and I loved all the storage space in the rattan type shelving in the bathroom. All of the employees were very pleasant and accomodating.

Originallly opened as a "W" this hotel has retained the cool and somehow added Hawaiian warmth.Great room,great beds,great views and best of all an oasis from the nearby insanity of Waikiki Beach.a 10 minute walk has you front an centerfor all of it but you will appreciate the peace and calm you can experience in and around this wonderful hotel.

A perfect location on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. We loved being located at the quieter end of things, and being able to walk the shoreline (beach or sidewalk) to access the more crowded things. Our room was on the 12th floor, had a small balcony to the east, and larger one to the south... a great place to enjoy the morning or evening (with a sliver view of sunset to the west). The balconies also allowed a good cross-breeze between them in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable and overall the room was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The complimentary wine between 4 and 6 was also appreciated. We had a great time taking a glass of wine up to enjoy with crackers, cheese and fruit on the balcony (we provided those). Overall... we wished we had spent the full week here rather than finding another place in Kailua. You could easily stay here and have amazing day trip out and around the island... keeping this as the most comfortable place to sleep you could imagine.

The Aqua Lotus is ideally situated in Waikiki. You have access to a private beach area and are only a short distance from Diamond Head, Aquarium, Zoo & restaurants. I found the staff pleasant & helpful. The room was fantastic with a wonderful view of Diamond Head.

Super little boutique hotel. Great friendly service. Especially Travis the Bell Man. We thoroughly enjoyed the location, also. Very quiet at night, not so in the morning because the street is the main route to Diamond Head but shouldn't be sleeping in on holidays, anyway! Great for couples who like to walk. Not great for people who don't want to walk. Wouldn't be good for families because (other than the super beach access and amenities the hotel provides) there is no pool or family friendly places. This is a good thing! We walked into the waikiki area every day and usually more than once. Very pretty walk up to Diamond Head, too. We used the fridge for snacks and beverages and light breaky foods. There is coffee in the lobby but I asked for and received a hotel style coffee maker so we could relax in the morning. The Internet was fabulous. We have business affairs which we have to keep abreast of and were able to with ease and not have to pay prohibitive fees!All in all, a great little place! We will definitely stay here again!

My wife and I along with my two adult daughters spent five days a t the Lotus. Every employee from the room service crew to the general manager is focused on the customer and intent on making their time in Honolulu a memorable one. The property is tastefully decorated and well maintained, the rooms are large and the views of Diamond Head are spectacular. Its location at the Eastern end of Waikiki provides solace from the urban intensity of the Eastern end which is only a 15 minute walk or a short cab ride away.The only negatives are the lack of a restaurant (the space is available but presently lacking a tenant...breakfast service is available) and a small fitness unit (however, yoga sessions in the park are available several days a week).A wonderful property with excellent service provided by excellent people.

We've stayed here a few times and each time I'm so happy we did. This is the secret hotel of Hawaii. The rooms are huge, clean, and well kept. I know everyone says you don't need a big room since you're never in it - but it sure is nice to go back to a hotel that's lovely instead of a trashy hole. The pluses:1. Great access to the beach (takes 3 minutes; it's around the corner)2. Staff is outstanding.3. Free coffee/tea in the morning4. Free wine in the evening (yummy)Possible Negative:1. It's a walk from the "hot spots" its really outside of the main street of crazy (but a short walk)2. The "ocean" view is pretty blocked. You can see it but it's between a building and you.3. No food on campus. (looks like a cafe is about to open soon).Really - you should stay there. Its the place you will always want to go back to.

We stayed at the aqua lotus for 2 weeks in November. From our arrival we were greated in great Hawaiian style with a big smile and Aloha from Wes. We had excellent service and the staff are very friendly (Carissa, Eric) We enjoyed the Beach and borrowed Boogie boards everyday. We have 2 children and they loved the hotel as well....especially the hot cocoa in the morning! We had a lovely room with great views of the ocean and Diamond head. The yoga classes/instructors were fantastic and such a nice way to start the day. I would fully recommend this hotel. We have stayed at many hotels in Waikiki and this by far has been the best. We hope to come back in January!

This is a very nice hotel. It is obscenely over-priced but so are the rest of the hotels in Waikiki so you won't find better value elsewhere. We were on honeymoon in Hawaii and were given a free upgrade to a corner room and were very pleased with a very clean and well equipped room and a nice balcony. Staff were cheerful and helpful and (crazy techno music in the elevator aside) we cannot fault the hotel. It is about a 10min walk from the main drag of Waikiki which was nice for us as it gave a good chance to walk off heavy dinners and was a little quieter. There is also a very nice view of Diamond Head. Recommended.

If your looking for a quiet upscale hotel with beach access and walking distance of everything, this is THE place! Wonderful room with views of both Diamondhead and beach. Immaculate, beautiful room and accommodating staff. Very relaxing atmosphere with a very comfortable bed. I'd do it again (and planning doing it again)!

The aqua lotus hotel is always a great place to stay. From the staff, to the rooms, and also the great views. And it's also nice and quiet. I always reccomend this hotel to all my friends and family. I stay here a few times a year. I always have a great time.

I found this little hotel on TripAdvisor and after reading the reviews am so glad I booked it....it was a delightful little gem!! It is a beautiful, well looked after boutique hotel. The staff are very friendly and very helpful....I would stay here again in a heart beat!!

My girl and I stayed here for four nights, and it was worth every penny! A nice little spot maybe 25 yards off the beach, the room was big and very comfortable and the staff was amazing. The restaurant was closed for remodeling while we were there so we couldn't try it out. Everything else was great, nice and quiet and relaxing!Stay away from the restaurant next door (hau tree lanai), extremely overpriced for the poor quality food and watered down drinks.

My husband and I headed to Hawaii for our 30th wedding anniversary. We were taking a cruise of the islands but wanted to arrive a few days in advance to acclimate to the time change (6 hours for us). On the basis of the reviews here at TripAdvisor we booked the Aqua Lotus. However, we also booked one night at a Waikiki resort hotel on the back end of the cruise. The difference was night and day! The Aqua Lotus staff must have been trained by Ritz Carlton personnel. They were amazing and did everything they could to make our stay special. The rooms are beautiful - sliding shutter doors instead of drapes, full length mirror, big bathroom / nice sized shower - a kind of "modern design meets the Island" feel. The wood laminate flooring might night satisfy everyone's tastes but it provides for a clean, cool and comfortable living space. The beach is right behind the hotel just a couple of minutes walk away. A few more minutes down the beach is Queen's Surf Cafe and Lanai where you can enjoy a relatively inexpensive meal right on the beach or take a short stroll in the morning and drink a quality cup of coffee or espresso while watching the morning surf. Everything about the location and the hotel is relatively peaceful. And the crowds of Waikiki are a 10 - 15 minute walk away if you need to be in the thick of things. Once a month local artists sell their work in Kapiolani Park, across the street from the hotel. We were fortunate enough that our stay corresponded to a show weekend. (Tip: buy your souvenirs at local arts shows if you want genuine articles made in Hawaii. Hilo Hatties and the ABC stores are selling items made in the Philippines and China so check carefully.) The number of rooms in the hotel is limited so you don't have to deal with the relentless masses of the resort hotels in Waikiki. Complementary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening is a nice touch. After our experience (4 days, 3 nights at the Aqua Lotus and one overnight at the resort hotel) I am so grateful we took the reviews here seriously and booked with Aqua Lotus. The resort hotel was so depressing in comparison. So crowded, wildly expensive and a little phoney / faux Hawaiian. (A word about valet parking. It was $20 at the Aqua Lotus, $30 at the big resort hotel. Service at the Aqua Lotus was instantaneous, at the big resort hotel we had to wait as long as 10 minutes for our car.) If we are ever fortunate enough to visit these gracious islands again, we would definitely book again with Aqua Lotus. Thanks to the Staff for making this milestone vacation so special for us!

Our room was spacious and had a warm relaxing feeling. The terrace was nice too, bedding amazingly comfortable. We would say a perfect room for relaxing holiday. As others have written, away from the noise of Waikiki, yet a good beach next door, and close enough to walk into the centre of town. Ivy

As many reviewers have indicated Aqua Lotus sets itself apart from the mega chain hotels on Waikiki. Placed between a beautiful city park and a small beautiful beach we found it to be a perfect location. If you need to be in the center of all the "action" this definitely wouldn't be the hotel for you however if you enjoy a 15 minute walk to breakfast or a stroll at night back to your room this is perfect. The free bikes also made a great impression being able to check out the local neighborhood first hand instead out of a car window. The complimentary coffee and evening wine was also a very nice touch.

If you like to be away from the hustle and close to a residential experience. Aqua Lotus is excellent. The staff is very helpful and friendly There is an excellent beach 100 yards from the hotel where locals and tourists swim.. There is complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon, however the hotel does not have a restaurant and that is the only deficit that reduces the star rating. If they just had a croissant and scone in the AM and some fruit in the PM would help. There is a restaurant next door in the New Otani. I prefer the ambiance of a laid back hotel because the guests tend to be laid back. It is a 15 min beautiful walk along the waterfront to Waikiki shopping . The feeling is one of relationship building between hotel and guests, that is hard to do in a commercial center like Honolulu. The Aqua Lotus is committed to service, value and hospitality. Try Tokkuri Tei sushi reasonably close by and Diamond Head Grill for breakfast scones.

Our stay at the Aqua Lotus was great. Loved the rooms. The wood laminate flooring was such a nice change from the grungy carpet most hotels have. The complimentary slippers were a great little extra! I loved the bathroom set-up. Plenty of space, and the shelving for the towels and the basket for the used towels was a nice touch.
