Felt more like an inviting guest bath rather than a standard hotel bathroom. As many others have stated, the location is peaceful and quiet compared to the rest of Waikiki, and the view of Diamond head with the sun rising behind it in the morning is beautiful! Wish I could wake up to that every morning! Will definitely stay here again.

Glad we chose this hotel as we found Waikiki completely crazy. It is near enough to walk to but far enough away to be peaceful. It is a nice walk (about 10-15 minutes depending on your speed) into Waikiki and you can enjoy the ocean views all along the way.We had a really nice mountain view room on 4th floor with a good view of Diamond Head. It isn't worth paying more for an ocean view room because, as noted by other reviewers, the view is obscured by other buildings. It is worth noting there is no bath although we were happy with the shower. The room was spotlessly clean and well maintained by the housekeeping staff throughout our seven night stay.The strengths of this hotel lie in the clean, contemporary decor and the great service. The staff were really cheerful, enthusiastic and helpful. We particularly appreciated the evening wine, when we were there at the appropriate time, and the beach towels, chairs etc. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at the front desk and the car valets.On the negative side the wi-fi signal was very weak and we had problems getting on line. The only other negative is that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant any more. We knew that when booking but hadn't appreciated how difficult it would be to find somewhere that served breakfast nearby (apart from the place in the park, which isn't great). Walking into Waikiki is an option but we found it wasn't worth driving as it is quite difficult to find parking. The hotel does provide free morning coffee, but doughnuts or some cookies would be an added bonus!Just a tip for those with a car, you may not want to pay to valet park at the hotel. It costs USD20 per day (in line with other hotels) and you can park free outside the hotel on a meter bay from 6pm to around 8.00am .If you fancy a 'posh meal' Michels is just next door and is excellent. The front desk will book a table for you. If you fancy a good Italian meal away from Waikiki, try Happy Valley Pizza on the road to Diamond Head. Good pasta and pizza, nice staff and very reasonable prices.Overall, the Aqua Lotus is a really nice little hotel for the price and we would be happy to stay there again. It is a great base for exploring Oahu, which is a beautiful island away from the madness that is Waikiki!

The Aqua Lotus Honolulu is a perfectly situated hotel near Waikiki Beach. You can easily walk to Waikiki Beach yet appreciate more peace and quiet just beyond it. Many amenties are included. Free beach equipment, bicycles, yoga instruction, wine in the afternoon and coffee in the morning. It is staffed by very helpful and friendly staff who go out of their way to make you at home.

My wife and I travel extensively, myself professionally as a medical practitioner for conferences, and both of us for recreation. We decided on aqua lotus based on reviews on trip advisor, the other hotels we contemplated were Halekulani and The Modern. We stayed for 7 nights.The hotel was generally as described in previous reviews, furnished in an islander style. We opted to upgrade to a premium diamond head view room based on previous reviews suggesting the ocean view rooms were obscured by propoerties closer to the beach (true). Our room was on the 5th floor and we really had no view of the mount as there was a large tree at the front of the property obscuring it. We did however have an excellent view of the large car park next door. Although disappointed by this, the room itself was well furnished and comfortable, the king-size bed likewise comfortable. The TV was a large screen plasma although there was no pay tv...In Australia most hotels would have this avaialble, not sure if the lack of this is the norm for Hawaii??As previously described on this site, there is no pool, the beach being about 200 meters away. The hotel provides towels/ mats/ beach chairs gratis. The hotel provides free wine with the oddly named 'happy ending' although we only partook of this the first night as it would best be described as cheap, and we stuck to Japanese beer purchased at a nearby convenience store. There is no restaurant or really any conveniently located reasonable option for breakfast.We also had a concern with the reception staff's lack of local knowledge. We sought information regarding directions via bus to the local clothing outlets and were given a convoluted google based route involving about 4-5 different buses. We eventually worked out that there was a direct trolley to these. Then we wanted a bus to the northern beaches which were lovely. Again we were given misinformation and almost missed our intended bus as a result. Unfortunately there is no dedicated tourist information and therefore most tourists would rely on front of house staff. Aqua Lotus would do well to keep this in mind.Overall we had a pleasant stay, but I'm not sure against what benchmark those that rate this hotel consistently at 5 are using. We had a chance to inspect the Halekulani and when we return will be staying there.

If you want somewhere out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki then this hotel is great.We stopped off in Hawaii after spending 3 weeks in mainland US and Canada and needed to recharge the batteries.We found the hotel to be just what the doctor ordered.The staff were warm and welcoming.The morning coffee in the lobby and wine in the afternoon were also a pleaseant surprise.The next time we visit it will be as our destination not just a stopover.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel has awesome character, the rooms are very clean and well appointed. Would definitely recommend this place to others! Definitely would stay here again!

We decide on this hotel after reading very good reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel was a little hard to find at first but once we arrived, we were greeted warmly. The room looks just like the photos on-line which was a relief as that isn't always the case with on-line websites. Our room looked towards the ocean which was great for land locked guests. We thought we were getting a king sized bed but had two doubles. My husband is goldilocks incognito and thought the beds were too soft. I thought they were just right. I would suggest putting a small light or reflective light switch in the bathroom. It was very dark in the middle of the night :)First and foremost the staff was excellent. They were always offering to give us directions and help us navigate around. Although my husband had lived here for 8 years, it was a nice refresher. We had one whoopsie daisy that I only bring up not to make the hotel or staff feel bad but rather to demonstrate how incredible they were even with a mistake. One of the valets accidentally put a scratch on our rental car. No biggie, life happens. However, not only was he honest about what happened, but the manager came in (it was after 10 p.m. when we got called) and let us know right away. They are covering the costs and everything is going to be just fine. It's not the situation that defines a person or company but how they handle it that truly reflects the integrity of that company. Thank you to all the wonderful and amazing staff at the Aqua Lotus. You truly made our stay a wonderful experience and we cannot thank you enough. Mahalo!

I found this hotel through yelp and am so glad I did! Got married in Maui and honeymooned in Oahu..Aqua Lotus was everything we hoped for. Friendly and attentive staff, clean & spacious rooms with great views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Bathroom was a girl's dream! Nice walk to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but quiet and tucked away. Loved it and would recommend it to anyone who isn't looking for an overcrowded noisy area of Waikiki.

Loved the hotel. The addition of complimentary coffee, yoga and wine in afternoon is awesome. Loved the decor of the hotel, it was nice and quiet and the location was great as well. I would highly recommend this hotel if your wanting a fantastic stay in Hawaii. Mahalo

Fresh coffee and complimentary newspapers in the morning and wine in the evening make a nice welcome in this zen inspired lobby. The front desk, valet and housekeeping work as a team to make your stay hum along as perfect as can be. The modern, spacious rooms with wifi, and view of DH from a private lanai are fantastic. Nightly turn down service and super comfy beds, pillows, sheets...There's lots of great eateries nearby and a fridge to store your wine, juice, milk, etc. So close to all the action of Waikiki, yet just far enough to make you feel not like a tourist, but an actual resident.

Lucky us! Our 25th anniversary, and they had recently remodeled rooms! Decor was very nice, rooms spotless. Staff friendly and aimed to please. Loved the wine happy hour from 4-6:00. Parking not inexpensive, but our car was easily accessible from valet staff. Convenient for our desires....quiet and a quick walk to Waikiki, and other amenities.

Hotel located close to the beach,quite area, 15 min walk from Waikiki.Service is excellent.Rooms are clean, hotel has complimentary towels and mats for the beach.Parking is $20 per day.We had two balcony with Diamond Head view and partially ocean view.We stayed for 7 days and will stay at this hotel again.

This hotel is close enough, yet a world apart from the noise of Waikiki. It is a fifteen or twenty minute walk tthrough a park. The premium ocean view room (be warned that the hotel is not on the water, so there are some high rises in part of your view) at night, with the balcony doors open is peaceful and calm. You can hear the ocean all night and birds in the morning, rather than tourists and traffic. Ride one of their complimentary bikes downtown, or just stroll to a peaceful restaurant on the beach. A great find.

Aqua Lotus Honolulu is the place to stay when you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I love this hotel, as I am always greeted with genuine hospitality and welcoming smiles of the ENTIRE staff! Rooms have been renovated, which are clean and simple, yet modern. The view of Diamond Head is magnificent, especially when you are greeted with the view from the balcony of your room. Hotel location is steps away from Waikiki beach and to Kapiolani Park, which is perfect to stroll along during anytime of the day. Hotel offers great amenities for all types of guests, such as free use of bicycles, beach chairs, a complimentary wine hour, yoga sessions, daily coffee/tea service in the morning and free daily newspaper. Aqua Lotus Honolulu will always be my home away from home!

We stayed here for 2 nights in late September - even with a small discount we still felt the Aqua Lotus was overpriced. The hotel is small and cute, beach access via the hotel next door (very small quiet beach), nice amenities (free cruiser bike usage, yoga, wine hour, etc). However, the room was small and fairly basic. The bed was very comfortable though. You're basically paying for the location. Only one elevator for the whole hotel. Yoga was too early for us 7:30 am (when we arrived later just the night before) but we did ride bikes to dinner which was fun. A nice place to stay but about $100 overpriced. Could have stayed at a resort for just a little bit more.

It is a great location and the customer service was exceptional. They always made you feel welcome! A peaceful place with a beautiful beach. The rooms were clean and housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean

We are in our early 50's. Close enough to walk to big beach or shopping areas. We used the complimentary bikes almost daily, never nervous in the traffic. Everyoneof the staff was very freindly and helpful. Had a view of Diamond Head and partial view of ocean. Nice small local beach for quiet time & swimming and big beach close to swim, read or people watch. We were lucky to be there when they closed down the main beach street for the night. lots of local tents and food.Bogarts and local health foods cafe (both are very small) are realatively close 3-4 blocks and have very good breakfast and lunchs. breakfast bowl of fruit and frozen berry concoction was worth the walk/ride.Initially dissappointed we were not right down on the strip, but quickly learned the peace and quiet of the area was the better choice.I see the new on site restaraunt will be opening in the near future. This would make this hotel an complete destination and excellent choice in my opinion.My only dissappointment was that it was not located right on the beach. but in reality it did not matter other than not being able to eat meals overlooking the water. No Big deal as we just had to venture out, and that is why we vacation.

This is my first ever review because we were so happy with this hotel and service standards were above expectations. After staying in the heart of Waikiki and having a few sleepness nights because of noise levels at all hours, it was so good to be so close to things in this hotel but in a quiet location while still enjoying great views and location.Special thanks to Joshua and crew for their help with medical and insurance matters when I injured myself.

- I never write reviews, but was compelled to with this hotel because I was so happy with them.- Just 5 min. from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Very convenient.- Rooms were modern, spacious and very clean.- Service was impeccable. Proactively switched us to a room with double beds despite our booking site making an error and booking us in a room with one King. Offered to bring in a roll away to make it more comfortable for us AND comp'd it for our entire 9 day stay. We didn't ask - they offered. AMAZING.- Can't be happier about our stay. - Parking is valet only ($22 per day) BUT, there is ample street parking across the street that is cheap during the day and free from 6 pm to 10 am (when you would probably be parking anyway).

We had a wonderful stay at the Aqua Lotus Hotel in September 2012. We had a minor difficult time finding it because the hotel sign says Lotus Diamond Head. A quick call to the hotel assured us that it was the one we were looking for. We were given a two double bed room, but when we went down to ask for a king, they quickly got us one and moved us. The hotel is beautiful, full of amenities that other hotels in the area don't provide (free internet, free morning coffee, free bikes, beach chairs, towels, and the wonderful free wine in the afternoon.) The staff was all very friendly and helpful and called us by name when greeting us. The room was lovely, bed comfortable, and bathroom very nice. The only thing that went wrong for us is we didn't realize how far from the rest of Waikiki Beach the hotel really is. We had returned our rental car when we got there (had been on the north shore for a week) thinking we could walk or cab it that week. It only took us one irritating day to realize that we needed to rent another car, which we did. Once we had a car, we were fine. We are both fairly young and in shape, but the hotel is really just a little too far from everything to walk every time you want to go somewhere. I should say however, that it was in a great location for our morning runs. We headed out towards Diamond Head and run up Diamond Head Rd. Terrific run. The hotel should definitely work on getting a restaurant back in there as quickly as possible. We both highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.

Being by Diamond Head, a stones throw from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki, was ideal. The hotel was very enjoyable and being on the water was great. I will stay here again when I'm next in Waikiki.

I booked with trepidation..an older hotel that could be a disaster. My wife and I were very pleasantly surprised at its cleanliness and comfort, but most of all by the wonderful staff. Every single person was terrific. The rooms were modern and very clean and the hotel did not have any of that "old hotel smell covered up by cleaning chemicals" that I was so afraid of. If you want noise and crowds, book in Waikiki, but if you want quiet and peaceful this is the place. It is across the street from a very large park and Diamond Head is right outside. Location was convenient. It did take us a couple of days to figure out the one way streets which sometimes made things difficult, but once we understood the pattern, all worked out well. I had the best walk ever one early morning from the hotel to Waikiki and back...peaceful and relaxing. Frankly, the staff really made this trip. Knowledgeable, kind, aloha spirit, and helpful. A joy to find in any hotel. I highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed at the Lotus recently and were very pleased with the service, and the size and design of the room. LOCATION: The hotel is on the quiet “Gold Coast,” in front of Diamond Head, across from Kapiolani Park and next to the Outrigger Canoe Club. All rooms have lanais that face Diamond Head, which looms very large and close, so you’ll have a nice view. If you’re on a higher floor, you’ll even get some ocean. STAFF: The staff could not have been nicer. They lay out coffee in the morning and wine in the evening on a table in the lobby. Anything we asked for, basically they accommodated.THE ROOM: The room had a very modern, clean design. Whites and teal blues. Sliding shutter doors closed out the sun. Nice flat-screen TV and complimentary wireless. THE PROPERTY: The only thing to note is that are no restaurants and there is no pool. But, you are right next to San Souci beach and the hotel will give you free beach chairs and towels. Much better than any pool. I would highly recommend to those who have done the busy Waikiki thing and are interested in staying a bit off the beaten path – just far enough – and don’t have the need to sit around a pool and be waited on hand and foot. A walk to the Halekulani for drinks is around 20 minutes or so.Tip: it’s $10 per day for valet parking, cheap enough, but there is ample meter parking across the street.

The Aqua Lotus hotel is truly outstanding in quality and service. It was a little tricky to find at first and the check in lady was a bit grumpy, but when we opened our room door we were so pleased we had chosen this hotel. The feeling certainly intensified after going out on our lanai.....amazing views!!!Complimentary wine between 4 and 6pm was well received even if it did mean we had to have a little nap before dinner!Location is perfect here as it is quiet yet close to everywhere you want to go. I even had a crazy exercise moment and made use of the complimentary bike to peddle round the local park.Our only issue is with with parking. Maybe it's because we are from the UK where valet parking is rare, but I found it annoying to be charged $20 a night for parking, then have to tip the valet every time you wanted to pop downtown in your car, especially when my car was parked right next to the valet station. It did make me smile though when the valet would only move my car 10 feet!

I have been staying at this hotel for over 20 years. It is a great small boutique hotel located near Diamond Head and out of the way from the crowds of Waikiki. The sevice and staff are excellent and they have just remodeled the rooms which are spacious and well appointed with dark wood floors and new furniture. The hotel does not have a restuarant or room sevice but I like the quiet location and apacious rooms.

Beautiful rooms and very affordable rates. No food service, but if you are a member or guest at the Outrigger you have a great place to eat right next door. Location is awesome; staff friendly and accommodating. Will definitely stay again!

We were extremely happy with our entire stay from the moment we pulled into the parking lot until the time we checked out. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and quiet and the staff were all pleasant, helpful and very accomodating with all of our requests and questions. Our room had a spectacular view of Diamond Head as well as the ocean. We were away from the crazy downtown area and all of the noise there but within walking distance to everything when we wanted the craziness. The beach near us was beautiful and never crowded and only a minute away from us. We also had a small convenience store a stone throw away from the hotel. We especially enjoyed the complimentary wine every evening. They offered beach towels, mats, and chairs, as well as bikes free of charge. We would definitely stay at the Lotus again and would highly reccommend it. We loved it there!!!!!

We booked the Aqua Lotus based on the photos on their website. It is as pretty as it looks, but it's lacking in amenities that I consider standard for a four-star hotel, like a pool and restaurant. Apparently the restaurant was shut down when the property was converted from a W hotel to the Aqua group, and that made it very inconvenient. After a long day of travel, we had hoped to check in and get room service for dinner, but that wasn't possible, as there's no room service. We also had hoped to relax by the pool the next morning, but, again, not possible. I guess I should have double-checked those amenities before booking, but it never occurred to me that at this price point it wouldn't have them. The hotel was very pretty and had outstanding views, and the staff were very helpful. It was just disappointing that we didn't have access to the amenities we wanted.

We have booked this hotel in advance specifying we were a couple with two kids and that we would have needed a room with two queen beds. We also booked and paied fro an ocena fron room.When we arrived we were given an ocean view room with a king bed only. we have been supplied right away with an additional roll away bed but the next day when we asked again for the two queens they replied they did not have any available and that type of beds in the room is not guaranteed. solution was acceptable but not optimal of course.Room was nice, new, modern, and really clean. The hotel is not ocean front (two condos block the view to the ocean which van be seen only sideways). Location is perfect, far away from the heart of noisy waikiki but still in a walking distance from everything. Restaurant was closed and we did not understand if it has been ever open. No coffe machine in the room: coffe available in the hall from 5.30 a.m. Aoverall hotel is great for business trips but sure not ideal for families or vacation.

From the time the valet met us pulling into the hotel, the receptionist, housekeeping, checking out the service was outstanding, very friendly and helpful. Our room was super clean, the view magnificant the location perfect, not too close to Waikiki and not too far away (8 min. walk). Very quiet area. The complimentary wine every evening from 4-6pm was a nice touch. They had beach mats, chairs, towels, bikes all available to us at no charge. We felt the $20/day parking fee was reasonable, our car was safe, we didn't need to run out and put money in the meter or check on the car, it was available at any time of day and as often as we needed it. Not having a pool was not a concern for us, as we have access to a pool here at home, but not the beautiful beaches that surround this property, so we took advantage of that and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on. Top quality sheets and pillows, we really felt pampered. Not the usual hotel quality, if we weren't in Hawaii, we would have slept in a little longer each day!We would stay here again and we would highly recommend this hotel.

Thanks Aqua Lotus for the upgrade to the penthouse, Our two families were delighted to be put up in the penthouse instead of two rooms. (double booked maybe) There was not quite enough in the way of beds but we made do due to the fabulous veiws and space offered by the massive penthouse. Not sure if that would do for some people though, It really made our holiday.The loaction is out of the main area of Waikiki which is a good thing if you dont like crowds and the local beach is small but really good.

My daughter and I stayed at the Lotus on our return to Oz from USA. I'd booked through a travel agent but found the property myself on Trip Advisor and was very pleased with my choice.Our room on the 7th floor viewed Diamond Head and the hallway Waikiki. The furnishings were simple and homely, timber trimmed and made you feel like you were in a bungalow. Beds comfy. Staff were very informative and even remembered our names even tho we only stayed two nights. There's a convenience store next door which had 'everything' at pleasant prices and we had breakfast in the hotel next door which was very nice. Across the road is a large park so the traffic noise is minimal and in the mornings all the healthy people are jogging doing Yoga and exercising. The beach is 20 meters away and much much quieter than Waikiki proper. We had everything we wanted and I'd recommend anyone to stay here. It's a 2km walk to the centre of Waikiki but we liked being out of the way a little and it's pleasant walking.

We did not book directly with the hotel, but through a 3rd party website and paid in advance. One thing we were not aware of was a $20/day valet fee, as we rented a car, but this fee is not unheard of, I suppose. The housekeeping, despite tipping, was not exceptional, and he/she would do the minimum but always an OK job. I guess that we are used to places like Mexico and Dominican Republic where they go the extra mile and dress up the room. Overall, the room was clean, so no issues.The room itself was spacious, and the wood shuttered windows let in a lot of light, and gave us a view of Diamond Head and a park. We ate dinner on the balcony a few times and that was fun. Wireless internet is included, and in the lobby, there is free coffee in the AM (or hot chocolate for my young kids) and wine from 4-6 PM daily. A nice touch. The room has a small fridge, and that is handy as my kids like milk, cereal, etc in the AM and it was handy. If you cross the parking lot, about 100 yards away is a PRIVATE BEACH, which is clean, not crowded and next to the Outrigger Canoe club. This stretch of beach is secluded from the adjacent, more busy beach as it has a stone/lava rock barrier that you can walk out on and view the ocean. We went to the more busy adjacent beach and it was filled with garbage, plastic straws in the sand. Yuck. Our stretch of beach had lots of shells and little coral in the sand and hermit crabs the kids played with. We also hired one of the workers at the Canoe Club to give us a outrigger boat ride for an hour and we rode some waves at 6 PM. Fun!! We loved it. It was great in the AM, if you go there at 6:30 AM and have coffee/hot chocolate and bring a little breakfast. We watched the sun rise on the ocean and on Moloka'i. Fantastic.I agree with a lot of other comments by others. The concierge was friendly and helpful, but the valet guys (esp. Travis) were excellent and filled with lots of tips on what to do for kids, always ready with maps and advice. The other fellow in the evening was also great and they are always friendlyRestaurant was closed, but we ate out a lot. Lots of choices in < 1.5 mile radiusOverall, a nice experience

We were assigned to a unit at the end of the corridor with an extra patio with view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Our room was kept clean and tidy at all time by the hotel staff who were very friendly and efficient. I gave four start on sleep quality because we prefer firmer bed. The hotel is not on Waikiki which means less noise from tourists and traffic. I found this place by referral from a Friend and we were not disappointed!

I was in room 1125, with Diamond Head and partial ocean view. The furnishings are modern and beautifully kept, w/ polished wood floors and sliding wooden window shutters. The staff was, to a person, exceptionally welcoming, knowledgeable and professional. I stayed here on the recommendation of two friends, and would myself recommend the Aqua Lotus to you.

Upon the arrival we found our that we could not stay at the Lotus due to the overbooking rooms. The hotel staff was very courteous and nice! gave us a sincere apology, and got a taxi to the different hotel with a deluxe ocean view in Waikiki. No wander why Aqua Lotus gets such great reviews! They really work hard to make the guest happy, and they deserve 5 starts for their service!!!

The only way this place could be any better is if the restaurant was open. Other than that, it was just wonderful. Free bikes, chairs and towels!! The valet is a vital part of this organization, even if you don't have a car. He sets everything up for you, and both guys I dealt with, Travis and the other fellow, whose name I forgot, were professional, kind, friendly, funny and super helpful with everything. They recommended the best restaurants, bike tours, grocery stores and walking trails. These guys were brilliant. The room was beautiful, we had a view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The beds were comfy, the shower worked great, and the location of the hotel is perfect. Not in the center of Wakiki, but close enough to be convenient, but quiet. I can't say enough.

We stayed at the Aqua Lotus for nine nights at the end of July and had a grand time. We have been to the islands a number of times and decided to return to Oahu this year. We wanted to stay in the Diamond Head area and the Aqua Lotus was a great choice. As many others have noted, the staff is just first rate, the rooms are large and nice, there are many free amenities, and the views (especially from the upper floors where we were) are outstanding. The beach here is quite nice, as is Kapiolani Park. I had local friends stop by to visit and they too were impressed. Our new place to stay.

My husband and I have been visiting Waikiki at least every other year since 1986, have stayed at any number of hotels (including the Hyatt Regency Club on a first-class vacation in 1993) and by far the Aqua Lotus is the best! I won't tell you which room we had (want to keep it a secret to insure its availability for future visits!) but the views of both Diamond Head and the ocean were absolutely gorgeous, and the quiet (even on the lanai) was very welcome from the usual bus and early morning garbage truck noise of everywhere else we have ever stayed in Waikiki proper. The 15-minute walk to the restaurants, shopping, and hustle and bustle of Waikiki is no big deal, and the Gold Coast and San Souci / Queen's Surf end of Waikiki is our favorite end of the beach, anyway. Be warned that there is no swimming pool, but why have a pool when the ocean is only steps away? The room (and lobby) was beautifully decorated in a Balinese theme and properly maintained, service and evening turndown were excellent, and the happy hour wine service in the lobby is a big plus! We can't wait for our next visit when the Lotus restaurant will be open, as we may never want to go far away from the Lotus, except to the beach! Which reminds me, we love how the Lotus provides so many amenities that are complimentary, including not only the happy hour wine service, but free WiFi Internet access, beach chairs and towels, cruiser bicycles, and even the in-room safe. It is so nice to find a boutique hotel with both reasonable rates and no "nickle-and-dime" amenities. With only 50 rooms, never is there a crowded or competitive feel to obtaining services or accessing the hotel elevator. An aloha spirit prevails, not only among hotel staff, but also among the guests, who during our stay all seemed like family. Special kudos to Dante at the front desk! We definitely will be staying at the Lotus on future visits, in fact, where else would we want to stay after this wonderful experience?

This hotel is well-suited for those who wish a serene stay in Honolulu. The hotel is located steps to the beach near diamond head. It is not oceanfront per se, but some rooms have partial ocean views. The staff is excellent and amenities include use of beach chairs and towels, beach cruiser bicycles, and yoga classes most mornings. The hotel rooms are nicely sized and well-maintained. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it.

We (family of four, with two teenagers) stayed for a little over a week. Our experience was OUTSTANDING. The location, the facility, and the staff helped to make this our best vacation to date. The location, by the park and away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki, was quiet, but still within walking distance to downtown. The Diamond Head and coastal view from our balcony was a poatcard, absolutely beautiful! Our room was clean and very comfortable. And the icing on the cake was the staff. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Travis and Carissa; their help made our vacation the best ever! If we can, we will definately return.

My teenaged sons and I have stayed here for the past 2 nights and we are very happy with our choice. It is a short, lovely walk along the beach front or park to the Waikiki shops and restaurants, the rooms are very nice, clean and modern. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful with maps, recommendations and beach chairs, boogie boards and towels. The hotel is not directly on the beach but it is just across the parking lot, not even over a road. Diamond Head is right over the road. I have enjoyed the coffee available in the lobby in the morning and the complimentary wine in the evening. Definitely recommended for a short stay on the island, away from, but accessible to, the very busy Waikiki 'strip'.

The Lotus exceeded our expectations. The room decor is very zen, the location by Kapiolani Park with a view of Diamond Head is unrivaled and the area is away from all the noise of Waikiki. The front desk staff is excellent and gave an excellent orientation. And the woman who checked us out the next day was very informative about breakfast venues. We'll stay again and recommend it highly. It is also very close to Kaimana Beach... A lovely part of Waikiki.

We loved our stay here, out of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but close enough to go into if we wanted. Loved to complimentary wine in the lobby , and also the complimentary bikes which allowed our family to go for a late bikeride on the boardwalk where we discovered a monk seal on the beach (yes, we kept our distance, but it was difficult since the boardwalk is very close to the shoreline) Thank you for a fabulous stay!!

We had a very pleasant stay and the hotel staff, who made our stay the top of the line, were extremely friendly, professional, and helpful. It is located in a quieter section of Honolulu, between the beach and a park. You can walk/bike to many nice shopping/eating areas. They provide free bikes, beach gear, etc., and will really take care of you. Lita, head of housekeeping, was great and was always available to help out.

I so don't want to write this review because I so don't want it to get too popular! But I owe it to the staff! Someone else wrote that they had never seen a hotel that is nicer in real life than in the pictures - I couldn't agree more. We had an Ocean View Premium room, beautifully decorated and were blown away by the view... I had walked by this hotel many times (I'm there a lot on business) and I couldn't understand how the views would be any good. Wrong! They're breathtaking! And having the disappearing wall with balcony and the second smaller balcony allowed us to open up the room and let the breezes blow through... And it's so quiet we could hear the ocean! The staff was wonderful and we used the bikes to go for breakfast almost everyday in Waikiki (after coffee at sunrise on our balcony!) There is also a restaurant steps away at the hotel next door that serves b'fast, lunch and dinner. We used the free beach chairs, towels and umbrellas every day as we ventured around the island. Valet parking is $20/night but that's normal. You just drive up and get out - the staff remembers you, unloads the car and takes care of the rest. I cannot say more about this hotel. It was so nice to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We will be back!!!

This renovated W hotel is an easy walk to Waikiki, the Zoo, the beach, and in the shadow of Diamond Head. Excellent staff and amenities. We enjoyed a great dinner near-by as well as watching the surfing, seeing an art show and the Tinman triathalon

This hotel is really amazing. i have never ever in my life discovered that the hotel is prettier in real life than on the pictures, but this hotel is even prettier in real life than in pictures. the rooms are big, we were 4 adults sharing 1 room and that was no problem at all. delicate and beautifully decorated hotel and rooms. The bed's are good and comfortable to sleep in and everything in the room seems to be of perfect quality. Big TV screen with lots of channels to choose between and there is also possible to rent movies on the TV. The hotel is clean and delicate. The cleaners does a really good job and the hotel seems to be perfectly clean at all hours. good service and perfect location. It's not in the middle of the city but a little bit out side, and it makes it a little bit more quiet and peaceful at night. The little beach 2 minutes from the hotel is a really nice place to relax and take a swim. It is not to many people there so you can relax more and just enjoy a peaceful holiday. The hotel lets you borrow beach towels and chairs for free, so that is really good. It simply a really good hotel with high standard. you will feel comfortable and relaxed while staying here, the perfect hotel for family's, love birds, friends etc. The atmosphere is great and i will guaranteed stay here the next time i visit Hawaii.

Two visits over the course of ten days confirmed that this is one of the best hotels experiences to be had. From the friendly greeting on arrival (and ever other time you meet someone), to assistance with any requests and helpful advice when you just don't know, the feeling here permeates casual relaxation - but without any sacrifice to the level of service you'll get. With views that overlook parklands, Daimond Head, a glimpse of the beach and a stunning vista towards downtown Honolulu (especially after sunset), this is where I'll be staying on future visits. The Aqua Lotus is situated an easy 15 minute walk from the bustle of the main strip but the 'buffer' of the beachfront parks makes for a lovely transition at the beginning and end of each day's activities. I left behind a couple of items after my first stay, but they were there, safe and sound, for pick-up on my return a week later. And on the second stay, unbeknowns to me, two credit cards had slid out of sight under furniture. Before we'd realised they were missing, hotel staff had contacted us and organised courier delivery (to Australia!) whilst happily declining offers to reimburse them. That's what I call 'the extra mile'! Top marks Aqua Lotus, Mahalo nui loa.

Fantastic location away from main high-rise concentration of larger hotels but close enough to walk to. Next to quiet uncrowded stretch of beach. Beautiful park opposite which is overlooked by Diamond Head. Relatively small hotel with 12 floors ( the first 2 are Reception, lounge and meeting rooms). Cool, calm, friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Beautiful, modern, clean decor.We had room on 7th floor facing Diamond Head and Kapliona Park but could also see the ocean.Complimentary coffee, tea and chocolate available in the morning and wine in the afternoon. We made daily use of the beach mats, towels and chairs provided at Reception.High spot was starting the day with Yoga 4 times a week in the park under a Banyan tree. Courtney and Pablo were great.Although no restaurant at the hotel there is a fantastic place next door. The meals at the Hau Tree Lanai were superb.The staff at the Lotus were extremely friendly and helpful but not pushy.

I did my homework looking for the best place to stay in Honolulu for a family of five adults. I had a lot of people to please. Aqua Lotus did not disappoint. My husband and I stayed in one room and the kids stayed in room next to us. We were on the 10th floor, and had a spectacular view of Diamond Head to the right, the ocean to the left. We even slept with our doors open at night, that's how quiet it is here. Yet it's a short 10 minute walk to the Waikiki hustle and bustle, which we did enjoy. But we were very happy to come back to our boutique hotel. I don't know what I liked the most; maybe opening my eyes (in a very comfy bed) and seeing the sunrise over Diamond Head, or maybe it was waking to the sound of birds singing, which I would sit and listen to on my lanai while sipping my (free) coffee! We also discovered Lulu's restaurant for breakfast which meant a lovely stroll through a beautiful park every morning. Free towels, free beach chairs, free boogie boards, were also appreciated. And a lovely touch was the extremely welcoming and helpful staff who addressed us by name when we came down for our car. The rooms were large and newly renovated. Hope to come back someday...

I just spent the weekend at The Lotus. The hotel was so nice and comfortable I did not want to leave. A really terrific location. You could walk to Waikiki or enjoy some of the terrific restaurants in the area. The views of the Ocean and Diamond Head were incredible. The staff is very friendly, and offers excellent service. I highly recommend this hotel, it is a gem.

We loved the modern, Asian-inspired decor. I took another Travelocity member's advice and requested a room on the seventh floor or higher. Also got the deluxe ocean-view room. It was worth the extra $20 or so dollars! We had an amazing view of Diamond Head on one side and could see a sizeable slice of the ocean on the other. Other great things about this hotel -- it was very quiet, bed was super comfy, they offered free wine from 4 to 6 p.m. in the lobby (nice touch!) and it was adjacent to a very pretty little park where we could jog, walk or people-watch. Also, in the hotel next door was a great little restaurant where we could eat on the lanai directly on Waikiki Beach (Hau Tree Lanai). We made OpenTable.com reservations and had a no-brainer place to go for dinner the night we checked in all jet-lagged and everything. Only downside was the $20-per-day parking, but that seemed to be common among all the area hotels. Highly recommend the hotel!

We stayed 10 nights, lured by the yoga,bikes,no pool and location just out of the tourist gulag.All of these features exceeded expectations.Yoga with Courtenay and Pablo was tremendous,helped by the setting outside under the banyan tree. These two are fab.The staff are cool, and not obvious. Ciette, Wes & other concierges are so happy and helpful, we saw them often as used the bikes most days. They could do w long shorts tho, must be real hot in those navy trou, not to mention un-Hawaiian.Sarah was excellent on reception and housekeeping staff were brilliant people.We ate a lot at the new otani hotel next door as no food at Lotus. We weren't bothered about that.The comp morning coffee & wine hours were much appreciated and part of our daily ritual.Super comfy bed to boot.We will be back next July.Two happy Kiwis
This hotel was so serene, beautiful, and clean. The hotel staff was very kind and courteous. Our room was beautiful and comfortable.

If you're looking to stay on Waikiki then location is important. I think there are two options: rights im the heart of the hustle and bustle of the high rise hotels or away from the noise but close enough to be near ther beaches and fun. If the latter is what you're looking for, then the Aqua Lotus is a perfect choice. This boutique hotel (formerly the W) is about half a.mile east of the edge of the Waikiki shopping district across from the big park ar the base of Diamond Head. It's a bit pricey as you'd expect for this area of Honolulu, but they don't nickel and dime you for the amenities. Bicycle rental, boogie boards and beach gear are all dispensed with no change or hassle. The bell/parking guys are friendly and very knowledgeable about Oahu sights and restaurants. Parking is $20 per day but only if you leave the car in the garage overnight. If you want to save that money for a nice breakfast at the Queen's Surf Cafe, then park overnight in the plentiful street parking and bring your car into the garage in the morning.

What a lovely hotel. This was our first visit to Honolulu and we were so glad we chose this hotel. The location was perfect away from the main part of Waikiki but easy walking distance. The hotel was one of the most comfortable I've stayed in. Apart from the recently decorated rooms, balconies to enjoy the view and ample space, the staff were outstanding. They were always friendly and ready to help with any request. We were really comfortable at the beach, which is very close, especially with towels and chairs supplied by the hotel at no charge. We stayed 6 nights then went to another island and came back for one night before returning home. We really felt so happy to return for our last night in Hawaii and it made the preparations for our return trip to Australia so easy. All of our experiences here were very good but what made the help of the staff so important was that 2 credit cards were accidentally left behind in our room and this was only discovered on our return to Australia. The hotel staff found and secured them and posted them back to us in Australia at no charge. This is what I call service!

I have never spent as much time researching a hotel as I did for this trip: what with all the reviews of dampness, bugs, noise, cost, etc. Standing out from all the choices was the Aqua Lotus and it is even better than I hoped. Freshly remodeled, spacious and attractive rooms, extremely comfortable beds, amazing staff, etc. Basically I have the same things to say as reviewer David S. I LOVE that this hotel is away from the chaos of main Waikiki and surrounded by parks and residential. It is relaxing, no external noise interrupt sleep and beautiful views of Diamondhead. The staff is amazing: warm, friendly, never without a smile, knowledgeable, helpful with suggestions and directions - you feel very pampered. The bathrooms have tons of counterspace and luxurious towels. The valet parking adds up, but it was the easiest and safest option plus the valets were so pleasant. The hotel offers bicycles free of charge and they come complete with helmets and bike locks. The valet was very helpful in getting us set up to ride. If I am ever to be back in this city, I will definitely stay here again.

I stayed at the Aqua Lotus for 5 nights and absolutely enjoyed my stay. I want to start of first by talking about the great staff at this hotel. As soon as I arrived to the hotel I was kindly greeted by the valet. I had a rental car so I knew that tipping the valet would add up over time. After my second day, the valet told me that I do not have to tip him all the time because I am always in and out of the hotel. Of course I still tipped him, but its the thought that showed me the type of employees this hotel hires. When I checked in, Dante at the front desk took care of my every needs. I had most of my activities preplanned before my trip, but his suggestions seemed better than some of my activities I had planned. So of course I took his word for it and canceled some of my activities. He also suggested some great places out of the Waikiki area for a romantic dinner with my wife. I could not have ever imagined my stay at a hotel to be so problem free. Anytime I had a question or need anything the hotel staff was right there to help me out. If I had it my way I would promote all of them lol.Secondly, I am going to talk about this hotel. The location in my opinion is better suited for me and my wife. Its away from the highly congested and noisy Waikiki area but still in walking distance. The amount of free amenities this hotel offers is unheard of. The hotel came with free wifi, which for me is a necessity. I know most hotels in Waikiki charge a daily fee for internet. The hotel provided free coffee and newspaper in the lobby every morning. The hotel provided free wine from 4-6 pm everyday. The hotel even provided us with free beach gear and even bicycles. My wife and I loved taking the bicycles out. Now the rooms from what the staff told me was just renovated a week or two ago so I was fortunate to enjoy the fine luxurious upgrades. As soon as I walked into my room, I was more than satisfied. The room was larger than I had anticipated. The floors were made of a dark hard wood flooring. All the furniture in the room was brand new. The king size bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby. The TV was a flat panel LCD. The bathroom was nicely finished with marble floors and new fixtures. Although I was rarely in the room during the day, its still nice to come home and rest in a nice clean hotel room. Overall my stay at this hotel and Hawaii has been such a great experience and more than satisfying. I highly recommend others to stay at this hotel. You will not get a better hotel than this in Waikiki with this many free amenities and price.

AQUA LOTUS was THE BEST place you could stay at to experience the different kinds of activities you could think of! We woke up with an awesome view of the DIAMOND HEAD on the left over looking the KAPIOLANI PARK and WAIKIKI BEACH on the right! They even had a FREE BEACH CRUISER for us to use and cruise down the waikiki strip that is only a few blocks away! It was awesome!! The customer service was on point... from the maid service to the very informative and friendly concierge and valet guys. DANTE at the front desk was the best on hooking us up with local spots and festivities that were happening in town. We would DEFINITELY come back and stay at this place! Thanks for a very memorable vacation!!

Having just completed another ten day stay at The Aqua Lotus, I can only give praise. The noise is minimal compared to any Waikiki hotel. Winos in the park are not the hotel's fault. Food options are great if you are willing to pay (Michel's) and diverse if you walk down to Waikiki.As to your raving rant about the hotel next door, The New Otani, I have only ever had nothing but great service and aloha spirit.I highly recommend this hotel. Big rooms and fabulous staff.

You are not getting nickeled and dimed here. We are at a big name hotel on Maui right now and I am afraid to see the bill.At the Lotus: Free internet, free coffee in the morning (served in the lobby), free wine in the evenings (and it's good wine, pleasantly surprised, in real glasses). Free beach chair loaner. This would have cost us $30 per person here at the Westin! Not to mention the smiles here are genuine. I see a lot of comments about the location, but it worked for us as we had friends renting a house across the park. It is off the "main strip", but absolutely within walking distance of the famous waikiki beach. The location works for us as we have two little kids and they didn't have to be right next to us the whole time, it's a very quiet and safe location, one elevator, small lobby. You walk behind the hotel and onto san souci beach, heaven. FYI there is a hose you can use to wash the sand off if you miss the showers at the beach. Just past the aquarium is a really cool little place for breakfast and lunch right on the beach, the queens cafe or something like that. Great burger and teriyaki chicken and grilled fish.I did an amazing run in the mornings from the hotel up to the lighthouse (about two miles with a good hill), just ask Wesley at the valet desk which direction to head. If you have kids ask for Jesel as your housekeeper- she was so patient with ours and full of smiles.Thanks so much for a fantastic stay and vacation! Can't wait to come back following the remodel.

We chose the Lotus to save some money and what a mistake. At the last minute before our trip I panicked when thinking about the cost of our trip (15th wedding anniversary) and so I canceled our reservation at the Kahala for the first 5 nights of our trip and cashed in airline miles for the first five nights of the trip to stay here. Let me start off and say that we were greeted with a smile, the bell men was helpful, the free use of the bikes is a great perk and overall this hotel is just OK. I would categorize it as a place to stay that is reasonable in price, nothing more nothing less. If you are on a budget and the most important thing is to just get to Hawaii and you don't really stay in the room, workout or eat in the hotel, and you don't want to be near the huge crowds in Waikiki then this is probably the place for you. Now back to my review, I guess you could say that I went into this with low expectations and even those weren't met. When I think of Hawaii I think of a hotel room with a lanai and trade winds and at least something unique to look at if not an ocean/partial ocean view. I knew from the reviews that we wouldn't be getting an ocean view but I wasn't expecting a full view of a parking deck with construction going on at the building next door. I know the hotel can't control the construction and the view is what it is but that doesn't change the fact that standing in our room and opening our door to the lanai you would have never guessed we were even in Hawaii. I have had better views and a better vibe looking out of my window at the SpringHill Suites on a business trip to Louisville KY. That didn't sit well with me given the importance of the trip. I write this review mainly to people that might be on the fence about spending more money to stay at a nicer hotel. We found that it was worth it! (If you can somehow strech your money it is worth the extra cost at the Kahala and Halekulani). To be clear though I am the type of traveler that doesn't see the room as just a place to crash. I wouldn't call myself snobby but if I am going on a nice trip(and I would categorize a long trip to Hawaii as that) I want a nice room with some sense that the hotel has an ambiance and a soul that is special. That is not this hotel. I am also used to trips(business or family) where the hotel is just a place to stay and the trip is more about the location or the people I am with. If this trip was that kind of trip maybe this hotel would have fit the bill. One side note, we did try and upgrade the room the morning after we arrived and we were met with a resounding "NO, the hotel is fully booked". It was a Wednesday, from all appearances there were few people milling around the hotel so I can only surmise that because they already had our money they weren't interested in upgrading us. I could be wrong but the most damning thing about the service was that we decided to check out that day regardless of the fact that we lost those points and when we did the lady at the front desk never acknowledged that we were checking out early and thus never asked why or if there was anything they could do to change our mind?? Poor service to say the least. For those interested we said damn the cost and we moved over to the Kahala (partial ocean view) and we had a magical stay. Truly one of the most special places I have ever stayed in. I will be writing a review for that hotel as well as the Halekulani. After the Kahala we went over to the Royal Hawaiian, (once again, tried to save money and cashed in points) and couldn't believe the small dark shoebox off a room. Cost be damned we checked out the next day an ended our stay with 3 nights at the Halekulani. Almost as magical as the Kahala!!

Pros: Nice, funky little hotel and helpful staff. Different look than usual big, corporate hotel chains. Comfy bed, clean room. Mine had a view of Diamond Head on one side and a sliver of the ocean (between two massive skyskraper condos) on the other side.Cons (HUGE but no fault of Aqua Lotus): 1) Construction noise from hotel next door. Call me fussy, but the sound of jack hammers and buzz saws ringing in your ears as you lie on the beach, trying to relax after a 6 hour trip from the mainland definitely throws a wet towel on the whole "relaxing HI vacation" vibe.  2) Winos/homeless people passed out, living in nearby parks, steps from the hotel.They didn't panhandle me (probably because they were unconscious) but they gave the area a creepy, unsafe vibe.3) Complete lack of food options nearby. The Aqua Lotus hotel has a sign near the elevator that refers to a restaurant in the hotel itself. However, it was "closed" when I was there. (Some staff members said it is "under renovation"; others laughed, said it has been closed "for years" meaning--wink, wink--obviously no real plans to reopen it--if it ever existed.) The only real option for food nearby was a restaurant in the hotel next door (the Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel). Of course, food there is absurdly expensively overpriced but that's to be expected. Worse, I found the attitude of the restaurant greeter (a snotty old lady) downright rude. One evening, I arrived at around 5 PM and she refused to seat me for dinner, citing"lack of a reservation." This was laughable because I ate there the previous night without a reservation or any problem. Besides, there were plenty of empty tables available and no one else in line. She clearly did not want to serve me because I was traveling on business/solo (instead of with a huge family or tour group in tow) and, obviously, would not be a huge cash cow for her/the restaurant. Instead, she referred me to a Japanese restaurant upstairs which was a TOTAL JOKE--dark room, completely empty (except for one other couple), across from rooms under construction, and attended by a few clueless old bats in kimonos who didn't speak a word of English and one of whom glared at me with a creepy combination of aggravation and condescension/shock when she first saw me and throughout the meal . Very uncomfortable and bizarre. (Guess she never heard of a single woman traveling or dinining alone. LOL) Certainly not the welcoming "aloha" spirit I expected. The only other "options" (not really) are a very small convenience store behind the Aqua Lotus where you can buy a candy bar and soda or you can walk a mile north for the lovely experience of dining on old picnic benches covered with pigeon droppings and flies, outside a concession stand. YUM!Don't fall for the website propaganda about how Diamond Head area hotels are a tranquil, relaxing, beautiful oasis far from the maddening tourist crowds of Waikiki. Next time, either stay on the North side of the island or elsewhere (Maui or another island).

We chose the Lotus based on TripAdvisor reviews and it's location...just far enough away from hustle/bustle of Waikiki, but within walking distance to Waikiki for dinner and shopping.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The valet parking attendant was especially helpful in directions and dining options.We stayed on 10th floor--room 1024. Hotel is being renovated from 12th floor down. View was nice--we could see Diamond head and a partial view of the ocean.

We loved our time here. Thank goodness we chose to stay away from the city in this wonderful hotel. The redone rooms are wonderful. Love the coffee in the morning, wine in the afternoon, yoga on some mornings, wonderful walks with views, apples, beach chairs, nice people. Just enjoyed our stay. Plus the valet and front desk were always there and extremely helpful.I know some people said the one elevator bothered them but it wasn't a problem for us at all. Neither was the restaurant being under renovation - probably because we like to explore a bit. I will say that this hotel in general and the hotel where the beach is are both under renovation. We spent most of our time on the north shore so it didn't affect us and I do think it is reflected in their price. The value for the really well done rooms was great.

Beautiful hotel, warm and kind staff, excellent location. The staff went beyond my expectations to ensure that we had everything we could possibly need. They anticpated our needs and were always 2 steps ahead. The location was perfect- just outside all the busy streets of Waikiki but within walking distance. From our balcony there was Diamond Head to the left and a beautiful view of the ocean to the right. Simply put- PARADISE at its best.

Thank you Aqua Lotus! This was a great getaway. We were greeted by a wonderful valet and front desk staff. Room was a corner room on the 10th floor. Beautiful views! Loved the elevator music too - Was upbeat and always entertaining. Excited for the renovation and restuarant as Aqua will be even better!! Thanks again,

We stayed here only one night in 2009 before we boarded a cruise. I so wish we would have stayed longer. What a perfect location right accross from the beach, just down the road from lots of restaurants and so close to Diamond Head. I would definitely stay here again!! We didn't get to use any of the amenities but still ahd a wonderful visit.

From the super friendly & helpful staff, to all the complimentary stuff... Wine, Yoga, Bikes, Beach Towels etc to the sweeping views & well appointed rooms this hotel has it all + the elevator plays dances tunes... hard to explain but quite the experience!

We decided to stay here due to its proximity to Michel's at the Colony Surf since we expected to sample several great wines during dinner. The accomodations were great on its own (even if it was nice to simply walk back to the room after dinner). They offer complimentary morning coffee and afternoon wine in the lobby and the down appointed bedding was great. Even the pillow didn't give me a neck ache (like many hotel pillows do) and the service was superb. The next time we have a wine dinner at Michel's or even The Kahala, we'll book a room again... or maybe even without a wine dinner!

Loved the complimentary yoga classes offered 4 mornings a week in the park across the street, enjoyed the music in the elevator (always got my energy up), the use of chairs for the beach, friendly staff, great rooms. They are renovating for a couple weeks one room at a time, so it will look even nicer soon, with hardwood floors, etc. Also loved they had a speaker system for your ipod/iphone, dvd player in the room, coffee and tea in the am in the lobby, great tasting wine from 4-6pm every day. These extras made me a loyalist for this hotel for the next trip to Waikiki. Also is quieter from the whole bustle of the main stretch, yet 5-10 min walking to all the action. The beach is also more private too. We had 2 balconies on the corner facing Diamond Head. Nice breeze for fresh air....can't say enough for this boutique feel hotel!

This was a great hotel experience, I can't say enough about the staff and their attitude, the rooms are fantastic and the hotels location is quiet and accesable. It has the happiest elevator I've ever been in, OK no big deal but it's all the little things that make the difference. Our last day there they were renovating the rooms below us and we barely new anything was going on, there was no interuption to our amenity at all. With Kiamana beach at your door and Kapiolani park across the road this hotel provides you with a more authentic stay in Hawaii than other hotels in the heart of Waikiki and the walk in is in itself a plesurable experience. Thanks again to all the staff, I will be bringing my family back sometime soon I hope, Mahalo

The building is currently going through renovations, but it's been barely noticeable during my stay. The staff is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Sarah and Carissa at the front desk, as well as Wesley were TOTALLY AWESOME and EXTREMELY HELPFUL during my entire two-week stay at this hotel. Even the hotel manager, Josh, went above and beyond my expectations by extending me certain ammenities that made my reason for being here (business) even MORE perfect than it already was! Honestly, I would stay here again JUST BECAUSE OF THE HOTEL STAFF! They were always willing to help and always friendly throughout the duration. Very down to earth people with a friendly disposition. I love the Aqua Lotus (at Diamond Head; Honolulu) and will absolutely keep them in mind the next time I go to Hawaii! This place was sooooooooo much better than the place I stayed at last year...and most of the reason why is because of the people who work here at the hotel. You can't go wrong with staying at this hotel. The beds are ridiculously comfortable; the balconies are very nice; the amenities are extremely adequate (if not better than adequate); the hotel staff is absolutely top-notch; and the location is perfect...especially if you want a nice, quiet place to stay. It's a little bit (1/4 mile) outside of Waikiki, which makes things much more quieter and enjoyable in my opinion. I love the Aqua Lotus and hope they'll remember me the next time I come to Hawaii!

--Staff was super helpful and friendly--Room was very clean and nicely appointed--We liked that the hotel is small and on the quiet end of Waikiki: this is NOT a mega-resort so don't expect the onsite spas, restaurants, fitness facilities etc. No pool or restaurant on-site--Nice touches include the free morning coffee, evening wine, beach chair check-out, and turndown service--Not directly oceanfront, but only one building in from the beach, so only a few hundred feet from the water. --Price seemed reasonable for location, we booked an oceanview room thru hotel website, and were pleased to be on the top floor, lower floors would not afford as good a view I think--Good sized balcony--Very comfortable beds (but note that the 2-bed rooms have 2 full, not queen, beds.

I travel a LOT for work and am picky about hotels. I LOVED the Aqua Lotus. And they define what "boutique" should mean.First and foremost - the staff is the best I've experienced in a long time. Very responsive and helpful and always cheerful.I love the location because its away from the touristy heart of Waikiki. My room was nice. The bed and pillows were super comfy. The lanai was a great place to both relax and to work from. The TV was older, but if you're coming to Hawai`i to watch tv then I have no words for you. Bathroom was nice and updated - lots of room around the sink for products and the shower water pressure was outstanding. Only minor complaint was that the internet was slow - they may have a speed limit as most hotels do. But i had my mifi card as backup. Housekeeping was nice and if they saw me early in the day, they would ask what time I wanted my room cleaned.There is no fitness center on this property, but luckily, you're right by the ocean for amazing swims and runs, and the hotel lends out bikes and has yoga several days a week.I also appreciated that they had beach mats and chairs to lend out, along with towels. Most hotels only have towels!The nightly wine hour and coffee/tea in the morning are a nice touch. Unfortunately, the restaurant wasn't open yet, but I did go the 30 steps next door to the New Otani for some good food.I'll be back there in a couple months for work and will definitely try to stay at the Aqua Lotus again!

Aqua Lotus served its purpose for us staying two nights before traveling to Kauai. Enjoyed the complimentary bike rental, yoga classes and wine hour. Its location is nice due to being semi distant from all of the hustle and bustle, yet not too far to walk or ride. Nice view of Diamond head and appreciated the park across the street for running. If you have the opportunity check out the diamond head market for the most amazing scones. Service at the hotel was good with most of the staff going above and beyond. Parking costs 20.00 a day which we found a little unreasonable and lastly the rooms were a little run down. Nonetheless, would go back but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Picking a hotel is an agonizing choice. So many variables and tradeoffs that inevitably I end up choosing one and just hoping for the best. Having researched Hotels in Oahu extensively (and visited 4 times before) I had a fair idea what i was getting into. My choices were between The Modern, Hotel Renew and The Lotus. In the end, being away from the grind of Waikiki was important for me.First impressions: the Lotus is fantastic. Colorful lobby without being tacky, away from all the noise, and a small amount of rooms. We chose a Diamond Head premium room. Some will say the second lanai is a waste of money - and that might be true. But you get one less room on the side, more space( and some of the middle rooms are blue, which IMHO are nowhere near as nice). For my money - these rooms are the best. As always higher is better. Oh and the beds - the beds! supremely comfortable.The staff: Great! Very friendly, and helpful. A small staff ( i only encountered 4 staff in the front desk) means a very personal service. Best service i have had in Oahu by a long stretchThe amenities: Few, but for us - useful. If you need a hotel bar/restaurant - look elsewhere. For us - free yoga, beach towels/chairs and bikes where perfect. As well as complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. Great touches.The bottom line: We really felt like San Souci was 'our' beach. The staff are wonderful. The location is perfect. The room was fantastic. We cant wait to return!

I looked at about 18 places in Honolulu (Royal Hawaiian, Sheraton Waikiki, Hilton Hawaiian Village, Outrigger Reef on the Beach, etc) before I booked my recent 9 night stay here in early May 2012. Wow! Everything was perfect! I came here as a solo traveler for my birthday. I highly suggest paying for a corner, ocean premium room - your jaw will just hit the ground and your wallet won't experience sticker shock (as a baseline, I live in San Francisco.) I stayed in room 1125 and was simply blown away. The room was immaculate. I had two lanais (one faced Diamond Head and the ocean and the other faced the ocean.) There are two hotels directly in front of the hotel but they do not at all take away from the gorgeous view. I loved the twice-daily maid service, in-room turn-down service and every staff member! I cannot speak highly enough about Dante, Sarah and Carissa at the front desk. I have stayed at luxury and budget places around the world and really felt like I was staying with family. Travis and Wes rocked as valets and I thank them big time for their enthusiasm and hospitality. I requested a coffee maker and microwave and had them about 10 minutes after my early check-in (which I had requested given that my flight came in at Noon.) The onsite restaurant is not open yet (June 2012) but the Hau Tree is within 50 yards at the New Otani hotel - just make reservations in advance on Open Table as they honor those before honoring walk-ins and they are always packed. Again, I live in SF so the prices were not high for me but I can see that the prices would be high at the Hau Tree for breakfast/brunch/lunch. You can walk in about a minute to the beach at the Canoe Club and in about two minutes to the beach at Kaimana beach (the beach in front of the New Otani Hotel). The latter has amazing swimming! Aqua Lotus is along Kapiolani Park and about a 15 minutes walk from the crazy, packed, yucky, touristy Waikiki strip. Given I live in SF, I wanted to stay at a smaller hotel (this one has 50 rooms) and be away from the touristy stuff. Major bonus points for: no resort fees, complimentary beach chairs/beach towels/beach mats/beach bicycles/yoga mats and lessons 4 days a week at 7:30am in Kapiolani park/wine from 4pm - 6pm nightly/coffee in the lobby every morning. I have to emphasize that the staff here is simply amazing! Customer service rocks! Everyone will go out of their way to make sure you have the vacation of a lifetime. They are renovating the rooms (wood floors to replace carpets and furniture upgrades) this month and next. As a comparison, I had dinner at the Royal Hawaiian, Hilton Hawaiian Village, Halekulani and Moana Surfrider and I would not stay at those places unless I craved being in a very busy, packed, loud City environment during my vacation. I would, if I had tons of money, stay at the Kahala Resort on the Gold Coast. Short of Kahala, Aqua Lotus is *the* place to stay. Just be advised that you will have to walk to get to the action. Again, I live in SF and walk a lot so this was just fine with me. May not be ideal if you have little ones. I hope you love it as much as I did! I will be back for sure :-) Oh, and I slept with the sliding glass doors open every night - nothing better than being lulled to sleep by trade winds and ocean :-) :-) For me, this place was my own slice of paradise! Thank you Dante, Sarah, Carissa, Travis and Wes!!!!!!!! :-)

The Lotus is a lovely small hotel. We live on the Big Island and when we come to Honolulu, this is where we like to stay. Away from the glitz and crowds of Waikiki proper (but close enough if you want a taste of that), the hotel has a peaceful, understated feeling and a very professional staff that genuinely cares about its guests. Kapiolani Park is right outside the front door, you can almost reach out and touch Diamond Head, and you are just steps to one of Oahu's nicest beaches. A great location! The Lotus does not have a restaurant but for us, half the fun of coming to Honolulu is local dining and there are lots of good options. If you appreciate something special, you'll be very happy here.
Exquisite service, spacious and lovely rooms, quiet location! I have been staying at the Lotus twice a year for the past 4 years. It is always a perfect experience!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. It's close enough to Waikiki Beach to walk but far enough away to leave all the hustle and bustle. We had a corner room with views of Diamond Head and the ocean. Though not on the beach, we were really just steps away. Aqua Lotus is quiet, clean and the staff is excellent. If I'm ever lucky enough to make it back to Honolulu, I will make the Aqua Lotus my first choice. Plus, I'm told that it will be totally remodeled by July 2012. I can't imagine how it can get any better.

We decided to stay at the Aqua Lotus Honolulu on our son's recommendation and looking at the website. Our stay actually exceeded our expectations. The location was perfect. The facility was very comfortable and quiet and the staff was excellent. I cannot remember any other hotel stay that was equal to this one.

This is my second stay at Aqua Lotus. It's a hidden gem, away from the noisy part of Waikiki. It's a short walk to the Zoo and International Market Place. The property is very clean and well maintained. I had a premium ocean view room that had great views of the ocean and Diamond Head. The king room was tastefully decorated and had a mini fridge for beverages. The location is awesome. If you stayed at other Waikiki hotels, you'd hear the garbage trucks, tour buses, and fire engines through out the day. It's very peaceful at the Lotus.The staff is top notch. Everyone was warm and friendly and always said hello. The valet service was excellent. The valets always offered tips and places to go. We found out about a great breakfast place down the road because of these tips.The beach is right outside the hotel. They offer beach chairs, towels, and other items for guests to check out. They even have bikes that can be used,Complimentary wine reception is offered daily. During our stay, we had some nice California wines.The Lotus offers an excellent value. Can't wait to return!

The location was wonderful, close enough to the action but far enough to be a wonderful retreat from the noise and congestion. The room was amazing. We were on the 12th floor in a corner room with a view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Our stay started off very frustrating in that we arrived from the cruise ship at 09:30 and were told to return between 1-1:30 for check-in. We expected this as the Orbitz confirmation had 1 PM as the check-in time. We stayed around the hotel until 1 PM and then had to sit in the lobby until 3 PM waiting for our room to be ready. It was especially frustrating to be told every 30 min. that our room would be ready as soon as possible and then take longer until we had sat waiting for over 2 hr.

I spent a long time picking out this hotel for my first trip to Hawaii-I loved the advertised views of Diamond Head and the fact that it was in a less busy part of Waikiki and reasonably priced. Turns out I made an excellent choice! The hotel is not technically beachfront but the beach is just steps away through the parking lot. Speaking of which, we were not looking forward to paying $20 per day for valet parking (apparently standard in Waikiki) but we ended up finding parking on the street every night either right by the hotel or near the park down the street and saving lots of money. I was particularly impressed with the terrific staff, very friendly and knowledgeable. The housekeeping staff were amazing-got us extra pillows immediately-and, best story; we came back after a hike and showered-the room had already been cleaned-and then went to the beach for an hour. When we returned, the towels had all been replaced-again! Kudos to the Aqua Lotus staff. I would definitely stay here again.
This place is a good hotel and you get what you expect from the price you pay. Don´t think you will get that great of price even during the slow season.

This hotel made me feel at home in Honolulu. The staff were incredibly friendly . The room was beautiful in its simple and artistic design and immaculately clean. Every room has a lovely balcony. Mine looked on to Diamond Head. The beach is a parking lot away and uncrowded and good for swimming. The hustle and bustle of Waikiki is far enough away that it felt peaceful, and near enough to walk to in a few minutes. No restaurant but a lovely one next door.

Great hotel for those who are looking to be near Waikiki but not in the center of it. Quick check-in, wonderful view and friendly staff. The bicycles are free to rent and come with a helmet and lock. This was a great way to get to Diamond Head (get there early before the sun gets too intense). There were free newspapers daily, free coffee/tea in the morning and free wine in the evening. They also provided a few apples in the lobby for guests. The hotel information in the room states that they charged $2 for every call made but we weren't charged. They offered to print my boarding passes which was appreciated. My only complaint is the location. The restaurant was closed so anytime you were hungry, you had to order take-out, go to the overpriced restaurant next door or walk the 10-15 minutes to Waikiki. While the main strip isn't too far, it feels like forever after a long day of sightseeing. There is a little convenience store next door which was useful when we wanted snacks or drinks. Great hotel!

Stayed at Aqua Lotus at the east end of Waikiki past the Aqarium. Nice rooms, great ocean view with balcony. Stayed in room 923. Recommend 7th floor and above. The staff was extremely friendly. No restaurant, but a new one should open in June 2012. No pool, but you are 150 ft from the ocean and a very nice beach. The hotel provides beach towels, mats, beach chairs, bicycles for free.
