There is a restaurant at the hotel next door. Fairly expensive. The hotel is acrosss from Kapiolani park. If you want to be on or right next to the ocean, but 1/2 mile from Waikiki bustle. Check this place out. Parking is $20/day and the rooms are due for remodeling soon. Great ocean view, some other hotels partially blocking. Great view of Diamond head. Free yoga classes a couple days a week. Very friendly place about 12 stories

Stayed on the 9th floor in April 2012. Hotel is at far end of Waikiki, almost in the shadow of Diamond Head Crater. We arrived about 2 hours before the normal check in time. We were met by valet Travis, who upon seeing our mountain of luggage retrieved a luggage cart and assisted us. A gracious front desk clerk allowed us to check in early. The upper floors of the hotel are completely open. The elevator opens up to an open air hallway so all access is from outside. The room was just ok. The bed felt like a typical truck stop type mattress. The shower had moldy grout in the corners and along the caulking of the shower door. The Lanai needed a good scrubbing. Some of the furniture was chipped and worn looking. Apparently there used to be a cafe and bar on the 2nd floor but it seemed to be closed down. Wine is offered in the lobby in the evening and coffee in the morning (no in room coffee, no microwave but there is a small fridge). I was very concerned about how easy it would be for a person of even moderate athletic ability to climb from one lanai to another. All it would take to have an intruder in a room is for someone to sit on the railing of the lanai and work their way over to where they had one leg on either side of a the thing wall diving the lanais. The lanais do have locking sliding glass doors but no way to listen to the ocean if you don't want to run the risk of an intruder. One can see into adjoining rooms simply by peeking around the wall separating the lanais. The pluses are the view of Diamond Head and a catty corner view of the ocean. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Due to a very late return from a poor Enoa tour we were very late checking out. Dante was understanding and only charged us a modest fee. Upon checking out Sarah was very courteous and even thought it was quite late allowed us to use the room to change and clean up before our flight home. I would probably stay here again simply for the people and the quietness of the area.

We're regular visitors to Hawaii and like to use Waikiki as our headquarters, and then head out all over the island from there. We normally stay in larger hotels on Waikiki, but wanted to have a "quieter" experience with our two teenage children this trip. Aqua Lotus hotel is across the street from Kapiolani Park. The view from our balcony was Diamond Head/Kapiolani Park on the left and partial ocean view on the right. Gorgeous. Hotel staff was wonderful with all our needs. Cette and Bill were especially helpful with tourist tips, getting our car, avoiding traffic snarls, etc. Always a friendly face and kind. We loved having the bikes available to cruise along Kapiolani Park and on down Ala Wai Canal. Free towels and beach chairs were fantastic also. We never felt nickled and dimed as we have been with other resorts. This boutique hotel did not have a restaurant as it is apparently on hold with refurbishing; however, we walked to the hotel behind us and ate breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanie restaurant on the beach at the New Otani Hotel. Gorgeous under the old Hau trees which legend has it, author Robert Louis Stevenson wrote nad reflected. Rooms were clean, comfortable...fantastic shower head, and nice balconies. The hotel was almost completely booked, but we did not hear loud bangings above or below us...not sure if building or if just polite neighbors. The "disco elevator" was a big hit with my teenagers. Balinese, quiet/meditative style in lobby, but once you entered the elevator, club music was going away. Was a constant source of laughter and conversation with other guests. We took advantage of the courtesy wine happy hour a few times in the lobby, and took up a glass to our balcony and enjoyed the view.A convenience store was out and across the parking lot in a building suite for bananas, bread, drinks...or other food items for mini fridge. As we pretty much spend most of our time on the Eastern side of island from the Pali over, this is a fantastic location for all the beaches, hikes, food and haunts we enjoy.

I love this hotel! It's tucked away in a quiet neighborhood at the edge of Kapiolani Park, about a half mile from the Waikiki strip. So you are only a ten minute walk from all the shops, restaurants, and nightlife; but it feels incredibly tranquil and far removed from the crowds. The rooms are spacious and clean, with nice little balconies to sit and watch the world go by. It is well worth paying extra for the deluxe rooms on the higher floor, as they have lovely views (though you should be warned that the hotel is not directly oceanfront, so ocean views are at a slight distance. Even the higher-priced rooms are a great value for the area.  I've also had great experiences with the staff -- the small size of the hotel means that everyone is friendly, helpful, and unrushed. The only real downside is that there is no restaurant and no room service -- but there are several places to eat next door. Overall, the best bargain in Honolulu!

A very nice, and clean hotel. The staff was awsome A+ x 100. The veiw from the room was very nice (beach and diamond head veiw). Quiet location,but not too far from all the shops. I will stay again and recomended to all my friends.

I travel to Hawaii often and I love Maui. I love everything about the quiet and serene atmosphere. SO, i was very very unsure how I would feel about Oahu. Especially staying in the Honolulu Waikiki Area with the hustle and bustle. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised with how quiet the end near Diamond Head is. And we were especially pleased with the calm and peaceful atmosphere of the Aqua Lotus. We had an ocean deluxe room. The view was perfect. One lanai gave us a glimpse of the water, the other a breathtaking view of Diamond Head. The staff there was completely attentive. From the first person at the front desk very late the night we arrived to both of the valets, Travis and Bill. Beds were extremely comfortable. The entire hotel had that "boutique" feel, which I loved. This is definitely made for couples without children. Especially couples wanting a very simple, laid back atmosphere away from the downtown area... but still close enough that you can walk.

We found this hotel on Expedia, and with Expedia you never really know what type of hotel you are going to get. My boyfriend and I took a trip to Honolulu for a fun little vacation and we were blown away from the moment we pulled up! Its a smaller hotel which worked great for us :)Long story: First of all the location was perfect, not on the strip with tons of noise, but closer to diamond head (which makes for a great view as well). Right across the street from a huge park.It was a little hard to find at first because we were looking for AQUA but it actually says Lotus, so look for that.We pull up to a very friendly smiling gentleman Travis, he was our valet (who also doubles as the bellman and the front desk person. this guy dies it all!) They only have valet parking which costs $20 a day, not the best news but so work it! He did inform us that with our Hawaii ID we got 50% off parking, great news. We checked in at the front desk and the gentleman told us that they have, get this: Complementary bikes for us to use, complementary coffee in the morning down stairs, complementary wine from 4-6pm in the lobby, complementary beach towels and chairs and even complementary yoga on certain days of the week! We loved having the bikes to ride, it really added so much to our trip. We really enjoyed the wine downstairs as well, made for a much more romantic trip.The room we got to was on the 3rd floor, with a view but not the best and it had 2 double beds (I had asked Expedia for a king). I'm not one to call and ask for things from the front desk but I thought I might as well ask if we can switch rooms to one with a king bed, the man at the front desk was so kind and told me that there were no rooms of the same type with a king, but that they did have a upgraded room (a corner room) for a $15 fee per day, we are on vacation so we said yes! Ohh boy it was so worth it, the room is on the corner and was a floor higher so the view of diamond head was great!We had a great stay, and they even let us check-out late upon asking them. Its nice and quite at night and during the day for that matter.The staff continued to be so nice and friendly and most of all accommodating. Travis, Bill and Saitte? Were all spectacular!! Short story: Traveled as a couple, great staff great location great complementary add on's.There is no pool so might not be great for kids. WE loved loved loved it and will be back the next time we are on Oahu.Only down side, now I'm nitpicking here is that there is only one elevator so it at times takes while for it to get to you.Note: Do Not waste your money at the restaurant next door Michele's, food is ok but WAY over priced.

I don't even know where to begin! My experience at this hotel have been eeeexcellent!!! The staff (valet, front desk, housekeeping...) get to know you on a first name basis. This hotel is very personal and intimate. It's away from the busyness of the main strip of Waikiki, although it's in very short walking distance. They provide free bicycles to use if you're lazy to walk. Kapiolani Park which is across the street is a good place to work out/run. It is steps away to the beach, aquarium, park, and a great view of the famous Diamond Head landmark. If you're in the military on TLA, this is the hotel where you want to be! I stayed here for about a month, and it's well worth it. I highly recommend for any travelers or even locals to come experience the great joy I've had staying here. :)

this hotel gem a few hundred yards east of crowded Waikiki is still within an easy stroll of the action and about 150 feet from one of the best white sand beaches in the area. It is well run, friendly, super quiet and near and eclectic collection of restaurants and shops. You don't need a rental car because there are bus, bike and walking routes to practically anything you might want to do.There are cultural, farmers market, art and other events nearly every weekend in Kapiolani Park, across the street plus a free fireworks show over Waikiki visible from the nearby beach every Friday evening.We live in Honolulu, but occasionally "vacation" at the Aqua Lotus

This hotel’s subtle charm and attention to detail was a pleasant surprise. Although most of the reviews were very positive, I was a little concerned because it was referred to as a “boutique hotel” and not on the main drag of Waikiki. With this being our first trip to HNL I feared I would regret not staying on the strip. We had no regrets at the Aqua Lotus.On arrival, I suggest you request the highest floor possible. Our first night was on 5th floor. The views from 5th floor are somewhat obstructed by trees. I requested a higher floor at front desk, I was given a key to room on 9th floor to see if I liked it better. The view of Diamondhead and the ocean was tremendous, so we moved to the new room on 9th floor with no fuss.The rooms are bright, with balconies. Traveling with the family, bathrooms are very important. The bathrooms at the Aqua Lotus are large, tiled sink and shower. They use a rainfall shower head which is great after log day on the beach. All rooms have mini-fridge and free internet. I note these characteristics because on the similarly priced properties along the strip with small bathroom and daily internet charges ranged from $12.00-$23.00. At the Aqua Lotus there were no resort fees, no nickel and diming you to death. When we checked out, the bill was actually $4.00 less than what was estimated on my confirmation! When was the last time that happened?The staff was so genuine and helpful. They made excellent suggestions for excursions and food. Oh, and the complimentary bikes! What a benefit to be able to cycle around at your leisure and enjoy. Bike comes with helmets and locks. We rose during the day, but noticed that during the evening, all the bikes were checked out, must be something to night time bike riding.The property is across from the park where many locals seem to go and recreate and walk up to main strip. The Aquarium and Zoo are both within 10minute walk. Bill was there when we first arrived and greeted us like family. He was consistently very helpful and always greeted us with a smile and made us feel like we were returning home. He gave a very good restaurant suggestion (Lulu’s) and we were very pleased. Ceitte also had superb customer service. He helped us with our bike rental, adjusted our bike seats for us and told us where to find the most amazing scones. Front desk staff is also great, as well as the housekeeping staff (I didn’t catch the guy’s name that was so quick to bring us extra towels, but he was awesome, friendly and always smiling.)We would definitely stay at the Aqua Lotus again on our next visit to Honolulu.

We live on the Big Island and went to Waikiki to relax for a few days. All of the staff we came in contact with was extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome. The rooms are large, clean and well decorated. The bed and pillows are so comfortable and the hotel is small so there aren't a lot of people going up and down the hallway making noise in the night. The bathroom is actually large enough for two people to dress comfortably. There was also a roomy balcony to have tea on and watch the sunrise over Diamond Head. As others have said the cruiser bikes and wine reception are a very nice touch. It is not on the main strip of Waikiki but it's close enough for most people to walk. There are also plenty of taxis or busses if you don't want to drive. There is a beautiful park right across the street and another park on the beach about 5 minute walk on the Waikiki side of the aquarium. The beach is only a few steps away. If you want a clean, comfortable, and relaxing place to stay then this is it! I will not stay anywhere else on Oahu in the future, only the Aqua Lotus!

This hotel is an excellent choice for the traveler who wants to be near Waikiki and is comfortable with a 10 min. walk to the main strip. The hotel is near the beach, has excellent ocean, mountain and city views from it's upper floors and is directly across the street from a large city park. The downtown noise of the typical Waikiki hotel is absent. The rooms are more spacious than the typical mid-range Waikiki hotel and the hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would stay again without hesitation.

For a comfortable stay,this hotel met all our needs.Upon arrival we were greeted with 'Happy Hour' & shown to our better than expected view room of Diamond Head & large glimpse of the ocean.Great staff, preferred location a short distance from the tourists of Waikiki. Great walking & seconds to the beach.

We had high hopes for this hotel and had billed it as the ‘luxurious’ part of our adventure Hawaii trip. In some ways it met expectations and in others not so much. The location of the hotel was great for us, as we wanted to be close to the Waikiki resort but not in it. It is a full ten min walk to the start of the main strip but this is along the nice park area and there are nice parts of the beach closer than this. It is quite away from the opposite end of the action but there was always a taxi available even late into the night. There was also plenty of free street parking (6pm-10am) along the road so we never had any need for the valet and always got a spot right outside the hotel. The rooms were very nice, large and spotlessly clean with pleasant Hawaiian décor: TV cabinet, desk, sliding blind doors etc. The bathroom was very nice too with marble finish and nice amenities (lethally slippery floor though!). Wi-fi was very useful, plenty of storage space and an in-room safe. I asked for a coffee maker and it was delivered immediately with nice coffee replenished every day. Housekeeping was very good, done thoroughly any time of day. You could hire beach gear from the front desk too. Lobby wasn’t overly inviting though, it felt like an annex of the underground valet area. What was the relentless cheesy dance music all about? Always on in the lobby and on even louder in the elevator, didn’t really seem to fit.Having two balconies was nice, but I’m afraid this is where my review must slip into the negative… I did a lot of research for this hotel and luckily I knew there was no real ocean view to be had. Being both our birthdays we paid extra for a Diamond Head Premium, so we had a very nice view over Diamond Head and you could also glimpse the ocean in between some buildings across a parking lot. We knew what we were getting, but in the build up we had been tempted to splurge for the Premium Ocean room that offered both views. This hotel is set back from the seafront, has a number of buildings in between and none of the rooms seem to face directly toward the sea. Slightly misleading that you could pay extra for a diagonal view across a car park between some buildings. The Diamond Head views are lovely though, better than a sea view in my opinion. As well as this, I have already mentioned we were celebrating both our birthdays while staying at this hotel, and I had twice mentioned it to the hotel in advance. Now I would never cry foul that a free gift wasn’t waiting for us or similar like we have had in hotels before, but we were maybe hoping that we would get the best room within our budget. Instead we were on the floor 7 of at least 12, so our side balcony looked into trees (the lower rooms must have awful views in all honesty). In fact, it being both our birthdays wasn’t mentioned either in email reply or in person while we were there.Another thing that irked me was that the wireless internet was lost for over 24 hours on my birthday so I could not Skype or email with family. I can handle technical problems OK, but I got the impression the staff either didn’t believe me or just didn’t care each time I brought it up. I had to file a log with the provider etc myself and hope for the best. I found this a lot with the staff to be honest, a kind of too cool for school attitude and that you should just be appreciative that you’re staying at this hotel. I can’t quite put my finger on it, but they seemed a bit up themselves for want of a better expression (except a helpful girl who was usually on mornings). It was as if everything was an effort and when anything was done they wore an expression as if they’d just made you the best cocktail in the world and you’d better tip for it! There was also no free internet access available to guests without a laptop, you had to pay to use their communal computers. Very annoying, especially when the wi-fi goes down. It was little things like that that just didn’t sit well with us. When you pay a little more you expect a little more…

Good location at far end of Waikiki away from the hustle and bustle. The room are spacious and very clean, comfortable bed, best sleep I ever had. Staff are amazing and super friendly. Different services provided was coffee service at the lobby and if you want to make your own coffee or tea in the private of your room, they provide coffee maker and hot pot. Wine reception in the afternoon, what a way to come back to your room with a glass of wine to relax and unwine before dinner, free Wi Fi, cruiser bikes to take for a romantic excursion around Diamond head or to the mall or taking advantage of their free yoga session. The hotel is not on the beach but just a few feet away and the view of Diamond head was breathtaking. Aqua Lotus exceeded all my expectations. I will be back.

We often stop in Honolulu before our vacation on Kauai and have always preferred the location near Diamond Head away for the mobs of people on Waikiki. We've stayed in this property several times, but our first under Aqua Lotus management. We were favorably impressed. Our higher floor room looks at both Diamond Head and the ocean. To a person the staff was friendly and helpful. Even the maintenance people greeted us on a regular basis. We enjoy the Hawaiian style decor. The smaller size of this hotel makes it seem more Hawaiian to us. There is fine dining nearby, but we look forward to the opening of the on-site restaurant on our next visit.
The beautiful Diamond Head location makes it a perfect retreat from busy Waikiki. The Staff are very welcoming, and free yoga in the park, surreal. See you again next time!

We stayed two nights in March. We had booked an inexpensive "Diamond Head View" room but were upgraded to one of the best top floor corner rooms with views of Diamond Head in one direction and the ocean (away from Waikiki) in the other. Everything about our stay was perfect. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, bright and clean, the afternoon wine and free bicycles and beach chairs were unexpected and welcome extras. The location, a short walk through the park to busy Waikiki beach, was perfect for us. We liked being away from the bustle. The large park across the street was full of community activities and sports and gave a nice "local" feel to the place. This hotel is just behind another hotel and condo building, so not right on the beach, and not with direct beachfront views, but the direct views of Diamond Head and partial views of the ocean were still delightful. The beaches are small but OK and steps away from the hotel. There is no pool or onsite restaurant, though apparently a restaurant is opening soon. In the meantime the restaurant in the New Otami next door is very nice.

We chose this hotel for our first Hawaiian vacation and we are so glad. We read reviews on trip advisor before making reservations and enjoyed our stay very much.This is a small hotel which allows for more personal care to it's guest. The rooms were very clean and have great views. If you look to the left on the balcony you see the ocean, turm slightly and you will see the volcanos. Beds were super comfortable and the pillows were the best!There is a restaurant on the 2nd floor but it was closed for renovations, however the hotel staff made some great suggestions (Bogarts for Breakfast is a must). The Hotel is close to everything, yet far enough away for the secluded feeling. Walk to the zoo or aqurium. He snorkeled on the secluded beach and saw many fish.....Minutes away from all the shopping and night life. If you love beer...The Yard House is a must with 118 beers on tap and great eats as well!We can't wait to go back to Hawaii...loved, loved, loved this vacation. We will stay here the next time as well!

I was really pleased with the Aqua Lotus hotel. It was away from the crowd of hotels on Waikiki but close enough to walk there. We had a view of Diamond head and the ocean from our room. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean. I thought the wine tasting, beach chairs and mats, and old-fashioned bikes were all great perks at no extra charge, and the overall price was quite reasonable for the area. I would definitely stay here again :)
the staff were so friendly and helpful, the room wasn't the cliched teal and palm trees.. the view of Diamond Head was stunning. the prices were great. i was nothing short of impressed.
Not a spectacular experience, just OK. Clean, comfortable but nothing fancy. We were booked a room incorrectly and it took a good 2 hours to straighten it out. Quite if high up floor. Staff ok.

We stayed at the Lotus for a week in January. We had an ocean view premium room on the 12th floor. The room was clean and spacious. The view was great – unobstructed view of Diamond Head with partial view of the ocean from the front balcony. The “25” series premium rooms also have a side standing balcony with partial ocean view on higher floors (we saw a whale from our room). The room has a small fridge for beverages and snacks but no coffee maker. We requested a coffee maker but after it had not arrived by the second day after our request, we cancelled the request and used the lobby coffee service.The web page advertises single king or two double beds. However the reservation process doesn’t allow for specifying a bed configuration request. We called after making the reservation on the web and asked for two doubles. We were told that requests cannot be guaranteed but they would note the request. Upon check-in, we did not get two doubles and they wouldn’t be available for a least a couple days, so we stayed with the king.We think that because the hotel is relatively small, and usually filled, that it is difficult for the staff to guarantee specific requests. However the rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable; and upper floor rooms have great views.The beach chairs, towels, and mats are a great service as is the afternoon wine service. The laundry facility on the 3rd floor is also helpful.There are many food options in this area on Kapahulu: Tokkuri Tei, Ono Hawaiian, Side Street Inn, Leonards. Also Diamond Head Market & Grill is a really enjoyable walk in the morning across Kapiolani Park (for scones); pick up salads or wraps to keep in the fridge for later in the day. There is also a Safeway on Kapahulu and a convenience store next door at New Otani.Like so many people mention, it is a great location nestled alongside Kapiolani Park. We would definitely stay here again.

We really enjoyed the Lotus. They had free bike rental, afternoon wine service a the best most amazing staff. We stayed there for three days and I didn't want I leave. The rooms were clean an comfortable and the price was awesome for a dual view room! Thank you to the wonderful staff! They all made us feel very welcome!!!

We stayed here for 5.5 nights in March 2012. (Checked out at 830pm on last night and paid full price in order to catch red-eye flight.) Our corner room had an ocean view plus Diamond Head view. Please note that the hotel is set back from the ocean a bit, so it is not possible to have a 100% view of the ocean. We enjoyed being able to see the waves break on the ocean and thunderstorms.The room was very clean, pristine, and nicely decorated. The hotel's website says wi-fi is free, yet there was a card in the room stating they charged; we phoned the front desk who then clarified that wi-fi is free. (I would recommend the hotel remove these cards.)The employees were very cheerful, polite, and friendly. We enjoyed them!There are beach towels, mats, chairs, and bicycles to check out at no additional charge. We took advantage of the towels and bikes.There is an approximate 0.5 mile walk to the bustling Waikiki strip. The walk goes through a nice park.The on-site hotel was closed for renovations, so we ate breakfast at an adjacent hotel our first full day there. I would recommend walking into Waikiki for breakfast for more and cheaper options.We did not take advantage of the nightly wine hour or Wii in the lobby.Since this is a boutique hotel, I do not think Aqua Lotus is a full-service hotel, but the staff was great.

This is my second trip to the waikiki beach area of Oahu . We stayed at a great hotel last time but I wanted something less noisy this time. When I read the reviews and description of aqua lotus, I booked the hotel although I was a little nervous about how far it really was from the main strip of stores and restaurants. From the moment we walked in to the sweet smelling lobby and were greeted by staff who were there to help us to our room, it was a great choice. A mistake in the number of beds that could have turned the trip negatively , was fixed quickly. A coffeemaker with hawaiian coffee and a microwave was brought to our room ; fridge provided too. The view from our balcony(1022) was amazing with diamond head to the left and the pacific ocean to the right. I was in heaven! The bed was comfy and I have a terrible back problem. The beach behind the hotel was terrific with the water crystal clear and while a little cool ... it was February after all ... we still enjoyed the water and sun. Oh yeah, the hotel really does lend chairs, umbrellas and towels. And you can also borrow a bike to take a ride around the surrounding park and mountain area. My husband even ran into them taping an episode of Hawaii 5-0 at the nearby park on a bike ride! The only drawback is the 15 to 20 minute walk for food and shopping - however it is a lovely stroll by the beach and park; great for working off calories from the variety of restaurants on the strip. Lu Lu's was one of our favorites. Service was amazing from information about the Bus, welcoming us back (shout out to Bill), help with luggage including storage while we awaited our plane, bed turndowns, the coffee and wine hours, etc. To sum it up .. if you are looking for a smaller hotel with awesome service, great views, breathtaking sunset and rises, and a vacation your friends will be envious of, book the Aqua Lotus.

I had a great stay at the Aqua Lotus! The staff went out of their way to make sure that my stay was a great one, and overall thought that this little hotel was wonderful. While you are a 10 minute walk from the Waikiki strip, this was actually a good thing for me!

Pros:This is a very nice location off from the noise and bustle of Waikiki, we stayed previously at the New Otani hotel nextdoor, where the hotel is actually on the water.This hotel is not near the water, but the views of the Diamond Head are nice and we probably should not have chosen the more expensive `ocean view' rooms and just taken the Diamond Head view as many reviewers suggest. The beds and bathroom are very nice, and access to the beach are easy.The restuarant in the New Otani next door has a very nice view on the beach and has classical food well done (shrimp salad, salad Nicoise)..Cons:The hotel does not have a real place to hang out as the restaurant is closed, here is no bar and the lobby is really a basement. However, the staff were helpful and the rooms are larger and in better condition than the New Otani. We were on the 9th floor and we overlooked the parking lot, with the ocean in the distant. The room does not come with a kettle or coffee maker but the staff helped us by providing a kettle for making tea. The little convenience store next door has cereal/coffee and all other sundries.

I extended my stay in Waikiki and moved to the Aqua Hotel for 5 days. It was much more quiet than Waikiki and It had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The room is huge and a super large sliding door opens to the large deck. I was on the 9th floor with a great view of Diamond Head. If you are a member of the Elks Club, it is onlt 2 buildings away and you can use their parking during the day and their pool. Unfortunatelly the hotel does not have a pool, but the beach is just steps away. The only drawback I saw was its old TV and niot many channels, Ask for a coffee pot in the room.

I booked this sight unseen through Orbitz. After a long flight from Australia was greeted warmly and upgraded to a premium ocean view room as the room booked was not yet ready. Corner room faced the ocean and Diamondhead. Location is perfect, half a block to the beach and away from the chaos of Waikikii. Staff couldn't have been friendlier, providing beach chairs, beach towels and free bikes. I will only stay here again when visiting Honolulu!

Quieter than the craziness of Waikiki, but only a short walk away. The room is not the newest but VERY clean. Housekeeping and Valet staff are excellent. The restaurant is under renovation, but staff had suggestions for others nearby, and there is a bar fridge in the room. We'd definitely stay here again. SUPER comfortable bed. We had a corner room with nice view of Diamond Head and partial ocean view. Really nice beach next to hotel- good snorkeling there too.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights in January. I loved the house music in the elevator, the ease of access to a part of the beach less people go to, free use of bikes and beach chairs, free wine in the afternoon, the lanai's overlooking diamond head. It is not right on the beach or have any unobstructed views of the beach (not from the 5th floor anyway) but it was a decent price and as an old W hotel the accomodations were very nice. There is no restaurant/bar inside but there was one nearby at the New Otani Hotel. Another highlight was Kapiolani park which was right across the street, if you like to run/walk/work out it is perfect. The zoo is also very nearby. The only part I didn't like so much was the distance we had to walk to everything else (i.e. Duke's, International Marketplace) which was about 15-20 minutes. I would also recommend going on a sunset catamaran a lot of them are all you can drink but in january the water was kind of rough so take some dramamine!! Overall very nice hotel for the money but a little far away.

Unfortunately our Premium Diamond Head View room is on the 4th floor with views half blocked by a she oak tree. But the room itself is very spacious and bright with windows on two sides being a corner room. Two very comfortable beds and the bathroom is well laid out with a great shower. Perhaps because I always want two beds rather than one king bed I ended up on a lower floor with a lesser view. The staff are so helpful and pleasant. No breakfast available but we brought our own bowls for cereal and the fridge in the room will hold what you need. Fresh coffee and tea are available in the lobby in the morning so we could satisfy our breakfast needs. In the afternoon there is complimentary wine served in the lobby and you can take a glass to your room to enjoy on the balcony. The hotel is situated well away from the hubbub of central Waikiki and for myself I would much rather look out at Diamond Head and a park (limited views of the ocean from the balcony) than pay a premium in town for ocean views or look out onto all the highrise buildings. The walk to central Waikiki and the shopping district is good exercise. The hotel also provides complimentary bicycles and the internet is FREE.

I've just visited the hotel Lotus.On a first glance I was disappointed that it is a bit of a walk to Waikiki center (ca 15 min walk) but the hotel amenities (beach equipment, bicyles, free wifi, free coffee and wine happy hour) and friendliness of hotel staff have convinced me. At the end I was pleased to stay a bit away from the Waikiki tourist noise.Hotel very tidy, room nice and spacious, view on Diamond head (and partially ocean view). I would defenitely book this hotel next time.1 point less because the location is a bit further, no the direct ocean view, price and no breakfast possibilities but you can go to near Lulu's or Starbucks by bicycle.Thank you Lotus Hotel for a pleasant stay in Honolulu.

Convinience of Waikiki Beach without the crowds +++- complimentary wine in the evenings between 4-6pm- complimentary Bicycles- complimentary beach chairs.This semi boutique hotel offers beach and diamond head views in the same room.with a pleasant 6 minute walk to the strip along the shore and only a 15 minute walk to the foot of diamond head. Definitely a great value.I've been told im a bit of a germaphob so it was quite clean as wellThe staff could not be more helpful and were dead on with directions and recomendations for great food to eat. Not one place recomended I would rate under excellent.The concierge - Jacob (think) and Dante were just great. The location could not be more perfect for those not wanting to be in the crowds vying for beach real estate. The free beach chairs are a plus as we had friends staying on the strip where they paid $15 pp per day for a lounge along with hunting for a spot to lay out. Arranging an in room massage is a must.If i ever make it back to HNL - I will stay here again

Stayed there for several nights (Feb 8-16, 2012); spacious, very comfortable room; a nice lanai with a small table and two chairs (and room for more), with a view of Diamond Head and the ocean; beautiful bathroom; AWESOME service (from the desk help and valet to the housekeeping staff). Right next to Sans Souci beach. A little bit of a walk to the action of Waikiki (maybe around 15 minute walk from the Lotus to the first hotels of the main strip, but you can walk alongside the ocean and beaches, so you don't really notice it). Charming, wonderful, looking forward to staying there again. Great value.

I stayed for a week in this hotel. The staff is very friendly, my room was large and very comfortable. The hotel is located next to a beach (1 min walk), close to Waikiki shops and to bus stops. Some bikes are available for use which is a great way to discover Honolulu. I'll go back to this hotel for my next trip to HLL.

I came to Hawaii with 4 people for a wedding and we shared a room. There was no difficulty doing this and the staff was supportive, helpful and accommodating at all times. We stayed for 6 days and wished we could stay longer. The hotel was well appointed and the choice of coffee, wine and decor was excellent. All of us enjoyed being there.

We recently stayed at the Aqua Lotus for the first time and absolutely loved this hotel. The staff members were without exception friendly, welcoming and extremely helpful. Travelling with our three children, we had two adjacent rooms, which were spacious, comfortably furnished and stylishly decorated in neutral tones. We were on the third floor, so did not have a view of the ocean but still had a very pleasant outlook over the park. Complimentary wine in the lobby each afternoon, and coffee and newspapers each morning, were very welcoming touches. The location is great for those who want to relax and escape the hustle and bustle and yet still be relatively close to Waikiki. After trying a range of different options on previous trips to Honolulu, we feel we have now found the hotel that ticks all the boxes for us and look forward to coming back to the Aqua Lotus again soon.

The Lotus is in a great location far enough away from the bustle of Wailiki for rest, but close enough to stroll down and have a mai tai under the Banyan tree at the Surfrider, or a treat at Yogurtland. At the beginning of the Gold Coast, we walked around the park each morning, to the Farmers Market at the community college on Sat, then up Diamond Head for a great view. It was about a 8 mile round trip and a great day. The beach is amazing for swimming. There were lots of whales spouting off the reef and during our morning swim we saw 6 turtles including the largest one we have ever seen, 3 eels and countless fish, including several Humuhumunukunukuapuaa! :) The bed was very comfortable and the room clean and fresh. The deck on the 12th floor looked at both Diamond Head and the whales, an unbeatable view. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We borrowed the bikes one day for a few loops around the 5 mile trail the circumnavigates the park. Great value and wonderful place. We hope to return.

This was our first visit to the Lotus Hotel but it will not be the last. The room was lovely, big and airy. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The views were breathtaking. It is a lovely quiet area of Waikiki but just moments away from the hustle and bustle should you want it. We loved the bikes for loan and enjoyed biking in the park an along the beach areas. The morning yoga classes set us up for a wonderful day. The extras such as a glass of wine in the evening and the internet in the room were the extras that made the difference. We will not hesitate to recommend the Lotus to our friends and hope to be back again soon.

We booked our first four-night stay at the Aqua Lotus when a deal showed up on Jetsetter.com. The price was right and the location perfect to our way of thinking: a bit removed from the hustle and noise of Waikiki at the foot of Diamond Head and across the street from Kapi'olani Park. We booked our second four-night stay because we'd extended our time in Hawaii and the Lotus was worth a return visit.The ambiance is that of a small boutique hotel. The staff, as others have noted, are professional and friendly. Several times during our second stay, we were recognized as returning guests and welcomed back. The combination of staff, the special touches offered at the hotel, the rooms and location led to our conclusion, that we've found 'our' hotel in Honolulu. We will be back.Special touches: Morning coffee is provided daily in the lobby -- free copies of the Star-Advertiser newspaper as well. If you prefer in-room coffee, a pot, cups and coffee packets will be provided. Each afternoon complimentary red and white wine, self-served in Reidel wine glasses replace the morning coffee service. The hotel also provides beach towels and chairs as well as bikes for guests to use. Guests are also invited to participate in complimentary yoga classes offered four times a week at 7:30 a.m. Instructors lead the class in Kapi'olani park. (I had never tried a yoga class and participated in this one - it is incredible! The instructor, Courtney, was able to adapt the workout to the ability levels of each participant in the class. The park location was perfect allowing for us to watch the sun rise over Diamond Head.)The rooms: all have postcard views of Diamond Head (and there's also a beautiful view of Waikiki Beach on the open hallway between the elevator and the rooms.) The amount of water view you have depends on how high your room is and its location in the hotel. Our first stay, we were in an ocean view room, on the eighth floor, on the end of the building which gave us two patios and a view of the water and Diamond Head. On our return visit we spent four nights on a 10th floor room and had a bit more expansive water view. Both rooms were spacious, kept clean by the housekeeping staff that visited during the day and provided an evening turn-down of the delightfully comfortable beds. Rooms have wi-fi access and a small refridgerator. The decks are large with two chairs and a large table and provide spectacular views of Diamond Head.Hotel location: As noted above, the hotel is to the south of Waikiki, just past the Aquarium. We found it an easy walk through the park to get back to the busier part of town. In fact our hotel's location allowed for us to walk to the top of Diamond Head (7.5 miles round trip) and to Kahala Mall (about 5 miles) quite easily. But for those who don't want to walk, the Honolulu public bus system, TheBus, can take you to the island's major tourist attractions. There's a bus stop close to the hotel and is served by Bus 2 which loops you back to Kuhio Ave. (the heart of Waikiki) or Bus 14 which loops around the base of Diamond Head (past the lighthouse, and near the Kahala Hotel, to the Kahala Mall and Coco Head area. We were provided transfer coupons which were valid for four hours and as a result often didn't need pay for a return trip or provided a free transfer to a bus going to the place we were headed. The hotel front desk can provide a reference sheet and map that tells you which bus to catch to reach tourist destinations such as Pearl Harbor and the Polynesian Cultural Center and points along the North Shore. The cost per adult was $2.50 (we could have purchased a four-day pass for $25 but opted to walk to most destinations.) A rental car isn't necessary.Restaurants: There was talk that the hotel's second floor restaurant will re-open in the future but for the present time the nearby restaurants offered high-end dining options. As noted above though it was simple to hop the bus to get back into Waikiki where multitudes of eateries at all price ranges are to be found or out to the Kahala Mall where a similar array is available.Area free attractions: If you stay at the Lotus don't miss the free band concert in Kapi'olani Park on Sunday afternoons, check out the art along the fence of the nearby Honolulu Zoo and if you are lucky, catch one of the free hula shows in the park as well. We were also entertained watching pick-up soccer games in the park from our deck each evening. The hotel is very close to the Outrigger Canoe Club, a private club that's been a Honolulu tradition since 1908. If you are a member of a club that has a reciprocal membership with the OCC, and plan to use it while in Hawaii, this hotel is perfectly located for easy access. Ask about OCC hotel rates when you call for a reservation.

At first we were unable to find a condo that was not in the heart of Waikiki. I stumbled upon this hotel on the internet. Now am so glad we stayed there. Lovely views, Super Clean Spacious rooms, Friendly Staff and best of all quiet. Only a few rooms on each floor. Extra little touches that make it even more relaxing.Daily afternoon complimentary wine in the lobby; Morning coffee and tea; Complimentary bikes to get you around.Evening room turndown. Helpful staff. We will be back.Only thing I'd change is the lobby. Needs a little more warmth - comfort to sit down and relax.

First and foremost we highly recommend this hotel. It is in a quieter part of Waikiki which in our opinion was fantastic as you have a more relaxing and paradisical experience in the area. Also, for the price it is a great value as other hotels of the same quality will charge more per night for the same types of views. We stayed in room 1221 (Ocean View Premium) and you cannot, absolutely cannot beat the views. We had two lanai's,one with a view of the ocean and Diamond Head and the other smaller one that looks out into the city and other mountains. The room was large and very clean. A few other reviewers commented on the stained carpet, there was a stain by the door but truly this was not a deal breaker. The room still felt up to date and modern. Also, people have commented on the TV's as they are not new flat screens, this was also not a deal breaker. I did not feel that I was lacking anything because the TV is an older style. The bed was super comfortable and it does have a feather mattress on top. This was not a problem, I did not experience it moving or becoming uncomfortable during the night. The bathroom does not have a tub, which was fine as we never take baths, but in a premium room one might expect to have a little more luxury and I would say that a few more amenities could be offered in the bathroom. The shampoo and conditioner and lotion were great, but when paying for one of the nicest rooms in the hotel it would be nice to see something special in the room. For example a shaving kit, or maybe cotton swabs....something to up the value of what you are paying for. There is not restaurant in the hotel although we were told two would be opening within the year. The hotel next door has a fabulous breakfast and as it has been mentioned it is pricey but maybe worth it one or two times. The "hidden" breakfast gem is located about a 5 minute walk toward busy Waikiki, Queens Surf Cafe & Lanai is super, super cheap by any standard and absolutely delicious. We were blown away. It is worth it for both breakfast and dinner. The pancakes were great and the lox was the best we ever had (no joke). That being said - we did not have a problem with the hotel offering no food or dining service. We ordered pizza one night and it was delivered to the room within 30 min. Back to the hotel - there is coffee service in the mornings and they serve wine from 4 - 6pm in the lobby which is a very nice touch (Gnarly Head Red). They offer free beach towels, chairs and mats and the beach is about 2 mins. from the front of the hotel. You can also take a ride on the complimentary beach cruisers they provide. All of these amenities came in handy for us and made our experience at the hotel very enjoyable. The only thing I would have liked was possible snorkel rental or sales. Otherwise, you have to bring your own or walk to the busier part of Waikiki to rent it. Parking is pricey at $20 but I believe it is one of the cheaper prices as compared to other hotels in Waikiki. You can park on the street at the meters but it will probably be a hassle and the street parking seemed to always be taken.The staff at the hotel was fantastic and friendly! No one was a problem for us and they all were knowledgeable and quick to deal with any problems. Travis the valet is fantastic. He recommend the Diamond Head Market and Grill for lunch and it was great. He was also very quick to get our car and patient as we had to get in and out of it several times. Carissa at the front desk was really nice and personable and helped us obtain a room on a high floor for extra special views. Two thumbs up for the staff!It you want a smaller hotel with amazing views, comfortable beds, and friendly staff this hotel is the place for you. If you like more action and want the hustle and bustle of a big resort like the Hilton or Royal Hawaiian in the heart of busy Waikiki, this will not be a good fit. The Aqua Lotus is a fabulous hotel and will only get better once their restaurants open.

20 minutes walk from the centre of Waikiki beach activity a nice, clean, pleasant place. Parking fee of 20$ is to much, but overall there is a good value for the money. Beach 250 meters away. Quiet place.

Well located hotel ten - fiteen minutes walk from central Waikiki, so in a quiet location opposite a park. Very close to the beach, but not on it. This is a good 3 star hotel. Our room was large with two good quality double beds. The bathroom was also a good size. Everything was clean and well maintained. The room had a view to diamond head and look the other way to see the ocean. We didn't eat there so no comment on dining experience.We actually had brekkie at a little roadside cafe up near Kahuku. It was the best breakfast! The smoothies were sensational. Sorry can't remember the name of it.

I have been staying at this hotel for five years, typically every three or four times a year for a week at a time (It is a former W Hotel). I come to Honolulu for business and appreciate that it is quiet and off the beaten path, but accessible to Waikiki. Just fifty rooms, five rooms per floor and easy in/out access valet parking. They are not on the beach but have towels, chairs and bikes for guest use. The beach is 100 yards away and is small and swimable. They also have complimentary coffee service in the AM, complimentary wine in the PM and free internet.Staff is very friendly and accomodating.What prevents an excellent rating is lack of on site food service. I understand that this is coming in summer 2012.

Wonderful feutre ambiance, great decor in pure Lotus style of well being, luxurious yet tasteful. Rooms offer great amenities and style. Beds are superb! The best I have slept in --to die for comfort. Kings and Queens! Better than Westin and Four Seasons! Bathroom tops too. Wonderful selection of tea's in the morning as well as fresh coffee complimentary--pau hana offering of white and red wine delightful after the beach. Location is tops - just in the shadow of Diamond Head, the park, zoo, aquarium are a stone's throw. Complimentary bikes for riding around Diamond Head or down the Ala Wai!Great beach towels and chairs.

Met my mom here for a 2 and a half week stay.Upon arrival, we were greeted by a smiling Bill, who took our bags up.The first thing I noticed when i got to the lobby, was the wonderful smell. It was calm and welcoming.Vanilla ? There are 12 floors, each floor has 5 units on it, making it quiet and personable.The room was wonderful ! Not like a hotel, more cozy. Very clean and bright. 2 balconies, one with ocean view, one with a partial ocean view with a full view of Dimond Head.Big room. 2 queen sized beds,super comfy with big fluffy duvets.The only complaints about the room, was that the TV was old, as was the fridge. ( however the entire hotel will be renovated, with flat screens ect by next year)Not too much to complain about considering.Housekeeping always did a great job, both during the day as well as turn down service. They always were smiling and accommodated any of our requests.Happy Hour is 4 - 6 . The hotel serves complimentary wine. White and Red. ( soooooo good! ) a very nice perk.The beach is steps away. It is somewhat private and shared with the Outrigger Canoe Club. The Lotus provides beach chairs, towels, matts no charge.The only thing missing was a pool. And the restraunt was closed. ( it did look nice ! ) I think it will be opened in the future.The location was great, if you want to be close to Waikiki, but not right in the middle of the loud tourist infested action. It's located between the Outrigger Canoe Club and the Aquarium. It's about a 7 m walk to the main part if Waikiki. Or you can take a bus and be dropped off right close.There is a conveience store steps away. It sells lots of things, however it is a bit more pricy then ABC. We felt safe here, actually we felt like family. The people here are amazing ! Bill Carissa Dante Josh - just to name a few. If you want a safe, clean, quiet, personable service, boutique hotel. Do not hesitate to stay here !

We have enjoyed many wonderful vacations in Honolulu over the years, this time we discovered The Lotus, a gem that we were in two minds about sharing☺ Crispy clean sheets on beds from heaven, great balconies with wonderful ocean, Diamond Head and park views, rooms that have a clean Pacific/Balinese vibe that are spacious, including the bathroom. Ipod docks/wifi. We love the feel of a boutique hotel where the staff are extremely personable; nothing was ever a problem. No roads to cross to the beach, convenient parking, quieter end of town yet still within easy walking reach of buzzy Waikiki, so you don't feel excluded. The Lotus ticked every box for our family, which included our teenage sons. Nice touches such as newspapers, wine and coffee in the lobby add to the warmth of this fabulous place. Especially enjoyed using the hotel bicycles to cruise around on. We have no hesitation recommending the comfort and service of the Aqua Lotus - We would definitely stay here again. Shepherd Family January 2012. Sydney

Just recently stayed at this boutique hotel for a little rest and relaxation getaway. The hotel is a about a good 10 min walking distance to all of the main shops and points in Waikiki and access to your own somewhat private beach.Accommodation wise the hotel is very clean and well maintained. Staff is wonderful and friendly especially the valet personals. You get free Internet access during your stay and also they provide you with free beach chairs, matts, towels and beach bikes. The beds are very clean and comfortable, I felt like I can stay indoors all day long. The bathroom is also well kept especially the clean showers. Also they have a washer and dryer facility on the third floor if you need to clean your clothes.I am only giving this place a four star since we were suppose to get a large king or queen size bed before check in. We did informed the front desk and they said they will handle this for us but never did. Besides that, this place is really nice and I would not mind returning for another stay.
We found it too remote from transport & restaurants as we did not have a car...otherwise we loved it.

I have been to Waikiki many times over many years and generally get disappointed by the bigger hotels for being too big / too impersonal / too busy. My latest trip we took 2 interconnecting rooms at the Lotus, a smaller boutique hotel up towards Diamond Head. Quite discrete, nice rooms, great outlook and very personalised service. Small things such as help yourself coffee in the morning to free wine at 4-6pm were nice touches. Can highly recommend

I truly love this hotel. Great rooms all with balconies....very comfortable. The best part though is the location away from the craziness of Waikiki but close enough to walk there if you want to. I would live in this location if I could---- And thanks Josh for being such a great host!

We have stayed in other Aqua properties in Waikiki. The location near Diamond Head is great as it is quieter and greener. No pool but the beach is steps away. The hotel is amongst several other properties and not directly on the beach. However, the 50 rooms all offer some sort of view, especially from the 5th floor up where you can get both ocean and Diamond Head views. Corner rooms are nice as you get two windows/lanai's. Room is spacious. Beds are comfortable. Wine service in the evening is nice. Staff is very personable. Coffee service in the morning ends at 9am; it would be nice if it was offered until 10:30am for late risers. No restaurant on property. If you want to be in the center of Waikiki activity, this is not the place for you. But if you want to be in Waikiki without BEING in Waikiki, I recommend the Aqua Lotus.

Words cannot describe our wonderful stay last month with about 50 family and friends from Anchorage, Seattle, Portland, Dallas, Houston, Maui and Molokai. The hotel staff always called us by name and took care of all of our needs, and those of our friends. And what perks to get a newspaper, coffee and wine in the lobby every day -- and all complimentary! Can't wait to try the new restaurant. I'm sure it will be as perfect as the rest of the hotel. Warm aloha to all of the managers, front desk staff, valets, housekeepers, building engineers and other hotel employees. You're the best!!!

We recently stayed five nights at this hotel and we very happy with everything about it. The main reason we chose it was because of its proximity to Sans Souci beach, also known as Kaimana beach, along with being close to but not in the middle of Waikiki. Although the hotel does not face the beach itself, we still were able to see the ocean, as well as a beautiful view of Diamond Head from our room on the 8th floor.The other reason we chose it was price. We made the reservation a couple of months in advance, and then when I checked back a week or so before arriving rebooked it at an even better rate.Once there we were very happy with the room and the service. Every one of the staff who helped us was very genuine, friendly and accommodating, Carissa at the front desk, Guy and Bill at the valet, Maribel and Shig in housekeeping, Wally in maintenance, and many more whose names I didn't get.

Stayed at Aqua Lotus for 20 days on vacation. The hotel and staff were outstanding. Very impressed with overall service, size of rooms cleanliness and the location In upper end Diamond Head just off of Waikiki. The hotel is a former W hotel and beats the W hands down. The guest service manager Joshua assisted us in all of our needs. Will stay here again and again. Richard Rollins ....

Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly; tucked away from the street, small and had the most beautiful Christmas tree in huge Balinese influence furniture in lobby. Staff gave me a cheaper room and were very accommodating when I had to limit my stay to a single night. Room was huge and with a decent sized lanei with views of ocean and diamond head. Best of all it was in the quiet end of waikiki beach ----with the hundreds of runners for the Marathon, I felt guilty walking and walking. Found the Queens on the beach outdoor restaurant to have Illy coffee, food breakfast food and I had a reasonably priced bbq dinner there on a Friday night (traveling solo) and watched the fireworks from the beach. Staff recommended the spa at the hotel next door and Yuko gave me two of the best treatments I've ever had. She is a real find - very strong hands for lomi lomi treatment. Highly recommend her services. This is not your fu fu spa - it is a health and healing place. Absolutely will return to this hotel and the spa!

This was the second time for us staying at this Hotel, the first time was back in 2009 and we had no reservations in booking the Lotus again for 2 weeks in November 2011. This hotel is in a quite part of Waikki but close enough to walk to the night life. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean and included in the room there is a Fridge which is handy if you require to eat food in the room. All members of the staff are polite. courtious and helpfull. Parking is easy and Bill and Travis will help with maps and directions. On reception Carissa and Dante are helpful if you require change for Travellers cheques and the hotel supplies Beach Chairs, mats and towels if required and there is a secluded beach a short walk away. There is a small shop close by which stocks all items. We shall certainly be returning to the Lotus on our next trip to Hawaii

This lovely boutique hotel is located near the foot of Diamond Head away from the hussle and hassle of Waikiki proper but easily accessed if you want it. It is steps from one of the better beaches in the area, Kapiolani Park and the Diamond Head Tennis Courts. The rooms and bathrooms are large and spacious with a magnificent view of Diamond Head and the Park. A very friendly and helpful staff keeps everything clean and efficient. Complimentary wine every evening helps kick-off of your evening activites.I understand that plans are in the works to upgrade the facilities even more and a restaurant is planned adjacent to the lobby in the near future. All this will make this hotel and even better place to stay in Honolulu. Privacy and peace when you want it, Waikiki nightlife when you need it. . .a great vacation combination.

We went on a late honeymoon last December 2010 after getting married in May 2010. We loved the hotel. We were upgraded to a corner room facing partial ocean and Diamond Head views. super comfortable bed and nice patio to watch the sunrise over Diamond Head. We will stay there again. It was such a great hotel. Staff very very friendly and helpful. Recommend it to everyone.

Pros: It was outside of the traffic in Waikiki, but close enough to walk to restaurants in Waikiki. The hotel was steps away from Kaimana Beach and Kapiolani Park. The hotel was clean with a helpful, friendly staff. There was a wine happy hour and coffee/tea each day in the lobby. There were also free newspapers in the lobby. Cons: There was no restaurant in the hotel. The convenience store next door was expensive with limited selection. There was no coffee pot in the room. Room had a musty smell when the doors were closed.We stayed for two nights and enjoyed our stay. There was some confusion when we checked in with our reservation, but after about 10 minutes, it was straightened out. The valet/bellman was very friendly and showed us to our room right away.The best part of the room were the views. We stayed in one of the upper floors on a corner room looking out at the beach in one direction and Diamond Head in the other direction. The room was rated as a 4 star hotel, but it was more along the lines of a 3 or 3.5 star hotel.

Pros: The rooms are large, clean and bright, and the staff are very friendly. We had a nice view of Diamond Head, and we could still see a bit of the ocean. They offer complimentary wine between 3-5 in the lobby, which is a nice touch. Great shower and great bed.Cons: 10 minute walk from the Waikiki strip or the beach. so it might be difficult for those with kids or difficulty walking. They nickel and dime you on the internet (they charge you twice to have two computers in the same room on the internet at once), and they have mandatory valet service if you park there. They literally park your car in front the front door to the hotel, and back it up for you when you want it. I suggest parking across the road. It's cheap and there are a tonne of parking spots. Overall I was happy with my stay there.

I recently stayed at the Aqua Lotus, formerly a W Hotel, located on the Gold Coast of Waikiki. The hotel is located in a great location, very close to the Zoo and Kapahulu Avenue. It's a short walk to the International Market Place. Having stayed in other W Hotels, I hoped the Lotus would be trendy and chic. I was very impressed with the property. The public areas were very nice and the rooms were quite large and were decorated in a combination of tropical and Asian theme. I stayed in an upper floor premium ocean view room that had excellent views of the ocean and Diamond Head. The sunset could be enjoyed from the balcony. The bed was very comfortable and unlike other hotels in Waikiki, you were not awaken daily by the sounds of sirens, tour buses idling, or garbage trucks collecting trash. I enjoyed the complimentary wine hour in the lobby. Parking was Valet only. The Valets did an excellent job and were always ready to offer assistance. If you called down for your car, it was ready and waiting for you when you got to the lobby. The Valet, Bill was very courteous and friendly. He provided directions and offered suggestions of where to eat and always welcomed you back when you returned. The entire Lotus staff was very professional and welcoming. Their hospitality was definetly first rate. If you come to Oahu, you need to try the Lotus!

This is my second stay at The Lotus. This property was once a W Hotel, so it has very nice comfortable rooms with docking stations, down comforters and large rooms. Most of all it comes with a VERY nice staff. There isn't a sour sack in the place! Everyone is very friendly and anxious to help. They have a nice wine happy hour which always was the same time I would head back to my room, shower and sit on my balcony with a complimentary glass of wine! This is the kind of hotel where you look forward to going back to at the end of the day. I look forward to my next stay and I would highly suggest staying there if you are interested in staying in a nice place on The Diamond Head side.

The Aqua Lotus hotel is located by Diamond Head, outside of the melee that can be downtown Honolulu but close enough to enjoy it when you want to. Great views of Diamond Head and the ocean, comfortable spacious rooms, nicely appointed, quiet and very comfortable. The bathroom was large with plenty of room for storage, nice sized shower. No restaurant or pool but super restaurants located very close by and the beach a few steps away. Nice spacious balcony with chairs and a table. An easy stroll down to Waikiki beach, shops and nightlife. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Valet parking available and necessary as parking would otherwise be a challenge. We were very happy with our stay here and would not hesitate to return.

This hotel was located a little outside of Waikiki but perfect walking distance and quiet enough for anyone not wishing to be disturbed by the evening noise of the main town. The hotel staff were brilliant and very helpful and the room we stayed in was large and clean with views of the Diamond Head and beach. The hotel staff are great at offering advice on places to go and will also arrange any transfers you need.

My bf and I stayed two nights in a basic room. It wad clean and comfortable. It is in a great location ie just a short stroll to main part of Waikiki but quiet as not right on top of Waikiki. We enjoyed the accomm being at the diamond head end.

We chose The Lotus for our stay because our two fabulous dogs were coming from Canada and we needed a pet-friendly hotel - and Diamond Head is a beautiful area of Waikiki. We booked through the 1-800 number and received an amazing deal. :)The staff at The Lotus are incredibly friendly and helpful - and the lobby is absolutely breathtaking, tranquil and always smells delicious!!The decor in the room is simple and clean - however the room overall is quite average with a very old and noisy mini-fridge, an older model tv and the 'pillow-top' on the bed rarely stays in place and is quite frustrating. Keeping in mind however, the view of Diamond Head is breathtaking. The only other negative is that, during our stay, the restaurant was closed for reservations. Granted, we could walk approximately 10-15 minutes to Waikiki and find numerous restaurants, ABC stores and shopping.The hotel is also incredibly close to the Aquarium as well as the Honolulu Zoo - it is also directly across the street from Kapiolani Park (which is perfect for walking the dogs, jogging, picnics or just enjoying the day) and an extremely short walk to the beach.Oh, one more thing - valet parking is mandatory - which we found a little frustrating as you have to pay for parking and then a tip is expected every time you require your car. Just something little, but something we would have liked to have known before we stayed here.Overall, the staff really make this hotel fantastic - and the lobby really is gorgeous!!

Great Hotel. Well decorated and well run. The staff was professional and flexible and I would go back in a heartbeat. The hotel was spotless and appeared and I look forward to whe they reopen the restaurant and bar.

I can honestly say that the room I stayed in here, not once, but twice, is hands down the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed in, anywhere in the world. Granted, I was staying in the penthouse suite, but the appointments, view, gracious and humble service, and general ambiance all exist throughout the property.Every single room in the hotel has a lanai, and a spectacular view, (though no room has a completely unobstructed ocean view). And most importantly, every single room in the hotel has the easy-going-yet-upscale hotel vibe that comes with the property. It's cool, super friendly, way convenient, AND MOST IMPORTANT: NOT ON WAIKIKI.It is super convenient to everything, steps from the beach and great restaurants, but if you want to be among the masses, swept up in the tourist mayhem, or clambering to get into Abercrombie and Fitch, you'll actually have to WALK 10 blissful beach minutes to get there. Don't come here if you'll be disappointed that you're not in the thick of it, because you just won't appreciate the incredible charming appeal of this great hotel.The Lotus sits at the foot of Diamond Head, in a very peaceful, quiet area that I will no doubt return to again. It has changed its name a few times in recent history, which concerns me, only because I don't want the great service/vibe to disappear. It's perfection.

We purchased our room through Groupon for a four nite stay over Labor day wkend. Clarissa from the front desk upgraded us to a corner room in the tenth floor with views of both the ocean and diamond head for only $30 more a nite. Try and book this room 1025. It's the best room in the house! We love love this hotel because all the service folks were friendly and helpful with the aloha spirit. The hotel is about a good 15-20 minutes walk to waikiki but we didn't mind it since we were getting good exercise. Had breakfast at Bogarts which is a must. Dinner next door at Michelson was awesome but bit pricey. Great view. There is a casual restaurant next door at the Otani hotel. There is also a convenience store and a few shops and beauty salon next door. We hiked up to the top of Diamond head which was phenom. The beach on the property was the best for swimming. Not rocky and not much surf. It wasn't very crowded at all compared to Waikiki. The bedding was nice and comfy. You can ask for a coffee maker for your room nc. For some authentic local grub head out to Side street inn cafe which is a five min can drive. You will be happy happy happy.

We stayed here for 2 nights. We had TWO balconies! It was so beautiful! We got there at night and I must admit, it was a little hard to find at first buyt we got it! Very close to the strip - it's a nice walk! There is plenty of free public parking outside of the hotel - no need to pay for the parking. Just make sure you wake up in time to move it prior to getting a summons. We never had an issue here but then again, we were hardly in the room. Who goes to Hawaii to stay in a room? NOT US! We had the best time ever! Diamond HEad does get packed early so if your going to go there, I would suggest heading out as early as possible. Oh, and one other thing, the hotel has a BEAUTIFUL gong in the lobby, This is not a chain hotel or a resort but it was still very nice! A little outdated but nothing that I could not handle. Thanks again for the amazing room!

Pros - Clean good size room and bathroom, with comfortable bed. We stayed on the fifth floor which had good views of the Ocean and Diamond head. This hotel is ten minutes walk from the main drag so is in a quiet location, It is also only 1 minute walk from beach access, and has parkland right on its doorstep. The Hotel has art Deco feel to it, we investigated the closed restuarant and once/ when its re-opened will definately improve this Hotels appeal.Cons - This Hotel has no restaurant as it is under renervation even though there wasn't any sign of work while we were their. There are Hotels nearby that have food but at a high cost. There are no restaurants in the near facility. The hotel also has no tea or coffeemaking facilities apart from 6-9am in the foyer. We asked for a kettle which after negotiation was provided. The staff, while friendly seemed unknowlegable on local shuttles or tour options to the local sites.Conclusion - good hotel but needs the edges ironed out. Recomendation for local eatery would be Tikkis ten minutes walk to the centre.

Rooms are large and very nicely appointed. Most comfortable bed I have had in a hotel in quite some time. Staff were all very friendly. With my package received free parking and free internet. They have free beach supplies one can check out.Down side is they have no pool and restaurant not open at this time.

good three star hotel. nice room with a balcony. very nice staff. a little bit away from the over-commercialized waikiki strip...downsides are that its about a mile away from the main waikiki main strip which means that if you want to eat (they dont have a restaurant) you either need to walk or drive there which is a pain. another alternative is an insanely expensive restaurant next door... also, only have 1 elevator which could be a problem if its down (as it was occasionally when we stayed)

My daughters and I stayed at the Aqua Lotus for 3 nights and 4 days and were very pleased. We had two adjoining rooms that made a very comfortable suite. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were Very cleaned and the maid service was excellent. It is on the Waikiki beach, very close to Diamond Head. The beds are very comfortable, the pillows are too. Another nice feature is the balcony had wooden french doors that slid in place in front of the glass sliders. These blocked the early morning sun allowing a dark room for sleeping.The very best part of Aqua Lotus is the fact that it is run so seemlessly, we could enjoy our vacation without stressing over our accomodations. Believe me this is the exception not the rule, lol. I highly recomend it!

The Lotus at Diamond, which now is the actually name, and formally the W and known as Aqua Lotus Honolulu was a good stay for me and friends, over to start our vacation.I actually chose the hotel as it's location was away from Waikiki, maybe a 5 to 10 minute easy walk, but also next to it's own beach, which was perfect for morning dips.If you need to get to the hotel, but want to save on taxi, the airport shuttle bus, which runs from the terminals to the down town hotels, actually makes a stop directly outside, just make sure you mention, The Lotus, or the old W hotel, as this is how driver's seem to remember the location. Check in was easy, the staff seem professional, and nice, but that's the Hawaii flow. The room I had was on the 7th floor, was a good size. A desk, working lamp, T.V cabinet, if you want to? You so don't need T.V. in Hawaii, and a good sized bathroom, and usual products, towels, hair dryer, and beds are comfy, with white sheets, staving away from the gory flower reprints.I also chose this hotel as I managed to get this is on a good deal, and it used to be a W, assumed, at least some of the aesthetics would be left over. The lobby is cute, but nothing grand, just nice, and actually lo key, it's a quiet hotel thank god. For a hotel that is 4 star, it could do with a little upscaling on touches, I mean, if you stay in solid boutique hotels, this is most definitely not one, it's just a well placed, neutrally painted hotel, with good staff. Something that is a good bonus, is the views! Diamond head is just behind the hotel, and to be honest, the area really starts to change if you take a walk. It's really the upscale area, and taking a morning run as I did was amazing. Close by is also the bus stops, for you to pick up to go around the island, but be prepared, it's forever))) And taxi's run up and down to road if you don't wanna walk. All in all, if they remain competitive on the price, always worth looking into this place, good sized rooms, and a peaceful nights sleep is exactly what you need if you're in Hawaii!
